Name: Business Analyst
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Analyst will have the following: Bachelors degree and three or more years of related experience; or three to five years of related experience and training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Understand data driven systems and their integration.Comprehend desired technical requirements and ad sales infrastructure.Process improvement experience desired.Experience in an ad sales organization a plus.Ability to determine areas that need improvement and implement a plan of action.Must be comfortable with aggressive schedules, as well as setting direction and priorities.High level of diplomacy. As an Business Analyst I will possess a variety of technical and analytical skills to ensure addressable ads are delivered to set top boxes, and ad viewership verification files are transported from set top boxes to billing agencies. Responsibilities will include knowledge of addressable ad workflows to and from set top boxes, familiarity with the scripts that transport files within the workflow, troubleshooting workflow issues, testing workflow upgrades, and determining/managing workflow improvement projects. More specifically, a Business Analyst I will be acquainted with the systems that establish orders, target customers, manage inventory, implement schedules, package assets, transfer ads to the set top box, and verify ad viewership. Coordinate program, episode, format, and window information for all networks between third parties and Traffic. Create manual formats and schedules when necessary. Keep all network schedules updated.Liaison between all third-party vendors to ensure formats, schedules, and inventory allocations are synchronized and current.Assign National (Aggregate) and Local (Zone Targeted Ad (ZTA)) inventory to available network windows, breaks, and spots. Make changes as required to take advantage of revenue-producing opportunities.Work with Team Members, IT Support, Program Management, Traffic, Echostar, and other partners in the implementation of addressable advertising projects/programs and their ongoing support.Monitor performance of the Addressable Advertising system. Use SQL and other analytical tools to drive insight and understanding of addressable advertising system performance.Suggest performance metrics to determine acceptable levels of quality, current performance, or improvement opportunities.Make recommendations on operational and troubleshooting procedures to keep the addressable advertising system running smoothly.Assist in testing ad sales system upgrades and new technologies. Help implement improvements and measure the success of system changes.Provide support to the Addressable System Administrator and Data Base Administrator, as well as Echostar Systems and Set Top Box teams.Travel to other Media Sales and partner locations as required.

Name: Epic Application Analyst
Description: Welcome to Centura HealthWelcome to the largest health ecosystem in Colorado and western Kansas. Welcome to living your mission among thousands of people on fire to live theirs too. Welcome to options, possibilities and values that guide exceptional care. Welcome to extremely important industry challenges and opportunities to solve complex problems. Welcome to highly intelligent teams, overflowing community and the wholeness of mind, body and spirit that is Centura Health.Flourishing Begins HereYou have a purpose, unique talents and NOW is the time to embrace it, live it and put it to work. At Centura Health, we value incredible people with incredible skills – but your commitment to a greater cause is something we value even more.  Design and present solutions and options that improve patient care, enhance patient engagement, improve operational efficiency organizational knowledge with thoughtful design. Reviews and analyzes systems including testing and documenting Epic applications. Understands system options and configurations completely and can suggest and lead teams through decisions on the best way to configure and utilize the system.What You Bring/Job RequirementsIn addition to bringing your whole self to the workplace each day, qualified candidates will need the following: 2 years of relevant experience, required.Strong business or clinical acumen Strong communication, presentation, interpersonal, and rapport-building skills.Able to get things done and escalate issues to the decision-makers as necessary.Exceptional organizational skills with ability to handle multiple projects, multiple (and sometimes conflicting) priorities and adapt to change.Strong customer service skills required Strong analytical skills, detail orientation, ability to troubleshoot, be proactive.On-call coverage (after business hours and weekends) is required, on a rotational basis or as-needed.Some travel required, both locally and overnight.Demonstrates qualities of assertiveness, a high sense of urgency, initiative (self-starter), effective communication skills including presentation skills, facilitation skills, and a positive attitude.Bachelors Degree or 8 years of equivalent work experience required in lieu of Bachelor's degree.High School Diploma or GEDEPIC Required Within 4 Months. Ongoing maintenance of Epic certification(s) required. Your Connected CommunityWhen people and places align, incredible things happen. Just like the 21,000+ amazing associates who work here, every community within Centura Health’s connected ecosystem has its own unique history, story and personality.  Centura Health is headquartered in Centennial, CO, with additional business office locations throughout the Denver Tech Center. The Corporate Service Center is home to our leaders and centralized teams that support our hospitals, clinics and people – including marketing, human resources, employee benefits, finance, billing, talent acquisition/development, payor relations, IT, project management, community benefit and more. Whether you work in the corporate headquarters or one of our nearby offices, you’ll experience a culture of collaboration and community where incredible people are doing incredible things every day.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: (LinkTechConsulting.com), is seeking Sr. Business Analyst (BA) for a three-month Contract opportunity with a well-established client in Denver, CO. Job Description: The Sr. Business Analyst (BA) will be responsible for working closely with the team in an agile and or waterfall development format while providing just in time requirements (in various formats), process flows and assisting in developing and delivering proof of concept demonstrations to key stakeholders. Expected Responsibilities:• Requirements engineering (business, stakeholder, functional, solution and transition level requirements). • Business process design and documentation (workflow modeling, BPMN experience a plus)  o Analysis of existing processes (as-is modeling) and ability to bridge to-be state processes. • Assess captured business requirements against enterprise platform capabilities (fit gap analysis). • Participation in the client’s Request for Proposal process. • Rapid design and development of proof of concepts / prototypes. • System and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) coordination and facilitation. • Issue tracking & resolution coordination. • Other duties as assigned. The ideal candidate will:• Have an excellent professional attitude with strong interpersonal communication, facilitation and presentation skills. • Be customer experience focused (customer empathizing). • Be highly capable in conflict resolution and negotiation. • Be able to articulate platform capabilities shape customer demand against platform offerings. • Have strong and proven background in developing Business Analysis artifacts, such as process maps, and requirements documentation (business and technical levels). • Have experience in operating as a Business Analyst / Product Owner in an agile framework (such as Scrum) and also within more sequential project methodologies (i.e. waterfall). • Have 5+ years recent working experience as a Business Analyst / Business Systems Analyst with a strong focus around upfront customer facing process analysis and requirements gathering against produced process analysis outputs. • Have a CCBA or CBAP certification (preferred, not required.) Employment details: There is a primary work location however, the contractor will work with team members at various building locations throughout Denver.

Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: GRC Analyst - Business Continuity & Incident Response
Description: At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people think about enterprise security technology. With our innovative Identity Defined Security platform, we're helping to build a borderless world where people have total freedom to work wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.  We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado, and we have offices and employees around the globe. And we serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 100. Because even in the most complex enterprise environments, security shouldn't be a source of anxiety. It should be one of your greatest competitive advantages.  We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that drives our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.  As an analyst working in Ping’s Denver office, you will become the subject matter expert for Ping’s Business Continuity (BCP) and Incident Response (IR) programs. This is a highly collaborative position, working with representatives from other key departments throughout Ping, ensuring that we have effective plans in place, and leading those plans, and reporting out on program status on a regular basis. Job Functions: Work with Management to update a company wide BCP and IR Strategy Review and manage current Business Continuity plans Work with stakeholders throughout the company to understand their recovery needs and requirements Review and manage current Incident Response plans Conduct periodic tabletop and simulated assessments of both the BCP and IR programs Document assessment results, including lessons learned, and work with teams to implement those lessonsEssential Qualifications: Seeking candidate with 1 to 4 years relevant experience in Business Continuity and/or Incident Response Hungry to learn and grow in a fast-growing technology company Clear communication skills, with the ability to tailor messaging to the intended audience Can carry out specific tasks and execute plans while providing constructive feedback Ability to maintain a positive attitude in a dynamically changing environmentDesired Qualifications: Experience in a fast-paced, ever-changing and growing environment Experience with AWS and cloud based services Requires minimal management attention—self managed and can work in a fluid environment Must be inquisitive and quick learner with attention to detailEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

Name: Loan Operations Analyst
Description: At OnDeck, we make small business a big deal. We're improving the world's economic landscape by changing the way small businesses access capital. We care intensely about each other, our company and the customers we serve, and are committed to making every day count. The OnDeck Operations team is a high performing department that delivers a world class loan originations and servicing experience that supports and delights our internal and external customers, and drives responsible company growth. We combine people, processes and technology to deliver outstanding results. From our Operations headquarters in Denver, Colorado our Operations team members have the opportunity to advance their careers "vertically" through their existing Operations group or "horizontally" across Operations and OnDeck more generally. This "vertical" and "horizontal" approach promotes fantastic career growth, particularly when paired with first class training. We seek energetic team members eager to roll up their sleeves and help small businesses achieve their goals.  Our Loan Originations team guides and executes on the journey of a Loan Application through the entire pre-origination life cycle. We consist of two divisions: Loan Processing and Quality Control/Policy Exception management. The position starts with learning the Loan Processing function. As potential Small Business customers apply through our website, the team attempts to qualify business owners for short term business loans based on their credit worthiness.  This is an excellent Entry Level position and great way to get your foot in the door within a FinTech environment at OnDeck! It's a dynamic and diverse team, consisting of members from the restaurant industry, financial services, sales and customer service backgrounds. You will be part of a newly expanded team where we think big, act boldly and strive for success in all measures. As a Loan Operations Analyst at OnDeck on the Loan Originations team, you will:Work with a queue of incoming small business loan applications to perform validation of small business existence and information through online search engines and other records.Assess missing components of the loan application package and prioritize follow up with the sales department.Structure Loan Applications in preparation for cash flow analysis and underwritingAssure compliance with all policies and procedures.Necessary qualifications for success:0-2 years of work experience in a fast paced and team based environment"Fast paced" or "high pressure" are not scary words for you, but are motivatorsMotivated when working towards KPI's, quotas or team goals & metricsStrong Work Ethic in a high-performance environmentConsistency in output, results and process, experience working with high volume tasksEffective Communication, both written and oralEffective Time management and experience balancing quality and efficiencyExperience following procedures, guidelines and policiesAbility to work a consistent 8 hour shift, Monday Friday.Nice-to-haves (not required):Financial Acumen a plusExperience working with Salesforce, workflow system, tracking system or CRM systemAbout OnDeck: As the largest online small business lender in the U.S. serving more than 700 different industries, we have been trusted by over 80,000 small businesses by providing them with a term loan or line of credit to help them build growing and thriving enterprises. Since 2007, we've issued over $10 billion in capital.  Join us as we enable small businesses to achieve their goals. At OnDeck, we're reinventing small business financing. We care intensely about each other, our company and the customers we serve, and are committed to making every day count. We are small enough to be nimble and strong enough to make a big impact. Benefits for you: OnDeck believes that each and every team member plays an important role in our company's success. That's why we strive to provide you and your family with a competitive and comprehensive benefit program with a variety of options and opportunities. We offer: Generous VacationComprehensive HealthcareEducational Reimbursement401k MatchingParental LeaveSports TeamsStocked KitchensLoan ConsolidationWe are going to ask you to talk about your accomplishments. Here are some of ours:WorldatWork, 2017 Seal of DistinctionFortune 50 Best Workplaces for Diversity, 2016Fortune 50 Best Small and Medium Companies to Work For, 2016Fortune 30 Best Workplaces in Finance and Insurance, 2016Built in Colorado, Top 100 Digital Companies in Colorado, 2015, 2016, 2017Crain's New York Business Fast 50, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017Fortune and Great Place to Work 100 Best Workplaces for Millennials, 2015Fortune/Great Place To Work Great Rated! People's Picks: 20 Great Workplaces in Financial Services, 2015Crain's New York Best Places to Work, 2013, 2014, 2015Colorado SHRM Best Companies to Work For in Colorado, 2015Forbes' America's Most Promising Companies, 2013, 2014Selling Power Magazine Best Company to Sell For, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017500|5000, 2013, 2014As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce,OnDeck provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, OnDeck complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.OnDeck expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of OnDeck's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.**No external recruiters or agents, please.**

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst

Company DescriptionAbout us  Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC (DISYS) is a global staffing and IT consulting services company with core capabilities in: Staff Augmentation ServicesApplication Development ServicesBusiness Intelligence ServicesCloud Enablement ServicesEnterprise Resource PlanningInfrastructure Support ServicesTesting Services Our vision is to be a global business partner, delivering highest quality and most consistent services at the best value to clients worldwide. DISYS is headquartered in McLean, Virginia, with offices and delivery locations worldwide in North and South America, Europe, and the Asia Pacific region.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: About the Role: Staffigo Technical Services, LLC is currently looking for Entry-level Business Analysts to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with an established technology solutions and consultancy.  Our Entry-level Business Analysts are involved in all aspects of the project lifecycle and work hands on with client stakeholders during the consulting, design, and production stages of each engagement. Responsibilities:Serve as the liaison by gathering and analyzing business requirements from client and user groups and then communicating these requirements with development and software engineers.Hone client skills by gathering requirements from client discussions, interviews, testing, analysis, and other forms of requirements discoveryDocument and present requirements effectivelyWork closely in coordination with development teams to implement and develop technological solutions that satisfy client needsIterate on designs based on user feedback and UAT testing until solutions effectively meet end user requirementsLead the implementation cycle, drive decisions, track and document issues, and assist in managing and meeting tight deadlines while working with cross-functional teams to see projects from concept to completionAbility to discuss, manage, document, and design decisions to varied audiencesQualifications:Masters DegreeA self-starting, entrepreneurial attitude, willing to take initiative and work through all obstacles to accomplish tasksOutstanding communication is a must presentation, documentation, and interpersonal skills are critical for the roleStrong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability, able to think, and act decisivelyAbility to thrive when working with multiple groups in a variety of settings with ability to listen, articulate positions, advocate designs, and affect changeMust be open to relocateProficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint (databases and knowledge of SQL is also preferred)

Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: Entry Level - Business Analyst BA acts as the conduit between the business customer, and the delivery team. They will identify, interpret, and define business need and features; translate them into requirements; and lead the process to visualize, document, and communicate functional product solutions used to design, build, and test the system. Business Analysis Understand current business environment, client, and stakeholder requirements and apply this knowledge to ensure that deliverables meet the business requirements.Provide input into the development/implementation processes to ensure that deliverables meet the business requirements.Triage defects to determine if the defect does conflict with business requirements as captured in the specification documents.Gather requirements by demonstrating a range of business analysis techniques appropriate to the setting.Critically analyze, negotiate and actively contribute to decisions on requirements. This includes engaging appropriate parties to facilitate the identification of the problem and root cause.Understanding the product extensively, being viewed as the subject matter expert.Strive to exceed the expectations of stakeholders by using clear communication, to understand and assess business requirements so that the right solutions are adopted.Work closely with the Product team to understand the vision and convert it into user stories.Play an active role in the development team including contributing to the scrum ceremoniesPrinciple Duties and Responsibilities:Interacts regularly and directly with the Operations function and has a close user working relationship to ensure industry and best practices are employed.Develops an intimate knowledge of business strategy, business model, and processes in order to identify improvement opportunities and value-added capabilities.Liaises with various business groups and users to understand and analyze business problems in an effort to lead toward viable solutions.QualificationsExcellent communication, computer, and analytical skills.Requires knowledge of IT terms and Functions.Masters' from a reputed University (Required).Bachelor's is Mandatory.

Expected Responsibilities: • Requirements engineering (business, stakeholder, functional, solution and transition level requirements) • Business process design and documentation (workflow modeling, BPMN experience a plus) o Analysis of existing processes (as-is modeling) and ability to bridge to-be state processes • Assess captured business requirements against enterprise platform capabilities (fit gap analysis) • Participation in the city’s Request for Proposal process • Rapid design and development of proof of concepts / prototypes • System and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) coordination and facilitation • Issue tracking & resolution coordination • Other duties as assigned The ideal candidate will: • Have an excellent professional attitude with strong interpersonal communication, facilitation and presentation skills • Be customer experience focused (customer empathizing) • Be highly capable in conflict resolution and negotiation • Have strong and proven background in developing Business Analysis artifacts, such as process maps, and requirements documentation • Have experience in operating as a Business Analyst / Product Owner in an agile framework (such as Scrum) Employment Location:There is a primary work location is however, the contractor will work with team members at various building locations Denver.

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Responsibilities & Duties: •Practice the approach to CRM success: business process and user adoption first, technology second  •Perform in-depth analysis as a participant in process definition, requirements gathering, design, configuration, and testing  •Document functional requirements and transform them into a detailed system requirements  •Ensure traceability to and from functional requirements  •Work with teams to develop solutions for the configuration and customization of software  •Work with teams to perform data integration and migration from outside sources  •Deliver training to client personnel – business process and system  •Strong understanding of the CRM functionality in order to identify requirements “trade-offs” that keep the project on schedule yet sill meeting the business objective  •Ability to relate CRM functionalities to the business objectives that can be clearly understood by the business  •Communicate effectively, solve problems and identify and communicate project issues properly  •Ability to lead small and enterprise engagements, facilitate meetings, and lead customer support projects RequirementsEducation and Prior Experience: •BS or BA degree required, MA or MS degree in a technology field a plus  •4+ years of experience with business or requirements analysis (Big 4 experience a plus)  •4.5 years salesforce, siebel, oracle, or dynamics experience  •3+ years of experience with CRM applications Additional Skills and Abilities: •Consultative, attention to detail; as well as highest level of integrity and strong problem solver  •Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously  •Comfortable working in an on/off shore environment  •Strong time management and organizational skills  •Strong interpersonal and presentation skills (MS PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Visio)  •Good communications skills both oral and written  •Ability to be a self-starter and thrive in a fast paced, start up environment

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionCapTech is an award-winning national management technology-consulting firm with an enterprising, entrepreneurial environment. We have achieved four straight years ranked in the Top 10 of Consulting Magazine’s Best Firms to Work For, including a #5 ranking overall in 2015. Additionally, we placed 28th within the Vault Consulting 50 for the second year in a row, including a #5 ranking in work/life balance.  At CapTech you’ll experience a flat organizational structure with access to constant learning -- where your career path isn’t set in stone, and you have unlimited potential for growth. CapTech is based upon a culture of mutual respect. We look for, and hire the best. The creatively innovative, the technically insightful, the driven, the self-managed, the value conscious, the caring, and the gracious person – these are all qualities that we look for along with a love and a passion for the work that we do. Job DescriptionBusiness Analysts (BA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration efforts spanning multiple lines of business. CapTech BAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.  Specific responsibilities for the Business Analyst position include: Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization, and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods.QualificationsSpecific qualifications for the Business Analyst position include: Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as change control and defect tracking software.Prior consulting experience preferred. Name: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a Senior Salesforce Business Analyst for the Enterprise CRM Program team to contribute to the success of implementation and evolution of the bank?s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms. The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst will play a vital role supporting a large-scale CRM program to ensure the timely delivery of innovative solutions to address complex business objectives across the enterprise. The position will collaborate between business groups and technology teams and will be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to assess and design business models, gather business requirements, integrate technology, develop training and implementation materials, and provide post-implementation support. *Responsibilities:** + Provide program management and conduct business and systems analysis on a variety of projects and initiatives in the Enterprise CRM Program  + Collaborate with business partners, subject matter experts and other team members to define and document high-level business needs and detailed requirements  + Define and implement improvements to business process and ad-hoc projects in the face of ever-changing marketplace and consumers.  + Create and maintain business process flow maps and diagrams to facilitate understanding of business needs and translate to technology solutions  + Define scope of projects and timelines associated with the completion of initiatives  + Develop and maintain relationships and communications with other team members and internal partners  + Conduct meetings and facilitate collaborative discussions to develop requirements and new functionality needs  + Serve as point of contact for user support and problem solving  + Lead efforts to investigate, analyze, and resolve application issues related to system functionality  + Review and validate test plan approaches as well as participate in system testing *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience  + 6-8 years business analyst experience with utilizing program management methodology  + 3-5 years? experience working with CRM systems  + 3-5 years? experience with system testing *Preferred Qualifications** + Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to communicate and influence effectively at various levels of the organization  + Proven leadership skills and ability to lead others in defining requirements and identifying solutions  + In depth knowledge of business operations and processes for multiple businesses  + Sharp focus on achieving results; persists at completing tasks despite challenges; ability to achieve results and navigate through ambiguity  + Well-organized; plans activities and consistently follows up  + Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment  + Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint  + Salesforce Administrator Certification (or ability to obtain within one year)  + Project management  + Agile methodology  + Sales processes and methodologies  + Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies  + Financial services industry experience *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180038418*Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-Richfield U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Restaurant Technology Systems Analyst
Description: Based out of our Home Office in Greenwood Village, CO, the Restaurant Technology System Analyst position will primarily focus on maintaining, supporting, and configuring the Back Office Supply and Labor Management Systems (NBO|Menulink). Additional system responsibilities include the Point-of-Sale (POS) System and other core systems (Aloha Takeout, Olo Online Ordering, and 3rd party delivery systems such as DoorDash, Amazon, GrubHub, etc.). This role works collaboratively with cross-functional Teams and outside vendors to ensure seamless restaurant execution and great Guest experiences. Responsibilities:Executes system configuration, maintenance, testing, software updates, and troubleshooting.Reviews, analyzes, and provides recommendations on system configuration and development requests. Always considers downstream impacts to other technical systems, data flow and overall impact to the business.Provides technical expertise and leads design efforts for system development requests while working closely with Business Solutions Architect and Support & Development Engineers.Translates functional requirements to technical requirements and develops use/test cases for QA Team.Communicates complex technical issues/requests to non-technical audiencesResearches and stays current on release notes for system enhancements/upgrades.Looks for ways to improve current environment to achieve better system stability, performance, and infrastructure.Plans, organizes, coordinates, and communicates necessary system changes/updates before deploying into the Production environment.Performs troubleshooting with appropriate Vendors and internal IT teams where required to resolve technical system issues that arise.Proactively monitors system performance and determines whether modifications are needed and/or required.Works closely with IT Helpdesk, Applications Support, and Support & Development Engineers to ensure appropriate documentation for applicable enhancement releases and/or system changes. This includes updating appropriate Knowledge Base Articles.Follows internal Change Control process.Ensures compliance with all IT security controls including but not limited to SOX, PCI-DSS rules and regulations.Considers all impacts to other Red Robin entities such as Red Robin Express, Canada, and Franchisees.Considers all impacts to NROs (New Restaurant Openings) and works closely with various teams to ensure NROs are ready.Support cross-functional teams in understanding financial impacts of systems configuration.Qualifications:Degree in Computer Science or related field preferredOther degrees/certifications/etc. or equivalent work experience around supply chain management and restaurant operations will be consideredExperience with supply chain management software administration and/or configuration (NBO, SCM, etc.)Experience supporting business facing applications preferredBackground in Food & Beverage industry preferredKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:Analytical thinking, excellent organization, and a focused problem-solving mentality requiredAbility to work within a fast-paced team environment requiredExcellent communication and customer service skills requiredDisplays strong attention to detail. Demonstrates effective planning and organization skills to meet the needs of the businessResponds with a sense of urgency and quickly adjusts to shifting prioritiesHighly motivated, self-starter, completes tasks with minimal directionAdvanced knowledge of NCR Back Office (NBO) or similar supply chain management systemKnowledge of Aloha POS including but not limited to Configuration Center, Command Center, EDC, Aloha Takeout a strong plusStrong understanding of Online Ordering and Delivery SystemsKnowledge of POS hardware including terminals, printers, and data runs a plusAbility to work collaboratively in a cross-functional environmentAble to drive technical requests in a fast-paced process-oriented environmentAn ability to quickly adapt to new technology to ensure immediate support and serviceability.Fosters an environment of open communication and problem solving Red Robin is an Equal Opportunity & E-Verify Employer

Name: Business Analyst / Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst / Sr. Business Analyst  Location  Denver, CO  Primary Functional Area  Banking Operations  Apply Now At CoBank, our Business Analyst/Sr. Business Analyst provides full-life cycle analysis and first line support for the business units they support. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Welcome to Centura HealthWelcome to the largest health ecosystem in Colorado and western Kansas. Welcome to living your mission among thousands of people on fire to live theirs too. Welcome to options, possibilities and values that guide exceptional care. Welcome to extremely important industry challenges and opportunities to solve complex problems. Welcome to highly intelligent teams, overflowing community and the wholeness of mind, body and spirit that is Centura Health.Flourishing Begins HereYou have a purpose, unique talents and NOW is the time to embrace it, live it and put it to work. At Centura Health, we value incredible people with incredible skills – but your commitment to a greater cause is something we value even more.  Provide statistical, operational and system support; responsible for the collection, manipulation, and analysis of qualitative and quantitative patient experience data to be used throughout Centura Health. Create and support automation tools to assist patient experience department in management of analysis needs. Establish and ensure adherence to standards of programming, data reporting, analysis and end user maintenance. Partner with end users to identify their reporting needs and solutions.What You Bring/Job RequirementsIn addition to bringing your whole self to the workplace each day, qualified candidates will need the following: 3 years experience in working with both relational and non-relational databases, reporting, and table maintenance preferred.Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Accounting, Business or related field. Equivalent work experience may be considered.Pharmacy knowledge is a highly preferred.Knowledge of healthcare operations preferred.Organized, self-starter.Must be able to work independently and collaboratively.High School Diploma or GED required Physical Requirements - Sedentary work -(prolonged periods of sitting and exert up to 10lbs force occasionally)Your Connected CommunityWhen people and places align, incredible things happen. Just like the 21,000+ amazing associates who work here, every community within Centura Health’s connected ecosystem has its own unique history, story and personality.  Centura Health is headquartered in Centennial, CO, with additional business office locations throughout the Denver Tech Center. The Corporate Service Center is home to our leaders and centralized teams that support our hospitals, clinics and people – including marketing, human resources, employee benefits, finance, billing, talent acquisition/development, payor relations, IT, project management, community benefit and more. Whether you work in the corporate headquarters or one of our nearby offices, you’ll experience a culture of collaboration and community where incredible people are doing incredible things every day.

Name: Associate Business Analyst
Description: Reports to: Senior Product ManagerLocation: Denver, CO  Help shape the future of how people experience the digital world. You'll be at the forefront of an exciting shift in how digital identity authentication allows companies and consumers to transact with trust in the digital world.  We’re actively looking to add exceptional people to our team who align with how we envision ourselves culturally and professionally. As a lens to how outsiders see Payfone, you will represent a team of people who love what they do and who they work with. POSITION SUMMARY As an Associate Business Analyst, you play an integral part in helping the Product team measure, interpret and experiment with new data sources and product features. You will own creating and updating coverage maps and other reports that help us to understand the coverage, data quality and holes in our products as well as the data of our partners. You will also assist in the data analysis needs for the Product Management team which entails troubleshooting transactions related to data input or output, analyzing new data integrations and data gaps. This is an entry-level position and no previous experience is required. RESPONSIBILITIES As a member of the Product team, the Associate Business Analyst is expected to: Design and conduct experiments to understand our data coverage and gaps.Analyze and organize large volumes of data.Analyze the results produced to make inferences about sample sets.Make recommendations to Product Managers based on results.Work with the development to understand data to be used in product enhancements.Assist the quality assurance and support teams in troubleshooting data processing.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCEBachelors degree or equivalent experience in a technical or business discipline.Experience in data analysis, testing or experimental design is a plus.Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Python or Java is a plus.Excellent analytical skills, especially synthesizing, dissecting and interpreting big data.Clear oral and written communication skills.COMPENSATION A compensation package composed of a base salary and equity component will be structured to attract a uniquely qualified candidate. Excellent health benefits are included. ABOUT PAYFONE Payfone is the leading digital identity authentication network for the connected world. Our real-time, passive identity authentication solutions enable consumers and the world’s largest banks, insurers, brokerages and technology companies to thwart digital identity theft and transact with trust. Learn more at http://www.payfone.com and https://www.linkedin.com/company/payfone.  This position description should not be considered the final description of the position. It should be assumed that we would, to some extent, structure responsibilities in accordance with the successful candidate’s capabilities and changing business conditions.  Payfone is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people regardless of race, color, religion, gender or sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, veteran status or other personal characteristics.  No employment sponsorship will be provided.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology, and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together.  Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 4,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2016 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 25 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada. Job Title: Business Analyst  Slalom Consulting is seeking talented, experienced technical Business Analysts. Working independently under limited supervision, the individual in this role will plan, design, develop, and analyze business solutions for complex problems. The primary responsibilities of this role include gathering and coordinating project impact assessments from various groups within a client’s organization; working with stakeholders to understand and define their business requirements and project scope. Additionally, will drive business validation of the solution and support testing, deployment and adoption. Core Responsibilities:Demonstrate a logical, rigorous, and analytical problem-solving approach, leading requirements gathering sessions and preparing and delivering client presentations and work products/prototypesManage release schedules, prioritize projects, and ensure adequate resources are availableAttend and lead meetings; provide project status reporting to management; assist with testing scenarios; and validate resultsConduct and document complex business analysis projectsPerform technical analysis to determine present and future business performanceProvide functional advice or training to less-senior business analystsOccasionally lead direct or indirect employees for specific projects or objectivesCreate and execute system test plansQualifications:3 or more years of technical business analyst experience in a consulting environmentBachelor’s degreeSkilled at analyzing complex issues and distilling concepts to clientsAble to proactively identify risks, and drive action to mitigate and resolve issuesStrong analytical and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to work independentlyStrong organizational skills and the ability to manage a vast array of informationBroad understanding of the role of data management, information flow, and data governance issuesExperience with market data and vendor integration and managementAble to serve as a liaison between both business and technical teams to drive effective, timely solutions that fulfill both strategic and operational needsSkilled at defining and documenting business processes and requirements for ongoing system enhancement initiativesDesired Technical Business Analyst Capabilities:Familiarity with databases and table structureUnderstanding of data integration, data analysis and designExperience with SQL, Salesforce, AWS or AzureSet up and/or execution of test automation Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Applications are accepted electronically ONLY at www.cu.edu/cu-careers * University of Colorado Denver l Anschutz Medical Campus  Office of Information Technology  Business Process Analyst  Position #1017 Requisition # 15142  The Office of Information Technology works to advance the University mission by providing innovative technology solutions and services to the CU Denver | Anschutz Medical Campuses, their constituents and partners.  Through our six core values, Service, Professionalism, Leadership, Innovation, Community, and Excellence (SPLICE), we make a difference.  Our Business Process Analyst (BPA) will be a strategic thinker with a passion for identifying opportunities for improvement within technology and business domains. The selected individual will be unique and genuine, as is our culture.  The Office of Information Technology is accepting applications for a full-time university staff (unclassified) Business Process Analyst for the CU Denver campus. Position Summary: The Business Process Analyst (BPA) is an unclassified administrative position that performs full performance professional level analytic work requiring skill in business process elicitation, documentation, and diplomacy. The Office of Information Technology's Business Analysis Team resides within the Policy, Strategy and Analysis Division. We partner with schools and colleges, administrative units, and technical service providers to bring forth an in-depth understanding of their business strategies, processes, and technical needs. Our work helps shepherd our partners to the best possible outcomes and solutions. The BPA applies management analysis techniques to solve problems and facilitate modifications/conversions. This position prepares recommendations to implement new policies, procedures, and process changes or improvements. Work is performed under supervision and performance is based on the effective outcome of projects and engagements. The performance evaluation is conducted through the performance evaluation system and in accordance with the University Policies & Procedures. Examples of Work Performed:Plans and conducts analytical management, financial, operational, and/or administrative projects and confers with management in order to define scope of work, purpose, goals and objectives, time frames, and resource requirements.Provides initial assessment of a situation and researches best practices, trends and historical data, policies and procedures, methods, and practices.Develops methods for the collection of data and assembles it into meaningful formats to facilitate data analysis.Explores alternatives and solutions and the feasibility of recommended changes.Adapts the results of business process analysis to specifying the functional requirements of automated business applications.Partners with team's technical analyst to assist in the development of technical specifications.Cultivates, fosters, and maintains positive working relationships with directors, managers, employees, and other stakeholders to gain their cooperation and support in assigned projects.Facilitates group discussions and meetings, and utilizes continuous improvement techniques and tools from Lean and Six-Sigma methodologies.Provides individual and group training on Lean topics, tools, and techniques.Salary and Benefits: The salary range for this position has been established at $65,000 to $70,000 and is commensurate with skills and experience. This position is not eligible for overtime compensation.  The University of Colorado offers a full benefits package.  Information on University benefits programs, including eligibility, is located at https://www.jobsatcu.com/hr/postings/true.  Your total compensation goes beyond the number on your paycheck. The University of Colorado provides generous leave, health plans and retirement contributions that add to your bottom line. Benefits: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/benefits.Total Compensation Calculator: https://www.cu.edu/employee-services/total-compensationDiversity and Equity: Please click here for information on disability accommodations: http://www.ucdenver.edu/about/departments/HR/jobs/Pages/JobsatCUDenver.aspx  The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is committed to recruiting and supporting a diverse student body, faculty and administrative staff. The university strives to promote a culture of inclusiveness, respect, communication and understanding. We encourage applications from women, ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities and all veterans.  The University of Colorado is committed to diversity and equality in education and employment.  The University of Colorado Denver | Anschutz Medical Campus is dedicated to ensuring a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students and visitors. To assist in achieving that goal, we conduct background investigations for all prospective employees. Minimum Qualifications:Completion of four years of college with a bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college with major emphasis in Business Administration, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a closely related field is required.Substitution: 4 years of professional or high-level technical experience may be substituted for the bachelor's degree.A minimum of 2 years of progressively responsible experience in the field of business analysis is required.A minimum of 2 years of Lean facilitation experience is required.Preferred Qualifications:Business analysis experience within a governmental or higher education institution is desired.Certification in Lean and/or Six Sigma is preferred.Conditions of Employment: Must be willing and able to travel between campuses (Denver Campus and Anschutz Medical Campus)  PLEASE NOTE: Candidates will be responsible for travel expenses related to the interview process and any relocation expenses, if applicable. Competencies, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Customer service excellence.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, interpersonal relationships, and decision-making abilities.Proven experience developing requirements documentation including stakeholder analysis, business requirements, functional specifications, user stories, use cases, storyboards, business process flow diagrams and test plans.Able to effectively facilitate meetings, learning sessions, and continuous improvement events.Experience working with multiple units and/or organizations, building relationships within highly collaborative projects.Sharp conflict resolutions skills.Ability to establish and maintain effective professional working relations with peers, colleagues, associates, administrative staff members, faculty, and with personnel of external agencies and organizations.

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst
Description: About Namaste Solar: We're not just selling solar. We're building a brighter future. Working at Namaste Solar is a chance make a living and make a difference. With over 6,000 solar installations since 2005 and a commitment to excellence in everything we do, we're passionate about doing work we love and that's making a positive impact in Colorado and beyond. Simply check out our online customer reviews to see why you'd be working with the best solar team in Colorado. We're also a Certified B Corporation which means we meet the highest standards of social and environmental responsibility. We are people using business as a force for good.  Namaste Solar is a 5-time Outside Magazine's Best Place to work award winner 2013-2017 and recently won Inc. Magazine's 2018 Best Workplaces. We offer the chance to become a co-owner of the company, learn about business through a "Namaste MBA", and share in the rewards of being a business owner. Namaste Solar is a place where you can learn, grow and thrive all while doing work you love, working alongside amazing like-minded people, and making a positive impact in your local community. Position Overview: As the IT Business Analyst, you will serve as the technical liaison between the Accounting and IT departments of our company. The position will particularly focus on our Sage Intacct financial management software. The successful candidate will partner with accounting team members to drive process improvements, make enhancements via configuration changes, log and manage bug reports, and perform daily system administration tasks. You will also be responsible for translating business needs to IT solutions, and vice versa, with current programs, projects and initiatives in mind. The scope of the position will also require supporting the interface to our Salesforce environment utilized by the sales and operations departments as well as the accounts payable automation system  This position will work closely with the Director of Accounting for project prioritization, and will report to the Director of IT. If you are motivated to help build a great company by not only doing your core job, but also by contributing ideas that improve the customer experience, add efficiency, and increase profit, then Namaste Solar may be a great fit for you. Position Responsibilities:ERP Systems Administration (user setup and removal, security role changes, configuration)Requirements gathering for enhancements via users interviews and independent researchDocumenting project tasks involving numerous stakeholders and monitoring progressFinancial data analysis and reconciliationManaging project tasks to a schedule created with input from senior leadershipReport creation and generationManaging a support ticketing queueLogging bug reports with vendors and working through resolutionsDocumenting systems and processes via Data Flow Diagrams, user guides, and process documentsAssisting in the training of new Accounting usersGather requirements, provide gap analysis and potential efficiency gainsManaging the Salesforce to Intacct interfaceWorking directly with 3rd parties including software providers and consultantsEssential Knowledge, Skills, and Abilties:Bachelor's Degree from accredited college or university in Business, Accounting, Computer Science, Management Information Systems or related field2+ years' experience implementing, maintaining and/or supporting accounting systemsCurrent working knowledge of accounting processes and systemsA strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting PrinciplesAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, particularly Microsoft Excel Utilizing formulas referencing datasets from numerous systems including Sage Intacct financials, ADP labor hours, and Salesforce operational data to produce reconciliation and analysis findingsTechnical Customer service experienceAbility to problem-solve complex issues for a root cause analysis in troubleshooting issues in a complex, workflow driven systemHighly organized with keen attention to detailExcellent documentation skillsAbility to work with little supervision; highly self-motivated with the ability to produce creative solutionsWillingness to learn new technologies and grow your technical and functional skillsAbility to quickly master new technologies as neededAbility to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly languageComfortably able to lift 25lbsNon-Essential (Valued but not required skills and experience):Experience working with ERP systems, with a particular value on Sage Intacct experienceExpert knowledge of Microsoft Excel including macro generation and VBACPASuccess Factors:Positive attitudeConsistent and reliableMaintains stability under pressureFlexible and willing to modify plans and behavior when necessaryTakes pleasure in problem solving and trouble shootingEnjoys the minutiae with high technical requirementsHighly organized, capable of multi-taskingDependable with a stable work historyFocused on customer serviceJob Posted by ApplicantPro

Having a familiarity with manufacturing safety and environmental management is a plus. Name: Corporate Financial Analyst
Description: At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people think about enterprise security technology. With our innovative Identity Defined Security platform, we're helping to build a borderless world where people have total freedom to work wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.  We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado, and we have offices and employees around the globe. And we serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 100. Because even in the most complex enterprise environments, security shouldn't be a source of anxiety. It should be one of your greatest competitive advantages.  We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that drives our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.  Ping Identity is looking for an experienced Corporate Financial Analyst in their Denver office. Candidate should have at least two years of corporate finance experience. Come be part of something extraordinary!  The Corporate Financial Analyst will be a key member of the Finance Team. The Corporate Financial Analyst will be an analytical, operationally oriented professional who is able to aggregate, disaggregate, and interpret financial data to convey business results.  This role will enhance visibility to key financial metrics and data through dashboards, reports, and presentations for the CFO, Board of Directors, and executive team. The Corporate Financial Analyst will be a detail oriented professional who utilizes standardized processes to accurately and efficiently compile, summarize, and present complex financial data. Additionally, this individual will be change-oriented and will continuously seek ways to improve existing FP&A processes. This role will have direct interaction with the CFO and exec team. Key Responsibilities: Help to tell the story of Ping Identity’s performance, including the preparation of financial statements and/or managerial reports within assigned area of responsibility, assisting with the preparation of presentations to the Board of Directors and internal business units, and conducting month-end close functions including variance analysis, explanations, and communicating significant or unusual business matters Collaborate with the FP&A team to report and effectively communicate timely and accurate financials to internal stakeholders, including maintaining various dashboards to highlight key metrics and bring insight to business performance Continuously improve upon existing monthly, quarterly and annual reporting and operating processes; drive automation and simplificationEssential Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or closely related field 2-4 years of relevant finance experience; at least one year of general accounting or finance work experience, including internships, co-ops and other work experience gained in the field during completion of degree; Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skillsDesired Qualifications: Prior experience within an FP&A organization desired, as is prior experience within a public company environment Familiarity with Adaptive Insights and NetSuite is a plus A working style that is comfortable with driving change, and effective at managing interpersonal relationships A successful track record in setting priorities and meeting deadlines; keen analytic, organization and problem-solving skills which support and enable sound decision-making Excellent communication and relationship building skills with an ability to work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders Software / SaaS / technology experience preferred, but not required, as is experience supporting a recurring revenue / subscription business model

Name: Performance Analyst - FUTURE OPPORTUNITY
Description: We’re here to ensure the advertising industry and the people in it are healthy and engaging positively and effectively with those around them. We’re here, ultimately, to improve the lives of people working in the media industry. And we take our responsibility seriously.  PERFORMANCE ANALYST ABOUT THE ROLE The Campaign Performance Analyst will be responsible for working with internal teams on specific accounts to align campaign objectives and KPIs, develop performance measurement plans, and recommendations for campaign optimization. This position is responsible for developing and delivering insightful and actionable reports that tell a performance story. It will have a strong focus on insights vs. observations with responsibility for driving performance outcomes and optimized media investment priorities. The priority for this position is working across the internal team to deliver optimal performance to drive client growth, retention and high levels of client satisfaction. ABOUT THE TEAM The Performance Analytics team has a passion for analytics and a common vision for improvement and growth. As trusted advisors to both our internal teams and clients, our time is split between diving deep into rows of data, showing off our reporting dashboards, and educating our clients on KPIs, tools and evolving methodologies. Among our supportive team network you can often find us showing off the creative reporting templates and custom dashboards that make us proud. CORE RESPONSIBILITIESAlign campaign objectives and KPIs and develop performance measurement plans and recommendations for campaign optimization.Develop and deliver insightful and actionable reports that tell the performance story of the campaign.Partner with Client and Media Services, Search, and Social team members to develop forward-looking campaigns based on historical performance insights.Present reports, optimization recommendations, and insights to both client and internal audiencesUnderstand Centro solutions related to analytics and reporting such as ad verification, attribution, brand studies, viewability, etc.Mentor Associate level performance analysts.QUALIFICATIONS2+ years digital media experience, especially in client facing buying or media measurement departmentsBachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing, Business, Statistics or Economics preferredStrong independent thinking and problem solving abilitiesExcellent organization and communication skillsHighly motivated with a strong record of project or process managementStrong qualitative skills with ability to demonstrate quality data organization and analysis techniquesUnderstanding of media buying and ad serving landscapeStrong knowledge of MS Office, especially ExcelAbility to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment, under tight deadlinesExceptional customer service and communication skillsAdaptable and flexibleA fun, positive attitude that embodies the Centro’s culture Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law. Centro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, gender, age, disability or any other basis protected under the law.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Client Reference Code: 226832 JOB SUMMARY Serves as a liaison to the business community in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as an understanding of the organizations systems and capabilities. Educates on the direction of the business. Utilizes understanding of both business process and technical capabilities to implement solutions to the more complex business needs/problems. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experience  Oversee the functions to gather, analyze, refine, validate, document and maintain complex business requirements for constructing anaclitic and reporting applications and reports  Support the integration of new products and services, regulatory requirements, tools, technologies and markets into existing operations  Ensure complete analysis and understanding of interdependencies, business risks, risk mitigators that could impact or be impacted by the delivery of new products, services, processes and/or support technologies  Ensure all defined business rules/policies are documented, implemented as designed. Ensure process enablers are working as designed (automated as well as manual). Ensure available technology is leveraged to the fullest extent. Redesign business process where applicable to leverage available or new technologies  Oversee the translation of high level business requirements into functional specifications and then translated to technical specs for configuration and deployment. Develop and maintain library of functions specifications via Change Management processes  Function as the liaison between the business unit and the other supporting functional organizations (IT, OSS, Billing, 3rd Party suppliers, etc.) to properly interpret and deliver to the functional specifications. Ensure alignment between the business operational strategies and technical solutions  Perform other duties as required PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Skills/Abilities and Knowledge  Proven experience as an Analyst, DBA or Data Scientist or Software/System Developer  Solid experience in data analysis and reporting  Background in market research and project management  Working Knowledge of database design, database administration, scripting languages, and transformations  Working Knowledge of Excel, R and SQL; familiarity with business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, SAS, Oracle)  Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst or software engineer or product owner  Understanding of different software development life cycles (SDLC)  Understanding of Agile methodologies  Ability to read, write, speak and understand English  Ability to analyze and interpret data  Ability to quickly identify business problems/opportunities  Ability to communicate orally and in writing in a clear and straightforward manner  Ability to communicate with all levels of management and company personnel  Ability to define key performance indicators / metrics  Ability to document, prepare and present data-driven presentations  Ability to make decisions and solve problems while working under pressure  Ability to manage multiple projects at one time  Ability to prioritize and organize effectively  Ability to show judgment and initiative and to accomplish job duties  Ability to supervise and motivate others  Ability to use personal computer & software applications (i.e. Word, Excel, Visio, etc.)  Cross-functional management skills  Knowledge of process and project management  Knowledge of general accounting and billing procedures Education Bachelors degree in Business Administration or related field or equivalent experience  Related Work Experience Number of Years  Business Operations Analysis experience 5  Project management experience 5  Telecommunications experience 10 WORKING CONDITIONS Office environment Job Code : BGN349 Sr Business Analyst Exempt 226832BR

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Sr. Business Analyst - Salesforce Experis is seeking a Business Analyst (BA) for a client in downtown Denver, CO. This person will be responsible for working closely with the team in an agile development format while providing just in time requirements (in various formats) and assisting in developing and delivering proof of concept demonstrations to key stakeholders for a Salesforce implementation. Expected Responsibilities: Requirements engineering (business, stakeholder, functional, solution and transition level requirements) Business process design and documentation (workflow modeling, BPMN experience a plus) o Analysis of existing processes (as-is modeling) and ability to bridge to-be state processes Assess captured business requirements against Salesforce capabilities (fit gap analysis) Rapid design and development of proof of concepts / prototypes within the Salesforce platform System and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) coordination and facilitation Issue tracking & resolution coordination Other duties as assigned The ideal candidate will: Have an excellent professional attitude with strong interpersonal communication, facilitation and presentation skills Be customer experience focused (customer empathizing) Be highly capable in conflict resolution and negotiation Be able to articulate platform capabilities shape customer demand against platform offerings Have strong and proven background in developing Business Analysis artifacts, such as process maps, and requirements documentation Have experience in operating as a Business Analyst / Product Owner in an agile framework (such as Scrum) Have 2+ years working knowledge of Salesforce (highly prefer this experience to have been gained while performing the role of a Business Analyst) Experience in analyzing business needs for Salesforce platform fit is more of a firm requirement for this position (vs heavy Salesforce administration experience). Exposure to Salesforce admin training (through the Trailhead program) a viable equivalency (Business User and Admin Trailhead training tracks). Name: IS Business Analyst
Description: GENERAL PURPOSE:The IS Business Analyst is responsible for the identification and documentation of functional and non-functional detailed user stories and acceptance criteria covering business rules, data definition, quality attributes, design constraints, external interfaces, integration, workflow, and security. The creation of user stories follows the best practices of being independent, negotiable, valuable, estimable, small and testable. In addition, this role plays a critical role in the support of internal production support issues to ensure minimal disruption in the business. The IS Business Analyst champions innovation and building strong, trusted relationships with internal clients and any third party application vendors.  Team: Digital Experience  The IS Business Analyst is part of the Digital Experience team which manages the agent and policy holder portals, as well as supports our online website. The role is directly involved in the development, maintenance and support of all Online software solutions in an agile environment.ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:Leads analysis of system issues to diagnose the root cause, escalating issues as necessary.Serves as primary contact for tier-2 internal production support issues, keeping customers experiencing issues up to date on progress and resolution.Creates detailed user stories with acceptance criteria ready for development, which has been reviewed and validated with the team.Creates process models, diagrams, charts or other materials to provide requirement clarification to the agile team and stakeholders.Educates end users through the creation of written documents and live training sessions which enables customers to effectively utilize new features or systems.Documents existing business process and its relationship to the system for cross training of other staff and creation of a knowledge base which enhances the speed and innovation of the team’s work.Manages all artifacts related to the creation of user stories, which could include diagrams, use cases, wireframes, etc. for use by other team members and future projects.Collaborates with the team to continuously improve its internal practices and processes.ADDITIONAL DUTIES:Other duties as assignedMIMIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s Degree strongly preferred. Relevant work experience (similar kind of work at a similar level of work as described in the essential duties) may be substituted for the bachelor's degree. Completion of a degree is encouraged and supported.Minimum 3 years of IT Business Analyst experience (experience working in an agile environment with a basic understanding of relational databases, SQL, and the SDLC) or related experience through working on IT projects.
