Name: Security Business Analyst
Description: At Ping Identity, we're changing the way people think about enterprise security technology. With our innovative Identity Defined Security platform, we're helping to build a borderless world where people have total freedom to work wherever and however they want. Without friction. Without fear.  We're headquartered in Denver, Colorado, and we have offices and employees around the globe. And we serve the largest, most demanding enterprises worldwide, including over half of the Fortune 100. Because even in the most complex enterprise environments, security shouldn't be a source of anxiety. It should be one of your greatest competitive advantages.  We call this digital freedom. And it's not just something we provide our customers. It's something that drives our company. People don't come here to join a culture that's built on digital freedom. They come to cultivate it.  As a Business Analyst working in Ping’s Denver office, you will work directly with Ping’s Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to oversee and manage the operations of the security department. You will be responsible for tracking status of security initiatives, working with cross-functional teams to ensure projects are completed fully, assisting with budgeting and procurement, and managing the security metrics program. You will have great visibility into how the program is run, and will be an essential part of measuring the success of the program. Job Functions: Track and report on the status of key security initiatives throughout Ping Assist with department budget and procurement of new technologies Manage the security metrics program Assist with security training and awareness initiativesEssential Qualifications: Seeking candidate with 1-3 years’ experience with Business Analysis, Project Management or Program Management Process improvement mindset Knowledge of fundamental security concepts Excellent written and oral communication skillsDesired Qualifications: Experience in a fast-paced, ever-changing and growing environment Experience with scripting languages (python, powershell, etc) Requires minimal management attention—self managed and can work in a fluid environment Must be inquisitive and quick learner with attention to detailEducation Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in business or computer related field or equivalent experience

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: OVERVIEW OF POSITION: Responsible for performing routine and moderately complex activities under limited supervision in order to design, implement, maintain and support policies, processes and systems related to Medicare Risk Adjustment programs. Interacts with Analytics, Coding Department, Clinical Decision Support, Health Plan Analysis, site and regional staff to accomplish goals. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Perform analysis and reporting activities relating to: risk score calculation, claims/encounters data submission, chart review programs and audits, and related performance metrics.Analysis and reporting on RAF Forecast Model by plan/patient cohorts and review cost and utilization trends to understand impact on revenue; along with reconciliation and root cause analysis for any variance.Stay updated and share knowledge on industry changes especially any changes on CMS side (changes like ICD10, EDS, Payment Model Changes)Assists department in tracking projects, expenditures and risks. Assists with project communication requirements.Responds appropriately to reports of trouble related to applications or programs to quickly resolve issue; manages customer expectations by keeping them informed of progress.Develops report specifications and writes complex reports for department or management using available reporting tools.Uses, protects, and discloses DMG patients protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards.Performs additional duties as assigned.Consistently exhibits behavior and communication skills that demonstrate Davita Medical Groups (DMG) commitment to superior customer service, including quality, care and concern with each and every internal and external customer.EDUCATION:Bachelors degree from a four-year college; preferred: major in information systems or related quantitative field (finance, computer science or, mathematics).EXPERIENCE:Minimum:Over 3 years and up to and including 5 years of experience.Background in healthcare industry and managed care.3-5 years of project management experience.3-5 years of experience with MS Access, Excel, and SQL.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Ability to work in a team environment with minimal amount of supervision.Ability to cope with fluctuating demands of an uneven workload.Proficient with MS Office, MS-Access, MS-Visio.Preferred:Strong understanding of Medicare Risk Adjustment Payment Model and Cycle including the knowledge base to calculate and manipulate risk scores.Familiarity with CMS data and risk adjustment processes including MMR, MOR and EDS data.Strong understanding of Claims and Encounter data.Strong command on SQL Server (T-SQL), SSIS and SSRS, and Database design.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:Commitment to DaVitas core values of Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfillment and Fun. Ability to demonstrate the core values positively and proactively to patients, teammates, management, physicians, and/or vendors (Village Service Partners) in everyday performance and interactions.Comfortable in and excited to be a part of an ever-evolving environment and team.Exceptional project management; ability to organize, direct and lead special projects.Proven ability to "get stuff done" and liaise with cross-functional constituents.Ability to communicate appropriately and efficiently with top senior executives both internally and externally.Ability to prioritize major projects and/or programs that require strict and time sensitive deadlines. DaVita Medical Group manages and operates medical groups and affiliated physician networks in California, Colorado, Florida, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania and Washington. A leading independent medical group in America, DaVita Medical Group has over two decades of experience providing coordinated, outcomes-based medical care in a cost-effective manner. As of June 30, 2017, DaVita Medical Groups teammates, employed clinicians and affiliated clinicians provided care for approximately 1.7 million patients. DaVita Medical Groups leadership development initiatives and social responsibility efforts have been recognized by Fortune, Modern Healthcare, Newsweek and WorldBlu.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Business Systems Analyst position will be a key member of the Onboarding team for system integration projects. Our clients implement many XML and JSON based B2B APIs, and we provide services and tools to assist with the implementation and testing of those APIs. This role may require interaction with some of our Fortune 500 clients; communicating with a broad range of associates with business and technical backgrounds. The ideal candidate must have the ability to blend technical and business skills to provide value at multiple levels and convey Motive Retail’s value proposition depending on the audience.  The role of Business Systems Analyst requires the unique ability to assess business needs and analyze complex technical / data problems. The nature of solving these problems to help our clients meet their business objectives includes a lifecycle of analysis, testing of systems, documentation of technical requirements, test case design and configuration of software. Business Systems Analyst Responsibilities:Application ConfigurationDetermining technical requirements for new APIsWriting technical documentation, including functional requirements, use cases, process flows/sequence diagrams and data specificationsTesting of interfaces across systems and test case configurationSet-up of technical projects in our integration automation platformWorking with our product team to identify platform enhancement opportunities and build requirementsProviding project management and oversight to ensure key projects are executed and meet clients expectationsWorking with the team to improve our delivery process and toolsMinimum Skills and Qualifications:Strong critical thinking and analytical skills, very detail orientedProven strong communication skills - both written and verbal, including the ability to effectively communicate complex, technical topics to both technical and non-technical usersEnergetic, self-starter, interested and willing to learnBachelor Degree Preferred Skills and Qualifications Experience with B2B Web Services and tools such as SoapUI and/or PostmanExperience with software development processes, testing and technical documentationExperience with XML, XSD, and XSLTExperience with XML tools such as Liquid XML, XML Spy or OxygenExperience with JSONExperience with relational database3+ years related experienceBusiness Systems Analyst Benefits:401K MatchProfit SharingHealthcare, Dental, Vision Insurance, FSA PlansBasic and Supplemental Life and AD&DShort and Long term Disability13 Company Holidays per Year15 days PTOFlexible Work Environment We’re a small but accomplished team making big waves in the global automotive industry. We’re serious about what we do but we like to have fun too and work / life balance is critical. Our office is in Louisville, CO, nearby bus routes, lunch spots and convenient to Boulder and Denver.  Our company culture is built on going above and beyond doing the work we have been asked. We are a team of collaborative innovators, each bringing different perspectives into the continuous improvement of our processes and products. If you like the sound of an organization where your opinion matters, your contribution is valued and you can be part of a team that doesn’t take itself too seriously, then we might be just what you’re looking for.  We are looking to hire an energetic, self-starter, interested and willing to learn about the automotive industry and system integration. We need someone who is not afraid of working independently, is able to self-direct, meet deadlines and enjoys customer interaction.  LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY, NO RELOCATION OFFERED.Company DescriptionMotive Retail is a unique software company that is passionate about providing innovative and dynamic system integration solutions to global manufacturers, dealer systems and value added software providers. Our integration automation platform gives our customers the ability to share data across a global, dynamic and complex ecosystem via tighter system integrations. We help organizations simplify complex data integration problems and partner with some of the largest names in the Automotive and Powersports industries.

Your teams solution will be impacting and improving the work life of thousands of users, as our clients rely on our team to develop custom applications that enable their companies to thrive in todays world. identify information systems integration points; and develop procedures to improve existing systemsAnalytical skills to evaluate tradeoffs between usability and performance needsExperience recognizing scope limitations and raising potential scope issues, while supporting the best technical solution design and approachStrong interpersonal and leadership skills including collaboration and facilitationAdaptable, dependable, and willing to learn independentlySila will not sponsor any employee in this position for a work visa, now or in the future (i.e. H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant or immigrant status)About SilaSila is a technology and management consulting firm that delivers solutions to the worlds leading corporations and Federal government agencies. We are a values-driven company with a culture that fosters collaboration, creativity, and social responsibility. Sila employees are part of a community of vibrant, high-performing contributors who push each other to achieve the highest standard of excellence. Our team members have extensive opportunities to discover their passions and shape their own career paths, and we continually invest in employees growth through innovative training, mentorship, and professional development programs. Staff are quickly immersed in clients business challenges, work closely with emerging technologies to develop impactful solutions to these challenges, and are exposed to a variety of industries and market offerings.We are looking for full-time employees to become an integral part of our growing team. Position Location Denver, CO Position Title Business Analyst – Oil and Gas Position Summary The key responsibility of the Business Analyst is to help create solutions to meet our client’s business needs across all areas of service offerings. The Business Analyst role is responsible for the oversight of data, reporting, and analytics. This person must possess strong analytical and computer skills along with advanced knowledge of computer applications that support business efforts. This position requires a person who can easily and professionally interact with IT, Land and Accounting. They will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help the business make decisions. Must take a proactive approach to look for opportunities to optimize business processes. Responsibilities:Collaborate with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.Clearly identify project stakeholders and establish user classes, as well as their characteristics.Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options, communicate these back to business stakeholders.Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements– verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.Assist with the implementation of Land and Division Order systems, build upgrades, system enhancements and maintenance.Understand and interpret land system interfaces with other software applications.Deal with ambiguity and discover the underlying requirements feature requests; recommend approaches and lead efforts to meet aggressive timelines.Work with managers as well as other groups to coordinate and develop business metrics; assessments, track/drive projects; manage the operational implementation process.Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management and make tradeoffs; encourage risk-taking behavior to maximize business benefit; identify interdependencies between concurrent projects to prevent downstream problems.Gain consensus on decisions and ensure that appropriate practices are employed to deliver high quality results.Work with internal client teams to launch projects and provide ongoing support as appropriate.Document current state and future state processes.Work with stakeholders that will be impacted by process changes to understand the scope, scale and costs of impacts.Identify process changes, systems, data and human impacts.Work with larger project team to document requirements.Participate in user acceptance testing and QA processes.Maintain high levels of partnership across organization, ensuring solutions orientated culture while fostering positive team environment.Perform and assume other duties and responsibilities as may be required.Education and Required Experience:High School Diploma required.Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Petroleum Land Management, Legal or technical degree preferred.Division Order or relevant oil and gas experience required.Experience in GIS, Land, and Accounting database.Experience with Quorum Land Suite.Demonstrated intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel capabilities.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required.Excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives.Able to exercise independent judgment and act on it.Excellent analytical and creative problem-solving skills.Logical and efficient, with keen attention to detail.Highly self-motivated and directed.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure.Strong customer service orientation. KG Lewis is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against applicants or employees on the basis of age, race, sex, color, religion, veteran status, genetic information, national origin, disability or any other status protected by state or local law. It is KG Lewis’s intention that all qualified applicants are given equal opportunity and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors.  We are unable to provide visa sponsorship for non-U.S. citizens.

Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description: SNI Technology's client located in Denver, CO is actively looking to hire a Senior Technical Business Analyst for an exciting direct-hire opportunity!Job Description: SNI Technology's client is the leading owner, operator and developer of industrial logistics real estate across the Americas, Europe and Asia. Our client creates value by developing and managing a world-class portfolio of high-quality logistics and distribution facilities, serving customers and investors as an integral part of the global supply chain.  Are you looking for a SeniorTechnical Business Analyst job on the data team of an ambitious company that takes analytics very seriously? Do you want a job where you can really influence decisions? Do you think that you have the right skills and experience to support our strategy to make data and analytics a driver of long-term growth and success?  If yes, please continue reading What we have:A position as Senior Technical Business Analyst on our data team.A team with very smart and dedicated colleagues.A company that wants to be the best in analytics in the industry.Internal and external customers who are very interested and willing to participate in new data and analytics initiatives.Projects in all stages of the analytics maturity model, from descriptive to prescriptive.What you are:You are very analytical. You understand the purpose of organizations and how they interact with the outside world. You understand how business processes generate and use data. You have a holistic view on how putting data into context provides information for internal and external use. In your vision the right information supports long term business growth and drives organizational success.You love to keep up to date with new technologies. You know a lot about business intelligence software and you regularly read about new functionality that you want to share with your team.You see every business problem as a logical puzzle that you want to solve. Even if your business partner isn't completely clear when they explain their need, you stay patient, provide guidance and ask the right questions so you obtain the information you need. Because you think two steps ahead, the discussions with your business partner produce new ways of looking at the problem. Your way of communicating creates trust and builds relationships.You speak and write English fluently. Code is your second language. You know SQL and can distinguish a good data model from a bad one. When you are solving a business problem, you use your prototyping skills to make sure there are no ambiguous requirements, both from a UI and data model perspective.You document requirements in a highly structured and efficient way as you don't want to spend more time than necessary on this task. Your audience of data architects, data modelers, ETL developers, report developers, data governance experts and QA engineers appreciate your clear writing style and great attention to detail.What you have:A bachelor's degree in relevant field of study.3+ years working experience in complex data environment.Track record of proven successes, and lessons learned.What we appreciate: As members of the data team, we always give the best we have. We are looking for candidates that also want to give the best they have. We would therefore appreciate it if you could add a brief letter to your resume in which you explain why you are a good fit for this position. To give you some ideas, we love to read about the experience you're most proud of, a crazy anecdote, your unique vision or anything else you think is worth mentioning.

Name: Sr. SOC Analyst
Description: DescriptionThe Threat hunter/Analysts primary function is to identify and prioritize potential threats and identify trends. Configure security solutions to identify threats. Perform incident response, issue resolution, and assessment or communication of security risk to the enterprise and provide support by monitoring real-time security alerts, identifying and prioritizing potential threats. Lead security incident investigations. Complete and deliver complex security reports to management in business terms. Analyze available data sources, security tools, and threat trends and lead security monitoring and analysis techniques to identify attacks against the enterprise. Create correlations and other logic to identify attackers and defend the network against advanced attacks. Hunt for and identify threat actor groups and their techniques, tools and processes Identify gaps in IT infrastructure by mimicking an attacker's behaviors and responses, Provide expert analytic investigative support of large scale and complex security incidents, Perform Root Cause Analysis of security incidents for further enhancement of alert catalog. Requirments:Advanced experience as SOC AnalystThreat hunting experienceFirewall and rules analysis experienceFamiliarization with a variety of information and network security monitoring tools (ArcSight SIEM, QRadar SIEM, Splunk, Arbor DDoS Mitigation, Cisco IDS/IPS, Netcool, and Imperva WAF, among others)Industry certs highly desired--CISSP, SSCP, CEH, ECSA, ECIH, etc...Drug, background and US citizenship required #High  #LI-AW1Horizontal Integration is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We seek to provide employment opportunities to talented, qualified candidates regardless of race, color, sex/gender including gender identity and/or expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under federal, state or local law. In addition, Horizontal Integration will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need to request a reasonable accommodation in order to complete the application or interview process, please contact hr@horizontalintegration.com. All applicants applying must be legally authorized to work in the country of employment.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Id: EB-5111505310 Location: Denver, CO Job Type: FullTimeRegularSenior Financial Analyst About the Company: Our client is a leading, national business services provider with multiple offices throughout the US. They are looking to hire a Senior Financial Analyst to join their growing accounting and finance team where there is significant opportunity for growth within the department. If you are looking for a company that maintains a professional, team-orientated culture and provides its employees with the tools and training necessary to perform, then this is the company for you. Responsibilities of the Senior Financial Analyst: Preparation of monthly, quarterly, and ad hoc financial statements and reporting Help coordinate with third party vendors to help complete audit and tax requirements Manage cash operations including forecasting, liquidity analysis, and debt compliance Review monthly cash reconciliation and G/LsRequirements of the Senior Financial Analyst: Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance with 5+ yrs experience Advanced Excel skills with a strong analytical skill set and financial aptitude Ability to effectively communicate and compile large data into clear and concise reports Salary $80k-$100k + generous benefits and bonus potential.

Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: At AES, we raise the quality of life around the world by changing the way energy works. Everyone makes an impact every day in our small, global teams. Apply here to start an extraordinary career today.  The Analyst role within the Business Development group is responsible for supporting the management of solar project development from point of identified project to start of construction. The incumbent works with developers, legal, finance and construction teams. The role requires project management knowledge and experience, preferably in the solar industry. Primary Roles & ResponsibilitiesProvide support to origination developers in the management of solar project development from point of identified project to start of construction.Provide support to origination team, finance team and construction management team to ensure team coordinationMay participate in project kickoff meetings and gather needed data to initiate projectSupport construction Project Managers in high quality project deliveryApply critical thinking needed to communicate and influence employees at all levels regarding project risks, opportunities, and recommended actionProvide support and analysis for Development Pipeline Reporting: May require coordination and data gathering with other members of the DE to produce regular KPI reports.Position RequirementsTwo to four years of project management and/or development experience, preferably in solar or related industry preferredUndergraduate degree, preferably in engineering or businessStrong Microsoft Office application skills Experience with developing and running financial modelsExperience utilizing CRM systems and developing metrics.Strong presentation, written and speaking skillsWilling to travel and work outside of normal business hours. Anticipated travel is no more than 10% of time.Highly organized; attention to detail and ability to meet deadlinesComfortable managing multiple priorities in a fast paced environment

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst/Developer
Description: As an integral member of our delivery team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Report Developer is responsible for the design, development, implementation and support of mission-critical enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) reports. Working with cross-functional teams, you will participate to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs. Using your skills and experience as a BI Report Developer, you will then use those requirements to design, develop, test and implement reports and dashboards that utilize the underlying data store(s)/ data warehouse(s) / data mart(s). Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:  Participate in business analysis activities to gather required reporting and dashboard requirements  Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used to implement the required reports and dashboards, created from potentially multiple data sources  Transition developed reports and dashboards to the Operations& Support team  Provide support as required to ensure the availability and performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users  Ensure proper configuration management and change controls are implemented for your sphere of influence  Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members  Provide training and assistance to users for generation of ad-hoc reports  Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes  Must be able to perform duties with moderate to low supervision  Other duties may be assigned. Supervisory Responsibilities This job has no supervisory responsibilities. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  3+ years experience developing and implementing enterprise-scale reports and dashboards, including: Working with users in a requirements analysis roleExperience with data warehouse implementationsKnowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional)Proficiency with Microsoft SSMS, SSRS, and SSIS requiredPerformance tuning experience related to reporting queries requiredExperience with SSAS and Power BI desired but not requiredFamiliarity with Pyramid Analytics and/or MDX desired but not requiredUnderstanding of data integration issues (validation and cleaning), familiarity with complex data and structuresExcellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills are required to support working in project environments that includes internal, external and customer teamsRequires strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilitiesProgramming / scripting experience and knowledge of software development life cycle is preferred.Ability to manage multiple priorities, and assess and adjust quickly to changing priorities Education and/or Experience Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; and at least three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Relies on extensive experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Troubleshooting skills are also required. Requires the ability to exercise extensive creativity and resourcefulness in determining business solutions. Language Skills Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Mathematical Skills Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Reasoning Ability Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. BENEFITS and PERKS Benefits are an integral part of the overall compensation package provided by 2-10 Home Buyers Warranty and a key tool in recruiting and retaining great employees. It is our objective to offer comprehensive coverage that meets our employees’ needs. Benefits Overview 2-10 Home Buyers Warranty offers the following benefits:  Medical insurance, Health savings account, Dental insurance, Vision insurance, Flexible spending accounts, Basic life and AD&D insurance, Supplemental life and AD&D insurance, Disability insurance, Additional Colonial insurance, Employee assistance program, Paid time off, 401K matching, Paid maternity leave. Work Perks 2-10 Home Buyers Warranty offers the following additional benefits for eligible employees. RTD EcoPass which can be used seven days a week. We are across the street from Iliff Light Rail Station.Discount Home Warranty program.On-site fitness center in Aurora.Modern and professional work environment.Many great events such as First Fridays (fun events), Social Responsibility Events, Jeans Days, and on-site food trucks (typically 2–3 days a week).

Sitefinity experience a significant plus.Experience with a product management approach to software developmentExperience with mobile first, responsive and adaptive designKnowledge, Skills, Competencies and Abilities:Must be approachable, respectful and well-rounded. Ability to work closely with others in an Agile environment (SCRUM)Strong elicitation and facilitation techniquesAnalytical skills to ask the right questions, dissect, organize, translate and cross-reference requirementsExperience in various prioritization methodsFeature-based road mappingEffective user storiesAcceptance criteria definitionAble to deliver capabilities that add measurable valueA strong sense of web design best practices and a passion for delivering simple and effective solutionsGood teamwork and excellent communication and presentation skills, especially client facing are essentialSelf-starter and ability to work independently or on a teamSDL2017

Name: Senior Consultant
Description: Choose Credera for a rewarding career that provides a range of opportunities and challenges that allow you to play a key role in solving problems for top Fortune 500 companiesa place where you will have the chance to work with cutting edge technologies alongside the brightest technical minds in the industry. Choose Credera for the chance to work with leaders who desire to equip and encourage you both in your personal and professional growth through monthly tech meetings and a company-wide mentorship program...choose Credera for the chance to work in a fun environment where you would enjoy minimal travel, company Fireside Chats, monthly happy hours, and a company trip!  Those selected for this position will join a high performing team of individuals who endeavor to live out our core values of humility, integrity, excellence, and professionalism. If you would like to be associated with a rapidly growing firm that passionately believes in providing excellent client service, then please consider joining our professional family. Travel: 25% Responsibilities The successful candidate will be responsible for performing work and managing tasks based upon knowledge of the client, solution, or industry, leading a work stream or acting as a team lead and managing non-complex components of the work plan/project and utilizing analytical, process, and/or technical skills to meet project objectives and deliverables that are self-directed and within project scope. Engagements range from 100% custom application development to Enterprise Portal design and implementation (i.e., SharePoint), cloud solutions (i.e., Azure, Office 365, Intune), eCommerce (i.e., B2B and B2C), MS Dynamics CRM design and implementation, mobile solutions, Enterprise Application Integration/SOA (e.g., BizTalk, WCF, etc.), and more. Basic Qualifications Applicants must have a strong background in a Microsoft centric development environment including: Visual Studio.net, ASP.net, C#, VB.net, MVC, MS SQL Server, and be at least familiar with one or more of Microsoft's platform technologies such as SharePoint, BizTalk, Azure, CRM, etc. Applicants must have excellent communication and organization skills, object oriented development skills, documentation skills, self-motivation, project leadership expertise, and maintain outstanding professionalism. Degree in the area of MIS, CIS, or Computer Science2-6 years minimum application development experience in a professional environmentExcellent communication and leadership skillsDatabase and Object Oriented Design skills Additional Preferred SkillsPrevious consulting experience preferredNET Framework, ASP.NET C#, Visual Basic .NETMicrosoft SQLCommerce Server, BizTalk ServerWindows Communication FoundationLearn More Credera is a management consulting, user experience, and technology solutions firm with offices in Dallas, Houston, and Denver. We work with clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to emerging industry leaders, and provide expert, objective advice to help solve complex business and technology challenges. Our deep capabilities in strategy, organization, process, analytics, technology and user experience help our clients improve their performance. Clients depend on our ability to anticipate, recognize, and address their specific needs. Credera's consultants work with some of the world's best known brands in a variety of industries, including Hilton Hotels & Resorts, Interstate Batteries, The National Geographic Society, Neiman Marcus, Pep Boys, The Container Store, and many more emerging industry leaders around the country. More information is available at www.credera.com. We are part of the OPMG Group of Companies, a division of Omnicom Group Inc.  Along with a great company culture, Credera provides an outstanding compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent performance-based bonus program, and a comprehensive benefit plan (e.g., medical, dental, disability, matching 401k, PTO, etc.). This position is an exempt position. U.S. Equal Opportunity Employment Information (Completion is voluntary) Individuals seeking employment at Credera are considered without regards to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Completion of the last four questions in our application is entirely voluntary. Whatever your decision, it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary  Under general supervision, organizes data and/or reports for the department of nursing. Produces material specific to nursing projects that will be shared with and used by nurse executives and other nurse leaders as appropriate. Compiles financial statistics and reports for the CNO, for the nurse executive team, and for committees and for nursing in general. Serves as a nursing liaison and resource for multiple nursing units/work areas. Minimum Qualifications Education and Experience 1. Bachelor's Degree required. Degree in Business Administration preferred. 2. Five years of related experience. Experience with reporting from multiple tables and databases preferred. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 1. Effective communication and teamwork skills. 2. Ability to manage projects and implement business applications. 3. Keen ability to prioritize a multitude of projects. 4. Knowledge of navigating CPOE, EDM and Invision preferred. 5. Able to weigh and evaluate several factors requiring judgement and problem solving. Computers and Technology 1. Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, SharePoint and Access software. Certificates, Licenses and Registration 1. None  All job applicants for safety-sensitive positions must pass a pre-employment drug test, once a conditional offer of employment hasbeen made.  Denver Health is an integrated, efficient, high-quality academic health care system that is considered a model for the nation. The Denver Health system includes the Rocky Mountain Regional Level I Trauma Center, a 525-bed acute care medical center, Denver's 911 emergency medical response system, 8 family health centers, 15 school-based health centers, the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Center, the Denver Public Health Department, an HMO, and The Denver Health Foundation.  As Colorado's primary safety net institution, Denver Health is a mission-driven organization that has provided more than $3.3 billion in care for the uninsured in the last ten years. Denver Health is a leader in performance and quality improvements and remains financially secure, in part, due to its nationally recognized implementation of lean principles in healthcare. Denver Health is a major resource to the community, serving approximately 185,000 individuals and 67,000 children a year.  Located just south of downtown Denver, Denver Health is just minutes away from many of the cultural and recreational activities Denver has to offer.  We strongly support diversity in the workforce and Denver Health is an equal opportunity employer (EOE).  "Denver Health is committed to provide equal treatment and equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Denver Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class."SDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: OverviewAt Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.  We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.  Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst in our Denver, CO office. Job Overview: Perficient is seeking a Business Systems Analyst with an established business systems background. Candidates will be responsible for gathering and defining requirements and creating functional designs of web-based applications, portals and integration solutions.  As a Business Systems Analyst based in Denver, your proven history of requirements gathering, project scope definition, process modeling, functional design, and partnering with internal and external teammates to drive projects to successful completion will serve as the foundation for your success. Full life cycle experience delivering web-based applications, portal and/or integration projects will allow you to hit the ground running.Responsibilities Translate client’s business needs into agile product backlogs, user stories, detailed business requirements documents, use cases and systems interaction diagrams.Participate on agile teams with responsibilities for managing an agile product backlog, backlog grooming, sprint planning, and sprint demos.Work with customers to establish approved wireframes and mock-ups for solutions.Help to establish critical path, milestones, delivery dates, and review client deliverables to ensure they meet client acceptance criteria.Build trusted client relationships through proactive communication and effective project delivery.Establish knowledge of client business challenges and priorities to translate into opportunities.Maintain regular client communication and satisfaction, ensuring opportunities and challenges are addressed in a timely manner.Help deliver presentations to clients and management teams.Contribute to project discoveries, kickoff, prepare proposals and statements of work following company standards.QualificationsBachelor’s DegreeFour or more years of professional business analysis experienceTwo or more years of experience working in an Agile environmentUnderstanding of iterative development methodologiesExperience developing and running SQL queries; ability to troubleshoot and report application data issues.Knowledge of current technologies and application software development methodologiesHighly detail oriented and well organizedStrong analytical, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.Energetic, motivated, service-oriented, and able to multi task.Proven track record of delivering on time, on budget, and meeting client commitments.Excellent listening, oral, and written communication skills.Excellent facilitation, presentation, and reporting skills.Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.Flexible to new situations and challenges.Preferred skills and education:Consulting industry experience working with external clientsExperience working in the telecommunications industryDegree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, and/or Business Management Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About Perficient Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.  Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index. Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Disclaimer: The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY Under general supervision, formulates and defines systems scope and objectives through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. With this knowledge, develops or modifies moderately complex information systems. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, and revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary. Competent to work in some phases of systems analysis and considers the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment. Generally uses existing procedures to resolve standard problems.CORE SKILLSSomeone who is motivated, customer service centric, lateral thinker/go-getter and willingness to learn and grow  Willing to work in team environment but can work independently  Proficient with Excel  Some Financial knowledge is required (basic financial analysis)  Some IT Networking, Active Directory/group/tree experience is required  Any ticketing system such as ServiceNow, Remedy etc is required  Providing access to application, admin rights etc experience is required  Good to have exposure to Commercial Real Estate industry (especially Appraisal & Valuation side) is PLUS but not requiredBi-Lingual: Spanish is preferred ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Provides end user support for a specific application while learning about the application and customer.  Assists in application implementations and assists in testing end user processes using defined guidelines.  Updates existing application tables and verifies the accuracy.  Collects data and runs basic reports in response to client inquiries as directed by more senior associates.  Interacts with clients, both internal and external, to supply basic information.  Analyzes business and user needs, documenting requirements, with the guidance of a senior associate.  Documents business rules/functional requirements to support system enhancements with the guidance of a senior associate.  Logs and tracks basic problems/work tickets with external product vendors or support organizations.  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as functional guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree in business or related field and 0-3 years of experience. CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills. Name: Associate IT Business Analyst
Description: The CU Office of Advancement manages and coordinates administrative functions to support the campus-based fundraising field staff. These functions include communications, database management, estate gift planning, gift processing, marketing, research and other services. These centralized services place the institution in an optimal position to attract substantial support from the philanthropic sector.  The Associate IT Business Analyst position is a member of the team working with CU Advancement offices, providing IT planning and consultation, with a focus on engaging with staff and partner staff to capture observations, prepare formatted documentation of those observations, analyze gathered information and recommend options, and implement selected solutions. The Office of Advancement consist of the following departments: Alumni Relations, Corporate & Foundation Relations, Parent Giving, and Annual Giving. The Associate IT Business Analyst position also works within central Advancement, and collaborates with central and Campus IT departments, to ensure the IT architecture and services, and overall university context are properly considered in any proposed IT solution.  The main focus for this position will be to understand the business processes and technology landscape of the Advancement Office and how to best utilize the functionality in those applications. The initial assignment of this position will be to work on a holistic project to redesign workflow and systems for the business of Advancement within CU.  This position is directly supervised by the Director of Technical Architecture. This position will exercise independent discretion and decision-making in determining how to meet goals set by the Director. This position does not have any formal supervisory responsibility, but may include peer development once the full project team is developed. The Associate Business Analyst is exempt from the State of Colorado Classified Staff system. Duties and Responsibilities: Duties and responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:  55% - Collaborate with department members and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) in support of functional analysis and requirements definition for specific business and IT solutions: Interview stakeholders (users, technical counterparts, vendors) to gather requirements and develop options that are low to moderate in complexity.Develop any necessary requirements and specifications possibly including process flow models, use cases or user stories, data models, and UML diagrams that fully communicate requirements and conditions of satisfaction.Perform analysis that considers the existing environment, the overall University business and technical environment, campus IT architecture, best practices from peer institutions and industry, and available technologies and services, then fully articulating and communicating solutions.Document business cases, cost models, and budgets from stakeholder interviews and in support of IT-supported business initiatives. 35% - Participate in ongoing projects and deployed services: Ensure tasks related to projects continue to meet the established objectives and business needs within scope established for the project or service through a continual service improvement methodology. This includes coordinating and facilitating deployment testing, problem resolution efforts and managing relationships and service level performance of service providers University and 3rd party vendors.Support troubleshooting and support activities with customers. 10% - Professional development and participating in university- and campus-wide IT planning efforts. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: To be successful in this position, candidates will need the following: Knowledge of project management best practicesKnowledge of IT data analysisExcellent judgement and decision-making abilitiesAbility to interpret and evaluate user requirements and produce and analyze dataAbility to work with tight deadlines and manage frequent requests from all levels of Advancement users each having their own timelines and constraints.Effective presentation skills to clearly articulate technical and business process-related concepts to groups and individuals with varying ranges of technical literacy.Skilled with effective communication strategies, outreach and interaction with constituents, strengthen business relationships with all Advancement staff, Alumni Relations colleagues, and business partners.Effective written and oral communication skills and interpersonal/customer-relations skills.Who we are: System Administration, which also houses the Office of the President, is located in the uptown neighborhood of Denver with an office in Broomfield and a few smaller offices located on the campuses. This position is located in Broomfield. Many of our departments support the educational and research missions of the four University of Colorado campuses. We provide diverse opportunities for professional development, innovation, and collaboration with talented staff and faculty. What we offer: Salary: The salary has been established at $55,000.  Benefits: The University of Colorado offers an excellent benefits package including: Medical: Multiple plan optionsDental: Multiple plan optionsAdditional Insurance: Disability, Life, Vision and WellnessRetirement 401(a) Plan: Employer contributes 10% of your gross payPaid Time Off: Accruals over the yearVacation Day: 22Sick Days: 15Holiday Days: 10Tuition Benefit: System employees have the benefit on all campusesECO Pass: RTD Bus and light rail serviceAdditional Perks & Programs: Click here to access a few more Perks and Programs Click here to access our Total Compensation Calculator to see what your total rewards could be at CU. This position is a University Staff position.  For more information on benefits programs, including eligibility, is available at www.cu.edu/employee-services/. Minimum Requirements:Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution of higher education or equivalent professional experience. (The educational requirement may be substituted on a year-for-year basis.)One (1) year of IT Business Analysis experience that includes at least 2 of the following:Business strategyBusiness casesProcess mappingFormal requirements specificationsSupport or implementation of complex systems with a demonstrated ability to translate them into solutions.Preferred Qualifications:Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP, CCBA).Higher Education experienceExperience working in moderate to highly complex policy and organizational environments.Experience in developing, testing, implementing, maintaining, and upgrading complex application systems.Experience with Salesforce or Advance ApplicationExperience in engagement, marketing, or communicationExperience with fundraising organizations and business processesSDL2017

Name: EDI Business to Business Analyst
Description: Driven by Possibility  Gates Corporation is a leading manufacturer of application-specific fluid power and power transmission solutions. At Gates, we are driven to push the boundaries of materials science to engineer products that continually exceed expectations.  We don't rest on our rich heritage of innovation. We leverage it to inspire solutions that will power the next hundred years. We invest continually in R&D and technology, so our products not only outperform industry standards; they exceed our customers' demanding expectations. We invest in our people, bringing real-world experience that enables us to solve our customers' diverse challenges of today and anticipate those of tomorrow. And we are constantly expanding our product catalog and value-added service offerings to support every facet of our customers' operations. In the most extreme environments and those more familiar, Gates is there with the right product, in the right place at the right time. Whether building original equipment or maintaining products in the aftermarket, we enable companies in every industry to be more efficient, productive, and profitable. We are Gates. POSITION SUMMARY: Gates Corporation has an exciting opportunity for a talented and team-oriented individual to fill the role of EDI/B2B Architect/Developer. Under general direction of the designated Manager, individual will be responsible for the support and enhancement of the Technical Architecture, Administration and Operations of the EDI environment. Assist in support for the IBM Sterling B2B Integrator and the REMEDI Framework. Responsibilities include supporting protocols such as FTP, SFTP, and AS2, performing code deployments, application upgrades, performance monitoring, mapping, ramping up of partners and tuning of the EDI landscapes. Responsibilities also include proactively identifying opportunities to utilize the technology to solve technical and business problems, provide remediation support during incidents, event resolution and training to team in system capabilities. This role will help define and support best practice standards for the Technical Administration and Operations team supporting the environment for continuous improvement and best practices. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Maintaining stability and performance of the B2B system and all its components.Actively manage the performance of the IBM Sterling B2B environment, including capacity planning and tuning.Support B2B communication and protocols including FTP, SFTP, HTTPS and AS2.Responsible for creating best practices for IBM Sterling B2B Integrator with supporting documentation and standard operating procedures.Participate in remediation of IBM Sterling B2B incidents and events. Provide 24 x 7 on-call rotational support including troubleshooting and issue resolution.Work closely with other teams to remediate all IBM Sterling B2B issues, i.e. (server, network, database, etc.)As a member of the EDI team you will work on prioritized incidents, enhancements, projects, code deployments, application upgrades, and performance testing support.Will participate in the IT Change Management process to schedule and support EDI related changes.Provide support for new projects affecting the IBM Sterling B2B Integrator landscape.Engage and interface directly with IBM as required for product support/questions.Performs related duties as assigned.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:Functions as an individual contributor with no supervisory responsibilities QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Requires a BS Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent.Requires a minimum of 5+ years of experience directly related and progressively responsible experience in EDI Technical Administration and Operations support.Requires a minimum of 5+ years of experience with IBM Sterling software suite: IBM Sterling B2B Integrator (Maps, BPML, Services/Adapters, Administration, Tuning, Troubleshooting)Requires a minimum of 5+ years of experience with Sterling B2B Integrator mapping, trading partner, message and communication profile configuration.Expert knowledge of all B2B mapper capabilitiesREQUIRED SKILLS:Expert level knowledge of all system mapping capabilities.Strong Data Exchange/ EDI background required, supporting Enterprise level environment.Working knowledge of EDI Development/ Configuration/solutions evaluation/ Validation and deployment.Working knowledge of file transfer protocols including HTTPs, FTP, SFTP, AS2.Experience and working knowledge of Linux Operating Systems and commands.Ability to document standard operating procedures and best practice to support environment of continuous improvement.Solid understanding of business requirements and ability to apply supporting solutions.Strong Self Starter and ability to provide training and support.Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.Strong organizational and prioritizing skills.Good analytical, conceptual and problem solving skills to evaluate business problems and apply technology knowledge to identify appropriate solutions.Good interpersonal skills and strong supportive team player required.Excellent discovery and active listening skills. Good relationship building skills.Experienced and Working knowledge of MS Office Suite and Outlook.PHYSICAL DEMANDS: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must frequently lift and / or move up to 20 pounds. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.  The person filling this position will be called outside of normal business hours to support IT projects, or otherwise be called upon to support IT functions within the responsibility of the position.  This position performs work on a global basis. There will be occasional need to coordinate with locations outside of the United States. This will require discussions and meeting attendance outside of normal time zones for Denver. There will be no travel except on very limited occasions.  Please be advised that Gates Corporation does not accept resumes from third-party recruiters.  Gates Corporation is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of gender, race, color, religion, age, disability, pregnancy, citizenship, sexual orientation, national origin, veteran status or any other protected class defined by state or local law. Name: Business Analyst Consultant
Description: Consulting Senior ConsultantCommunication Media PracticeThe Communication Media practice serves major clients in the telecommunications, entertainment, and media space. We service major clients across the network, cable and wireless segments. Our business consulting practice provides management consulting services to our clients with an emphasis on providing digital strategy, operations management, and business analysis. We provide consulting support to both the business and the IT functions.Communication Media Business Analyst overviewYou will work closely with clients to solve business problems and craft solutions that drive value. Individuals that have the ability to gather data, analyze facts, and provide recommendations will be an ideal fit for the Business Analyst role within Cognizant Consulting Communication Media. As a client facing role your ability to demonstrate integrity and a willingness to accomplish stretch goals are paramount to achieving success. If you are not afraid to challenge the current status and willing to ensure high quality work, please apply!.RequirementsAbility to figure out operational objectives by studying business functions; gather data, analyze facts, and build recommendations.Track issues reported during Software Development Lifecycle.Craft Executive level status reports, presentations, and roadmaps.Identify task owners, follow up on completion percentages, and identify risks.Support Change Control Management by communicating direction deviations across IT and Business Stakeholders.Possess advanced problem solving and research skills to assist client in understanding solutions.Work with teams with dynamic strengths to develop recommendations for addressing key program /project related issues to keep program on track.Build process flows, systems and procedures which aids in analysis and recommendations for solution offerings.Capable of working independently to achieve client objectives.Strong presentation, verbal and written skills addressing a variety of audiences.A deeply high level of energy, sense of urgency, creativity, and decisiveness coupled with the ability/willingness to work hard and well in complex environments.Ability to establish immediate credibility among peers; a professional who is respected for intelligence and technical expertise.Minimum requirementsSome experience in Telecommunication or Cable industry.Expertise in MS Office: Word, Excel, and Outlook.Ability to travel as necessaryMinimum Bachelor’s level Degree required.Role and Responsibilities:Work directly with our clients providing consulting services designed to help them pursue their most complex business and technology issues in the new digital spaceDeliver extraordinary client results, direct client personnel, prepare work plans, facilitate client teams to implement recommendationsDraw conclusions from the market / industry trends, client issues and support go to market initiatives for CognizantContribute to research, design and writing of articles/whitepapers and participate as a team member in collateral developmentSupport business development activities in the form of gathering standard methodologies for RFI/RFP responses and writing proposalsDedicatedly support team building and on boarding efforts via mentoringHelp strengthen client's confidence in Cognizant and Cognizant's ability to deliverNote:No H-1B: “Cognizant will not sponsor H-1B (or) other U.S. work authorization for this role.”  No GC: “Cognizant will not sponsor lawful permanent residence (otherwise known as a “Green Card”) for this role.”  No H-1B + GC: “Cognizant will not sponsor H-1B or other U.S. work authorization, or lawful permanent residence (otherwise known as a “Green Card”) for this role.”  Cognizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. Cognizant is committed to ensuring that all current and prospective associates are afforded equal opportunities and treatment and a work environment free of harassment.Technical SkillsSNoPrimary SkillProficiency Level *Rqrd./Dsrd. 1 OmniVBA PL1 Desired* Proficiency LegendsProficiency LevelGeneric Reference PL1 The associate has basic awareness and comprehension of the skill and is in the process of acquiring this skill through various channels. PL2 The associate possesses working knowledge of the skill, and can actively and independently apply this skill in engagements and projects.
