PL4 The associate can function as a subject matter expert for this skill. The associate is capable of analyzing, evaluating and synthesizing solutions using the skill.Job Location : Denver, Colorado, United States  Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Travel : No  Job Posting : Jul 25 2018  Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US, please send an email with your request to CareersNA2@cognizant.com  About CognizantCognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us on Twitter: USJobsCognizant.Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.

Name: Cybersecurity Analyst, Applied Cryptography
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be.  As a member of the Applied Cryptography, the Associate Info. Security Analyst will assist in implementation, maintenance, documenting and support of Visa's Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and implemented key management systems and Host Security Modules (HSM)  Duties / Responsibilities:  Assist in the maintenance and support all Enterprise PKI technology, including Primekey, RSA Certificate Manager & Microsoft Certificate ServicesAdminister the PKI certificate lifecycle for various solutionsWork with senior members to evaluate upgrades and new products & technologies for the enterprise PKI infrastructureProvide End user certificate support for certificatesMaintain a key service of PKI systemsSupport certificate request, escalating to senior members as needed.Maintain, support, and troubleshoot PKI systemsPropose and implement improvements to PKI in accordance with standard procedures and change control policies and proceduresParticipate in projects to deploy new PKI applications and servicesImplement changes to the PKI infrastructure in accordance with standard procedures and change control policies and proceduresProactively identify and recommend process improvement to reduce risk and improve operational efficiency.Document design, installation and operations & maintenance guidesSupport Visa end-to-end symmetric key management.Support HSM management support requests as per pre-defined sets of procedure and within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA), resolve problem tickets and assist other staff members as neededMonitor and troubleshoot PKI services for problem and failures, providing support and resolutions.Support Data Encryption Deployments and Applied CryptographyComplete certificate requests as per pre-defined sets of procedure and within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA), resolve problem tickets and assist other staff members as neededMaintain security certificationMaintain a technical certificationSupport Document and evidence gathering for Applied Cryptography AuditsHave good understanding of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) practices, policies and procedures;Level 1 support of PKI systems and services.Have good understanding of Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) core elements, Certificate Authorities, Registration Authority, CRLs, CDPs, certificate elements.Have a good understanding of protocols like TLS, TCP/IP, OCSP, SCEP, LDAP.Good analytical and troubleshooting skills on all platforms and tools supported.Flexibility to work after hours and weekends.Have a global mindset and collaborate effectively within and across teams in different part of the global landscape.Security + and other comparative information security certifications are preferred, that show an understanding of information security principles.IT infrastructure knowledge including operating systems, applications, communications, and network protocols.Have a familiarization with PCI PIN, PCI DSS, PCI P2PE, and TR-31 Standards as applied to symmetric key processing.Good knowledge in a technical skill set that supports one of the Applied Cryptography's core services.Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills along with the ability to present complex security subjects to internal work groups and projects.Strong ability to work independently and manage one's time with minimal direction from supervisor.The ability to work effectively with other functional areas and understand the operational and cultural issues relevant to achieving superior results.Must be flexible and able to manage multiple tasks and priorities on very tight deadlines.Be a self-motivated and results oriented individual with an attention to driving aggressive project timelines and schedules.Ability to work independently and in collaboration with others to achieve a high level of success.Sound interpersonal and collaboration skills with the ability to develop, maintain and foster constructive relationships with others.Have a global mindset and collaborate effectively within and across teams in different part of the global landscape.Compliance and technical certifications that show an understanding of systems support and compliance approaches. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Name: Business Analyst - Telecommunications
Description: Overview At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a Business Analyst / Consultant in in our Denver, CO office.Job Overview:The role of the Business Analyst / Consultant is for individuals passionate about identifying and delivering the right Business solution for each client. Our Business Consultants have a keen Business orientation with an understanding of how technology can be effectively applied to meet a variety of Business needs.Our Business Consultants fill a number of different roles on our project teams working with a variety of technologies for a wide range of clients. The specific responsibilities vary for each client and each project. Key to the success of our Business Consultants is the willingness and desire to quickly learn the client’s industry and the unique requirements of each engagement and to fill whatever role may be required to best support our client’s needs.A Business Consultant thrives in challenging environments and accomplishes difficult assignments without significant supervision and instruction. Our Consultants can handle the stress of being accountable for delivery and: complete goals on time, practice strong attention to detail, persevere through tough obstacles, and do not get easily discouraged.The Business Consultant may be involved in the strategic planning of an engagement or helping the client make decisions about their future IT direction. Once a project has begun, the Business Consultant may assist in facilitating key requirements with stakeholders and customers using standard and User Experience techniques. The Business Consultant may be responsible for functional designs, detailed designs and system mapping, wireframes, requirement specifications, and prototypes.The Business Consultant works with the Lead Business Consultant and Senior Project Managers to assist with daily operations exercising time management, communication and collaboration in a fast-paced environment to ensure the successful delivery of projects. The Business Consultant will interface with Perficient technical and business delivery personnel, as well as vendors and customers on a regular basis. Responsibilities Build trusted client relationships through proactive account management and effective project deliveryEstablishes knowledge of client business challenges and priorities to translate into opportunitiesMaintains regular client communication and satisfaction, ensuring opportunities and challenges are addressed in a timely manner.Helps deliver presentations to clients and management teamsContributes to project discoveries, kickoff, prepare proposals and statements of work following company standardsTranslate client’s business needs into detailed business requirements documents, use cases and systems interaction diagramsGather, document and analyze output of business and data requirements using any of the following methodologies: use cases, function/non function requirements, epics/user storiesImprove systems or process by studying current practices, identifying process improvements, and designing modificationsFollow and execute against the specific business analysis requirements as defined by the business organizationHelps to establish critical path, milestones, delivery dates, and review client deliverables to ensure they meet client acceptance criteriaProvides leadership throughout the lifecycles of a project, guiding the understanding the project team has through design and development to ensure project requirements are metHelps establish project test strategy, methodologies, test plans as well as assist with test execution Qualifications Cable/Telecom experience is required. 3 years of professional business analysis experience, with strong relationship management, account management, and support experience.Experience working with external clients.Knowledge of Agile and iterative development methodologies.Understanding of current technologies and Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).Product Management / Product Integration experience.Ability to obtain, understand and respond strategically to client needs.Highly detail oriented, well organized, and able to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.Strong analytical, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.Energetic, motivated, service-oriented, and be able to multi task.Excellent listening, oral, and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.Flexible to new situations and challenges.Flexibility to travel up to 50 percent.Preferred skills and education:BA or MBAExperience working in the consulting industryUnderstanding of complex Internet based enterprise level applicationsExperience working in an Agile environmentTrack record of delivering on time, on budget, and meeting client commitmentsPerficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About Perficient Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index.Perficient is an award-winning IBM Premier Business Partner, a Microsoft National Service Provider and Gold Certified Partner, an Oracle Platinum Partner, an Adobe Business Solution Partner, and a Salesforce Gold Consulting Partner. Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Disclaimer: The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst in Denver, Colorado (CO).  Responsibilities:  Manage and develop business intelligence reporting and analytics process/relationships Develop Business Intelligence framework to provide heightened client experience, drive sales and marketing effectiveness, support, and analytics for business channels and sellers, and roll out new analytics tools Build flexibly and adaptably designed data, reporting, and analytics structures from multiple data sources to support reporting and analytics needs Work with sales executives to determine appropriate target audiences for new distribution reporting and analytics initiatives Provide reporting and analytic support on assignments designed to acquire, enhance, service, and retain customer relationships Execute previously developed analyses and models related to value-based and behavioral customer segmentation, acquisition, attrition, enhanced cross sell and profitability Execute previously developed statistical testing programs to measure and improve on-going performance of professional development program outcomes, marketing initiatives and campaigns outcomes, market share growth, product duration and diversity, and other strategic initiatives Develop all this with the technical competency to illustrate this analysis to senior level stakeholders and the wider business Manage and develop executive and board level reporting and presentations Develop Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ANALYST REQUIREMENTS:Great can do attitude  2. Minimum 4 years work experience in either startup, biz dev, and/or finance environment.  3. Great organizational and communication skills  4. Work hard / Play hard.  Boutique Business Consulting company seeks professional to work as Business Development Analyst. The company's principal activities include providing consulting services to the startup, tech, entertainment, and finance verticals. Fun, hardworking, and fast paced environment.  This is a terrific opportunity for the right individual because it allows for the right candidate to obtain some of the experience(s) of a senior level executive by demonstrating their ability to add value to the company.  The founder is looking for an individual that possesses many of the same qualities that he does work hard / play hard. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 4 years of biz dev, entrepreneurial, or finance experience with an undergraduate degree focused on finance, entrepreneurship, or accounting. Foreign language fluency a plus (preferably Spanish). Job may require some amount of travel. Hard working environment with great growth potential and responsibility.  Great writing, speaking, and communication skills, as well as Microsoft Office (especially excel) and Internet savvy, required. High-stress environment with amazing experiences. Ability to multitask is very important.  Duties will include assisting executive(s) in executing on company initiatives that will include, but not be limited to, business development, marketing, sales, PowerPoint presentations, strategic planning, finance, accounting, business plans, and the ability to represent executive(s) in meetings. Also, this position will require coordination between the company's other team members, clients, various company vendors, and other people associated with the various endeavors. Name: 2019 Technical Business Analyst I - Campus
Description: Title 2019 Technical Business Analyst I - Campus  29-Nov-2018 Job DescriptionTravelport is the only true travel commerce platform in the world. We are specialist solution providers and are committed to building leading technology that makes the experience of buying and managing travel continually better for the global travel and tourism industry. Come and be part of our mission to make sure that every trip is powered by Travelport… Are you looking for an exciting place to jumpstart your career? Do you feel passionate about innovative technology? If so, then we could be the place for you.  As a Technical Business Analyst at Travelport, you can thrive in the exciting world of Travel Tech.  This Analyst role will involve… Supporting gathering of business requirements, analyzing and documenting these for a product/tool or a subset of an internal business system.Documenting requirements according to enterprise standards/tools (eg: Jira)Capturing use cases required by the business stakeholder in an agile delivery environment, the Business Analyst may support product owners writing user stories/epics and creating requirements for delivery of solutions.Contributing to the translation of business requirements into functional and support the onward process of creation of technical specifications for functions within a product/sub-set of business systemCreating test plans and acceptance criteria for review by senior colleagues and attend meetings with delivery teams to fully understand Travelport SDLC and the Change LifecycleParticipating in UAT as requiredParticipating in continuous reviews to ensure acceptance criteria is met and the solution meets assigned project objectives/expectationsPresenting ideas to improve productsubsystemm design/work flowsWorking with internal departments as requested to correct poorly structured or inaccurate data/processesRegularly seeking review and feedback of work activities under overall guidance of line manager Come and join us…  To ensure we achieve our goal, you will join us in embracing our core values; Be a player, not a spectator; You will take ownership and make things happen.Think we, not me; We are One Travelport, collaborating to succeed.Keep it simple; We’re straightforward and easy to do business with.Build for tomorrow; You will challenge the norm, aim high and lead change. You’ll be an innovator, passionate, accountable and solutions focused, not to mention adaptable, hungry for a challenge and an individual who thrives on partnering. All of these combined with the below capabilities are what will make us such a bold and compelling organization.You:0-2 years of business analysis or related experienceHas training and basic knowledge of job function principles, theories and concepts to complete clearly documented requirements for supervised assignments/scope.Has basic knowledge of SDLC including Agile methodology, business and technology operationsDegree in Computer Science, Business or Statistics or equivalent (major course of study is role dependent)Fast learner with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Familiarity with one or more programming languages desirable (Java, SQL etc)Familiar with SDLC / Agile methodology and processes and the Change LifecycleFamiliar with service analysis and design eg: ITILIdeally some knowledge of Business Process Discovery methods and tools (Different approaches, Workshops, Interviews, etc)Ideally some knowledge of relevant tools for Requirements Management (eg: Jira) and Project Mmt tools (eg: PPM) If this sounds like you, we’d love for you to get in touch.  What’s in it for you?  You will receive a competitive salary & benefits package accompanied with the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic and progressive organization that cares about its people and promotes innovation.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: About KG Lewis KG Lewis is built on 16 successful years of helping businesses of all kinds navigate change, challenge, and transformation. Our consultants are pros in agile project delivery, program offices, post-M&A integration, and a wide range of technology disciplines. When our customers can’t afford to fail, we’re at our best.  Cultural impact. Business impact. Career impact. What unites our diverse team of professionals is a passion for constant learning, solving problems, transforming businesses, and making the world a better place inside and outside the office. If this sounds like you, let’s talk!  KG Lewis offers a great benefits package as well as a culture that supports continuous learning and career development. We offer all of our employees access to industry-leading training platforms and technology-focused research tools to help them personally and professionally in their careers. Position Location Denver, CO (DTC) Position Title Senior Business Analyst Position Summary KG Lewis is seeking a Senior Business Analyst. This role will lead a team of three Business Analysts and will be responsible for assigning these resources to projects. The team is responsible for eliciting and writing product business requirements with varying delivery methodologies including waterfall and agile. This role will be key in building relationships with other departments and improving requirements hand-off to cross-functional partners for user story refinement, functional requirements and technical/system requirements and for developing full requirements traceability from business requirements through test cases and defects. This role will develop and build consistency into the BA practice for our team, including requirement tool refinement, standard templates, offered services, etc. They will serve as a liaison to the business to provide solutions to meet user needs and will eventually possess the expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as an understanding of the organization’s systems and capabilities. This role will educate on the direction of the business and suggest short and long term improvements in functionality and processes. They will utilize their understanding of both business process and technical capabilities to implement solutions to the more complex business needs/problems. The ideal candidate must have high attention to detail and not be afraid to also serve as a Business Analyst on projects. The candidate must be a driven individual capable of managing workload with minimal oversight.  This role will be responsible for overseeing the business analysis activities to ensure Product Development needs are addressed and solutions are implemented. They will function as the liaison between the various business operations functional groups impacted by a particular initiative (i.e. new products, services, processes, support technologies, regulations, etc.). They will manage the team of Business Analysts to assess, capture, document the Product Development or “user” needs into detailed business and technical requirements.  An ideal candidate will quickly understand business process, new technologies and technical capabilities to implement solutions to the more complex business needs/problems. This position requires extensive Business Analyst and product delivery experience. documents and maintains complex user stories and business requirements for all opportunity to cash order flow activities for all lines of business (video, data, and voice) for commercial servicesAssigns projects and provides support to direct report Business Analysts, up to and including reviewing performance and monitoring continuous improvement plansServes as a resource to project others, manage and build trusted relationships to effect change through influence and partnershipFlexible with proven ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through Name: Business Systems Analyst - Campus Recruiting
Description: Category:  Business Analysis (functional and technical) City:  Denver, Colorado, United States Position ID:  J0918-0217 Employment Type:  Graduate Position Description:CGI is seeking students interested in careers in the Information Technology field. CGI is more than just an IT consulting company; we are a global organization offering a world of opportunities. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career.  Our Business System Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business System Analysts will be placed on one of our many projects and provide technical/functional expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing basic systems. Your future duties and responsibilities:What you’ll do (assignments may include responsibilities in one or more of the following areas): Business Analysis: Developing knowledge of a client’s industry, customers, organization and business objectives in order to help the client in a problem-solving role. Assessing user requirements, procedures and problems to create or improve a system.User Support Analysis: Providing quality client support by answering client questions, researching possible solutions to problems, and fostering open communication between the client and the CGI project team. Tracking software and documentation defects, performing application maintenance, and providing onsite consulting and training as required.System Testing: Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of a system. Assessing how well a product adheres to its design, standards, as well as its usability and ability to meet business needs.Decision Analysis: Applying quantitative methods to study and make recommendations regarding various business issues, including credit risk management, customer profitability, resource allocation and optimization, and customer segmentation.What you’ll gain:Involvement in a team oriented atmosphereExposure to business issues and challengesOpportunity to leverage your computer knowledge and analytical skills Required qualifications to be successful in this role:What you’ll need: Bachelors degree required in a relevant field (i.e.: Business Majors to include Finance, Accounting, Management Information Systems, IS/IT and other majors that include consulting and technology coursework)A great attitude and hunger for learningExcellent analytical, written and oral communication skillsFlexibility and ability to deal with ambiguityAbility to work within a team environment3.0 GPA strongly preferredAbility to work in the U.S. for an indefinite period of time with ability to obtain a US Government clearance What you can expect from us:Build your career with us.It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.  At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.  Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.  Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.  No unsolicited agency referrals please.  CGI is an equal opportunity employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, or any other legally protected status or characteristics.  CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com. You will need to reference the requisition number of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a requisition number will not be returned.  We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Background investigation components can vary dependent upon specific assignment and/or level of US government security clearance held.  CGI will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI’s legal duty to furnish information.

Name: Business Analyst (Consultant)
Description: Position Summary We are seeking energetic and motivated Business Analyst(s) to work on client projects requiring quantitative and qualitative business analyses and planning. Duties & Responsibilities Perform specific business problem or opportunity assessments, such as market, customer and operational analyses.  Identify data sources, secure data, define and implement analytic approach.  Create models to evaluate performance, analyze risk and forecast the impact of new initiatives on sales, profit, and/or service delivery.  Conduct research to determine if solutions to business needs currently exist within or outside the business; and if not, what new solutions are feasible. Work with business partners to assist in business process redesign and implementation, as needed, for realization of business benefits. Qualifications Strong business analysis aptitude and experience.  Proven ability to define and accomplish short-, mid- and long-term goals.  Consulting or research experience on cross-functional project team(s).  Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint for analyzing data and presenting implications.  Experience working in ecommerce, marketing, or cable industry strongly preferred.  Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, operations or related field preferred. MBA preferred.

Name: Legal Operations Business Analyst (Remote)
Description: Help us shape the future. Elevate is changing the way legal support services are delivered and we are looking for creative, innovative people who can help. If you are a customer-focused professional who wants your creative and innovative ideas to make a difference, Elevate's team of legal service experts could be the right fit for you.  Elevate Legal Business Solutions practice is growing! As an Elevate Legal Operations Business Analyst, you will work with customers directly to improve Am Law 200 law firms and Fortune 500 law departments through analysis, strategy, and implementation. You will support a variety of customers and will work to deliver solutions and directly impact ROI. You might be the person were looking for if you...You have supported strategic or operational improvements to a law department or law firm.You have developed and used metrics and analytics as part of your solutions.You have worked with common legal technologies, including matter management, eBilling, and contract management systems.You are capable of working on multiple assignments in a fast-paced environment.You are interested in joining a growing company and the potential for a long-term career path.You enjoy a culture of change that seeks out efficiencies, cost savings, and constant improvement.Specifically you will beDelivering strategic administrative support to a Fortune 500 law department.Supporting Legal Operations in multiple ways including eBilling support (internal and external requests and troubleshooting, coordinating with and training suppliers, creating spend reports, and ensuring compliance with internal policies), event planning, writing and proofreading award applications and department communications, and using innovative thinking to gain efficiencies and document process revisions.Skills for Success:Prior experience as a business analyst, legal operations analyst, or similar role within an organization.Prior roles as a consultant or in-house strategy.Experience running reporting and metrics for a team or department.Capable data skills, able to use a variety of methods to analyze data.Flexibility and interest in learning the wide variety of solutions that Elevate delivers, including our industry leading Cael legal app suite.Technical Skills:Strong Microsoft Office skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).Experience with leading legal systems (eBilling, Contract Management, and eSignature) a plus.Experience with leading business intelligence and reporting tools a plus; persuasive writing skill including proofreading and editing, process or playbook documentation, administrative tasks including calendaring, scheduling travel, and planning events.Specific tool knowledge a plus (SharePoint, MS Teams, Adobe Sign, TAP, eBilling).Experience:1-3 years experience in an office setting, legal office preferred.Strong administrative and project management skills, strong communicator, personable and collaborative, with good organizational skills and strong attention to detail.Qualifications:Bachelors degree.Elevate is the law company. We provide consulting, technology and services to law departments and law firms. Our global team of lawyers, engineers, consultants and business experts improve efficiency, quality and outcomes for customers worldwide. Elevates achievements and distinctions include: Ranked on the Inc. 5000 list of Fastest-Growing Private Companies two years in a row.Ranked as a top Global Services Provider by Chambers & Partners three years in a row.Lead Partner of the FT Innovative Lawyers Awards. At Elevate we live our core values: We deliver - We are careful about the comments we make to our customers and to each other. We do what we say we will. We innovate - We celebrate creativity. We challenge the status quo and continuously ask ourselves and each other how can we improve. We care - We listen to our customers' needs and help them solve their business problems. (Chart of Accounts, Profit Centes, Cost Centers, Internal Orders, Functional area, CO-PA, etc.) Expert level understanding of SAP FI-CO and integration points with other modules Expert level understanding of accounting and finance processes - particularly Foreign Currency translation, Intercompany, Ownership/Investments/Equity accounting Solid understanding of financial consolidation concepts/processes Experience in finance master data management At least 2 full-cycle SAP projects as a Finance/SAP FICO lead Experience in managing and implementing change. Strong understanding of the systems development life-cycle and typical problems associated with the implementation of information systems, from initial concept through development and implementation to operation and support. Able to convert strategy into results. Strong analysis and decision-making skills and enterprise mindset. Strong critical thinking and analytical skills. Results driven with a focus on quality and accuracy. Leadership capability. Name: Financial Analyst, MEP Business Unit
Description: Trimble Inc. (www.trimble.com) a public company focused on positioning, laser, and optical technologies as well as engineering and construction software and services is an exciting, entrepreneurial company, with a history of exceptional growth coupled with a discipline and strategic focus on begin the best. Our employees represent this diversity and can be found in over 30 countries. Due to geographic, product and customer reach, there is plenty of room at Trimble for exceptional people to grow. The Trimble MEP Business Unit, which is part of the Trimble Buildings Sector, is looking for a smart, hard-working Financial Analyst to work close with the Senior Financial Manager of North America, General Managers and other senior members of the MEP organization.Job Summary: The Financial Analyst will have full P&L exposure within the MEP Division. This division is a fast growing, technology focused, dynamic business involved in software, hardware and professional services. The Financial Analyst will help review and report the relevant financial information to internal customers. Specifically, this role will help manage the P&L of at least one business area (potentially more) within the MEP division by providing financial planning and analysis (FP&A) including but not limited to modeling, analytics and ad-hoc requests. This role has exposure to the Senior Division Management team and will help to develop and execute strategic business decisions to drive success of business.Primary Duties: The Financial Analyst is responsible for supporting the management of Trimble MEP Division with a focus on month-end close, bridges and variance analysis, modeling, and reporting of results. Report WW expenses by BU and help develop reporting to help senior management make informed decisions Develops P&L models and forecast quarterly and annual results Responsible for working with key stakeholders in the Division on key initiatives by modeling virtual P&Ls that allow for what-if scenarios Prepares, edits and maintains reporting elements provided to the management team Ensures that financial information is presented clearly, consistently, on time and to the right people in various regular and ad hoc financial reports Supports the Business Unit and Corporate Finance in special projects and participates in ad hoc analysis as neededRequirements and Previous Experience: 2+years of experience in technology companies is required (software preferred) Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting, or equivalent business experience Detail oriented self-starter with solid analytical thinking and excellent communication skills Desire to create and improve processes and a think outside the box attitude to develop innovative solutions Advanced proficiency in Excel, including pivot tables and formulas Ability to coordinate multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment and strong project management skills Experience in Oracle Financials and Cognos are a plus. Roll up the sleeves self-started with the ability to both dig into the details and think strategically Trimble Navigation Limited is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D  #finance

Name: Sr. Business Continuity Analyst
Description: SNI Technology's client located in Lakewood, CO is actively looking to hire a Senior Business Continuity Analyst on a full-time, direct-hire basis!MUST HAVE REQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or other related field, and a minimum of 5 years of related experience(A combination of post-high school education, job related certification and related experience equivalent to 7 years, may be considered in lieu of a degree.)Working knowledge of Business Continuity and Mass Communication platformsExperience developing and implementing business continuity and disaster recovery plans.Experienced in designing and implementing risk assessments and incident management exercises.SUMMARY: The Sr. Business Continuity Analyst is responsible for leading the initiative to develop, recommend, support and implement corporate wide efforts in all business continuity and disaster recover activities.  The individual will play a leading role in coordination during any disaster recovery effort and be responsible for the coordination plans with company stakeholders. The individual will also work closely with management and information technology teams to support the information security governance, risk and compliance program while also being a leading role in incident management and incident coordination.  The candidate must be well-rounded with proven business continuity management expertise along with strong communication and project management skills. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Advance the development of corporate business continuity plansCoordinate, conduct, and document tests of company resiliency plans and back-up systemsLead the development of and enhancements to the corporate business continuity strategyFacilitate continuous process improvement events looking for gaps, gathering and analyzing metrics throughout the process, determining success factors, and identifying solutionsIdentify threats to business operations, and present relevant information to managementLead incident response effortsBuild strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure preparedness is achievedAssist in improving the organization's assessment of operational riskDesign and implement risk assessmentsHave a strong understanding of dependencies for business processes, business functions, applications, technology, and internal / external parties related to the businessLead company incident management exercisesParticipate in on-call rotation and after-hours work as required by system implementations, outages or upgrades.MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS OF POSITION:Typically requires a bachelor's degree in related field and a minimum of 5 years of related experience. A combination of post-high school education, job related certification and related experience equivalent to 7 years may be considered in lieu of minimum requirements.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS OF POSITION:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Sciences or other technical field is preferredCertified Business Continuity Planner (CBCP)Master Business Continuity Planner (MBCP)KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:Working knowledge of Business Continuity and Mass Communication platformsExcellent written and oral communication skillsGood computer skills including of Microsoft OfficeAbility to work with minimal guidance and directionPrevious IT experience is not required, training will be provided

Name: Business Analyst/Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst/Senior Business Analyst Location  Denver, CO Primary Functional Area  Information TechnologyApply NowAt CoBank, our Business Analyst conducts analysis of business and user needs in order to develop requirements documentation for the diverse business needs of business units across CoBank. This role performs impact analysis, gathers and documents requirements, documents test plans, performs user acceptance testing, documents changes to workflow and procedures, delivers training, and provides post-implementation support for business unit focused system enhancements and upgrades. In addition, the Business Analyst utilizes expertise in areas including but not limited to banking, financial services, and understanding of the organization’s systems and capabilities to ensure the most efficient use of resources. Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree in management information systems, finance, accounting, or relevant discipline and 3-5 years’ experience with impact analysis, requirements gathering, and user acceptance testing for software development; or appropriate combination of education and experience.Preferred QualificationsExperience with business analysis and user interface configuration, specifically with SalesforceExperience in strategic business process modeling, traceability and quality management techniques.Experience in requirements prioritization and scope negotiation.Experience in developing and leveraging various modeling techniques for requirements elicitation (use cases, wireframes/conceptual prototypes, process flow diagrams, etc.).Experience planning and facilitating requirements gathering sessions (Joint Application Design (JAD) or other requirements gathering techniques).Experience developing and conducting training.Experience developing and executing test plans and test scripts.Intermediate experience with word processing, spreadsheet, database, reporting and flowcharting applications.Excellent interpersonal, facilitation, oral and written communication skills.Some travel may be required.Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours.Basic understanding of program management concepts, project management and implementation techniques, process re-engineering and change management.Experience in both iterative (agile, RUP, etc.) and waterfall.CBAP certificationPMP certification.About CoBank CoBank stands strong as a $125 billion enterprise dedicated to the financial needs of rural communities. That means we help fund new ways to grow food, generate energy, access technology, and otherwise improve life in America. When you choose a career with us, you make a difference by standing for something that matters. A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. We also provide competitive compensation, health and wellness benefits, company-funded retirement plan, matching 401(k), and professional development programs.  CoBank will not sponsor a work visa (e.g. H1B, etc.) to fill this position.  CoBank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST - Business Intelligence
Description: Under the supervision of theDirector of Application Development,theSenior Business Analyst will be an integrated member of Business Intelligenceandis responsible for supporting corporate projects by defining business requirements, translating requirements to technical specifications to the BI team, and delivery/UAT of projects. They will be an integral team member on all or parts of a project through all stages of the project life cycle, including requirement documentation, development, regression testing, QA/UAT, and project life. Work with the EDI Analyst to ensure Colorado Access complies with applicable state and federal requirements.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS& WORK DUTIESThe following essential functions of this position are performed personally, in cooperation with your supervisor, and/or in coordination with other staff. Additional work functions and duties may be assigned.Supports corporate projects by defining business requirements, providing project management oversight and aligning business and application system solutions with strategic plans. Analyzes and documents requirements through research, data gathering, and brainstorming activities. Designs and documents customer requirements by defining, creating, evaluating, and/or selecting alternatives.Responsible for accurate creation and timely delivery of Business Requirement DocumentationResponsible for accurate creation and timely delivery of Functional& Non-Functional Requirement DocumentationFacilitate UAT with Business OwnerWork directly with BI Analyst to ensure data accuracy for internal reporting purposesPerforms project management activities as assigned to promote quality, facilitate resource management and progress reporting, define and maintain project scope, meet schedules and deadlines, and coordinate intra-and interdepartmental activities. Manages all or parts of a project through all stages of the project life cycle, including requirement documentation, development, regression testing, QA/UAT, and project life.Provides application support for internal users as assigned. Troubleshoots problems and escalates as necessary. Provides configuration changes following change management procedures.Ensures all requirement documentation policies and procedures are followed. Reviews status reports and reports departmental operations, concerns and successes to the Director of Application Development.Ensures the successful implementation of developed manual and automated information systems by performance of the following activities: Business requirement documentation; Gap Analysis; Cost benefit solutioning (build/buy); Coordinate and/or conduct; regression testing; quality assurance testing; end-user training; develop and/or maintain; end-user training materials; end-user procedure manuals; on-line help documentation.Actively participates in and demonstrates support for all Colorado Access and department quality initiatives, which includes: Colorado Access system development methodology implementation and deployment; Standards and procedures definition and adherence; Quality management strategy definition and adherence; Rapid continuous improvement, transformation, and strategic plan implementation initiatives.Actively supports and implements the department communication strategy. Establishes and maintains mutually beneficial and productive relationships internally and with other Colorado Access departments. Informs others, as appropriate, of problems, issues, concerns, or developments that arise from department or business activities, or the use of technology.

Name: Business/Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Title: Business/Data Analyst Position Type: Exempt Reports To: DFS Project Manager Date Prepared: November 2018 Business/Data Analyst This newly created role is responsible for building process maps to support existing business across the DFS organization. The role is part of the Project Management organization and will work on multiple projects simultaneously to achieve goals by translating business data into digestible information. Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSeeking an experienced Business Analyst with SalesForce experience to join the team in the downtown Denver office.  6 month contract with likelihood to extend Expected Responsibilities:Requirements engineering (business, stakeholder, functional, solution and transition level requirements)Business process design and documentation (workflow modeling, BPMN experience a plus)Analysis of existing processes (as-is modeling) and ability to bridge to-be state processesAssess captured business requirements against Salesforce capabilities (fit gap analysis)Rapid design and development of proof of concepts / prototypes within the Salesforce platformSystem and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) coordination and facilitationIssue tracking & resolution coordinationIdeal Candidate:Have an excellent professional attitude with strong interpersonal communication, facilitation and presentation skillsBe customer experience focused (customer empathizing)Be highly capable in conflict resolution and negotiationBe able to articulate platform capabilities shape customer demand against platform offeringsHave strong and proven background in developing Business Analysis artifacts, such as process maps, and requirements documentationHave experience in operating as a Business Analyst / Product Owner in an agile framework (such as Scrum)Have 2+ years’ working knowledge of Salesforce preferred (experience to have been gained while performing the role of a Business Analyst).4+ years in a Sr. Business Analyst role (Salesforce or otherwise)Experience in analyzing business needs for Salesforce platform fit is more of a firm requirement for this position (vs heavy Salesforce administration experience).Exposure to Salesforce admin training (through the Trailhead program) a viable equivalency (Business User and Admin Trailhead training tracks). Company DescriptionAbout us  Digital Intelligence Systems, LLC (DISYS) is a global staffing and IT consulting services company with core capabilities in: Staff Augmentation ServicesApplication Development ServicesBusiness Intelligence ServicesCloud Enablement ServicesEnterprise Resource PlanningInfrastructure Support ServicesTesting Services Our vision is to be a global business partner, delivering highest quality and most consistent services at the best value to clients worldwide. Name: Program Analyst
Description: As a Program Analyst at DaVita Medical Group, you’ll work on strategic, high-priority, cross-functional projects with an emphasis on people. Projects will focus on all aspects of the People Services (HR) ensuring our teammates can deliver their best work and be the best version of themselves.  This role features extensive interaction across People Analytics, Teammate Experience & Development, Recruiting, Compensation & Benefits, and our market People Services (HR) teams. The Program Analyst is highly-motivated self-starter who has a passion for people and is interested in helping us meet the needs of our workforce so we can meet the needs of our business.  Responsibilities include: Create and manage individual work plansIdentify problems and develop hypotheses and paths forwardDevelop strong relationships through thought partnership to enable your work and communication with stakeholdersBuild project business cases and performance methodology so that we’re able to understand project outcomesTake advantage of formal and informal presentation opportunities to a wide variety of stakeholdersBuild communications (e.g., presentations) for projects and executive leadership initiatives Qualifications: Bachelor's degree from a 4-year accredited college or university1 to 3 years of professional work experience preferredAre curious about how organizations work and thrive in building end-to-end solutions with a high standard of executionAre adept at listening to teammates needs and are constantly ensuring your solutions meet these needsAre organized and have project and self-management skillsAre a strong communicator, in person, in presentations, by email and phoneCan think analytically, synthesize findings and recommend actionCan build appropriate horizontal and vertical logic in presentation decksHave proven capability to GSD (get stuff done) through creating networks/connections, resourcefulness in problem solving, and sense of urgency to resolve.Are learning / growth orientedAre aligned with DaVita Medical Group’s mission and values of Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfillment and Fun

Name: Sr. Business Analyst (BA)
Description: (LinkTechConsulting.com), is seeking an Sr. Business Analyst (BA) for a 6-month contract with a well-established client in Denver, CO.The client is in need of Sr. Business Analyst (BA) who will be responsible for working closely with the data management team to elicit, document, and analyze requirements for a solution designed to enhance data access for the client. They have recently completed a Request for Information (RFI) study and need assistance in translating the information into meaningful requirements for the initiation of a formal Request for Proposal (RFP) process. The Sr. BA will work across a variety of Agencies and key data stakeholders to ensure the immediate and long term data requirements are represented in the RFP. The ideal candidate must be an energetic, highly motivated individual with an ability to collaborate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. The candidate must also have previous experience within a data management program. Expected Responsibilities: • Requirements engineering (business, stakeholder, functional, solution and transition level requirements) • Business process design and documentation (workflow modeling, BPMN experience a plus) o Analysis of existing processes (as-is modeling) and ability to bridge to-be state processes • Assess captured business requirements against enterprise platform capabilities (fit gap analysis) • Participation in the city’s Request for Proposal process • Rapid design and development of proof of concepts / prototypes • System and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) coordination and facilitation • Issue tracking & resolution coordination • Other duties as assigned The ideal candidate will: • Have an excellent professional attitude with strong interpersonal communication, facilitation and presentation skills • Be customer experience focused (customer empathizing) • Be highly capable in conflict resolution and negotiation • Have strong and proven background in developing Business Analysis artifacts, such as process maps, and requirements documentation • Have experience in operating as a Business Analyst / Product Owner in an agile framework (such as Scrum) Employment Location:There is a primary work location is however, the contractor will work with team members at various building locations Denver.

Name: Business Analyst - Telecommunications
Description: Overview At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a Business Analyst / Consultant in in our Denver, CO office.Job Overview:The role of the Business Analyst / Consultant is for individuals passionate about identifying and delivering the right Business solution for each client. Our Business Consultants have a keen Business orientation with an understanding of how technology can be effectively applied to meet a variety of Business needs.Our Business Consultants fill a number of different roles on our project teams working with a variety of technologies for a wide range of clients. The specific responsibilities vary for each client and each project. Key to the success of our Business Consultants is the willingness and desire to quickly learn the client’s industry and the unique requirements of each engagement and to fill whatever role may be required to best support our client’s needs.A Business Consultant thrives in challenging environments and accomplishes difficult assignments without significant supervision and instruction. Our Consultants can handle the stress of being accountable for delivery and: complete goals on time, practice strong attention to detail, persevere through tough obstacles, and do not get easily discouraged.The Business Consultant may be involved in the strategic planning of an engagement or helping the client make decisions about their future IT direction. Once a project has begun, the Business Consultant may assist in facilitating key requirements with stakeholders and customers using standard and User Experience techniques. The Business Consultant may be responsible for functional designs, detailed designs and system mapping, wireframes, requirement specifications, and prototypes.The Business Consultant works with the Lead Business Consultant and Senior Project Managers to assist with daily operations exercising time management, communication and collaboration in a fast-paced environment to ensure the successful delivery of projects. The Business Consultant will interface with Perficient technical and business delivery personnel, as well as vendors and customers on a regular basis. relationship management, account management, and support experience.Experience working with external clients.Knowledge of Agile and iterative development methodologies.Understanding of current We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About Perficient Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: OVERVIEW OF POSITION: Responsible for performing routine and moderately complex activities under limited supervision in order to design, implement, maintain and support policies, processes and systems related to Medicare Risk Adjustment programs. Interacts with Analytics, Coding Department, Clinical Decision Support, Health Plan Analysis, site and regional staff to accomplish goals. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Perform analysis and reporting activities relating to: risk score calculation, claims/encounters data submission, chart review programs and audits, and related performance metrics.Analysis and reporting on RAF Forecast Model by plan/patient cohorts and review cost and utilization trends to understand impact on revenue; along with reconciliation and root cause analysis for any variance.Stay updated and share knowledge on industry changes especially any changes on CMS side (changes like ICD10, EDS, Payment Model Changes)Assists department in tracking projects, expenditures and risks. Assists with project communication requirements.Responds appropriately to reports of trouble related to applications or programs to quickly resolve issue; manages customer expectations by keeping them informed of progress.Develops report specifications and writes complex reports for department or management using available reporting tools.Uses, protects, and discloses DMG patients protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards.Performs additional duties as assigned.Consistently exhibits behavior and communication skills that demonstrate Davita Medical Groups (DMG) commitment to superior customer service, including quality, care and concern with each and every internal and external customer.EDUCATION:Bachelors degree from a four-year college; preferred: major in information systems or related quantitative field (finance, computer science or, mathematics).EXPERIENCE:Minimum:Over 3 years and up to and including 5 years of experience.Background in healthcare industry and managed care.3-5 years of project management experience.3-5 years of experience with MS Access, Excel, and SQL.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Strong analytical and problem solving skills.Ability to work in a team environment with minimal amount of supervision.Ability to cope with fluctuating demands of an uneven workload.Proficient with MS Office, MS-Access, MS-Visio.Preferred:Strong understanding of Medicare Risk Adjustment Payment Model and Cycle including the knowledge base to calculate and manipulate risk scores.Familiarity with CMS data and risk adjustment processes including MMR, MOR and EDS data.Strong understanding of Claims and Encounter data.Strong command on SQL Server (T-SQL), SSIS and SSRS, and Database design.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:Commitment to DaVitas core values of Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfillment and Fun. Ability to demonstrate the core values positively and proactively to patients, teammates, management, physicians, and/or vendors (Village Service Partners) in everyday performance and interactions.Comfortable in and excited to be a part of an ever-evolving environment and team.Exceptional project management; ability to organize, direct and lead special projects.Proven ability to "get stuff done" and liaise with cross-functional constituents.Ability to communicate appropriately and efficiently with top senior executives both internally and externally.Ability to prioritize major projects and/or programs that require strict and time sensitive deadlines. DaVita Medical Group manages and operates medical groups and affiliated physician networks in California, Colorado, Florida, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania and Washington. A leading independent medical group in America, DaVita Medical Group has over two decades of experience providing coordinated, outcomes-based medical care in a cost-effective manner. As of June 30, 2017, DaVita Medical Groups teammates, employed clinicians and affiliated clinicians provided care for approximately 1.7 million patients. DaVita Medical Groups leadership development initiatives and social responsibility efforts have been recognized by Fortune, Modern Healthcare, Newsweek and WorldBlu.

Name: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Posting Details  Posting Details  Posting Number A01076 Position Title Junior Business Intelligence Analyst Position Number E 966 Salary for Announcement  The starting salary for this position is $44,758. The final salary will be commensurate with education and experience.  Employee Category Administrators Department Office of University Effectiveness EClass Code Full Time Administrators Position Summary  Located in the Office of University Effectiveness, the Junior Business Intelligence Analyst is a report author and supporting team member to Business Intelligence and/or related teams or individuals within this office. The Junior Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for pulling, cleaning and formatting large amounts of data from multiple sources for regular recurring and ad-hoc analyses. This position must demonstrate best practices in effectively supporting data informed decision-making by a diverse range of university stakeholders.  Metropolitan State University of Denver is an equal opportunity employer.  Duties/Responsibilities 40 50% data collection and cleaning oWorking with Lead or Senior BI Specialists and clients to fully understand client questions, problems, or hypotheses to identify data needs  oCollect data from various sources including enterprise data warehouse, Banner, Qualtrics, etc. using appropriate data definitions  oDevelop, document, and implement processes where needed, for decision analysis and support and maintenance of metrics 40 50% Report writing and data analysis oWrite ad-hoc and recurring reports and analyses using multiple data sources  oWorking with Lead or Senior BI Specialists to interpret data  oCreate thorough analysis of various questions, problems, or hypotheses that come from clients across the university stakeholder spectrum  oWorking with Lead or Senior BI Specialists to provide recommendations based on analyses 10% other duties as assigned oWork effectively and diplomatically with other teams, such as Information Technology Services, Institutional Research, and BANNER stakeholders or others, to ensure validity and integrity of data  oWork with other university staff to improve data collection efforts, process documentation, and report archiving  This position works within a team that responds to requests from many university stakeholders. For that reason, the demands of the position and areas of focus will be fluid. Over the course of a year, the above percentages are anticipated but cannot be guaranteed.  Required Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in analytics or related field (computer science, computer information systems, economics, math, market research, psychology research, business, etc.)Experience conducting researchExperience with descriptive statisticsExperience pulling data from a relational databaseIntermediate proficiency with ExcelExperience working in a collaborative team environment Preferred Qualifications Experience interpreting data and presenting findingsExperience doing data reconciliation and data integrity validationExperience with Tableau, Power BI, WebI or another similar softwareExperience with SPSS, R, or another similar statistical programExperience with SQL, Access or another similar querying toolExperience working with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in an organization Posting date 09/18/2018 Closing date Closing Instructions Open Until Filled Special Instructions to Applicants  Complete applications received by October 01, 2018 will receive full consideration. Position is open until filled.  IMPORTANT: In order to be considered as an applicant you must apply via the online application system, www.msudenverjobs.com.  References refers to a list of three professional references and their contact information.  Official transcripts will be required of the candidate selected for hire. Name: Business Data Analyst III

The Business Data Analyst III will be responsible for the technical reporting design, new report development and modification of existing reports. In addition, the Business Data Analyst III must be able to provide technical documentation and participate in report troubleshooting with the CDHS Trails OIT team and the Trails Modernization development vendor. Undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university in information technology, computer science, or related field. (Relevant experience may be substituted for education at the hiring manager’s discretion.) Documented proficiency working with report development on Oracle 10 or above and experience with both Crystal 10 and Crystal 13. Familiarity with producing technical documentation. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of the Trails OIT SDLC business processes Crystal report version 10 and 13 experience. Conversion experience is a plus Good understanding of Oracle database with hands-on experience Excellent PL/SQL skills Crystal Server 11 and developer version 13 Hands on experience developing the reports with 2 - 3 yrs on Oracle 10 or above SQL server experience writing packages, procedures, views etc. in PL/SQL for at least 2 or 3 yrs

Name: Sr Business Analyst
Description: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management. stakeholders.Oversees test and project task development and implementation.Evaluates and provides written and verbal updates on project status.Performs other duties as assigned.Required project management.Requires 7 years minimum prior relevant experience.EducationBachelor's Degree FinanceSkillsField of Experience – Job-specific knowledge requirements An ideal candidate will Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Factions culture encourages and cultivates an entrepreneurial spirit every day, and embodies out-of-the-box thinking, which all translate to our company values: We are genuine; We are innovators; We are relentless problem solvers; We are passionate about client delight; We are radically transparent; We are a professional team, and we do our best thinking with a shared beverage. Can you manage challenges while maintaining a positive client-focused attitude?  Faction is a leader in deploying cloud infrastructure at scale. We are a venture-backed, rapidly-growing provider of private, hybrid-, and multi-cloud infrastructure. We design and deploy compute, storage, networking, and services for clients who need infrastructure at significant scale, driving those economies of scale to benefit our service provider and enterprise clients. We consult with our clients on a variety of cloud migration and transformation efforts, and assist them in making the most of cloud infrastructure with a variety of managed services.  Position: **  We are seeking a strong Financial Analyst to join our innovative and growing finance team. As a member of a lean team, you will be responsible for financial reporting & budgeting, product modeling, and data management. You will collaborate with various business functions and play a critical role in providing valuable business insights to drive decision-making.Reporting directly to the Director of Finance, this position provides high visibility to the executive leadership team and offers an incredible opportunity for growth. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Financial Planning: 2 years (Preferred)Price Modeling: 2 years (Preferred)Product Modeling: 2 years (Preferred)Financial Analysis: 2 years (Preferred)

Name: Business Technology Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY:Responsible for assisting in technology integration. Oversees a company's current information technology (IT) systems to ensure that the company's technology-related goals are met and implements new IT systems. Business technology analysts are expected to work with, and improve upon, current systems while taking budgetary concerns into consideration.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:• Responsible for the creation and implementation of business processes, workflow, technology solutions and technology frameworks within a business organization. • Provide orientation and training to users on internal systems • Maintains and updates skills through formal and informal training opportunities. • Coordinate data integrations between systems. • Maintain IT asset inventory including the tracking and procurement of IT equipment • Follow business-specific standards relevant to various business industries when creating business/functional/system requirements. • Configure business rules and business/functional/system requirements for improvements or new additions to the current computer system. • Responsible for computer system maintenance policies such as Version Control, Form Management, Baseline Management, Change Management, and Release Management. • Responsible for maintenance and improvements/enhancements to the existing technology within a business
