Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Qualifications &Responsibilities  Business Systems Analyst (BSA)  Conversant and Epsilon is seeking a qualified Business SystemsAnalyst (BSA) that has strong technical skills and a mind/business savvy forproduct management. The BSA will work closely with the Client Delivery, StrategicPartnerships, and Development teams, to translate the business' wants and needsinto workable solutions from both the perspective of our clients as well as theDevelopment and the Business teams.  The BSA will contribute to, produce and manage clientdeliverables, as well as scoping and building new online behavioral targetingproducts. The BSA, serving as a liaison between internal clients, developmentand production support team, provides effective collaboration, facilitation,leadership, problem solving and engineering solution skills supporting theAgile development and delivery of our application on top of client products.  Role Functions Analyze and translate business needs and opportunities, includingrequirements elicitation and prioritization, into effective functional andtechnical solutions.Co-ordinate withbusiness and product teams across the company to identify high-impact areas forproduct enhancements and build plans to advance our offerings towardscollaboratively developed goals.Work with partners toonboard new data sets and troubleshoot launches, and coordinate the intake andtesting of partner data sets.Analyze business andfunctional requirements and identify gaps in existing systems.Work with developmentstaff to design and implement technical solutions.Assist with SystemIntegration Testing, User Acceptance Testing, and associated activities such astest planning, creating test cases and test execution.Support production staffand client delivery in the use of the designed solution.Assist Issue Managementevents from troubleshooting and identification through resolution.Provide ad-hoc analysesand reports as well as creating standardized reports.Assist in the removal ofimpediments and distractions that interfere with the ability of the developmentteam to deliver. Technical Knowledge Solid understanding ofRelational Database Management Systems.Strong knowledge of SQL.Strong knowledge of UNIX and UNIX tools.Experience analyzingdata files and layout formats.Familiarity withcampaign management/execution is a plus, especially online campaigns.Working knowledge ofBusiness Intelligence/Reporting tools, such as MicroStrategy, Business Objects,OBIEE, is a plus.Understanding of datawarehouse and data mart concepts along with ETL processes is a plus.Required Qualifications:2 years recent experienceas a BSA or similar role writing requirements and technical documentation andworking with client delivery and development teams.Experiencewriting SQL queries for ad-hoc analysis.Experience working withdata files, preferably in a UNIX environment.Experience working withtechnical staff to design and implement technical solutions.Experience in systemsdevelopment and SDLC.Preferred Qualifications:Experience usingbusiness intelligence or reporting tools.Experience supportingchange management and issue management.Experience in productmanagement.Working knowledge ofdigital advertising and targeting data.Working knowledge of digitaladvertising and targeting data.Passion for streamliningand integrating business processes and data.Desire to learn andparticipate in the client and partner side of the business.Strong written andverbal communications skills.Strong analytical andproblem solving skills.Detail-oriented, able to multi-task and prioritize.Self-starter with a strong initiative.| LI*JS #advanced-solutions

Name: Commercial Products Analyst
Description: Job Summary  Under general supervision, the Commercial Products Analyst performs a variety of duties to include various data and statistical analysis, administrative and customer service plan marketing activities for Denver Health Medical Plan’s (DHMP) Large Group segment. Prepares monthly reports including enrollment trends and profitability. The individual will have direct oversight of plan enrollment activities supporting the manager, and broker teams with member events as assigned. This position requires development and maintenance of the commercial large group segment within the business.  Minimum Qualifications Education and Experience 1. Bachelor’s Degree required. 2. Three years of related commercial health plan experience required. 3. Five years of related commercial health plan experience preferred. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 1. Ability to recognize, document and initiate process improvement efforts as it is related to enrollment and process and procedure evaluation in order to improve departmental efforts. 2. Demonstrates a strong ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. 3. Working knowledge of the Colorado Medicaid System. 4. Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills. 5. Ability to think analytically, problem solve, and perform with a high level of accuracy. 6. Ability to prioritize work activities with minimal supervision in a team setting. 7. Bilingual in Spanish preferred. Computers and Technology 1. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Visio, Microsoft Project, and SharePoint. 2. Working knowledge of QNXT.All job applicants for safety-sensitive positions must pass a pre-employment drug test, once a conditional offer of employment has  been made.Denver Health is an integrated, efficient, high-quality academic health care system that is considered a model for the nation. The Denver Health system includes the Rocky Mountain Regional Level I Trauma Center, a 525-bed acute care medical center, Denver’s 911 emergency medical response system, 8 family health centers, 15 school-based health centers, the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Center, the Denver Public Health Department, an HMO, and The Denver Health Foundation.  As Colorado’s primary safety net institution, Denver Health is a mission-driven organization that has provided more than $3.3 billion in care for the uninsured in the last ten years. Denver Health is a leader in performance and quality improvements and remains financially secure, in part, due to its nationally recognized implementation of lean principles in healthcare. Denver Health is a major resource to the community, serving approximately 185,000 individuals and 67,000 children a year.  Located just south of downtown Denver, Denver Health is just minutes away from many of the cultural and recreational activities Denver has to offer.  We strongly support diversity in the workforce and Denver Health is an equal opportunity employer (EOE).  “Denver Health is committed to provide equal treatment and equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Denver Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.”

Name: Functional Analyst (e-business)
Description: Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works behind the scenes to support operational excellence. Our functional services teams (FSTs) provide services to 22,000 employees in over 400 locations worldwide. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger. Explore opportunities in Corporate Development; Financial Services; Human Resources; Health, Safety, Security &, Environment; Information Technology Services; Marketing, Communications & Public Relations; Operations Support; Practice Services; Procurement & Real Estate; Programs & Business Solutions; and Risk Management. Your Opportunity: We are actively looking for a Functional Analyst. Using a combination of business domain and functional system knowledge rooted in a disciplined approach, the Functional Analyst creates system solutions to for improvements for the business and/or to implement development initiatives and resolves Tier 2 incidents/problems as required. To accomplish this, the Functional Analyst maintains an in-depth understanding of the functional configuration and system flows; and works collaboratively with Service Delivery Analysts, Technical Analysts, and Business Analysts to develop functional solutions. Your Duties:Maintain an in-depth understanding of the functional configuration and system flows that underpin an application to deliver functionality to the business.Keep abreast of configuration options and best practices with out-of-the-box functionality.Resolve functional problems effectively and efficiently working with internal technical teams, and external vendors to identify work around, root cause and fix.Log SRs with vendors and coordinate diagnostics, requested actions and testing with technical teams.Execute SQL database queries to assist in data analysis.Proactively identify and consult on functional capabilities to improve service delivery processes.Analyze requirements documents and participate in requirements discussions with business stakeholder to develop and recommend functional designs.Research and develop proof-of-concepts to determine optimal functional designs.Document functional designs & configurations using Microsoft Office tools such as:VisioWordExcelPowerPointCollaborate with end users and/or Business analysts to flesh out requirements and plan/design solutions.Assess impacts of functional changes to the system, including upstream and downstream system flows; and develop appropriate unit test plans to mitigate risk of changes negatively impacting the business.Execute formal testing by participating in testing activities such as test case creation, execution and issue resolution.Work collaboratively with technical analysts to design and develop solutions requiring technical configurations and extensions.Adhere to Stantec's Solution Delivery Framework, Incident Management, and Change Management procedures.Lead or assist with day-to-day service delivery issues and processes as required.Skills:Strong verbal and written communication skills with a professional demeanor.Strong interpersonal, organizational, time management, problem solving, and analytical skills.Strong understanding of data model and system flows for one or more application domains.Strong system troubleshooting skills.Formal training and/or accreditation in accounting/financial management, human resources or other relevant discipline.Good presentation and facilitation skills.Demonstrated proficiency with the following:Microsoft Office tools such as Visio, Word, Excel and PowerPointUnderstanding internal system flows for a particular application domainQA testing tools such as HP Quality CenterQualifications & Experience:Completion of a post-secondary Business, Finance, or Information Technology related program or comparable education.Experience with system development and testing methodologies and tools.Project management and/or project lead experience.Experience with ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library).Hands on experience with Oracle E-Business Suite in one or more of the following modules:ProjectsFinancialsHRMS This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.  Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. Name: Business Development Analyst
Description: BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ANALYST REQUIREMENTS:Great can do attitude  2. Minimum 4 years work experience in either startup, biz dev, and/or finance environment.  3. Great organizational and communication skills  4. Work hard / Play hard.  Boutique Business Consulting company seeks professional to work as Business Development Analyst. The company's principal activities include providing consulting services to the startup, tech, entertainment, and finance verticals. Fun, hardworking, and fast paced environment.  This is a terrific opportunity for the right individual because it allows for the right candidate to obtain some of the experience(s) of a senior level executive by demonstrating their ability to add value to the company.  The founder is looking for an individual that possesses many of the same qualities that he does work hard / play hard. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 4 years of biz dev, entrepreneurial, or finance experience with an undergraduate degree focused on finance, entrepreneurship, or accounting. Foreign language fluency a plus (preferably Spanish). Job may require some amount of travel. Hard working environment with great growth potential and responsibility.  Great writing, speaking, and communication skills, as well as Microsoft Office (especially excel) and Internet savvy, required. High-stress environment with amazing experiences. Ability to multitask is very important.  Duties will include assisting executive(s) in executing on company initiatives that will include, but not be limited to, business development, marketing, sales, PowerPoint presentations, strategic planning, finance, accounting, business plans, and the ability to represent executive(s) in meetings. Also, this position will require coordination between the company's other team members, clients, various company vendors, and other people associated with the various endeavors.  Given investors, businesses, and contacts of the company, confidentiality is crucial to this position and a comprehensive background check and execution of a confidentiality/non-compete agreement will be required prior to employment offer. Looking for someone with a minimum of 4 years work experience (preferably in finance). This is an incredible opportunity for a success oriented individual that is not afraid of hard work.  Job Types: Full-time, Contract  Salary: $55,000.00 /year  Experience:startup: 4 years (Preferred)Excel: 5 years (Preferred)entrepreurship: 4 years (Preferred)Microsoft Powerpoint: 5 years (Preferred)business development: 4 years (Preferred)Microsoft Office: 5 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: Denver, CO (Required) Language: Spanish (Preferred)

Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionCapTech is an award-winning national management technology-consulting firm with an enterprising, entrepreneurial environment. We have achieved four straight years ranked in the Top 10 of Consulting Magazine’s Best Firms to Work For, including a #5 ranking overall in 2015. Additionally, we placed 28th within the Vault Consulting 50 for the second year in a row, including a #5 ranking in work/life balance.  At CapTech you’ll experience a flat organizational structure with access to constant learning -- where your career path isn’t set in stone, and you have unlimited potential for growth. CapTech is based upon a culture of mutual respect. We look for, and hire the best. The creatively innovative, the technically insightful, the driven, the self-managed, the value conscious, the caring, and the gracious person – these are all qualities that we look for along with a love and a passion for the work that we do. Job DescriptionBusiness Analysts (BA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration efforts spanning multiple lines of business. CapTech BAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.  Specific responsibilities for the Business Analyst position include: Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization, and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods.QualificationsSpecific qualifications for the Business Analyst position include: Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as change control and defect tracking software.Prior consulting experience preferred. Name: Data Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY We are looking for a passionate, detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Data Science team. The successful candidate be responsible for identifying and developing solutions to turn data into actionable business recommendations. You will need to exhibit a strong combination of analytical prowess, technical aptitude and business judgment. You will be expected to focus on results, be a self-starter and demonstrate success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression and excellence in product and operations.  As a Data Analyst, you will be the analytical partner for our Media and Product teams. You will work closely with Campaign Strategists, Developers and Product Managers to transform subjective discussions about product into concise analytic questions that deliver actionable answers. You will support the design, development, and execution of marketing campaign analysis and game design including managing data and processes, modeling, and analysis to measure effectiveness and improve performance.  You will shape the way product performance is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions for the business. RESPONSIBILITIESEvangelize data knowledge and insights: manage communications with your stakeholders and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve.Prioritize and execute in the face of ambiguity: work with stakeholders and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches.Work on data modeling, metric development, data prototyping, and insight generation using Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Sila is looking for a rock star Business Systems Analyst to develop collaborative relationships and deliver world class solutions for our clients. You will be executing complex projects that are challenging and critical to our clients success. Your teams solution will be impacting and improving the work life of thousands of users, as our clients rely on our team to develop custom applications that enable their companies to thrive in todays world. We are looking for a high performer with SDLC experience who can engage business and IT stakeholders to gain a deep understanding of system requirements in order to fulfill business needs and objectives. Your role will have horizontal and vertical impact across the enterprise as you play an active role throughout the SDLC, guiding development teams and delivering true value.ResponsibilitiesActively participate and lead the delivery of technology solutions and support the creation of artifacts through a rigorous and logical approach to solving business performance issuesLead and execute efforts to produce documentation to support project delivery and define information architecture. These include: technical requirements, functional specifications, data flow diagrams, test cases, requirements traceability matrices, detailed specifications requiring swim lanes, flow charts, wireframes/mockups, user stories, and use case documentationPerform and follow through independently with minimal guidance and effectively manage multiple projects at any given time, setting priorities, schedules, and meeting deadlinesCritically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsDeliver on technical analysis and planning, business performance analysis, and business process designLead the execution of test scripts to ensure the functional requirements have been metSupport the adoption of the solution Unit and System Testing, Integration Testing, identifying deployment activities, and helping to define business processesRequirementsBachelor's degree in Systems Engineering or other related technical fieldMinimum of 3-7 years of experience supporting business analysis for software development projects, developing real-world scaled solutions and leveraging waterfall, agile, and hybrid methodologiesHigh degree of technical competence, a deep understanding of the SDLC, and ability to understand detailed functional requirements and translate them into technical specificationsExperience and/or interest in supporting the development of custom applicationsExperience integrating and deploying COTS productsStrong ability to analyze business and systems requirements, business system capabilities, workflow, and functional limitations; identify information systems integration points; and develop procedures to improve existing systemsAnalytical skills to evaluate tradeoffs between usability and performance needsExperience recognizing scope limitations and raising potential scope issues, while supporting the best technical solution design and approachStrong interpersonal and leadership skills including collaboration and facilitationAdaptable, dependable, and willing to learn independentlySila will not sponsor any employee in this position for a work visa, now or in the future (i.e. H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant or immigrant status)About SilaSila is a technology and management consulting firm that delivers solutions to the worlds leading corporations and Federal government agencies. Our solutions expertise lies in the areas of cybersecurity, risk management, data analytics, software engineering and integration, strategy and transformation, and digital creative services. We are a values-driven company with a culture that fosters collaboration, creativity, and social responsibility. Sila employees are part of a community of vibrant, high-performing contributors who push each other to achieve the highest standard of excellence. Our team members have extensive opportunities to discover their passions and shape their own career paths, and we continually invest in employees growth through innovative training, mentorship, and professional development programs. Staff are quickly immersed in clients business challenges, work closely with emerging technologies to develop impactful solutions to these challenges, and are exposed to a variety of industries and market offerings.We are looking for full-time employees to become an integral part of our growing team. Sila is headquartered in Washington, D.C. and has offices in Chicago, IL; Denver, CO; Seattle, WA; and Shelton, CT. Sila offers a range of great benefits including a comprehensive healthcare package, 401K with matching, paid time off, and paid company holidays, as well as other unique benefits that support our staffs active work/life balance.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Name: Business or System Analyst/Technical - Expert
Description: Job DescriptionLocation: Denver, CO Salary: Open Description: Our client is currently seeking a Business or System Analyst/Technical - Expert Denver, CO This job will have the following responsibilities: * Act as requirements project lead for medium to large projects, directing and coordinating requirements project staff and activities. * Oversee production support of core projects, including gathering and documenting requirements, translating functional requirements to technical requirements, and identifying options. * Partner with business users and act as a liaison between business and technical teams. Coordinates development, testing, and implementation of solutions with vendors. * Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst with track record of delivering business process requirements and use cases is required. Qualifications & Requirements * Solid experience and understanding of Agile Scrum and Rational Unified Process Methodology in developing use cases, use case model, supplementary requirements, and business rules is essential. Solid understanding of relevant business issues. Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skills. * Excellent written and verbal communication skills. * Strong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and iGraphx or Visio Drawing tools along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also required. * The following is preferred but not required: Experience managing multiple large, complex and cross functional projects, with emphasis on systems, technologies, business process redesign, and knowledge of technical environments, a background in the financial services industry * BA/BS degree and/or PMP certification. Contact: acano@judge.com This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at www.judge.com

Name: Data Analyst - ( Business Development )
Description: Position Summary:This role will manage business development and clinical data analysis and quality initiatives across the organization to create a culture of clinical excellence and performance improvement. This position acts as an internal consultant for all levels of the organization with skills in facilitation, change management, and quality improvement. This role manages day-to-day activities of data analysis and development of intelligence reports to support Rose Medical Center’s growth and other strategic initiatives. Enables sound decision-making through accurate data reporting and incisive analysis of the data.Develop and maintain business development reports and intelligence sources, including volume reports and market share data.Oversee all clinical data registries and clinical performance databases, both internal and external. Oversees and manages all clinical data analytics including relevant HCA and local systems Provides supervision or through matrix reporting of all staff performing abstraction or data entry for clinical data registries, publically reported databases or similar processes. Monitor division and corporate clinical excellence and performance improvement initiatives and programs including analyzing corporate and division dashboards Routinely and at a minimum of annually, participates in the review and update of the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement Plan by conducting evaluations. Assures that practices are evidenced-based and consistent with regulatory guidelines to include core measures. Provides ongoing Orientation, Education and Training pertinent to quality assurance and performance improvement based on customers’ needs assessments. Monitors key performance indicators and performance improvement including the use of control charts, statistical analysis and gap detection Executes position responsibilities that demonstrate leadership, experience, and creative approaches to management of developmental needs that contribute to the enhancement of patient care. Regularly communicates PI and quality/safety activities to leadership and QM staff. Utilize conceptual and diagnostic skills to prioritize and manage projects in an effective manner Facilitate teamwork and communications to assure optimal outcomes in the provision of quality improvement services to the organization Facilitates understanding and implementation of systems for quality improvement purposes Position Requirements: Licensure/Certification/Registration: NoneEducation: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience requiredExperience:Three to five years of project and data management preferredThree to five years of clinical experience preferredDemonstrated skills in multi-tasking, problem resolution, planning and expediting work flowDemonstrated experience in the application of quality improvement methods, including PDSA, LEAN, Six Sigma, Control Charts, data collection, analysis and reports Highly developed problem solving skills, ability to manage programs and projects Excellence in interpersonal and written communication skills Ability to assess and analyze data Knowledge of National Patient Safety Goals, requirements and implementation expectations Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Organization – proactively prioritizes work with minimal direction, and effectively manages resources to meet objectives and deadlines Communication – communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing. Communicates effectively with a variety of constituents. Customer orientation – establishes and maintains customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectations.

Name: Business Analyst- Sales Ops
Description: *Business Analyst- Sales Ops***Preferred Qualifications** The Key Account Operations Analyst is a part of the Sales Operations organization supporting multiple Key Account VPs. This Key Account Operations Analyst drives programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization's business, financial and tactical objectives. The role will work closely with Key Account VPs on a daily basis, acting as a trusted business advisor on all aspects of Key Accounts. Responsibilities will include:Advise Key Account VPs and Key Account Directors on policy and processesDrive pipeline management and forecasting processes for Key Account VPsDevelop strategic reporting & analysisDefine and allocate Key Account quotasResearch & resolve compensation exceptionsProvide support in the research & review of account structures for global alignmentDrive plan acceptance and various compliance activities across Key Account teamsAdditional responsibilities may be defined depending on individual candidate?s areas of expertise*Detailed Description and Job Requirements** Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes. Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. May have project lead role. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 5 plus years relevant work experience. *Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.***Job:** Business Operations*Location:** US-TX,Texas-Austin*Other Locations:** US-VA,Virginia-Reston, US-CO,Colorado-Broomfield, US-MA,Mass-Burlington, US-CO,Colorado-Colorado Springs*Job Type:** Regular Employee Hire*Organization:** Oracle

Name: Analyst, Business Strategy
Description: The DaVita Health Solutions (DHS) Analyst will work with a dynamic team focused on revolutionizing care in the evolving value-based healthcare environment. You will be joining a highly entrepreneurial, fast paced, multi-disciplinary work environment that will challenge and grow you professionally and personally. This position requires an energetic, passionate professional to work on high visibility initiatives including: Become part of a healthcare start-up team and launch new programsAnalyze business development opportunities for potential partnersAnalyze competitive landscape and identify opportunities for growthSupport high visibility and evolving product development strategy The position is based in the DaVita Denver, CO headquarters. The Role The analyst must be able to work successfully with cross-functional teams and be able to interact directly with both peers and executives across departments. The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all inclusive. Create and foster growth opportunities for the business Collaborate on new business and care modelsCreate and execute on new outreach ideas for potential clientsCreate and maintain proformas for the business and new client opportunitiesExplore channel partnershipsConduct competitive research Project Management - ability to create and execute growth plans in a collaborative manner Create process and manage customer relationship management softwareManage progress with new and existing clients, including prompting follow-upsHelp manage BD process from initial pitch to sale Develop executive communications, typically done in PowerPoint Research market developments to support strategy formulationResearch insurance companies to prep executives before conversationsResearch on state developments to support insights into potential areas of opportunitySuccinctly and clearly convey findingCustomize communication to fit audience Ad-hoc analytics and research Drive new insightsProvide analytical support to ad-hoc executive requests Just as important as your experience and skills will be the following characteristics and competencies: Build relationships with both internal and external partners and clients to ensure success of DHS programIntellectual curiosityFlexible and able to embrace working in a startup environment. Comfort with ambiguity.Focus on analytical process improvementA self-starter mentality and thoughtful execution abilitiesStrong written and verbal communication skillsExcellent organization and prioritization skillsAn upbeat, team-oriented attitudeSuccessful candidates will have interest and strengths in data analysis and innovationThe RequirementsMission and Values fit with DaVitas culture/mission/values.Two to four years of full-time analyst experience preferredBachelors degree requiredExcel experience with data manipulation and pivot tablesStrong proficiency in all Microsoft applicationsBonus PointsFinancial modeling skills a plusPopulation health and value-based care experience a plusTravel & Time Requirements Travel: 10% may have some local travel  Join us as we pursue our vision "To Build the Greatest Healthcare Community the World has Ever Seen."  Why wait? Explore a career with DaVita today.  Go to http://careers.davita.com to learn more or apply.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data AnalystDenver,CO View All Positions Apply Now Apply Now View All Positions Job SummaryThe Data Analyst is responsible for the creation and publication of daily, weekly, monthly reports and executive dashboards, including collaborating with event teams to gather business requirements, manual consolidation of data, and assisting in the assessment of technology to meet requirements.  Looking for an out of the box thinker with the ability to use data to tell a story the way that the business team understand. This analyst must be able to communicate and present ideas clearly and confidently such that a non-technical audience can grasp the subject matter easily and sway decision makers towards the right decisions.  Candidates should be detail oriented and have a strategic mind, so they are able to question and follow through on suspicious events. The analyst must be able to recognize and differentiate the true impact of the analysis and how it affects the organization. Must have the ability to demonstrate data proficiency, flair and mastery on data manipulation to solve or answer organizations questions. Ideal candidate must be comfortable in networking and liaising with a whole range of people across different lines of business. Job ResponsibilitiesPrepares reports and facilitates analysis, including recommendations, for presentation to senior leadership teams.Creates and maintains daily, weekly, and monthly reports and executive dashboards using Excel and PowerPoint.Oversees collection of data to enable more effective sales and increased guest satisfaction including effectiveness of marketing campaigns, guest spend demographics, ticket sales effectiveness, and partner relationshipRecommends strategies to increase sales, guest satisfaction and improve business results.Collaborates with event and corporate teams including; Product Sales, VIP Sales and Hospitality, Business Development, Food and Beverage, Marketing, Accounting, Artwork, etc.Document and Manage Requirement implementation.Recommend manual and technical solutions to improve gather and presentation of data to the SVP Corporate Operations Required Skills & QualificationsMinimum 3 + years Analytical experience requiredMinimum 1+ year Business Analyst experience requiredExperience with a BI tool like Tableau or Looker preferredExpert with Microsoft ExcelExperience working with large data setsAdvanced computer skills and technical expertise (Oracle, Snowflake, SQL, Tableau, etc.)Excellent analytical thinking, time management, and decision-making skillsKeen ability to visualize data through graphing/ charting/ information display skills (strong Power Point skills are essential)Change Management ExperienceLight project management skills are preferredStrong understanding of Business Operations; Event Management and/or Festival experience is a plus Apply Now Apply Now19163

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Symmetrix Solutions, LLC an elite IT Managed Services and IT consulting firm, is currently seeking candidates that fit the qualifications below:Business Analyst – 6-month contract to hire The Business Analyst will participate in the definition, execution and management of high-impact projects and strategy initiatives, as well as lead small-to-medium sized projects in a highly collaborative work environment. Their role is to elicit, analyze, specify and validate the business needs of stakeholders, as well as assist with managing the project. The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements and be proactive about working and looking for new technologies to optimize business processes.  Responsibilities: Serve as a point of contact for business and IT teams.Participate in the development and maintenance of project estimates, plans and schedules.Create, contribute to and maintain business analysis and project management documentation, ensuring high level of specification completeness, quality, and consistency.Critically analyze, negotiate and actively contribute to decisions on requirements. This includes engaging appropriate cross-functional parties to facilitate the identification of the problem and root cause.Work with development and QA teams to design, implement and test, ensuring that deliverables meet the business requirements.Engage and consult with senior staff to communicate risks, issues and clear impediments that have the potential to impact the delivery schedule.Strive to exceed the expectations of stakeholders by using clear communication, to understand and assess business requirements so that the right solutions are adopted.Actively engage in the review of documentation and critically assess the existing standards and documentation set, fostering continuous improvement.Take on other responsibilities related to the fields of Business Analysis and Project Management, as needs arise, and skills are developed. Qualifications: 5+ years’ experience with BA / BS in Business / Finance / Economics / Logistics / Computer Science preferredExperience working as a BA on integration projects preferredAbility to manage multiple priorities effectively and work in a fast-paced environment.Ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment.Self-starter, highly motivated and creative.Excellent interpersonal skills, as well as excellent communication skills, verbal and written to both technical and non-technical audiences that are in a geographically dispersed environment (conference calls, Skype, face-to-face).Strong analytical and organizational skills.Must be able to work overtime, as required.Experience working on an Agile Team that use Jira and Confluence, preferredSome travel may be required.provided by Dice Business Analysis, Requirements Gathering, Project Estimates/Plans/Schedules, Documentation and Communication, Testing Requirements, Agile, Jira and Confluence a huge plus.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Danone North America is the largest Benefit Corporation in the world. Our mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible.  Danone North America is looking for a Business Process Analyst in Broomfield.  The Business Process Analyst, BPA, leads order to cash (OTC) systems and processes as the technical subject matter expert translating systems capabilities into best practice order fulfillment processes. They are responsible for monitoring and evaluating system and process performance for SAP, OpenText, Orsoft, MicroStrategy, and OmPrompt to drive successful order fulfillment for all customer orders. The BPA serves as the primary liaison between Customer Solutions and internal Master Data and EDI teams and is the gatekeeper to coordinate escalation of OTC systems issues prior to engaging those teams. The BPA leads Customer Solutions in systems development projects to ensure systems enhancements do not adversely impact customer service. Responsibilities:Subject matter expert for order to cash systems and processes.Manages business-critical master data and configuration for Customer Solutions.Leads SAP order processing issue management and resolution.Responsible for productivity and continuous improvement including identifying, developing, and implementing efficiencies within order fulfillment process.Acts as key technical lead representing order to cash SAP functionality for Customer Solutions.Works cross functionally to deliver business objectives. Anticipates the impact of meeting new challenges and leads problem solving and adaptation to overcome challengesMaintains Customer Solutions systems SME knowledge base through SOP and training document creation and team trainings.Owns system testing and acceptance for order to cashLeverages multi-systems knowledge to provide technical expertise in developing departmental KPI reporting.Ensures that published reporting and root data are accurate based on a comprehensive systems and process knowledge.Education and Experience (Requirements):SAP experience required including both APO and ERP, including gATP. SAP system implementation experience preferredSAP Master Data managementSAP Order to Cash experienceEDI process and transaction managementBachelor’s Degree required3 - 5 years of CPG business system experience in related area within IT, Customer Service, Logistics, or Supply Chain preferredKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:In-depth knowledge of customer supply chain operations as well as familiarity with all systems that integrate with the order fulfillment process.Capacity to comfortably interact with all levels of the business and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.Ability to apply a disciplined, logical and comprehensive approach to problem solving.High degree of initiative and ownership.Strong attention to detail for both accuracy and content.Judgment to resolve issues with the appropriate sense of urgency including ability to provide afterhours support.Excellent communication skills both written and verbal including the ability to translate technical information to a broad end user community.Ability to create and communicate a structured business recommendation with advantages and disadvantages.Skill set which allows one to both identify an issue and implement the solution while working as part of a team or as an individual contributor.Ability to maintain productivity and professionalism while under pressure to meet strict deadlines and balance multiple priorities.Ability to develop work instructions, training material and presentations.Advanced Excel skills preferred.NON ESSENTIAL:APICS certification preferredOpenText, MicroStrategy, Orsoft and OmPrompt experience preferred Danone North America is a Certified B Corporation business unit of Danone and operates in the U.S. from headquarter offices in White Plains, NY and Broomfield, CO. For more information, please visit DanoneNorthAmerica.com.　  Danone North America is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran status, genetic characteristic or any other unlawful criterion.　 #LI-NORAM  http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf Nearest Major Market: Denver Job Segment: Business Process, ERP, Logistics, Document Management, SAP, Management, Technology, Operations

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: ?Job Req #: 18-04832 Job Description: Business Systems Analyst?Location:Glendale, COPosition Type: Direct Placement??Summary? The Business Systems Analyst will act as the primary interface to business users, subject matter experts and managers and will be held accountable for developing a strong partnership promoting a collaborative and unified working relationship. In addition to identifying opportunities, this individual will be responsible for turning opportunities into projects and managing projects to completion ensuring projects are delivered on-time as well as meeting or exceeding expectations. A critical component to the success of opportunity identification and management as well as business analysis will be acting as a visionary regarding the identification and production of key artifacts produced during these phases of the project within and across organization boundaries. This individual provides a unique role in identifying, developing and promoting business solutions. It will be essential to understand as many aspects of how computing fits into an organization as possible. They must have credible knowledge of both business and computing models and techniques to effectively investigate business processes to understand and communicate how data, processes and communications flow within and across business functions and departments. This individual is responsible for identification, evaluation, and management of technology solutions in relation to business needs while ensuring continuity between IT solutions. Most importantly this role provides leadership in partnering with the business to drive future strategy regarding technology and best-in-class processes necessitating them to be an excellent communicator, planner and organizer with a comprehensive understanding of business application and technology integration. ? Essential Functions? Perform requirements gathering and documentation with clients, internal users, and third-party vendors for systems development, enhancements, and process improvements.Develop and clearly document functional business specifications for new projects.Work with external and internal clients to identify systems and process solutions that will enable new business opportunities. Quantify the IT resources needed to implement new business solutions.Develop User Acceptance Testing plans, coordinate testing, and document test results of new systems functionality and processes.Provide level three support on new features and work with development staff as necessary to resolve issues.Assist the Director of Business Solutions to devise and/or modify procedures to solve complex business problems in many forms (RFP response, cost benefit analysis, financial feasibility studies, software analysis and review, gap analysis).Assist with documentation of IT projects and reporting to management.Perform related duties as requested Education ? Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Information Systems or related discipline preferred.? Experience 4 or more years of hands-on total IT experience.Four (4) or more years hands-on experience in project initiation and business requirements and analysis.Four (4) or more hands-on technical design, software development, testing and production support.Two (2) or more years hands-on SQL experience - must be recent/current.Two (2) or more years as a business analyst or operations analystFive (5) or more years writing functional requirements and specifications for software development projects.Agile is a must have?Audrey Lamb Technical Recruiter  Ascent 303-220-6885?*If this is not a fit for you or you are not interested, Ascent Services Group offers an excellent Referral Bonus!? We look forward to hearing from you!?About Ascent:? The Ascent Services Group (ASG) is a nationally recognized technology staffing and consulting firm whose fundamental business is providing staffing services to Small, Medium, and Large Enterprise clients in our core market verticals: Financial Services, Healthcare, Technology and Life Sciences.? As consultants for ASG, you will have access to many of the top clients within the industries we serve.? Our goal is to deliver innovative talent through proven best practices and effective resource optimization.? Become one of ASG?s candidates and experience the difference! IND05?? Company Description:About Ascent:  Ascent is a leading national technology consulting and professional services firm that focuses on tactical and strategic consulting. Ascent’s fundamental business is providing staffing services to Large Enterprise clients in our core market verticals: Financial Services, Healthcare, and Life Sciences. We focus the majority of our efforts in Staff Augmentation support of Large Enterprise Clients who utilize a Vendor Management System. Ascent works as both a reliable supplier in support of programs, as well as a Strategic Advisor in support of enterprise efforts to establish best in class preferred vendor programs. Ascent was ranked in the 2007 and 2008 Inc. 500 and recognized specifically for its innovative work in staff augmentation support of Large Enterprise preferred vendor accounts.  If you are ready to propel your career to new heights… read on. We are looking for talented and dedicated colleagues to join our phenomenal team. At Ascent, we have created an environment where culture, commitment and opportunity converge to yield a truly unique place to work. We know that every employee has something important to say and that every employee is integral to our success. Where else can you walk over to a founder and talk about your ideas to help build our business and have that idea implemented in 48 hours? More importantly, we do everything we can to make sure our employees not only have great jobs, but great lives.

Name: Business System Analyst
Description: Description:Lone Tree - CO, DENR3, 9800 Schwab Way, 80124  Laura Troy  20180820-5266 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: Customer Reporting Technology (CRT) organization oversees the strategy and implementation of Schwab‘s regulatory and non-regulatory client communications. This team is responsible for collecting, rendering and delivering various documents, including but not limited to confirms, statements, letters. The organization also supports various functions including Tax and Client Reporting by ensuring the successful delivery of customer reporting files to our print and electronic channels in a timely manner.  The Business System Analyst will be a highly motivated and self-driven individual that thrives in a fact pace, exciting technical development environment. This role provides an opportunity to leverage analytical skills to solve complex business problems across multiple functional areas, while also providing technical expertise in identifying, evaluating and developing systems and applications to support client user requirements. This role is also critical in driving significant enhancements and streamlining processes which will allow the ability to bring more flexible products to the market quicker. The BSA within Client Reporting Technology will focus on the Statements and Confirmations process, converting business requests into technical functional requirements and managing development thru deployment. What you’ll do:Translates business needs into technical solutions and corresponding technical requirements used throughout the development process. Develop Functional Specifications and system context diagrams are required.Drive significant enhancements and streamlining of our processes and introduction of new technologies to bring more flexible products to market quickly.Uses case requirements to drive the design or review of test cases, process change requests.Track and manage a project’s scope, development, testing and deployment.Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.Helps implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way and builds key relationships with stakeholders and communicates with partners.Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.Facilitates effective project requirement discovery meetings while exhibiting confidence and extensive knowledge of business requirements and emerging technology best practices.Partnering with business organizations (e.g. Client Reporting) to ensure expectations are met and acting as a liaison between business and technical teams to resolve issues.Ensuring projects are progressing according to plan by resolving issues or obstacles.What you have:BS Degree in Technology, Math or related subject or equivalent combination of education and experience3-5 years of Business System Analyst experience, including gathering requirements, creating use cases and wireframes, user stories, etc.Project management experience/knowledge, with ability to drive projects to successful completion; Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Posting TitleBusiness Intelligence Analyst . LocationCO - Golden . Position TypeRegular . Hours Per Week40 . Job Summary Primary role of the Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will be to develop reports and dashboards utilizing enterprise project and financial data. The BI Analyst will work directly with the Financial Analysts, Business Managers, the IT Data Management Team, and lab dashboard users to design, implement and maintain dashboards and reports. The ideal candidate has extensive experience translating raw data and user requirements into useful visualizations and reports. The BI Analyst will cultivate and align with a strong team culture and collaborative environment centered on consistently delivering exceptional performance and outcomes. Duties shall include: Responsible for the overall design, implementation and maintenance of the Office of the CFO’s (OCFO) reports and dashboards, which includes reports targeted to NREL’s executive team, lab program managers, project managers and project coordinators, and business units. Create ad-hoc reports as requested in a timely and accurate manner to provide actionable data to senior level manager and above both internal and external to the department Responsible for developing and executing test plans to ensure accuracy of data Ensures the use of demonstrated best practices for multiple business intelligence solutions Works directly with the IT Data Management Team including the Database Architect, BI Developer, Database Administrators, and Data Engineers to facilitate Data Hub and integration requirements, troubleshoot data anomalies, and build new functionality/enhancements within the enterprise data architecture Works directly with report authors within the OCFO to ensure synchronization of efforts and provide training and best practice guidance Provides BI analytic guidance to projects and teams, ensuring that new initiatives or enhancements to enterprise business systems enable effective data reporting and display Responsible for turning business requirements into technical requirements through prototyping and requirements documentation Develop improved data visualizations as well as consistent NREL-branding across business intelligence dashboards Support the budgeting and planning process, including variance analysis as well as long term strategic planning Assist in month end and year end close responsibilities Knowledge, Skills and Attributes: Deep understanding of general BI data strategies and solutions utilizing a wide range of products Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common metrics used to measure and monitor operational performance, define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and provide clear and concise communication with a wide audience of internal departments Expert data analytic skills, including expert Excel data modeling techniques (VBA, macros, PowerView, PowerQuery, PowerPivot, etc.) 5 years of hands-on experience with at least one mainstream BI tool (Power BI, OBIEE, Tableau, etc.) 5 years of experience with and a wide base of knowledge of general Data Management principles, methodologies, and frameworks including master data management, data security, data dictionaries, metadata management, data governance and data quality. Expert in building complex visualizations out of raw data with drill-down capabilities Deep subject matter expertise in business processes mapping, solution design, and data analysis in technical/business environments supporting reporting and analytics needs Good understanding of finance and accounting including budget creation, financial reporting and analysis and cash flow planning. Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to work well in a cross-organizational team environment Entrepreneurial, self-starter that gets excited about rolling up their sleeves and proactively solving problems . Required Education, Experience, and SkillsRelevant Bachelor's Degree and 5 or more years of experience or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant Master's Degree and 3 or more years of experience or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant PhD or equivalent relevant education/experience. Or, relevant JD or equivalent relevant education/experience. Complete understanding and wide application of technical principles, theories and concepts in the field. General knowledge of other related disciplines. Considerable knowledge of laws, regulations, principles, procedures and practices related to specific field. Strong leadership, project management and problem solving skills. Ability to use various computer software programs. . Preferred Qualifications . Submission Guidelines Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at NREL you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified. Applications are not kept on file for future positions. Please include a cover letter and resume with each position application. . EEO Policy NREL is dedicated to the principles of equal employment opportunity. NREL promotes a work environment that does not discriminate against workers or job applicants and prohibits unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, marital status, ancestry, actual or perceived sexual orientation, or veteran status, including special disabled veterans. NREL validates right to work using E-Verify. NREL will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For additional information, click here.

We are a "must-run" company and we are committed to greater in everything we dofrom operating efficiently, reliably and safely to being a responsible community partner. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, DCP Midstream operates assets in 17 states. Name: Technical Analyst, Business Operations
Description: Ibotta is one of the top mobile shopping applications on the App Store and Google Play. Our apps are used by millions of customers every month and we're looking for an Technical Analyst, Business Operations to come build something great with us. As part of the team, your extensive knowledge of system capabilities will inform the structure and strategy of campaigns that launch on the application. To be successful in this role, you must have excellent attention to detail, complete technical tasks at a fast pace, and take a collaborative approach to problem-solving. What you’ll be doing:Communicate and collect cross-departmental feedback to align on best practices and proceduresManages setup and launch of all components in the applicationAnticipates issues and provides alternative methods of setup or deliveryStays up to date on internal system changes and updates/educates impacted department(s)Analyzes, detects, identifies, and helps fix technical problems alongside engineering teamWorks closely with Analytics to pull complex user behavior dataDetermines best methods of setup and execution for campaign optimizations in order to meet client needs and enhance user experienceStrategizes and implements Marketing initiatives to optimize user acquisition and retentionCompletes assigned technical duties at high level of independence under minimal supervisionWhat we’re looking for:Project management experience - should excel at juggling multiple projects at onceStrong communication skills and ability to collaborate cross-departmentally to mitigate and troubleshoot issuesAbility to match client’s business requirements with internal product capabilitiesStrong desire to learn and navigate internal technical systems effectivelyAbility to adapt to changing environment – responsive when priorities change and able to pivot workflow accordinglyStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsProactive in initiating changes to make internal systems more efficient, resulting in higher productivity of current team membersBA/BS degree related to business or technology preferred2+ years technical experience preferredProficiency in Microsoft ExcelAbout Us:  Headquartered in Denver, CO, Ibotta (“I bought a...“) is transforming the shopping experience by making it easy for consumers to earn cash back on everyday purchases through a single smartphone app. The company partners with leading brands and retailers to offer rebates on groceries, electronics, clothing, gifts, home and office supplies, restaurant dining, and more. Ibotta is the premier destination for rewarded shopping on mobile, and has paid out more than $270 million in cash back to its users. Launched in 2012, Ibotta has nearly 28 million downloads, and is one of the five most frequently used shopping apps in the United States. Additional Details:This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), 401k, commuter stipend, and equity.Ibotta provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and genetics.Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.

Description: Overall Purpose: Responsible for all aspects of the analysis, evaluation and production support solutions for internal or external customer for Oracle or emerging Technology applications. Roles & Responsibilities: 1) Primary responsibility to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the needs of the project stakeholders. 2) Retrieves and analyzes operational data evaluating and comparing information to identify solutions to operational production support issues or project plans. 3) May design and/or create reports/summaries, reporting tools, and database requirements to help operational effectiveness. 4) Verifiable track record of managing complex IT projects, performing gap analysis between goals and existing procedures/skill sets, and designing process and system improvements to improve productivity and reduce costs. 5) Provide recommendations for improvement and written documentation that relates to the analysis of the data. Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.Military Experience Welcome!Benefits for New Hires start Day 1.SummaryMaps metrics against the Company's operational plans and tactical/strategic goals to ensure alignment and focus.
