Name: Sr. Technical Business Analyst - APIs
Description: The Company  Worldpay is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the fastest growing payments company in the U.S., first in PIN Debit transactions and the second largest merchant acquirer. Visit Worldpay.com for more.  The Opportunity  As Worldpay grows, we must be proactive in assuring we stay ahead of the curve with truly cutting-edge products and services. The payments industry is in rapid evolution with the implementation of new technologies. By hiring the best minds that understand that new features and capabilities are just as important as security, Worldpay will continue to beat the competition with our offerings. Whether it's dedicated to new products and services, or ensuring we have the best infrastructure out there, Worldpay is dedicated to tech.  The Senior Technology Business Analyst is passionate about learning new products, technologies, and processes to provide subject matter expertise of APIs, integrations, systems, and data to facilitate overall understanding while driving solutioning, development, and support. The ideal candidate will have a deep passion for learning, simplifying the complex, and continually driving improvement of products, process, and technologies  Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.  Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At Worldpay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. People with ambition, optimism and courage. We provide growth and opportunity and give employees flexibility in how they get the job done. You might not expect that from a big payments company, but we're smart enough to know how to hire the best and when to step aside and let them lead. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board. What you'll do:Work closely with product management and a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization to develop, validate, refine and groom user's stories and associated test casesPerform detailed analysis, mapping, and documentation of a variety of systems and data including internal, back-end, and third party,Become an API and domain SME to facilitate team understanding of requirements and capabilities with a specific focus on the "how' and 'why'.Work under the guidance of the product owner and development manager for day to day prioritization of work and help achieve sprint goals.Provide integration support and in-depth technical trouble shootingDevelop documentation and guidelines to facilitate understanding and use of APIs, systems, and data.Who you are:You have expertise with technology, as well as with acumen from a business perspectiveYou have excellent analytical, problem-solving and research skills with a creative mindset capable of tying desperate information together and making sense of the complex.You strategically see the big picture but also can focus on the details needed to tactically execute.You are passionate about building exceptional experiences and understand what a great API that meet these needs looks like.You understand the importance of the developer experience to maximize impact, distribution and success for those building on top of APIsYou are an excellent communicator and understand the importance of networking and building relationships.You are good at sorting out ambiguity.You are persistent, rational and put facts above speculation.You are proficient in Databases. (Query languages like SQL ) and have a solid understanding of Web services/APIs. (SOAP, REST, XML etc.,).You are comfortable working with a wide variety of stakeholders at all levels within the organization.Be able to handle multiple priorities and tasksSelf-Motivated, Proactive and can work under minimal supervision Bonus skills Demonstrated success in developing Product APIsDomain knowledge of the payment industry.Excellent presentation skills and comfort presenting complex information to senior leadershipAbility to teach others the art of analysis and developing product APIsBasic qualifications for consideration:Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related field or equivalent experience4+ years' experience in technical analysis or related field2+ years of designing, analyzing, testing, or supporting APIs (though no API programming will be required for this specific role) Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Name: ANALYST III - Business Tax Efile Analyst
Description: Department Information  The Colorado Department of Revenue (CDOR) employs approximately 1,300 hard-working and dedicated employees throughout Colorado. We can be seen performing functions as varied as auditing and collecting taxes, issuing driver licenses and motor vehicle titles, marketing lottery products, enforcing liquor laws, and regulating gaming, horse racing, marijuana, and the auto industry and assisting the citizens of our state. At CDOR, we value Communication, Dedication, Ownership and Responsible Government. The Department of Revenue also offers:Strong, secure, yet flexible retirement benefits including PERA Defined Benefit Plan, PERA Defined Contribution Plan, State Defined Contribution plan plus 401K and 457 plansMedical and dental health plansEmployer-supplemental Health Savings AccountPaid life insuranceAutomatic short-term (and optional long-term) disability coverage10 paid holidays per yearPaid vacation and sick leaveDiscounted RTD Eco-Pass (Denver Metro locations)BenefitHub program for discounted merchandise, food and travelCafeWell employee wellness programExcellent work-life programs, such as some flexible work schedules, training and more To learn more about our benefits visit: https://www.colorado.gov/dhr/benefits Description of Job  The position is located in the Taxpayer Services Division/Electronic Filing Unit and exists to implement and advance electronic filing of business tax returns,including sales tax and other tax types, that are prepared and submitted using third party tax software or using other methods, such as spread sheet filing, that are devised to advance adoption of electronic filing. This position will analyze business tax statutory and form changes in order to update the data filing schemas for Colorado sales tax and other business taxes that are filed electronically. Provide the schemas and business rules to the Gentax developers and Gentax support group. coordinate with them on the installation and system testing of the schemas and rules. Monitor Gentax for performance issues and electronic returns that fail to process. Provide filing instructions to taxpayers and tax practitioners in order to resolve return filing issues. Respond to software provider and tax practitioner questions on taxability issues. Provide guidance to businesses wishing to being efiling. Run reports and communicate with the business tax accounting section and Discovery section to identify filing issues that could be prevented at the third party software level. Communicate with the software industry and propose upfront rules as needed to eliminate or reduce such issues.  Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Science, Finance or a related field at the the agencies discretion.  AND two years of professional experience in business information operations which must include one year of testing and/or validating business information systems.  (This professional experience MUST be detailed in the application. Failure to provide the above listed experience and/or "see resume" statements will not be accepted in lieu of a completed application).  Substitutions  A combination of work experience in Accounting, Auditing, Business, Management, Computer Management or Finance may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the Bachelor's degree.  A Master's or Doctorate degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Science or Finance may substitute for the Bachelor's degree and one or two years of the experience, respectively.  Preferred Qualifications and Competencies  The preferred candidates will possess a Master's degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Management or Finance; two years of xml schema design experience or two years of project management or two years of experience in testing and validating business systems or two years of system analysis and support for Gentax.  DOR REQUIRED SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: Competencies required for all DOR positions include good communications skills (both oral and written), interpersonal skills, the ability to multi-task, the ability to work with confidential information, the ability to work in high-stress environments, and the demonstrated ability to assist customers in an effective, efficient, and elegant manner.  The following are conditions of employment with the Colorado Department of Revenue: All employees must be current with their Income Tax filings and payments with the State of Colorado. This includes successfully passing a pre-employment evaluation of your tax records/accounts.Employees are in a position of public trust in the performance of their job duties and must operate in a manner that maintains the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and public confidence. All job finalists require successful completion of a background investigation and reference check prior to appointment. Background checks may include national criminal, financial, traffic, civil, education, and/or experience checks or any other checks related to the job assignment. Fingerprint background checks and pre-employment drug testing may also be required for some positionsAPPEAL RIGHTS: If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.  Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.  Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb.  A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.  Supplemental Information E-MAIL ADDRESS: All correspondence regarding your status in the selection/examination process will be conducted via e-mail. Include a working email address on your application; one that is checked often as time sensitive correspondence WILL take place via email. Exam information or notification will take place via email; check your email frequently. Please include your current e-mail address on your application and set up your e-mail to accept messages from "state.co.us" and "info@governmentjobs.com" addresses. It is your responsibility to ensure that your email will accept these notices and/or review your junk mail and spam filtered email. APPLICANT CHECKLIST: Only complete applications submitted by the closing date for this announcement will be given consideration. Failure to submit properly completed documents by the closing date of this announcement may result in your application being rejected.  Applicants MUST submit a resume, cover letter/letter of interest and transcripts (if applicable) detailing how their experience and background address the stated minimum and preferred qualifications/competencies of the job (late submissions will not be accepted).  Complete Applications must include the following documents:  1) A complete CDOR Application for Announced Vacancy (Submit online using the link in this announcement)  2) A complete Supplemental Questionnaire (Submit online as part of your application)  3) A chronological resume (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted)  4) A Cover Letter with a Written Narrative. The written narrative should describe your interest in this position and specifically how your education, abilities, skills and experience relate to the requirements, responsibilities and competencies listed in the job announcement. (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted)  5) A copy of your official or unofficial transcript showing that your degree has been conferred and the name of your school, or your NACES accreditation (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted) MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS:The application will be used to determine if the applicant meets the Minimum Qualification requirements.The application, resume and cover letter/letter of interest are the first step in the comparative analysis process and will be used to determine whether an applicant will move on to the next step in the process.They may also be used to determine the top group to be invited for further testing, the applicants rank or establish an eligible list. Part of, or the entire comparative analysis for this position, may involve a review of the information submitted in the application material, including the answers to the supplemental questions. Therefore, it is paramount that in the experience portion of the application, the applicant describes the extent to which they possess the education, experience, competencies and background as they relate to the duties outlined in the job announcement, as well as the special and/or preferred qualifications. List your employment history starting with the most recent job, including part-time, temporary, and volunteer jobs. If more than one job was held with a given organization, list each job held as a separate period of employment. Under "Duties," describe clearly the tasks you performed and the nature of your supervisory, technical, or other responsibilities as they relate to the job for which you are applying. Be complete and specific in detailing of duties. Information must be accurate, including dates of employment. If it is found that information provided is falsified, you will not be considered for a job with the State of Colorado and/or may be removed from a job after hire. "See resume" statements will not be accepted in lieu of a properly competed application. Failure to include adequate information or follow instructions may affect the applicant's score and/or prevent them from competing in any subsequent measures used to arrive at a top group of applicants. Factors to be assessed are those outlined in the requirements, competencies, and preferred qualifications.  Years will be expressed in terms of full-time equivalent service with full-time workload equal to one (1) Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) year. No more than 1.00 FTE year may be credited in any twelve (12) month period. Positions working 40 hours of less per week will be pro-rated (i.e. 30 hrs/wk=0.75 FTE=9 mos credit; 20 hrs/wk=0.5 FTE=6 mos credit; 10 hrs/wk=0.25 FTE=3 most creditSDL2017

Name: Senior Business Solutions Analyst
Description: GENERAL NATURE OF JOB:  We’re widely known for our Dual Bottom Line culture where we seek to enable the full release of human possibility and individual development while achieving strong financial returns. We invest in our employees and provide opportunities for them to make a difference while building a culture that reflects our core values of safety, excellence and respect. We are looking for a passionate and innovative Business Solutions Analyst.  Under the direction of the IT Global Business Solutions Mgr, this position is responsible for interacting with the application development and support services within a mixed architecture (client/server and web-based) for One Global Garlock. This includes and is not limited to Oracle 11i eBusiness Suite. Duties include analysis and problem solving of complex application problems to meet the needs of users. This position will require direct interaction with end-users, business leaders, vendors and will act as a strategic partner to the management teams. Support, maintain and administer policies and procedures for ensuring security and integrity of the company’s critical business applications. The ideal candidate for this position is detail-oriented and highly innovative.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Interacts regularly and directly with the Business and has close user working relationship to ensure industry and best practices are employedAct as a change agent to help the business stakeholders envision the future and how their work will need to change to support it.Evaluate, test and recommend new opportunities for enhancing our software, hardware and IT processesEvaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Select systems and capabilities to meet business data requirements and evaluate new techniques for improved functionality.Evaluate, test and recommend new opportunities for enhancing our software, hardware and IT processesManaging projects, developing project plans, monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.Managing competing resources and priorities.Assists with the implementation and support of Oracle's eBusiness Suite modulesProvides end-user support to a diverse, non-technical user baseProvides research, analysis and problem resolution including creating and monitoring of service requests with support vendors and Corporate IT Shared ServicesConfigures applications and interprets functionality for business usersDocuments functional and technical specifications for application configuration and submits to developers for time and cost estimatesWorks closely with technical developers as neededDocuments and communicates changes throughout the user organization, supporting change management and complianceCreates and maintains end user training documentation, and provide training for end-users as needed OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES:  The successful applicant will possess the following requirements (items are required unless noted otherwise): Strong knowledge of Oracle E-Business Suite in a Manufacturing environmentIn-depth functional knowledge of and experience (10+ years) with Oracle's e-Business Suite applications with focus on the Quote to Cash business flow including Order Management, Advanced Pricing, Customer modules from a functional and technical perspective.Knowledge of Oracle iStore a plusOracle 11i experience a plusStrong analytical approach to business process design with emphasis on cross-functional inter-dependenciesA track record of following through on commitments.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills as well as flexibility in working hoursAbility to interpret, drive, and support customer vision and thinkingAbility to identify and help mitigate risks and issuesStrong interpersonal, written communication, and presentation skillsWorking knowledge of analysis and reporting toolsWork collaboratively within our team, the department, and across the organizationTraining and mentoring skillsKnowledge of Systems Life Cycle development and Agile methodologiesExperience as a member of a team performing an ERP ImplementationExperience in a team environment serving an end user communityUnderstanding of database concepts such as schemas, tables, and views as well as experience in developing SQL queriesRequired SkillsRequired Experience Job Location  Denver, US-CO

Name: Business Systems Analyst SAP
Description: Position HighlightsGreat-West Financial is currently recruiting a Business Systems Analyst for SAP. Viewed as an expert in SAP system implementation and support, this position presents an opportunity to an experienced SAP FI/CO, banking configuration and testing professional to take the next steps in their career. This is an exciting opportunity for a qualified candidate to participate in our Financial Reporting transformation initiative by defining effective business processes for our organization and configuring and testing the SAP system in support of this effort. As part of our established SAP team, the successful candidate will under consultative direction, design, document and implement complex applications and system enhancements for SAP. Ensures delivery satisfies system and business requirements. Provides on-going configuration and operational support for complex SAP application modules. The chosen candidate will coordinate with users to determine functional and/or technical requirements, and ensure that SAP system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency.  Primary ResponsibilitiesGathers, documents and analyzes system and business requirements for moderately complex SAP applications. Prepares detailed specifications from which new applications and system enhancements will be written.Analyzes system and business needs to effectively map business processes to SAP application modules.Configures and customizes moderately complex SAP application modules.Tests moderately complex SAP application modules. Troubleshoots problems and recommends modifications to applications. Completes moderately complex project tasks within defined milestones. Makes recommendations for project resource requirements to project managers and/or systems leadership. Maintains requirements documentation, project tracking, and key stakeholder reporting metrics. May lead or direct projects of smaller scope.May train and mentor less experienced staff. Act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.Other duties as assigned.May be assigned to on-call support rotation.  QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business or equivalent experience. Minimum of 2 years relevant SAP experience. Hands on configuration experience required.Experience in implementations of new SAP enhancements and conversions. Financial Accounting expertise in configuring General Ledger Accounting (FI-G/L), New G/L, Accounts Payable (FI-AP), Accounts Receivable (FI-AR), Fixed Asset accounting (FI-FA), and Treasury-Cash Management (TR-CM), Material Management (MM). Experience in setting up SAP banking, treasury and cash management configuration and testing. Experience should include the setup, testing and maintenance of house banks, and the integration of SAP with banks – NACHA files, check formats, and EDI and BAI file formats. Expert experience in Transaction manager with expertise in setting up inter-company loans and debenture setup.Working Conditions/Physical Requirements: Normal Office Working Conditions May be required to work on-call shifts as necessary.Desirable skills: Experience on a Financial Reporting business process transformation initiative.Experience using SAP Solution Manager.Experience using Agile as method of delivering new Software Development. SAP FS-CD module experience is desired About Great-West FinancialAt Great-West Financial® and Empower Retirement, our more than 5,000 associates are dedicated to helping customers secure their financial futures. We offer a range of retirement savings products, life insurance, annuities and investment services from offices across the country. If you’re interested in joining a company that enjoys a record of strong performance and is rich in history yet innovative, bold and transformative, then our organization is an outstanding place for you to grow and succeed. We’re an equal opportunity employer dedicated to workforce diversity. We’re also committed to providing a drug-free workplace.

Name: Loan Operations Analyst (Contract)
Description: At OnDeck, we make small business a big deal. We're improving the world's economic landscape by changing the way small businesses access capital. We care intensely about each other, our company and the customers we serve, and are committed to making every day count.  The OnDeck Operations team is a high performing department that delivers a world class loan origination and servicing experience that supports and delights our internal and external customers, and drives responsible company growth. We combine people, processes and technology to deliver outstanding results. From our Operations headquarters in Denver, Colorado our Operations team members have the opportunity to advance their careers "vertically" through their existing Operations group or "horizontally" across Operations and OnDeck more generally. This "vertical" and "horizontal" approach promotes fantastic career growth, particularly when paired with first class training. We seek energetic team members eager to roll up their sleeves and help small businesses achieve their goals.  Our Loan Origination team guides and executes on the journey of a Loan Application through the entire pre-origination life cycle. We consist of two divisions: Loan Processing and Quality Control/Policy Exception management. The position starts with learning the Loan Processing function. As potential Small Business customers apply through our website, the team attempts to qualify business owners for short term business loans based on their credit worthiness.  This is an excellent Entry Level position and great way to get your foot in the door within a FinTech environment at OnDeck! It's a dynamic and diverse team, consisting of members from the restaurant industry, financial services, sales and customer service backgrounds. You will be part of a newly expanded team where we think big, act boldly and strive for success in all measures. As a Loan Operations Analyst at OnDeck on the Loan Origination team, you will:Work with a queue of incoming small business loan applications to perform validation of small business existence and information through online search engines and other records.Assess missing components of the loan application package and prioritize follow up with the sales department.Structure Loan Applications in preparation for cash flow analysis and underwritingAssure compliance with all policies and procedures.Necessary qualifications for success:0-2 years of work experience in a fast paced and team based environment"Fast paced" or "high pressure" are not scary words for you, but are motivatorsMotivated when working towards KPI's, quotas or team goals & metricsStrong Work Ethic in a high-performance environmentConsistency in output, results and process, experience working with high volume tasksEffective Communication, both written and oralEffective Time management and experience balancing quality and efficiencyExperience following procedures, guidelines and policiesAbility to work a consistent 8 hour shift, Monday Friday.Nice-to-haves (not required):Financial Acumen a plusExperience working with Salesforce, workflow system, tracking system or CRM systemAbout OnDeck: As the largest online small business lender in the U.S. serving more than 700 different industries, we have been trusted by over 80,000 small businesses by providing them with a term loan or line of credit to help them build growing and thriving enterprises. Since 2007, we've issued over $10 billion in capital.  Join us as we enable small businesses to achieve their goals. At OnDeck, we're reinventing small business financing. We care intensely about each other, our company and the customers we serve, and are committed to making every day count. We are small enough to be nimble and strong enough to make a big impact.  OnDeck believes that each and every team member plays an important role in our company's success. That's why we strive to provide you and your family with a competitive and comprehensive benefit program with a variety of options and opportunities. We offer: Generous VacationComprehensive HealthcareEducational Reimbursement401k MatchingParental LeaveSports TeamsStocked KitchensLoan ConsolidationWe are going to ask you to talk about your accomplishments. Here are some of ours:WorldatWork, 2017 Seal of DistinctionFortune 50 Best Workplaces for Diversity, 2016Fortune 50 Best Small and Medium Companies to Work For, 2016Fortune 30 Best Workplaces in Finance and Insurance, 2016Built in Colorado, Top 100 Digital Companies in Colorado, 2015, 2016, 2017Crain's New York Business Fast 50, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017Fortune and Great Place to Work 100 Best Workplaces for Millennials, 2015Fortune/Great Place To Work Great Rated! People's Picks: 20 Great Workplaces in Financial Services, 2015Crain's New York Best Places to Work, 2013, 2014, 2015Colorado SHRM Best Companies to Work For in Colorado, 2015Forbes' America's Most Promising Companies, 2013, 2014Selling Power Magazine Best Company to Sell For, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018500|5000, 2013, 2014As part of our dedication to maintaining an inclusive and diverse workforce,OnDeck provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, OnDeck complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.OnDeck expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of OnDeck's employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.**No external recruiters or agents, please.**

Name: Business Analyst Level-1
Description: Job Summary:Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis.Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well.High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary.Graduate or Post Graduate from Tier 1 with 0-2 years of experienceIdeal candidate would have strong analytical skills, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis.Basic Requirement:Graduate degree in Computer Science. Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

Name: Business Analyst - Wealth Management Group
Description: What sets Bank of the West apart from other banks is our team members–they embody the optimistic spirit of the West. There is a spirit here that drives us to do more. Our team of more than 10,000 employees is vital to the success of our Bank. They reflect our modern western values—straightforward, entrepreneurial and optimistic. We seek to create a corporate culture that fosters and rewards excellence, encourages creative thinking and respects diversity – an environment where team members are engaged, supportive of one another and enthusiastic about serving our customers. Bank of the West offers the stability of a company that has a 135 year history and is part of BNP Paribas, a European leader in global banking and financial services and one of the 6 strongest banks in the world. We offer opportunities across our diverse business lines – Retail Banking, Commercial Banking, National Finance, and Wealth Management.  Job Description Summary  Responsible for documenting business, functional and data requirements for strategic initiatives and projects as identified by the business line. Collaborate with IT, Business and other Bank Partners to and ensure continuity and understanding of requirements. Provide guidance to IT team (Solutions Delivery, Dev, QA, UAT) on approved requirements through the development cycle. Acts as a liaison between the Business Partners and Technology team to articulate business requirements and understands technical requirements. Participate throughout project life cycle including requirements elicitation, performing user acceptance testing and supporting implementation activities.  Essential Job Functions  Responsible for relaying information to the Technology team in easily understood terms for both technology and business.  Liaise with the business, development team and technology on an ongoing basis. Responsible for effective communication to all business partners and users to ensure that critical strategic decisions are vetted and well thought out prior to implementation.  Evaluate data gathered from multiple servicing and other source systems reconcile differences, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to understand and distinguish optional user requests from what is required.  Conduct user acceptance testing as it relates to the technology solutions.  Work independently with users to define concepts under direction of project managers.  Advises and leads in the planning and implementation of projects and strategic initiatives for the business unit/department.  Drives business team members to define business needs through utilization of effective elicitation techniques.  Evaluates data gathered from multiple sources, reconciles differences, and ensures consistent approaches, data interpretation, and results measurements are employed.  Other Job Duties  Primary liaison with business partners, development team and technology. Acts as the "Subject Matter Expert" (SME) and provides business knowledge as needed.  Identifies, integrates, and manages required internal and external resources to provide business solutions for groups most complex business issues, while able to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously. Develops and implements detailed project plan.  Will form part of a project team and will be expected to interact with the team on a daily basis.  Will report to a manager in the business line.  Initiates the design and implementation of the operational and technical aspects of the project plans and develops and supports programming requests to meet project goals through discussion with project stakeholders.  Oversees test and project task development and implementation.  Evaluates and provides written and verbal updates on project status.  Performs other duties as assigned. QualificationsRequired Experience Requires advanced knowledge of job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience.  May have practical knowledge of project management.  Requires 5 years minimum prior relevant experience. Education Bachelors Degree- Finance or related field Skills Field of Experience – Job-specific knowledge requirements An ideal candidate will have: Strong SQL skills.  Some experience in retail and wholesale banking and a working knowledge of Banks loan products.  Very good understanding of software delivery lifecycle with focus on requirement management and business analysis.  Experience in process mapping / process flows / process modeling required.  Strong attention to detail and experience in representing complex issues based on comprehensive analysis in a holistic and understandable manner.  Prior experience working with large implementation projects.  Must have solid organizational skills, with the ability to handle complex projects in a multi-tasking environment and meet deadlines with quality results.  Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts..  Equal Employment Opportunity Policy  Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.  Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.

Name: SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST - Business Intelligence
Description: Under the supervision of theDirector of Application Development,theSenior Business Analyst will be an integrated member of Business Intelligenceandis responsible for supporting corporate projects by defining business requirements, translating requirements to technical specifications to the BI team, and delivery/UAT of projects. They will be an integral team member on all or parts of a project through all stages of the project life cycle, including requirement documentation, development, regression testing, QA/UAT, and project life. Work with the EDI Analyst to ensure Colorado Access complies with applicable state and federal requirements.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS& WORK DUTIESThe following essential functions of this position are performed personally, in cooperation with your supervisor, and/or in coordination with other staff. Additional work functions and duties may be assigned.Supports corporate projects by defining business requirements, providing project management oversight and aligning business and application system solutions with strategic plans. Analyzes and documents requirements through research, data gathering, and brainstorming activities. Designs and documents customer requirements by defining, creating, evaluating, and/or selecting alternatives.Responsible for accurate creation and timely delivery of Business Requirement DocumentationResponsible for accurate creation and timely delivery of Functional& Non-Functional Requirement DocumentationFacilitate UAT with Business OwnerWork directly with BI Analyst to ensure data accuracy for internal reporting purposesPerforms project management activities as assigned to promote quality, facilitate resource management and progress reporting, define and maintain project scope, meet schedules and deadlines, and coordinate intra-and interdepartmental activities. Manages all or parts of a project through all stages of the project life cycle, including requirement documentation, development, regression testing, QA/UAT, and project life.Provides application support for internal users as assigned. Troubleshoots problems and escalates as necessary. Provides configuration changes following change management procedures.Ensures all requirement documentation policies and procedures are followed. Reviews status reports and reports departmental operations, concerns and successes to the Director of Application Development.Ensures the successful implementation of developed manual and automated information systems by performance of the following activities: Business requirement documentation; Gap Analysis; Cost benefit solutioning (build/buy); Coordinate and/or conduct; regression testing; quality assurance testing; end-user training; develop and/or maintain; end-user training materials; end-user procedure manuals; on-line help documentation.Actively participates in and demonstrates support for all Colorado Access and department quality initiatives, which includes: Colorado Access system development methodology implementation and deployment; Standards and procedures definition and adherence; Quality management strategy definition and adherence; Rapid continuous improvement, transformation, and strategic plan implementation initiatives.Actively supports and implements the department communication strategy. Establishes and maintains mutually beneficial and productive relationships internally and with other Colorado Access departments. Informs others, as appropriate, of problems, issues, concerns, or developments that arise from department or business activities, or the use of technology.

Name: Sr Analyst, Business Assurance
Description: Sr Analyst, Business Assurance Denver, CO Requisition #: 187566Job Type: Full TimeLocation: Denver, COTeam: Finance and AccountingPub Date: 10/12/18Military Experience Welcome!Benefits for New Hires start Day 1.SummaryMaps metrics against the Company's operational plans and tactical/strategic goals to ensure alignment and focus. Develops and maintains standard reporting measures, quantitative explanation of relevant data, and ongoing analysis of alternatives and solutions. Monitors internal controls to ensure operations are conducted in accordance with established guidelines, policies, procedures, and governmental and legal requirements. Frequently collaborates and communicates with various functional areas to drive operational improvements into the business and minimize inherent risks.Responsibilities also include planning and conducting audits of internal controls covering a broader range of the Company's operations to determine if functional areas are conducting operations in accordance with established guidelines, policies, procedures, and governmental and legal requirements. Partners to ensure Regional process alignment with Division and Company standards. Responsible for assisting in the analysis and evaluation of the efficiency and effectiveness of Regional policies and operations. Name: Business Systems Analyst IV
Description: Description  This position will support system modernization project. The focus of a business analyst is to document, review and analyze an organization’s business, including its intentions, business services, processes, and information needs to assist the organization to implement changes that lead to an improved operating environment. The business analyst serves as a conduit in the development of technology and process improvement solutions between the business unit, stakeholders, and solution delivery teams. This position serves as a liaison with stakeholders to document a solid understanding of how the business is currently operating, future goals, and the steps required to achieve those goals. This understanding allows the business analyst to assist the organization in evaluating and defining existing and future business services, processes, organizational structure and other relevant information with the goal of identifying the best way to affect business change and achieve identified goals.  Operationally, the senior business analyst supports the project by working with leadership, management, stakeholders, Office of Information Technology co-workers, vendors, and other business analysts to ensure tools and technology support the information gathering process, gap analysis, and subsequent trace ms, and customer alignments.]  Ideally, candidates for this position will also have a background in complex software system testing - test plan creation, system integration test planning, UAT coordinationRequired Skills Required Experience Job Location  Denver, US-CO

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: As the Operations Analyst at Alto you will have a large impact on the company's growth and future success. You will be a key player enabling needed insights across our entire operations. You will specifically provide analysis related actions that will improving the experience of our patients and providers as well as improve the efficiency of our Care Team (Pharmacy and Customer Service). You will create queries and develop dashboards providing the needed insight for our operational performance. You will use statistical analysis to understand correlation and trends and provide recommendations for changes based on these insights. You will dig deep into the Care Team performance metrics and share recommendations that will help set department priorities on staffing ratios, improving KPIs and efficiency, and staffing forecasts. You are able to understand what data is necessary to assist with business needs and problems and what data isn't necessary. You are an ideal candidate if you have:Minimum of 3 to 5 years of statistics and data analyticsExceptional analytical skills and a passion for dataExcellent statistics background and the ability to explain analytical methodologies simply and thoroughlyProficient in Excel or other visualization toolsProficient in R, SQL, Python, Minitab or other data mining tool / statistical toolsExperience with business intelligence technologies and strong understanding of database architectureStrong oral and written communication skillsExperience performing forecasting and trend analysisA passion for Alto's mission and valuesIt is a plus if you have:BA/BS or equivalent work experienceData warehouse development skillsExperience handling and analyzing medical or pharmaceutical dataHealthcare experienceAlto Pharmacy is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Name: Project Manager/Business Analyst
Description: Project Manager/Business AnalystEnglewood, CO  Tech USA is currently looking for a Project Manager/Business Analyst for a contract position to be a part of an innovative and diverse team in Englewood, CO. We are looking for a talented, team oriented, quality minded, and motivated individual to join a group that utilizes cutting edge technologies and promotes a healthy work/life balance. Don’t miss this great opportunity and apply today!  POSITION SUMMARY:  This BA/PM position has primary responsibilities for gathering, managing and communicating requirements that will be used to deliver value clients. It also involves working closely with business sponsors, subject matter experts, stakeholders and other project managers. The BA/PM also has to perform PM duties such as facilitate activities, report on statuses and ensure sponsors stay informed with accurate timely information to make decisions  RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsible for thoroughly understanding and communicating stakeholder requirements to appropriate team members, and manage all requirements accordingly to realize each for the stakeholder Responsible for user stories (creation & grooming) Organize and facilitate project planning, daily stand up meetings, reviews, retrospectives, sprint and release planning, demos and other agile project related meetings. Ensure the development teams are practicing agile principles of collaboration, prioritization, team accountability, and visibility. Find and work to remove development and project roadblocks; motivate the development team; protects the team from outside distractions. Manage the team - Ensure that daily, sprint and release commitments are being upheld. Provide direction and support to project team Coordinate and facilitate delivery of project objectives Assess project issues and identify solutions to meet productivity, quality and customer goals. Responsible for requirement elicitation, requirement analysis (includes creating supporting documentation), requirement communication (verbal and written) and solution assessment Create business requirement documents, supporting diagrams and use cases Gather information from sponsors and subject matter experts and analyze the information to create streamlined solutions, recommendations and risk assessments Act as a liaison between business and IT to distinguish requests from needs and to move initiatives forward Assess project issues and identify solutions to meet productivity, quality and customer QUALIFICATIONS:4+ years of experience as a business analyst or system analystExperience managing projectsExcellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlinesStrong technical aptitude, analysis skills, and problem solving skillsAbility to truly thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environmentBachelor’s degree preferably with emphasis on Computer Science or related field; or equivalent, relevant work experienceExcellent presentation and communication skills with an ability to lead productive group meetingsCan identify and resolve problems in a timely mannerUnderstanding of software engineering and web development would be a plusHealthcare experience would also be a plusWorking scrum knowledge and experienceWorking experience with Microsoft’s Team Foundation Server would be a plusAbout Tech USA:Tech USA, is a comprehensive provider of staffing and workforce solutions throughout the Infrastructure and Information Technology Industries, including Education, Healthcare, Financial, Government, Engineering, and Cyber Security. We are actively seeking candidates for contract, contract-to-hire, project support, and permanent placement jobs throughout the nation. View our website to see a list of our current open positions; however, not all of our positions are listed so don’t forget to submit your resume and request a consultation with one of our Information Technology recruiting specialists to explore your opportunities further.At Tech USA we understand that next to your family, your career is one of the most important aspects to a happy and fulfilling life. This is why we take the time to truly understand and get to know our candidates, so we can then pair them with the right job, not just any job. As a result, Tech USA is known throughout the industry for quality, reliability, and the highest satisfaction from both our clients as well as the candidates that we represent. Contact a local Tech USA representative today and learn about the many opportunities we may have available for you. Tech USA is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Energy Analyst I
Description: Req ID: 49771 Areas of Interest: Commercial Banking, Energy BOK Financial (BOKF), Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top 25 U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in ten states – Oklahoma, Texas, Arkansas, Arizona, Colorado, Kansas/Missouri, New Mexico, Nebraska and Wisconsin. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .The Energy Analyst I is primarily responsible for assisting the senior Energy Analysts and Petroleum Engineers in the preparation and processing of data for oil and gas evaluations; working as directed to acquire new job skills in order to provide technical computer support, and maintenance of the engineering filing system including both paper and electronic files under the direction of senior analysts.PRINCIPLE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Creates data files and inputs data such as ownership interests, production forecasts, revenue streams, capital costs, operating expenses, product prices and applicable pricing differentials; into Petroleum Engineering software as directed. Accesses a variety of input data forms from various sources including program databases, spreadsheets, and online sources; inputs data into spreadsheets to track important statistics (e.g. NYMEX oil and gas prices).Responds to various requests for production and pricing updates of economic evaluations and assists in the preparation of 1-line economic summaries to be used by the bank's legal team in preparing mortgages.Works under the supervision of the Energy Analyst III and the Petroleum Engineers as directed to help provide timely technical analysis and evaluation to the energy lending staff.Builds both paper and electronic job files and is responsible for day-to-day maintenance of the engineering filing system. This includes the updating and filing of client data in paper files and in electronic files and databases; and the creation and maintenance of appropriate backup copies for data security.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES:Working knowledge of Oil and Gas industryExcellent verbal and written communications skillsComprehensive PC skills, including Excel and WordAbility and willingness to learn oil and gas reserve evaluation software, for example ARIES or PHD. The applicant would be expected to successfully complete software training classes and to further develop their knowledge of the software through self-studyAbility to attain proficiency with commercial industry databases such as IHS; and to develop competence in acquiring data from state regulatory bodies such as the Texas Railroad Commission or the Oklahoma Corporation CommissionMust be able to take direction and work with minimal direct supervisionThis level of knowledge is normally demonstrated by the completion of an Associates Degree combined with 1+ years in the energy industry or 3+ years related experience. Preference would be a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Earth Sciences or related subject.BOK Financial is a stable and financially strong organization that provides excellent training and development to support building the long term careers of our employees. With passion, skill and partnership you can make an impact on the success of the bank, our customers and your own career!Apply today and take the first step towards your next career opportunity!BOK Financial is an equal opportunity employer. Ultimately, this position will be responsible for establishing solid data requirements for the Florida market. This position will report to the Manager, Enterprise Information Management. alternatives.Work closely with end-users during User Acceptance Testing (UAT), and document issues and defects.Provide timely, comprehensive verbal and written status reports.Partner with IT and Business teams to capture, track, and resolve data and reporting issues.Use, protect, and disclose client patients' protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards.Minimum Qualifications:4+ years of Data Analyst experience.2+ years working knowledge in a Data Warehouse/BI environment, ETL tool skills a strong plus.2+ years working knowledge of Healthcare Medical group business areas (clinical, operations, care management).Strong SQL skills and full understanding of querying relational databases.Experience with data quality and profiling tools.Full understanding of the CMS capitation model and the required datasets that support it.Experience documenting detailed requirements, design documents, and Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSUMMARY A brief description summarizing the overall purpose and objectives of the position and the results the worker is expected to accomplish.  This position provides tactical, entry level support to the rest of the FP&A team, responsible for pulling and gathering data, checking numbers to verify accuracy, and creating first drafts of presentations and reports. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS The tasks, duties, and responsibilities of the position that are most important to get the job done.  Support the Sr. Budget & Forecast Analyst as they conduct the budgeting and forecasting process;Assist in the development of budgets and forecast estimates for expenditures and revenues;Provide monitoring of department progress on budgets and forecasts;Support the Sr. Financial Analyst as they conduct regular and ad hoc analysis;Pull production and financial data as needed to feed into analysis;Check numbers in presentations and reports to verify accuracy;Initial preparation of data population of budget to actual analytic reports;Create first drafts of financial presentations and reports to be reviewed and updated by the Sr. Financial Analyst, such as the Production and G&A presentations and similar G&A reports;Investigate data for some accounts, pulling together data and analyzing as needed;In partnership with the Sr. Financial Analyst, collaborate with the business, especially department heads and asset teams, to gather and understand budget and forecast data;In partnership with the Sr. Financial Analyst, collaborate with Internal Reporting to provide budgeting and forecasting data for key reports and presentations;In partnership with the Sr. Budget & Forecasting Analyst, collaborate with department heads and Human Resources to create G&A budget and update forecasts;Provide ongoing analysis, investigation, and support to the FP&A team, including completing other responsibilities as assigned. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTES The specific minimum competencies required for job performance.  Strong analytical and documentation skills;Ability to probe for answers and solve problems;Ability to manage and maintain confidentiality of sensitive budget information in a professional manner;Ability to be flexible, multi-task, and prioritize work within the time constraints of a deadline focused function;Willingness to own their work and seek coaching where needed;Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint;Intermediate knowledge of accounting systems and tools (SAP preferred, Enersight preferred). SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES The scope of the person's authority, including a list of jobs that report to the incumbent.  There are no supervisory responsibilities associated with this position. WORKING CONDITIONS The environment in which the job is performed, especially any unique conditions outside a normal office environment.  Consistent of that with a normal work environment. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS The minimum level of education, experience, and certifications required to perform the job.  Bachelor's degree in a related field required;0-3 years of relevant experience, preferably in Oil and Gas;Basic knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).SDL2017

Name: Functional Analyst (e-business)
Description: Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works behind the scenes to support operational excellence. Our functional services teams (FSTs) provide services to 22,000 employees in over 400 locations worldwide. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger. Explore opportunities in Corporate Development; Financial Services; Human Resources; Health, Safety, Security &, Environment; Information Technology Services; Marketing, Communications & Public Relations; Operations Support; Practice Services; Procurement & Real Estate; Programs & Business Solutions; and Risk Management. Your Opportunity: We are actively looking for a Functional Analyst. Using a combination of business domain and functional system knowledge rooted in a disciplined approach, the Functional Analyst creates system solutions to for improvements for the business and/or to implement development initiatives and resolves Tier 2 incidents/problems as required. To accomplish this, the Functional Analyst maintains an in-depth understanding of the functional configuration and system flows; and works collaboratively with Service Delivery Analysts, Technical Analysts, and Business Analysts to develop functional solutions. Your Duties:Maintain an in-depth understanding of the functional configuration and system flows that underpin an application to deliver functionality to the business.Keep abreast of configuration options and best practices with out-of-the-box functionality.Resolve functional problems effectively and efficiently working with internal technical teams, and external vendors to identify work around, root cause and fix.Log SRs with vendors and coordinate diagnostics, requested actions and testing with technical teams.Execute SQL database queries to assist in data analysis.Proactively identify and consult on functional capabilities to improve service delivery processes.Analyze requirements documents and participate in requirements discussions with business stakeholder to develop and recommend functional designs.Research and develop proof-of-concepts to determine optimal functional designs.Document functional designs & configurations using Microsoft Office tools such as:VisioWordExcelPowerPointCollaborate with end users and/or Business analysts to flesh out requirements and plan/design solutions.Assess impacts of functional changes to the system, including upstream and downstream system flows; and develop appropriate unit test plans to mitigate risk of changes negatively impacting the business.Execute formal testing by participating in testing activities such as test case creation, execution and issue resolution.Work collaboratively with technical analysts to design and develop solutions requiring technical configurations and extensions.Adhere to Stantec's Solution Delivery Framework, Incident Management, and Change Management procedures.Lead or assist with day-to-day service delivery issues and processes as required.Skills:Strong verbal and written communication skills with a professional demeanor.Strong interpersonal, organizational, time management, problem solving, and analytical skills.Strong understanding of data model and system flows for one or more application domains.Strong system troubleshooting skills.Formal training and/or accreditation in accounting/financial management, human resources or other relevant discipline.Good presentation and facilitation skills.Demonstrated proficiency with the following:Microsoft Office tools such as Visio, Word, Excel and PowerPointUnderstanding internal system flows for a particular application domainQA testing tools such as HP Quality CenterQualifications & Experience:Completion of a post-secondary Business, Finance, or Information Technology related program or comparable education.Experience with system development and testing methodologies and tools.Project management and/or project lead experience.Experience with ITIL (IT Infrastructure Library).Hands on experience with Oracle E-Business Suite in one or more of the following modules:ProjectsFinancialsHRMS This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.  Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other's talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best. Name: Data Analyst - ( Business Development )
Description: Position Summary:This role will manage business development and clinical data analysis and quality initiatives across the organization to create a culture of clinical excellence and performance improvement. This position acts as an internal consultant for all levels of the organization with skills in facilitation, change management, and quality improvement. This role manages day-to-day activities of data analysis and development of intelligence reports to support Rose Medical Center’s growth and other strategic initiatives. Enables sound decision-making through accurate data reporting and incisive analysis of the data.Develop and maintain business development reports and intelligence sources, including volume reports and market share data.Oversee all clinical data registries and clinical performance databases, both internal and external. Oversees and manages all clinical data analytics including relevant HCA and local systems Provides supervision or through matrix reporting of all staff performing abstraction or data entry for clinical data registries, publically reported databases or similar processes. Monitor division and corporate clinical excellence and performance improvement initiatives and programs including analyzing corporate and division dashboards Routinely and at a minimum of annually, participates in the review and update of the Quality Assurance and Performance Improvement Plan by conducting evaluations. Assures that practices are evidenced-based and consistent with regulatory guidelines to include core measures. Provides ongoing Orientation, Education and Training pertinent to quality assurance and performance improvement based on customers’ needs assessments. Monitors key performance indicators and performance improvement including the use of control charts, statistical analysis and gap detection Executes position responsibilities that demonstrate leadership, experience, and creative approaches to management of developmental needs that contribute to the enhancement of patient care. Regularly communicates PI and quality/safety activities to leadership and QM staff. Utilize conceptual and diagnostic skills to prioritize and manage projects in an effective manner Facilitate teamwork and communications to assure optimal outcomes in the provision of quality improvement services to the organization Facilitates understanding and implementation of systems for quality improvement purposes Position Requirements: Licensure/Certification/Registration: NoneEducation: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience requiredExperience:Three to five years of project and data management preferredThree to five years of clinical experience preferredDemonstrated skills in multi-tasking, problem resolution, planning and expediting work flowDemonstrated experience in the application of quality improvement methods, including PDSA, LEAN, Six Sigma, Control Charts, data collection, analysis and reports Highly developed problem solving skills, ability to manage programs and projects Excellence in interpersonal and written communication skills Ability to assess and analyze data Knowledge of National Patient Safety Goals, requirements and implementation expectations Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Organization – proactively prioritizes work with minimal direction, and effectively manages resources to meet objectives and deadlines Communication – communicates clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing. Communicates effectively with a variety of constituents. Customer orientation – establishes and maintains customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectations.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Ascend Learning; LLC (www.ascendlearning.com) is a leading provider of technology-based educational, curriculum and assessment solutions for high-growth careers in a range of industries, including healthcare, fitness and wellness, and insurance and financial services. We provide outcomes-based solutions aimed at helping people enter, sustain and succeed in their chosen fields. Ascend employs more than 1,000 employees, with headquarters in Burlington, Mass., and offices in Kansas City metro, Phoenix metro, Minneapolis-St. Paul, Walnut Creek, California, Ann Arbor, Michigan, and the U.K. Ascend Learning is looking to add a Business Systems Analyst to our team in Leawood, KS. As a Business Systems Analyst you will work under general supervision from senior team members, while developing professional expertise in analyzing business requirements and crafting functional and design specifications for all the aspects of a software solution in order to meet the requirements and overall quality of the intended solution. Business Systems Analysts also work with product owners and developers on the design, testing, and implementation of new software and defect corrections and enhancements to existing software.ResponsibilitiesCreate functional specifications documents and other design artifacts to ensure a systematic approach to the development of a new product or service.Participate in all relevant agile ceremonies for each project iteration including story tasking, task estimating, and story ownership.Translate business requirements or high-level user stories into detailed user stories and technical issues that can be interpreted by the agile development team.Conduct analysis that identifies the current state of business processes and system inadequacies.Work closely with other Business Systems Analysts, Scrum Masters, Quality Assurance Engineers, Product Owners, and other cross-functional resources to define, develop, and refine project deliverables.Deliver recommendations for process and system improvements that assist the business in achieving its goals and objectives, leveraging best practices and professional experience.Work with team members to proactively identify, communicate and resolve issues and risks that impede the execution and success of the project.Collaborate with business stakeholders, agile team members and project managers to ensure timely delivery of project deliverables.The Business Systems Analyst leverages their deep knowledge of the platform to translate high level requirements into multiple user stories in order to deliver the intended functionality in a way that is consistent with the broader platform architecture and capabilities.Education and ExperienceBachelor’s degree in CIS, MIS, CS or equivalent experienceTwo to five years of work experience in platform managementExperience writing SQL queriesTwo to five years’ work experience building requirements and design artifacts for data related systemsExperience with ETL and reporting systems preferredPrevious experience with business intelligence and machine learning based products preferredExperience with the Agile methodologies; SCRUM and Kanban is preferred Skills and AbilitiesAbility to multi-task by working on multiple assignments and projectsStrong analytic skills and attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication skills with all levels of users including product owners, developers, offshore groups, and managementPassionate about quality and takes pride in work deliverables and outcomesAbility to participate in iteration planning discussions, provide estimations on tasks for stories, and be willing to stick to commitments made in each iterationCapable of leveraging a deep functional knowledge of the solution/platform to clearly articulate via stories in JIRA what the desired end state of a feature is to software engineerCustomer-focused mindsetSolid working knowledge of agile software development

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Company Description CapTech is an award-winning national management technology-consulting firm with an enterprising, entrepreneurial environment. We have achieved four straight years ranked in the Top 10 of Consulting Magazine's Best Firms to Work For, including a #5 ranking overall in 2015. Additionally, we placed 28th within the Vault Consulting 50 for the second year in a row, including a #5 ranking in work/life balance.  At CapTech you'll experience a flat organizational structure with access to constant learning -- where your career path isn't set in stone, and you have unlimited potential for growth. CapTech is based upon a culture of mutual respect. We look for, and hire the best. The creatively innovative, the technically insightful, the driven, the self-managed, the value conscious, the caring, and the gracious person these are all qualities that we look for along with a love and a passion for the work that we do. Job Description Business Analysts (BA) at CapTech work side-by-side with key business and technical stakeholders to elicit solution requirements, drive the solution design, and ensure the finished product meets the needs of the business. Our BAs work on a variety of projects from mobile and content management systems, to large integration efforts spanning multiple lines of business. CapTech BAs are called upon to provide leadership through experience and help shape the strategy of our clients.  Specific responsibilities for the Business Analyst position include: Quickly become familiar with client business challenges and technologies in order to act as a SME and trusted advisor to client stakeholders.Act as key player in a team environment through all phases of the system delivery lifecycle.Provide connection between technical and business views to ensure that high quality and impactful solutions are delivered for our clients.Perform gap analysis to identify capability gaps within the organization, and propose and evaluate alternative solutions that will fulfill the business needs.Work with client stakeholders to understand high level business needs and elicit detailed requirements using various methods.Qualifications Specific qualifications for the Business Analyst position include: Demonstrated progression and growth as a Business Systems Analyst through past career experiences with a minimum of 3 years of experience on IT-related projects.Familiarity with multi-system integration and common issues that can arise when integrating enterprise technologies.Excellent written and verbal communication skills leveraged to interface with senior business leadership and technical resources.Ability to write and perform basic SQL queries preferred.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite as well as change control and defect tracking software.Prior consulting experience preferred.Additional Information We offer challenging and impactful jobs with professional career paths. All CapTechers can keep their hands on technology no matter what position they hold. Our employees find their work exciting and rewarding in a culture filled with opportunities to have fun along the way.  At CapTech we offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to: Competitive salary with performance based bonus opportunitiesSingle and Family Health Insurance plans, including Dental coverageShort-Term and Long-Term disabilityMatching 401(k)Competitive Paid Time OffTraining and Certification opportunities eligible for expense reimbursementTeam building and social activitiesMentor program to help you develop your career At this time, CapTech cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.  Candidates must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly (we are not open to contract or "corp to corp" agreements).  CapTech is an equal opportunity employer.  CapTech is a Drug-Free work place.  Candidates must have the ability to work at CapTech's client locations.  All positions include the possibility of travel.  CapTech has not contracted/does not contract with any outside vendors in its recruitment process. If you are interested in this position, please apply to CapTech directly.  I'm interestedI'm interested  Refer a friendSDL2017

Name: EHS Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionAbout DCP Midstream:DCP Midstream is the largest processor of natural gas and natural gas liquids producer ensuring the country has clean energy to warm homes, manufacture goods, and produce consumer products. We are a “must-run” company and we are committed to greater in everything we do—from operating efficiently, reliably and safely to being a responsible community partner. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, DCP Midstream operates assets in 17 states. Day-To-Day:This role serves as an experienced lead of Environment Health and Safety (EH&S) and IT related projects and activities; serves as the lead for small to medium activities who understands company goals and objectives. Enables collaboration with cross-functional teams. Translates strategies into roadmaps and requirements ensuring resolution with the utmost effectiveness and efficiency. Responsible for the research and development of business cases, designs, configurations, implementation plans and overall management of project related activities. Maintains budgets, negotiate contracts, work closely with 3rd parties, vendors and other critical personnel. Strong communication and analytical skills are required as part of this agile team. Provides support to team members as needed. What You Will Be Responsible For:Serves as PM / Lead for small to medium IT and EH&S related project activity ensuring the design and architected solutions meet requirements, guides the development of test cases and scripts, manages project costs and resources to ensure objectives and KPI’s are metProvides strong technical and functional business supportServes as a lead member of the team who builds knowledge, cross trains, influences and guides othersCollaborates and facilitates cross functional teams to resolve business requirements and ensures design solutions are cost effective, efficient and forward thinkingMay drive Governance meetings, develop ROI and business cases, cost or valuation estimatesUnderstands and is accountable for contractual obligations, SOW and Change Order (CO), etc.Anticipates opportunities and can articulate recommendations and suggestions to business and ITMaintains good relationships and broad general knowledge across multiple business and IT functionsMentor, guide and advise less-experienced personnelMay need to juggle multiple projects at once with little to no supervisionQUALIFICATIONSMust have a minimum of 5 years’ experience (preferably 7-12 years) in similar roles managing or supporting IT and/or EH&S related work (e.g. Title V reporting, environmental permit process, air emissions)Must have a Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent Training / ExperienceMust have a broad, technical IT background with strong analytical skills and business acumenMust have excellent communication and collaboration skills, strong influencer, able to create messages and communication materials for multiple levels; OCM experience a plusExperience with EH&S software systems such as EnablonProject management experience and PMP certifications, a plusExperience with measurement software systems such as Flowcal, a plus It has been and will continue to be the policy of DCP Midstream not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of their race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.
