Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Robert Half Technology is seeking a dynamic and success-driven Senior Business Analyst for an exciting position with a rapidly expanding organization in the South Denver Area. In this role, you will have the opportunity to have a major impact as their organization transitions over to a fully agile environment as well as oversee digital transformation projects. Our client is at the cutting edge of technology with one of the largest and fastest growing government IT groups in Colorado. If you are passionate about working with stakeholders to identify key needs and translating them to technical requirements, then this may be an ideal position for you! As a Sr. Business Analyst, you will play a key role in planning, designing, and launching new business and operational systems. The ideal candidate should have 5+ years of BA experience and demonstrate leadership attributes to be a positive influence on the team around them. This is a full time, direct hire opportunity. Any experience with change management or transitioning from Waterfall to Agile is a definite plus for this role. If you meet most or all of these requirements, then lets have a conversation! For direct consideration, please send your resume to ian.maxwell@rht.com. Apply for this Sr. BA position today! What you will do every day: * Meet and collaborate with decision makers and end users to define business and operational requirements * Identify and resolve a variety of systems issues * Review and analyze effectiveness of current systems and develop strategies to improve system utilization and processes * Lead requirement gathering sessions to clarify business requirements, processes, and recommendations to identify effective solutions * Conduct research on products to support new software and hardware deployment * Prepare effective recommendations and alternatives to address and improve identified trouble areas * Plan, design, develop, and deploy new applications and enhancements to existing products * Build, develop and nurture business relationships across departments * Coordinate and perform in-depth testing as well as end user review Job Requirements The preferred candidate will have all or most of the following requirements: * Expertise in developing business requirements and specifications * 5+ years experience as a Business Analyst * Strong understanding of the interaction between legacy and web-based products * Understanding of application programming alongside client/server architecture * 3+ years of experience in Agile environments * Strong communication skills, both written and verbal with ability to communicate ideas to non-technical users * Product experience is a nice-to-have * Demonstrated experience having seen an entire project through from beginning to completion - provided by DiceAgile, Analyst, Architecture, Business Analyst, Business Requirements, Change Management, Hardware, Management, Programming, Project, Research, Testing

Name: Business Analyst, Data Modeler
Description: Location: Denver, CO --  Denver Federal Center, 6th Avenue & Kipling, Lakewood, CO 80225 Job Description ASRC Federal Vistronix is actively seeking a Business Analyst and Data Modeler to join our team and support analysis efforts for a government client in Denver, Colorado.  ASRC Federal Vistronix is a technical, professional services company providing state-of-the-art solutions to government and commercial clients. Our services include custom-engineered solutions that integrate with the latest technology, resulting in advanced information technology systems; business and management consulting services to assess client needs and reengineer processes; and strategic and tactical program expertise to support continuity and provide comprehensive oversight for mission-critical initiatives.  We partner with government and commercial agencies that require development of systems, such as communication systems, asset management, network deployment and engineering services, power and energy management solutions, portal applications, command and control, and geospatial information systems (GIS) to operate more efficiently and profitably.  We are always looking for exceptionally bright and motivated people to join our team. We are thought leaders in our market space - providing comprehensive solutions to our clients, throughout the enterprise. If you are looking for an opportunity to use your skills in an environment that promotes free thinking, presents positive challenges, and makes real impact - Vistronix is the place for you. RESPONSIBILTIES: The successful candidate will work with business sponsors and other relevant stakeholders to define and document the data requirements for complex government software systems using Agile software development processes. In addition, this position will develop conceptual and logical data models that meet business needs and support agency and bureau data standards. The ability to work with both technical and non-technical audiences is very important, so having a solid understanding of the software development process is key. Principal responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Creating data models that promote streamlined data entry and enhanced data quality standards,Leveraging existing data reporting tools and standards,Documenting legacy data systems via reverse-engineering using tools like Erwin,Supporting the effort to establish a data framework that can be used as a template for enterprise data. Perform Alternatives Analysis to determine optimal data framework approach.Assisting in crosswalk development and use of Informatica.Analyzing business processes for new and revised business applications,Eliciting information and functional requirements from product owners and business sponsors through oral and written communication,Supporting requirement management process, as needed,Developing Agile user stories and workflow diagrams to support the elicitation process,Assisting with product backlog grooming process,Defining test plans and test cases and supporting testing for Scrum development teams,Providing Alternatives Analysis for new Collecting and documenting preliminary data requirements,Assisting in design of technical specifications for complex, integrated government systems which include numerous feeders crossing agency boundaries,Working with other analysts to support a holistic approach to business analysis applicable to portfolio-level development efforts.REQUIREMENTS:Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree -- Computer Science or Technical/Engineering degree preferredAt least 6 years of experience supporting software/hardware development efforts as a business analyst, software tester, or similar roleAt least 8 years of relevant work experience in lieu of a specific degree would be acceptable, especially if the experience is multi-functional (i.e., operations and development)Required Skills and Competencies:Demonstrated proficiency in SQL Server 2012 (or higher).At least 2-years' experience with Oracle Enterprise Edition 11g (or higher).A working knowledge of other database platforms (Informix and MySQL preferred).Experience perform extraction, transformation, and load (ETL) activities (use of Informatica preferred)Strong technical writing skills, with the ability to concisely describe business requirements and functional requirements.Experience creating conceptual and logical data models as part of the requirements definition process (experience using Erwin data modeling software highly desired).Ability to use a variety of software tools for managing requirements, creating diagrams and written documents to communicate with a variety of stakeholders; both technical and non-technical.Examples of BA tools include Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPointUnderstanding of user interfaces and most common approaches found in GUIsPresentation of requirements findings and mockups for review with sponsors and end usersAbility to understand formulas used in financial calculations and to describe relevant workflowsDesired Skills:Experience documenting business requirements. Examples of documentation include business requirement specifications (BSR), work flow diagrams, context diagrams, use cases, and user stories.Solid understanding of Agile development methodologies. Experience supporting Scrum development highly desired.Recent experience supporting live production databasesKnowledge of SQL Server Analysis/Integration/Reporting ServicesExperience with database performance monitoring, tuning, and error resolutionExperience supporting spatial databases (Esri ArcSDE preferred)Recent database certifications desiredExperience working in an ITIL environment (ITIL v3 certification highly desired)Business Process analysis skillsExperience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) concepts The successful candidate is subject to a U.S. Federal Government background investigation and must be able to meet the requirements to hold a position of public trust or higher. ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard torace, gender, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, religion, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor prohibited by applicable law.

Name: Lead MDM Business Systems Analyst
Description: OverviewAt Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.  We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.  Perficient currently has a career opportunity for an Lead MDM Business Systems Analyst in our Denver, Colorado office. Job Overview: As a Lead MDM Business Systems Analyst, you will work with stakeholders to define functional and technical requirements for Master Data Management solutions using industry leading MDM packages and custom developed systems.ResponsibilitiesWrite data and systems requirements following an Agile / Scrum methodologyResponsible for writing business user stories /requirements, data profiling, data analysis in support of scrum development teamsDefine Source-to-target data mapping documentationDefine requirements for Match/Merge & Golden records, including the definition of trust levels for multiple data sourcesIdentify and define Reference Data QualificationsStrong written and verbal communicationsExperience working on data integration and MDM projectsAbility to analyze and interpret dataStrong data analytics skills – including using SQL to profile / query data to discern requirementsAbility to work collaboratively in a team setting with Perficient and client teammatesExperience with two MDM implementations using enterprise level MDM products (e.g. Informatica, Talend, Pitney Bowes Spectrum, etc)Experience defining testable acceptance criteria and collaborating with test teamPreferred skills and education:Experience defining requirements using data integration and analytics as an enabler for broader Digital TransformationBachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, MIS, or related field Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About Perficient Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.  Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index. Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Disclaimer: The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time.

Name: Senior Business Solutions Analyst
Description: GENERAL NATURE OF JOB: We're widely known for our Dual Bottom Line culture where we seek to enable the full release of human possibility and individual development while achieving strong financial returns. We invest in our employees and provide opportunities for them to make a difference while building a culture that reflects our core values of safety, excellence and respect. We are looking for a passionate and innovative Business Solutions Analyst.  Under the direction of the IT Global Business Solutions Mgr, this position is responsible for interacting with the application development and support services within a mixed architecture (client/server and web-based) for One Global Garlock. This includes and is not limited to Oracle 11i eBusiness Suite. Duties include analysis and problem solving of complex application problems to meet the needs of users. This position will require direct interaction with end-users, business leaders, vendors and will act as a strategic partner to the management teams. Support, maintain and administer policies and procedures for ensuring security and integrity of the company's critical business applications. The ideal candidate for this position is detail-oriented and highly innovative. Name: Geospatial Project Manager / Business Analyst
Description: Map out your career at WSB, recognized as a top workplace for the sixth consecutive year and the Zweig Group Hot Firm List for the fifth consecutive year.  WSB s GIS Group has been taking on increasingly complex and innovative GIS projects. We have an immediate need for a Geospatial Project Manager/Business Analyst to bring creative and technical solutions to our clients. This position can be located in any WSB office. A Small-Scale View of Your Role: As a Geospatial Project Manager/Business Analyst, you will work closely with internal and external clients to create GIS solutions. The Project Manager/Business Analyst will:  Work with clients to define, understand, and analyze business requirements and develop functional/technical specifications  Work with the development team to design and deliver GIS solutions using the entire ArcGIS platform  Build GIS solutions using the ArcGIS platform  Manage a variety of projects including agile development projects  You will also work with end users, create mapping products, and perform complex GIS analyses using the ArcGIS Platform. While project oriented, you will be required to understand WSB s core business and be able to see how GIS fits into our Information and Technology strategy. Your Attributes: A Bachelor's or Master s degree in GIS, Computer Science, or Geography and three years of applicable experience is required. Our preferred candidate will have at least seven years of applicable experience. Additional requirements include a thorough working knowledge of the ArcGIS platform, strong analytical and quantitative skills, the ability to effectively communicate with both business and technology experts, and knowledge of the software development life cycle. Excellent technical skills in SQL, MS Excel, JIRA, MS Project, SharePoint, Visio, and MS Project, Smartsheet, or Primavera P6 are also required. A valid driver's license and a clean driving record are required as well as strong project management skills, collaboration and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.  Expertise in AutoCAD Civil 3D, Asset Management Systems, SAP, GPS, and drone technology is preferred. Who We Are: WSB is a professional consulting and design firm with offices in Minnesota, North Dakota, Texas, and Colorado. WSB has over 400 staff members who provide diverse engineering, planning, environmental, and construction services to clients in the government, energy, and commercial markets. Our services also include GIS, landscape architecture, right of way, and surveying.

Name: High Risk Analyst
Description: High Risk AnalystAt Computershare we invite you to share our vision and commitment to excellence in everything that we do. Our 16,000 people around the globe are entrepreneurial and innovative and serve our clients and customers with precision and reliability because they count on us to deliver, every time.We are a global market leader in transfer agency and share registration, employee equity plans, mortgage servicing, proxy solicitation and stakeholder communications. We also specialize in corporate trust, bankruptcy, class action and utility administration, and a range of other diversified financial and governance services.Founded in 1978, Computershare is renowned for our expertise in high integrity data management, high volume transaction processing and reconciliations, payments and stakeholder engagement. We are proud to say that many of the world’s leading organizations partner with us to streamline and maximize the value of relationships with their investors, employees, creditors and customers.At Computershare we see diversity as a source of strength. The more perspectives we have, the better equipped we’ll be to meet the demands of our diverse global customer base. We want every person who joins out team, every customer and every supplier to feel welcome. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and believe in equality for everyone, regardless of age, national or ethnic origin, sex, gender identity or expression, race, color, religion, disability, sexual orientation, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected be applicable law. That applies throughout our company, around the world with no exceptions, regardless of differences. We will hire, develop, reward, promote and retain people purely on the basis of their talents, commitment, potential and the results they achieve. We will work hard to make sure everyone is included within our organization, removing barriers and obstacles to give everyone an equal opportunity to succeed.Computershare is committed to providing accommodations for candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment and employment process. If you need any assistance, please let us know and we are happy to help.Interested in joining our leading brand? Keep reading below about this position and then click “Apply” to tell us about yourself!Job SummaryProvide support for a team of High Risk Analysts who monitor contested legal matters, exception timeline reporting for foreclosures, bankruptcies, REO, new pleadings, issues and holds from company vendors, and coordinate with outside counsel. Assist with keeping various department work queues current.Position Responsibilities & Essential FunctionsAssist High Risk Analysts with tasks needed to effectively manage loans which have been deemed to be high risk, complex default contested or adversarial cases.Responsibilities include document collection, review and electronic storage, research, analysis and other items as needed.Assist with data base tasks including setting up items in hold and issues queues and clearing items from exception reports.Work certain assigned queues including bankruptcy, RESPA and title issues.Regular, consistent, and predictable attendance is an essential function of this job.Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.QualificationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.SkillsIntermediate skills in Microsoft Office, with a focus on Excel and Word.Strong problem solving ability, data collection, analysis, and presentation experience.Ability to gather and analyze information and develop alternative solutions.Strong communication skills.Consistently demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.Education and ExperienceTraining as a paralegal preferred.1 years of mortgage servicing or high risk experience preferred with an emphasis on default administration, foreclosure, bankruptcy, and/or REO.Other financial services experience of an analytical nature or operations management experience may be applicable.High School Diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience preferred.Language AbilityAbility to read/comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos; write simple correspondence; effectively present information in one-on-one/small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organizationMathematical AbilityAbility to add and subtract two digit numbers and to multiply and divide with 10's and 100's. Ability to perform these operations using units of American money and weight measurement, volume, and distance.Work EnvironmentThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.The noise level in the environment is moderate.Physical RequirementsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Frequently required to use hands and fingers to type and handle. Occasional reaching with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required include close vision and ability to adjust focus.Computershare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.This job specification should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions and perform any other related duties as may be required by business needs and communicated by their supervisor.

Name: Analyst, Business Technical II
Description: Frontier Airlines is committed to offering‘Low Fares Done Right’ to more than 80 destinations in the United States, Canada, Dominican Republic and Mexico on more than 300 daily flights. Headquartered in Denver, Frontier’s hard-working aviation professionals pride themselves in delivering the company’s signature Rocky Mountain hospitality to customers. Frontier Airlines is the proud recipient of the Federal Aviation Administration’s 2016 Diamond Award for maintenance excellence and was recently named the industry’s most fuel-efficient airline by The International Council on Clean Transportation (ICCT) as a result of superior technology and operational efficiencies.  The Technical Business Analyst II works proactively with business units, technology partners and development teams to create and maintain technical solutions for commercial, operational control, and back office functions. The Analyst may also need to provide project management for solutions with limited scope. Documents and reports project status to directors and managers. The Analyst will document business processes and technical requirements using analytical skills to help develop best practices as well as designing future improvements to systems. The Analyst can train and assist Support Services and users on solution as well as existing and new technologies. Essential Functions:Acts as a subject matter expert (SME) by learning the business user functions, organization and role in the enterprise as well as industry best practices.Analyze, identify, and document through either Change Requests or New Project forms specifications for solution development and/or software enhancement.Assist with documentation for testing, implementation and support for business solution, application and/or software enhancement.Coordinate the corresponding system software changes with Configuration Management.Performs necessary investigation, analysis and evaluation to determine project feasibility.Utilizes business process and data analytics to assist organization in achieving goals of reducing costs, improving efficiencies and increasing revenues.Work with the assigned department on business integrations.Process new software releases and/or patches and documentation for Configuration Management, Infrastructure and Support Services.Perform regular application, systems and data administration tasks, monitor results and resolve discrepancies in applications program.Train or assist training staff as needed.Other duties dependent on department needs.Job Requirements:Bachelors’ degree in business analysis, information systems, business administration or a related major; or equivalent technical business analyst experienceMinimum 3 years of related experience in addition to a college degree will be a plusKnowledge of and experience with (at least 2 years) enterprise application integration requirement including transactional databases and field mappingKnowledge, Skills and Abilities:Motivated self-starter, with good overall documentation and communication skills,Proficiency in Microsoft productivity tools such as Visio, Project and ExcelPossess strong technical skills to be able to coordinate with all areas of technology and the technical business units.Experience and/or interest in developing requirements or user stories for new application implementations, SDLC projects and business process improvementFamiliarity with both waterfall and Agile project management methodologiesGood knowledge of requirements gathering, diagraming and process documentationRequires focus on timelines and deliverables; willing to occasionally work over 40 hours a week or on weekends and eveningsAbility to learn new technologies quickly and share that knowledge with other team membersAbility to support IT objectives within the business environmentAbility to analyze and explain business processes and provide guidance in selecting technological solutionsAbility to work in a highly collaborative and fast paced team environmentDisclaimer: The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature and level of work required of the referenced position; they are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of individuals in this position. Please be advised that duties and expectations of this position may be subject to change. Frontier Airlines, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and, as such, is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability status, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including: recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  Frontier Airlines is a Zero Tolerance Drug-Free Workplace. All prospective employees are subject to pre-employment testing for the following drugs and their metabolites: Marijuana, Cocaine, Amphetamines, Opioids and Phencyclidine (PCP). Further, any applicant who is found to have tested positive on any required drug or alcohol test at a former employer will be considered ineligible for employment with Frontier.

Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Position: Senior Data/Business Analyst  Position Overview: Credere Group is looking to add a Senior Data/Business Analyst to our delivery team in Denver, Colorado. As a Senior Data/Business Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying data gaps/issues within a global asset management organization. Description: Responsible for performing Data/Business Analysis to identify data gaps/issues across the investment lifecycle.  Responsible for analyzing data to identify and interpret patterns or trends in data sets.  Perform data audits to identify problem areas and implement strategies to optimize data integrity and process improvements. Requirement Skills & Knowledge: Bachelors Degree  8+ years of Data/Business Analysis experience within the Financial Services Industry.  Strong investments product knowledge and trading/brokerage platform experience.  Strong quantitative and analytical skills. Must be very comfortable pulling and analyzing data from multiple systems and using data to identify gaps.  Knowledge of Charles River (OMS) and Markit EDM preferred.  Strong written and verbal communication capabilities able to thrive in a collaborative team-oriented environment.  Delivery focused serving the needs of internal investment team.  Strong analytical skills with demonstrated strengths in organization, reasoning, critical thinking, problem solving, and attention to detail.  Solid experience with Microsoft Office applications including Project, Word, Excel, Visio, and Power Point. About Us: Credere Group is a professional services firm providing consulting and talent solutions across transformation and change management, operations and information technology, program and project management, regulatory compliance and customer care.  Credere Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

Name: Senior Programmer Analyst
Description: Global advertising is undergoing a rapid and monumental transition to the modern age. Hundreds of billions of dollars are moving away from handshakes and backroom deals and onto open, transparent exchanges. As a leader in this transition, The Trade Desk is bringing a level of sophistication to advertising that has only been seen in financial markets.  We have built a best-in-class platform-as-a-service that processes over 8 million queries per second that's over 100X more volume than all web search queries and tweets combined. This also represents a 8-fold increase over four years, and our team has grown in a similar fashion, with 10X growth in headcount over the same period. By any measure, we are one of the fastest growing public companies in the world. Growth of this kind requires our internal business systems to scale to meet the needs of our rapidly expanding business.  We are looking for full-stack programmer analysts with grit individuals with a passion for building and owning the business systems that underpin a multibillion dollar public company. The advertising industry is evolving rapidly, every day creating new business problems that need creative solutions. We run our team very fast and very lean, which means every member has a high degree of ownership and potential impact and we are looking for candidates with the chops to solve these problems.  Recently named one of the top 20 Best Places to Work in the US by Glassdoor (based on employee reviews) and one of the top 15 Best Workplaces in the nation by Fortune Magazine, The Trade Desk offers a culture of "relaxed intensity" one that comes from working alongside one of the most talented teams in our industry, and leading in a race that is ours to lose.WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING:As member of The Trade Desk's Business Engineering Team, you will report to the local Engineering lead, and work extensively with team members across all functional areas to own the integration of various business systems and delivery of solutions for internal clients. This will involve: Design, development, integrate, and maintain the internal business systems and platform functionality that interoperates with those systems.Develop a deep understanding of company's various operational systems and processes: Operations, Finance, HR, Marketing, etc.Optimize and consolidate reporting for business teams.Identify and pursue opportunities to improve efficiency and scaling our business systems and processes.Participate in building the enterprise data warehouse and ETL stack to support reporting and BI.Evaluate and onboard new business systemsServe as subject matter expert for internal business systems.WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:8+ years of experience in full stack corporate systems development and management, using a modern object-oriented language. Memory-managed languages are best -- e.g. C#, Java, Python, Ruby, etc. We do a lot of development in C#/.NET, but specific experience here is not required.A track record of significant, specific, and self-directed contributions to complex and challenging business application development projects. What we're getting at here is "grit" or "street cred" some proof that this isn't your first rodeo, and you have learned some lessons the hard way.A solid understanding of database fundamentals and SQL, including database design, ETL development, and SQL writing and performance tuning.5+ years of experience in web application development using MVC and/or modern JS frameworks, such as React.An understanding of finance and accounting principles and their practical applications.Excellent analytical, problem solving, troubleshooting and debugging skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a demonstrated ability to document complex technical problemsAbility to work effectively in a team environment, as well as independently with limited supervisionExperience implementing, integrating and maintaining the following SaaS corporate systems or equivalents preferred: ERP: Intacct or NetSuiteHRIS: WorkdayCRM: SFDCExperience developing with iPaaS solutions, such as Dell Boomi or Informatica preferredEnterprise report delivery skills using tools like SSRS, Tableau and PowerBI preferred We also hope you'll take some time to learn more about The Trade Desk and what it's like to work here. Here are a few links to help get you started: Learn more about our mission to transform the global advertising industrySee what it's like to be an engineer on one of the world's most highly scaled Internet applicationsExperience a taste of our global cultureGet to know a few members of our teamRead the Glassdoor reviews that got us named one of the top 20 best places to work in North AmericaNOTE: Do your best to apply to the one role and location you believe best fits your skills, needs, and interests. There's no need to apply to more than one if you're qualified, we'll find the right role and location for you.  The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without a contract in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Name: Business Analyst- Business Call Center
Description: Job Req #: 18-10781  Job Description: Business Analyst- Business Call Center  Location: Greenwood Village, CO  Position Type: ContractDescription of Work to Be Performed: Provide Business Analysis/Project Management expertise along with collaborating and overseeing the Knowledge Management activities for a large financial services firm. The resource would provide/perform the following services: In partnership with the Operational Excellence Manager, the resource will define the plan to revise the Knowledge Management ArticlesAll possible articles have to be migrated to Sales Force enabling the representative search capability on the contentOrganize the content to WIKI level consumption so when the application is migrated to a new platform in the future, the content can be dynamically displayed at the desktop for the representatives in the new applicationReview and update all existing content with the subject matter experts to ensure it reflects the current business operationsCollaborate with offshore resources to update the content in Sales ForceOnce offshore team has updated the content, the resource will review to ensure the readability and format of the content for consumption by the representativesWhen needed update the articles to keep the project schedules and timelines in tactEnsure a well-defined project plan is created with milestones to complete all the articlesWhere needed create new content in partnership with SME'sProvide other services along with leadership updates on a weekly basisAll issues and risks are proactive identified and mitigated without impacting the project and its milestonesSuggest recommendations and deliver them to complete migration successfully without delaysDeliverables The following key deliverables define the success of this project. Existing Knowledge management articles migrated to Sales ForceEnsure that all articles are reviewed by subject matter experts with feedback collectedCollected feedback needs to be reflected in the revised articles as part of the updateFinal articles are at WIKI level so it is easily consumable for the repsContent in Sales Force is searchableContent in Sales force is formatted so that it is easily exported to another platform as neededQualifications or Skillset3 years of experienced in Call Center environment with expertise on Knowledge Management and related resources or articlesBusiness Analysis skills enabling the resource to collaborate with Subject Matter Experts (SME's) in reviewing the articles, collect feedback, and update itExcellent writing skills as it relates to Knowledge Management articles supporting Call Center representatives/agentsExcellent communication skills to enable SME's in reviewing the content and soliciting timely feedbackOrganization skills so the work is categorized, organized, tracked, and completed in a timely manner401K record keeping industry experience is preferredProject Management skills is beneficialAbility to proactively identify and manage risks/issues associated with the content management, review, and updateExperience related to migrating content/Knowledge management articles is critical ?**If this is not a fit for you or you are not interested, Ascent Services Group offers an excellent Referral Bonus!? We look forward to hearing from you!? About Ascent:? The Ascent Services Group (ASG) is a nationally recognized technology staffing and consulting firm whose fundamental business is providing staffing services to Small, Medium, and Large Enterprise clients in our core market verticals: Financial Services, Healthcare, Technology and Life Sciences.? As consultants for ASG, you will have access to many of the top clients within the industries we serve.? Our goal is to deliver innovative talent through proven best practices and effective resource optimization.? Become one of ASG?s candidates and experience the difference!  IND05Company Description:About Ascent:  Ascent is a leading national technology consulting and professional services firm that focuses on tactical and strategic consulting. Ascent’s fundamental business is providing staffing services to Large Enterprise clients in our core market verticals: Financial Services, Healthcare, and Life Sciences. We focus the majority of our efforts in Staff Augmentation support of Large Enterprise Clients who utilize a Vendor Management System. Ascent works as both a reliable supplier in support of programs, as well as a Strategic Advisor in support of enterprise efforts to establish best in class preferred vendor programs. Ascent was ranked in the 2007 and 2008 Inc. 500 and recognized specifically for its innovative work in staff augmentation support of Large Enterprise preferred vendor accounts.  If you are ready to propel your career to new heights… read on. We are looking for talented and dedicated colleagues to join our phenomenal team. At Ascent, we have created an environment where culture, commitment and opportunity converge to yield a truly unique place to work. We know that every employee has something important to say and that every employee is integral to our success. Where else can you walk over to a founder and talk about your ideas to help build our business and have that idea implemented in 48 hours? More importantly, we do everything we can to make sure our employees not only have great jobs, but great lives.

Name: Operations Analyst
Description: As the Operations Analyst at Alto you will have a large impact on the company's growth and future success. You will be a key player enabling needed insights across our entire operations. You will specifically provide analysis related actions that will improving the experience of our patients and providers as well as improve the efficiency of our Care Team (Pharmacy and Customer Service). You will create queries and develop dashboards providing the needed insight for our operational performance. You will use statistical analysis to understand correlation and trends and provide recommendations for changes based on these insights. You will dig deep into the Care Team performance metrics and share recommendations that will help set department priorities on staffing ratios, improving KPIs and efficiency, and staffing forecasts. You are able to understand what data is necessary to assist with business needs and problems and what data isn't necessary. You are an ideal candidate if you have:Minimum of 3 to 5 years of statistics and data analyticsExceptional analytical skills and a passion for dataExcellent statistics background and the ability to explain analytical methodologies simply and thoroughlyProficient in Excel or other visualization toolsProficient in R, SQL, Python, Minitab or other data mining tool / statistical toolsExperience with business intelligence technologies and strong understanding of database architectureStrong oral and written communication skillsExperience performing forecasting and trend analysisA passion for Alto's mission and valuesIt is a plus if you have:BA/BS or equivalent work experienceData warehouse development skillsExperience handling and analyzing medical or pharmaceutical dataHealthcare experienceAlto Pharmacy is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Name: Global Product Development Analyst
Description: Job Area: Investments  Business Area: PGI Other  Location: IA - Des Moines;CA-Folsom  Career Category: Experienced Professional  Full/Part Time: Full-Time  Regular/Temporary: Regular  Date Posted: 2018-11-20 Responsibilities At Principal®, every role supports a greater purpose to help people live their best lives. And after more than 130 years we've never had a more vibrant and dynamic global team united in our purpose.  Our employees are empowered to do their best work. We care about more than just skillsets and job responsibilities. We're invested in helping our employees diversify their experiences, meet new challenges and reach bigger goals. Working at Principal comes with many opportunities and paths for career growthall in the kind of welcoming, collaborative and community-spirited environment you'll look forward to working in every day.  Within the Global Product Development team, you will be responsible for support to the product team by managing investment product development and implementation efforts supporting the asset management efforts of Principal Global Investors.  Key responsibilities; Working to design and develop new investment products by participating in the coordination of product research and relationship management initiatives;Working collaboratively with other business areas of Principal including cross functional groups to identify, validate, and implement product development solutions;Representing PGI and all boutiques in firm wide product development initiatives. Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Common Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be. Job Description: The Technical Business Analyst position at Visa is primarily an analytical liaison role between the various technical teams and the business owners of the applications. As such, the TBA role is highly focused on requirements validation and management to ensure common understanding between all of the stakeholders. Within this role, the TBA needs to be effective at verbal and oral communication to make complex technical logic understandable to non-technical audiences as well as problem and conflict resolution.  The TBA needs to constantly be aware of the requirements and their impact on the system in all stages. This awareness requires balancing concurrent work in multiple stages from proposed requirements through design, development, testing and implementation. Effective balancing of competing priorities is a vital TBA skill.  The TBA is responsible for various artifacts including, but not limited to use cases, traceability matrices, status reports and various analysis documents to help in clarifying issues and options for the stakeholders and decision makers.   The TBA is also a key change agent in identifying opportunities, analyzing options, recommending improvements and promoting adoption for manual and automated process improvements.  Responsibilities:  · Working for the technical organization, act as a liaison between multiple technical teams and business staff for requirements clarification and scope.  · Facilitate resolution discrepancies between a variety of stakeholders including technical and business teams.  · Review and verify viability of business requirements.   · Coordinate and resolve requirement and design issues between project stakeholders.  · Create and manage traceability documentation throughout the project and product life cycle focused primarily on requirements to design traceability.  · Create ad hoc analytical documentation to help stakeholders and decision makers in understanding for making effective decisions.  · Work closely with the Project Managers to ensure scope, appropriate stakeholders, and action item follow through.  · Identify, analyze and promote manual and automated process changes to improve team effectiveness.  · Analyze and document both business rules and system processes to create technical system documentation.  · Translate the business rules and data validation rules into business processes flows into activity diagrams, sequence diagrams, and /or Use cases.  · Identify areas that could be refactored and enhanced.  · Work with the business and Development and provide context to what the existing systems and processes are doing.  Competencies for Success:  · Ability to read System Code (C, C#, SQL Stored Procedures, SQL) and elicit the business rules and data validation rules.  · Ability to make complex technical logic understandable to non-technical audiences.  · Ability to work in a collaborative, dynamic team environment and interact at all levels.  · Ability to manage multiple tasks with changing priorities in a cross-functional environment.  · Ability to work effectively under very broad direction with minimal supervision.  · Excellent organizational, presentation, interpersonal, and team building skills.  · Excellent time management and project planning/strategizing skills.  · Strong analytical and problem solving skills.  · Strong verbal and written communication skills.  · Ability to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical concepts.  · Ability to communicate technically complex IT concepts to business stakeholders.  · Sense of accountability, owning one's work and taking pride in it; commitment to quality and continuous improvement.  Qualifications:  · 5+ years' experience with working with developers and business users to gather, document, analyze, and create technical system requirements.  · Demonstrated experience with producing detail-level technical system functional documentation and conducting inspections of required documents and quality reviews.  · Strong technical skills, with the ability to learn and understand technical concepts in order to interpret and document system processes.  · In-depth experience with SDLC software development methodologies.  · Experience with Agile & Scrum software development process.  · Demonstrated experience with technical design, reviews, and implementation of enterprise applications.  · Demonstrated experience with MSWord, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint.  · Experience with SQL and .NET technologies.  · Experience with other Microsoft technologies a plus.  · Experience working as a developer in .Net, SQL, or similar is a plus.  · Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) certification a plus.  · Stored Value Card experience is a plus.  · B.S. or B.A. in Computer Science, Business Administration or related discipline or equivalent work experience preferred.  Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Familiarity with SAP, Hyperion and tableau are a plusExperience with RPA (Robotic Process Automation) is a plusUnderstanding of process improvement tools and methodologies (e.g. lean, kaizen, gemba, process mapping) is a plusMust be able to manage significant amounts of data to be analyzedExperience of independently managing projects and delivering results on-time, accurately and successfullyStrong analytical skills and adept at identifying trends and variancesStrong communication skills; ability to interact with all levels of management and persuasively present financial issues to non-finance personnelStrong interpersonal skills Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Finance: 3 years (Preferred)

Name: Analyst
Description: Analyst: Business Intelligence/Competitive IntelligenceBulletin Intelligence, Remote- U.S.Bulletin Intelligence: A news-monitoring and analysis boutique within Cision, Bulletin creates bespoke, expert-curated briefings and dashboards for approximately 150 of the most demanding clients in the world; chief executives who are household names, and their Comms and other teams. Client contracts are for as much as $1mm per year. Annual client-retention rates are typically in the mid-90% range. Bulletin was acquired by Cision in March 2017. Location: Bulletin’s primary office is in Reston, VA. The company’s analysts are able to use the company’s cloud-based software to work anywhere in the U.S. that has a high-speed internet connection. Responsibilities: Our Analysts live at the intersection of digital information, public policy and markets and apply layers of sophisticated human judgment to the information explosion in order to deliver the essence of what our clients -- a who’s who of government and corporate leaders -- need to know to start their day.  Analysts work overnight, utilizing complex proprietary software, to scour tens of thousands of sources – mostly news, but also white papers, financial analyst reports, market research, business opportunities, etc. – and distill their core findings into quick-read briefing. Each briefing service is created specifically for each client, focused on (if govt) its unique mission and (if corporate) its company, competitors and industry.  Successful analysts distinguish between critical, important and non-essential information and must be able to provide insightful briefings that allow senior business executives to begin their day fully prepared. You will be part of a top team using cutting-edge technology in order to research and analyze changing events and information trends. Qualifications:Excellent writing and editing ability.Strong skills in competitive-intelligence analysis.Understanding the information needs of chief executives and their teams.Excellent computer skills and comfort learning advanced technical tools.Ability to work overnight and under tight deadlines.Demonstrated intellect and curiosity, often via a bachelor’s degree from a leading university; MBA, JD or industry-specific advanced degree helpful.US citizen or permanent resident.A plus: fluency in any non-English language often used in business. Bulletin Intelligence and Cision are Equal Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity and sexual orientation or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation as part of the employment selection process, please contact Human Resources at Recruiting@Cision.com.  Company Insights:Seamless, cloud-based workComprehensive health benefitsFlexible time off (PTO) programCasual dress codeFree parkingClose to Wiehle Metro (VA)On-site gym and deli (VA)Formal quarterly reviews that facilitate your success About Cision: Cision Ltd. (NYSE: CISN) is a leading global provider of software and services to public relations and marketing communications professionals. Cision's software allows users to identify key influencers, craft and distribute strategic content, and measure meaningful impact. Cision has over 3,000 employees with offices in 15 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. For more information about its award-winning products and services, including the Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow Cision on Twitter @Cision. EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V, 41 CFR 60–1.4

Name: Business Analyst IV

Our mission – “Helping people throughout life’s journey” and the vision to be the trusted partner for improving the quality of life in the communities we serve. GCE’s serves to help people with disabilities find meaningful employment within multiple service lines in 14 states.  GCE’s IT teams maintain more than 73 government and commercial contracts and we has been honored with numerous awards for service excellence and supporting employee morale. Our IT team is a primary federal contractor for Department of Defense agencies where our focus is on identity management and software development credentialing, and personnel security and benefits. A “Top 25” non-profit provider under the AbilityOne® Program. Our IT teams are located in Seaside, CA and Lorton, VA. We are launching a new office in the DTC in Denver, CO, and soon to open in Arlington, VA, by end of year. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Documents requirements, defines scope and objectives, and formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Formulates/defines system scope and objectives. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired results. Prepares detailed specifications for programs. Assists in the design, development, testing, implementation, and documentation of new software and enhancements of existing applications. Works with project managers, developers, and end users to ensure application designs meet business requirements. Assists all phases of software systems programming applications. S. Name: Billing Analyst
Description: Guild, the leading education benefits platform and one of Denver's fastest growing startups, is increasing economic mobility for working adults in America and providing education and support to help every student survive and thrive in the economy of tomorrow. Our platform helps employers offer education as a benefit to their employees by connecting employers' workforces with our network of nonprofit universities and education institutions that focus on serving the needs of working adults. And, our team of retention coaches helps each employee navigate the path back to school, providing individualized support from day one through graduation. In order to accelerate our growth and achieve our mission to serve 1000s more students, we've raised over $70 million from top tier investors including Felicis Ventures, Bessemer Venture Partners, and Redpoint Ventures (among other social impact and VC partners!). Now, we're looking to add a Billing Analyst to the team.  As a Billing Analyst, you'll work on a first-of-its-kind tuition assistance payment facilitation system ensuring that our students receive their employers' tuition assistance benefits in an accurate and timely manner. You will be responsible for the accurate and timely facilitation of tuition assistance payments, be a trusted first point of contact for specific tuition assistance facilitation questions and help raise opportunities to improve our rapidly growing system. This role will have a meaningful impact on the business, students and our corporate and university partners given the mission-critical nature of our tuition assistance payment facilitation flows. A day in our open, collaborative workspace might look like:Creating tuition assistance invoices by extracting and manipulating transactional dataReconciling customer and student accounts for tuition assistance facilitation billing, including providing manual updates if neededMaintenance of tuition assistance facilitation records and controlsFielding billing questions from internal and external stakeholders; collaborating with cross-functional team members to help answer questionsPerform quality assurance checks on data / invoices to ensure student data and billing accuracy while identifying and finding solutions for known issuesSupporting work on billing process improvements and process documentationSupporting on new corporate and university partner billing on-boarding activitiesYou'll join a team:Focused on our double-bottom-line mission of changing higher ed for working adults and building a successful startup in DenverFrom diverse backgrounds from traditional higher education, to athletic coaches, to politicians, to startup leaders (and more!)Of learners & problem-solvers dedicated to our dual mission of changing education in America while building a successful, high-growth companyCommitted to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment that you'd support every dayBuilding a first-of-its-kind tuition assistance payment facilitation process that helps students go back to schoolWhat you'll add to Guildas an individual and part of the broader team:College degree in Finance, Accounting, or other technical area3+ years of relevant work experience in a detail oriented environment with high expectation of precisionExperiencing working with a billing / payment facilitation system (potentially in a financial or healthcare environment) that requires near perfect execution and has not been fully automated yetIntermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills; experience with SalesForce strongly preferredSelf starter with demonstrated time management skills and ability to work independently, while managing multiple work-streams in a fast-paced, evolving work environmentAnalytical, detailed and process oriented; ability to spot opportunities for process improvements to streamline and systematize work-flowsComfortable collaborating with others - both internally and externally to execute on payment facilitationsGrowth mindset; Name: Credit Analyst
Description: Position Description: MidFirst Bank is seeking a driven individual that is looking to make a career in the financial services industry.  MidFirst Bank consistently ranks as one of the best performing privately held banks in the United States. We are driven to identify top talent and match you with a position that will utilize your strengths, while providing the necessary support and training to help you build a successful career as part of a stable and prosperous company.  The responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:  Analyze borrower and guarantor financial statements to determine eligibility for commercial loans, including both commercial real estate loans and commercial & industrial loans. The candidate must be able to identify key credit risks, make sound loan structuring recommendations, and utilize trend analysis in executive level reports. Responsibilities also include loan portfolio management, ad hoc borrower analysis, and in limited cases, customer interaction to gather and examine financial data.  Position Requirements: Basic knowledge of banking, lending, accounting and business law.Experience in commercial credit analysis is preferred, although MidFirst Bank is willing to consider candidates with other relevant experience if the applicant is a good fit. MidFirst Bank will consider a range of experience levels for this position.Applicants must possess a customer service focus, have strong attention to detail, provide inquisitive insight, and make sound business decisions to protect MidFirst Bank.Must have strong PC skills including Microsoft Word and Excel.Bachelor degree in business (finance or accounting emphasis preferred) or economics. GPA of 3.00 or greater is preferred.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  Stay Connected - Join our Talent Community!
