Name: Business Analyst II
Description: GCE - Global Connections to Employment is excited to offer IT career opportunities within our fast growing organization. Our mission – “Helping people throughout life’s journey” and the vision to be the trusted partner for improving the quality of life in the communities we serve. GCE’s serves to help people with disabilities find meaningful employment within multiple service lines in 14 states.  GCE’s IT teams maintain more than 73 government and commercial contracts and we has been honored with numerous awards for service excellence and supporting employee morale. Our IT team is a primary federal contractor for Department of Defense agencies where our focus is on identity management and software development credentialing, and personnel security and benefits. A “Top 25” non-profit provider under the AbilityOne® Program. Our IT teams are located in Seaside, CA and Lorton, VA. We are launching a new office in the DTC in Denver, CO, and soon to open in Arlington, VA, by end of year. Position Summary: Business Analyst II for one or more moderately complex software engineering projects. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Documents requirements, defines scope and objectives, and formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Formulates/defines system scope and objectives. Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired results. Prepares detailed specifications for programs. Assists in the design, development, testing, implementation, and documentation of new software and enhancements of existing applications. Works with project managers, developers, and end users to ensure application designs meet business requirements. Assists all phases of software systems programming applications. Evaluates new and existing software products. Minimum Job Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or related field. May substitute equivalent combination of education and experience.Years of Experience: 3+ years in Business Analyst.Proficiency Level Required with MS Office Products: intermediate.Experience with the following software languages: SQL, Java, JavaScript.Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts.Knowledge of Use Case development and analysis.Knowledge of best practices for developing documentation, including but not limited to Unified Modeling Language (UML).Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for a public trust clearance or higher.U. S. Citizenship required per government contract.Some travel may be required, up to 10% of the time.To Apply: Interested applicants please visit our Career Center @ www.gce.org and complete our on-line applications. Our toll free number is (866) 236-3981.  Global Connections to Employment, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities are encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.  Drug Free Workplace Employer, DRUG TESTING REQUIRED  Equal Employment/Affirmative Action employer including Vets and Disabled. For more information, view the EEO is the Law Poster and Pay Transparency Statement. For reasonable accommodation, please email us at LCIEmployment@bhcpns.org.

Name: Business / Systems Analyst - Expert
Description: Job DescriptionThe Senior Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the Strategic Planning and Process Engineering Manager in developing and driving standardization and operational efficiencies across the AE organization. Through data monitoring and measurement of metrics, communicates and informs the AE organization on the effectiveness of the business as it relates to operational efficiency. The Senior Business Analyst leverages their expertise in the business unit(s) supported as well as an understanding of AE organization's systems and capabilities to identify gaps in performance and potential solutions (utilizing Agile, Lean, and 6-sigma methodologies). Works independently with minimal supervision.  Additional Job Details: Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the organization's operational efficiencies and processes using Agile, Lean, and 6-sigma methodologies. Monitors AE Business as Usual and project work to ensure consistent streamlined processes which facilitate efficient engagement of AE teams. Partners across the organization to help develop RACI models clearly defining roles and responsibilities Oversees creation of operational process documentation (including process reference documents, data tracking, process improvement plans, etc.…), schedules reviews and tracks progress. Produces and provides feedback on trends. Partners in efforts to manage continuous process improvement, including development of models, processes, workflows, and procedures through Agile, Lean, and 6-sigma methodologies. Actively and consistently support all efforts to simplify, enhance, and improve operational efficiency within AE business operations. Ensures complete analysis and understanding of interdependencies, business risks, risk mitigators that could impact or be impacted by the development and delivery of new processes and/or support technologies. Ensures all defined business rules/policies are documented and implemented as designed. Ensures process enablers are working as designed (automated as well as manual). Ensures available technology is leveraged to the fullest extent. Redesign business process where applicable to leverage available or new technologies

Name: Measurement Analyst
Description: Company Name: MarkWest Energy Partners, L.P. POSITION SUMMARY:The primary purpose of the Measurement Analyst position is to analyze, interpret, and validate measurement data directly related to MarkWest assets. The position will be responsible for identifying problems with measurement data and determining potential solutions. In addition, the position will provide support, when needed, for upstream and downstream business groups.ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:• Obtain and input measurement data into various spreadsheets and associated measurement applications.• Run reports and prepare data needed to evaluate the accuracy of measurement data.• Review measurement data for completeness, trends, discrepancies, and other anomalies.• Analyze and interpret measurement data, and make corrections when necessary.• File hard copy and electronic measurement data.• Work in conjunction with downstream business units and third party companies to receive and/or provide third party volume information. • Update and maintain measurement balances.• Assist in testing and troubleshooting the measurement system and related processes. • Update and maintain desk procedures related to assigned assets.• Perform special projects as directed by management.SUPERVISORY DUTIES:NoJOB QUALIFICATIONS:• Required:o High school degree (or equivalent). o 1 year of measurement related experience.o Basic knowledge of measurement principles.o Strong knowledge of computers and Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel. o Ability to organize and manage work according to deadlines.o Ability to relay questions with regards to data review.o Ability to shift focus and comfortably cope with change.o Ability to analyze data.o Well-developed written and verbal communication skills.o Ability to work in both a collaborative team and individual environment. o History of customer service and interaction. o Positive attitude.• Preferred:o BS degree in Accounting, Engineering, Physical Sciences, or other related field.o Basic knowledge of measurement equipment, and pipeline and plant operations.o Strong math skills.o Strong analytical skills.WORKING CONDITIONS:Physical Demands:Requires sitting throughout most of the day, interspersed with short trips throughout the office.Working Environment:You will work primarily in an office environment.Materials and Equipment Used:You will use a personal computer, phone, fax and copier.About Marathon Petroleum CorporationHeadquartered in Findlay, Ohio, Marathon Petroleum Corporation (MPC) operates an integrated refining, marketing and transportation system. MPC is the nation's second-largest refiner, with a crude oil refining capacity of approximately 1.9 million barrels per calendar day in its six-refinery system. Marathon brand gasoline is sold through approximately 5,600 independently owned retail outlets across 20 states and the District of Columbia. In addition, Speedway LLC, an MPC subsidiary, owns and operates the nation's second-largest convenience store chain, with approximately 2,730 convenience stores in 21 states. Through subsidiaries, MPC owns the general partner of MPLX LP, a midstream master limited partnership. Primarily through MPLX, MPC owns, leases or has ownership interests in approximately 10,800 miles of crude oil and light product pipelines. Also through MPLX, MPC has ownership interests in gathering and processing facilities with approximately 5.9 billion cubic feet per day of gathering capacity, 8.2 billion cubic feet per day of natural gas processing capacity and 610,000 barrels per day of fractionation capacity. MPC's fully integrated system provides operational flexibility to move crude oil, NGLs, feedstocks and petroleum-related products efficiently through the company's distribution network and midstream service businesses in the Midwest, Northeast, East Coast, Southeast and Gulf Coast regions.Job Function: Corp Functions; MarkWestTravel Expected: Up to 10%If you have visited our site in search of information on U.S. employment opportunities and require an accommodation to submit your application, please contact the MPC EEO/Compliance Office at 866-492-7802. Note that we only accept resumes and applications for posted positions.Marathon Petroleum Company LP (“MPC”) is an equal employment opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity, veteran status or other legally protected status.

Name: Functional Analyst
Company: Analysts in Motion Consulting Group, LLC
Description: Note: AIM Consulting employs a local delivery model and does not provide visa sponsorship.OverviewAIM Consulting is hiring Functional Analysts with strong consulting backgrounds. The work requires understanding current business processes and the expertise and ability to recommend well-reasoned ways of enhancing, re-architecting and improving technical solutions to support business requirements. The ideal candidate must be able to independently manage simultaneous projects, communicate effectively, and have a customer-service oriented approach.Responsibilities:Partner with project stakeholders, vendors, and members of the software team to gather and document functional requirements as defined by the needs of end-users, application owners, and integration partners.Produce documentation to support the product vision and make engineering tasks clear, including functional requirements, business logic and rules, interface requirements, user interaction behaviors, sitemaps, user journeys, and other system interaction requirements.Communicate effectively to varied audiences through documents, graphics, presentations, charts, and other materials.Participate in on-site project meetings, design reviews, training, exercises, and other events as required in support of projects throughout the entire software development lifecycle (SDLC).Embrace agile principles, participating in and driving agile techniques and ceremonies. CSM or CSPO certification a plus.Work with the software team to implement and support software installations, both onsite and remotely. Perform educational and training course work, research, and activities required to support new technologies utilized in the software group.Provide support to other members of the technical staff as needed to ensure the team achieves technical objectives, meets sponsor requirements, implement technology, and support existing installations.Required:Associate’s degree in Computer Information Science or a field related to the position or equivalent experience.Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to present technical concepts to non-technical audiences.Why AIM Consulting?AIM Consulting, an Addison Group company, is a rapidly growing leader in technology consulting services and solutions delivery that helps companies compete effectively in the digital world. AIM’s differentiation is its ability to build long term relationships with the best technology consulting talent in the region and to deliver end-to-end on business-critical initiatives with modern technologies and processes. Founded in 2006, AIM Consulting provides strategic guidance and scalable project teams in the areas of Application Development, Data & Analytics, Delivery Leadership, Digital Experience & Mobile, and Infrastructure, Cloud and Enterprise Service Management. Headquartered in Seattle with offices in Denver and Minneapolis and the capability to deliver solutions across the US, AIM Consulting has been repeatedly recognized as one of the nation’s fastest growing private companies and best places to work. Learn more at aimconsulting.com.Our approach is straightforward and focused on you and your long-term career growth. We want to understand who you are, what your strengths are and what you are looking to do. Because of the strength of the relationships we have with local companies and leaders, we can present you with career-changing projects. If we don’t have a project that is right for you at first, we continue to keep in touch, even if it’s just to check in and see how things are going. Our objective is to help you build a career that is going to excite your passion for technology, compensate you appropriately, and seriously enrich your life.Reasons to join the AIM Consulting teamWork on the most interesting projectsAccelerate your career growth and experienceBuild insight into company culturesGet ongoing career support and commitmentEnjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages

Name: Business Operations Analyst - Tech Ops Analytics - Fulfillment
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH. A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following:BS in a quantitative field such as statistics, data science, or business analytics (MS or MBA is preferred)Experience with large database SQL platforms as well as wide-column or NoSQL stores, and related environments, frameworks, and engines (e.g., Teradata, Hadoop, Hive, Impala)Experience with creating extracts and visualizations in Tableau.Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to write reports and procedure documents related to trainingCapacity to deliver a technical message to a non-technical audienceExcellent quantitative and analytical abilities, with proficiency in mathematical concepts and ability to define problems, seek and collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions DISH currently has an opportunity for a strongly motivated Business Operations Analyst on the Tech Ops Analytics team. The Tech Ops Analytics team is an important part of the larger Technical Operations team, which serves as the liaison between Customer Experience Operations (CXO) and different departments at the corporate office. This position will be filled by a detail-oriented individual with a strong analytical background and the ability to handle a fast-paced environment, with often changing and competing priorities. The ability to connect data to real world problems and solutions will be the key to being successful in this role.  Primary responsibilities fall into the following categories: Perform ad hoc analysis on fulfillment data from Triage agents and techniciansMonitor, analyze, and report on Triage calls, and fulfillment parts that are usedBuild automated daily, weekly, and monthly reports for a variety of groups and individualsIdentify outliers and root causes of problems and develop plans for improvementUse findings to partner with other departments within the company on process improvement

Name: Business Analyst - Natural Resource and Land Management
Description: Our Federal Government clients in areas of Renewable Energy, Non-Renewable Energy, Timber, Forest Management, Grazing, NEPA, Environmental, and Land Management require program support in business analysis. They need strong analysts with people skills to help them move efficiency, transformation, and innovative missions moving forward. Is this you? Self-Motivated, High initiative, enjoys working within changing deliverables, team environment, and impacting how our government works? We are looking for people that believe we can help our government improve in these ways. We want our analysts to be natural change agents and passionate about change while empathetic to the clients environment on how they leverage, mature, and incorporate data products, services, and new capabilities. We want leaders who can both support the influence of the right change direction while managing the technical and business analysis and design, and are skilled and self-motivated with solid domain/subject matter expertise. Knowing being coachable on building coalitions is key. For instance, coached on balancing empathy against current environment, smart-timing, and smart team decisions on balancing efficiency gains with transformational vision and new innovations.  Our analysts will be on teams that through facilitated analysis, work shoulder-to-shoulder with the clients and our project leadership to get this raw, and sometimes unstructured requirements into analyzed process and information models that make sense and ties back to the objectives. The vision for growth and delivery is: First 30 day qualities - Ramp-up Quickly and be extremely coachable on subject matter from our leads. You will be expected to rapidly ramp-up on Client lingo, proactively make observations of patterns, anomalies, problems, and are customer service focused on being accountable and decisive and able to rapidly respond to change requests. We expect you to be proactive, efficient, and ready to learn quickly, and rapidly in response to all team member needs.First Quarter - Deliver to our customers iterative milestones. Focus on Analyst role for modeling reachback and observations. This is your chance to shine. We expect all our roles to have a mastery of their technical level at their role whether that be in architectural methods, work products, consulting techniques, and client culture. If they are not, they need to demonstrate how they are VERY fast learners. Show you can model workflow, data lifecycle management (supply-side, use-side), and Geospatial/GIS.First Year - Build client trust to be in position to move towards alternative analysis and recommendations. We want to not only gain your technical solutions, but we also want to leverage and grow your interactive and client facing skills. All roles will require strong communication and interactive skills - oral, written, visual especially for triaging conflict, ideation barriers, mitigating risk, foster thought diversity and team environment. The scope will change, so we expect the role to adapt to change and manage expectations, be goal-oriented and self-motivated, and have a customer-oriented (consulting mindset, not "the code works in my environment"). The team likes to coach and explore, so we are looking for life-learners, inherently curious, team players, cooperative, reliable, dependable – basically, you need to rock, but not be a prima-donna rock star. This is what and how we do what we do different in for our Government – we bring transformations to life.  Position Requirements: Technical Skills Requirements Lifecycle (Interview, Gather, Organize, Process Model, Information Model)Value Creation Support (Business Case, Alternative Analysis, Solution Evaluation)Architecture Collaboration - Support Senior Business Analysts and Architects at various levels (Enterprise, Solution, Process, Data, Tech, Geospatial) including pre-procurement input support (Requirements for SOWs, Trend Analysis)Project Length: Contract is currently in 1st of 5 total planned yearsStart Date: ASAPLocation: Denver WestTravel: Minor at mostExperience 3-5 years Process and Information Modeling Experience - Less if closer to subject domain and preferred 1 year of consulting experience. More Senior are welcome to apply, as more Senior Business Analyst positions may open as this always has possibilities to shift to new more Senior role as well depending on value, performance, and client budget/plans.Could pass ad-hoc technical and whiteboard test given various requirements for process/dataOur work is traditionally unclassified, but will require certain amount of background, reference, and other checksTravel will be local in-state only and require on-site work in Downtown Denver.We emphasize a balance of work and life and target 40-50 hour weeks with ample times to refresh with great paid-time off.We do currently have an opening.We review our requirements quarterly and this could change. We like to plan ahead in finding amazing talent.About Xentity We are a fast-growing data consulting and support services firm - focused on large data programs in data types such as geospatial, open, big, and IoT data. Check out www.xentity.com to learn about our focus, services, clients, missions, values as well as our excellent benefits package and career information.  We have high profile clients and projects that our staff really delivery for, as well enjoy knowing they make a large difference.  Our President has a vision to continue to focus on solutions that transform the Next Generation. Using data integration, knowledge solutions, and amazing increases in computing to impact energy, geosciences, land management, we can bring quality and simplifications to existing and new data flow! Imaging being on a team that brings advanced concepts like high performance computing, AI, data science, fuzzy logic, changing interfaces human-computer points mobile or augmented reality and many more disruptions. This truly can put the I back in IT and GIS.... by concentrating on pragmatic knowledge-first data designs, leadership and management, and the all too forgotten focus on outreach and engagement strategies and solutions.  More can be found at careers.xentity.com

Name: Technical Analyst/Senior Technical Analyst
Description: Technical Analyst/Senior Technical Analyst Location  Denver, CO Primary Functional Area  Information TechnologyApply NowAt CoBank, our Technical Analyst defines business, data and processing requirements, facilitates user acceptance testing and conducts training activities for business intelligence implementations. They will also ensure new functionality is accurately and appropriately integrated into installed components of the business intelligence architecture. This person will also act as a primary interface between the technical team and the business.  Right Data, Right People, Right Time…The Information Technology Business Intelligence/Data Analytics Team supports the bank’s overall strategic vision to foster a data driven culture by empowering our business to make smart, insightful and timely decisions to support our mission. At CoBank, our Information Technology Senior Technical Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing and providing solutions to share data to assist our customers run their business. Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a computer science, information systems, or relevant discipline.Four (4) or more years of relevant experience in information technology, preferably in the banking or financial services industry; or appropriate combination of education and experience.Preferred QualificationsAdvanced knowledge of identifying and documenting business requirements in a business intelligence environment.Demonstrated outstanding analytical, verbal and written communication and interpersonal skillsHands on experience with BI tools, such as report writers and cube technologySkills with SQL, Toad or other query tools.Skills in Joint Application Design (JAD) facilitation or other requirements gathering techniques.Experience with data profiling tools and processes.Experience developing and conducting training.Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences.Basic knowledge of banking and of lending terminology.Occasional travel required.Availability for occasional work outside normal business hours.About CoBank CoBank stands strong as a $125 billion enterprise dedicated to the financial needs of rural communities. That means we help fund new ways to grow food, generate energy, access technology, and otherwise improve life in America. When you choose a career with us, you make a difference by standing for something that matters. A career at CoBank can offer you the opportunity to make a personal impact on the people and communities where we do business. We also provide competitive compensation, health and wellness benefits, company-funded retirement plan, matching 401(k), and professional development programs.  CoBank will not sponsor a work visa (e.g. H1B, etc.) to fill this position.  CoBank is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant
Description: If you are a passionate Business Intelligence professional steeped in projects related to development, testing, and implementation and who also enjoys helping businesses transform their technology and processes, please get in touch! We are working with multiple organizations located in downtown Denver, Northern Colorado, and the Denver Tech Centre that require this experience. Apply to tom.gartland@rht.com for immediate consideration! An example of what you will get to do daily: * Plans and executes multiple projects involving all aspects of business intelligence solutions and data, including business intelligence analysis and data exploitation. * Takes business intelligence to the next level to support business decisions and recommend best practices and policy in business intelligence implementation, maintenance, and data quality. * Contributes to a variety of projects related to development, testing, and implementation of new and modified business intelligence systems in an efficient and cost-effective manner. * Leads analysis and recommendations relating to organization's optimization and testing efforts. * Customizes business intelligence report contents and views using Excel, Access, and other tools to meet the requirements of internal business customers. * Works with team and customers to define business requirements, resolve technical issues, and provide training. * Works cross-functionally to implement key projects. Interfaces with other departments to leverage data for their respective business needs. * Tracks web site usage using Omniture and other web tracking tools. * Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance. * Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary. * Other duties and responsibilities as assigned. * Ensures accuracy and high quality data across data sources and platforms. * Translates business process standards and best practices to key stakeholders. * Collaborates with operational leadership to educate and proactively support audit issue resolution. * Responsible for managing data mappings to support analytics and meet the needs of the business * Grasps new tools and systems quickly * Executes on account assignments and requested budget adjustments Job Requirements The above duties will require the Business Intelligence Platform Analyst to establish efficient and effective solutions/procedures in diverse and complex technical and business problems on a regular basis. The success of a Business Intelligence Platform Analyst is tied to the success of the organization as a whole, a growing company in a changing environment. The Business Intelligence Platform Analyst will be successful by achieving a close working relationship with our internal and external customers and ensuring the smooth operation. - provided by DiceAnalysis, Analyst, Business Intelligence, Business Requirements, Development, Excel, Testing

Name: Cyber Intel Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionDGS is currently seeking a talented Cyber Intel Analyst to support our Team located in Denver, CO.  Responsibilities and Duties  The Cyber Intel Analyst will provide specific duties and functions include, but are not limited to: Assess the foreign intelligence (FI), international terrorist, and technological collection threats directed against customers personnel, resources, S&T, facilities and programsProduce cyber products for circulation within the organization, and for external dissemination throughout the USICDevelops liaison contacts within the USIC to further research and analytical objectives and goals of the ProgramWorks with the Program Director to contribute to the integration of field and headquarters analysisMakes oral presentations, which convey ideas, facts, conclusions, estimates, and projections to a variety of the customer and USIC personnelPrepares a variety of written communications and documents, including but not limited to reports, national security studies, and policy recommendations at the direction of the cyber managementRequired SkillsIndividual must have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in intelligence analysisIndividual must have demonstrated evidence of excellent oral and written communication skills and proven performance delivering high-quality products under sometimes seemingly enormous pressure to meet tight deadlinesExtensive knowledge of cyber tradecraft, analytic standards and integrity, methodology and tools is requiredKnowledge of adversary methodologies and collection interests is also requiredSpecial expertise, such as area or country specialization, foreign language fluency, emerging science and technology research is desiredThe individual must demonstrate direct and current knowledge of the mission, structure, and key intelligence programs of the US intelligence community (USIC), to include tactical analysis in support of the cyber mission, international political, economic, and military matters as they impact US national security policy and issues, all aspects of the intelligence cycle, and must demonstrate core analytical competencies to include critical thinking skills, strong collaboration skills, and a customer focus to espouse counterintelligence issues with an analysis dimensionTS/SCI (Q desired, but not required) Clearance Required - (please note: only apply if you currently have the necessary active security clearance stated below) TS/SCI (Q desired, but not required)EducationBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university is required, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related fieldAn advanced degree is preferred, this requirement may be waived if the individual has demonstrated experience in the information technology or cyber security fieldsForeign language proficiency, written and spoken (such as Russian, Arabic, Farsi, Hindi, or related languages), is desirable Company Overview  Dependable Global Solutions (DGS), a Security and Intelligence Firm, was founded in September 2004 as a privately held small business. DGS principle belief is that security is not a singular endeavor. Our clients require the ability to recognize, plan for, and mitigate risk in all of its various forms.  DGS specializes in IT security, mission assurance, and intelligence operations and analysis. We build, manage, and enhance our clients ability to identify and deal with threats and attacks in near real-time.  DGS Benefits  At DGS, we understand that our employees are our most valuable resource. Thats why we offer competitive compensation packages and a supportive environment with good work-life balance. In addition, we provide opportunities for growth and development so that our employees can continually develop their competencies, skills, and talents, and pursue advancement opportunities.  When you join the DGS Team you receive - Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Life Insurance, Short Term & Long-Term Disability, Flexible Spending Account, 401k Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match, Employee Assistance Program, Tuition and Professional Development Assistance, 529 College Savings Plan.

Name: Sr. Business Analyst - Systems Performance

Through data monitoring and measurement of metrics, communicates and informs the organization on the effectiveness of the business as it relates to operational efficiency. The Senior Business Analyst leverages their expertise in the business unit s supported as well as an understanding of organization s systems and capabilities to identify gaps in performance and potential solutions utilizing Agile, Lean, and 6-sigma methodologies. Works independently with minimal supervision. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or equivalent work experience Minimum of Three (3) years business analysis experience MS Project Advanced Excel Agile Experience in process improvement (Lean, 6-Sigma) preferred Experience in Telecom industry preferred Interested in this role? Name: Business Requirements Analyst
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year College or university; or at least four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to interact with and communicate effectively with a large spectrum of different stakeholders from IT personnel to field operations. Preferred: Programming background and an understanding of basic IT architecture.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office notably Excel. Preferably, an understanding of service codes and how different systems communicate with one another.Must be able to handle different situations and tasks with minimal direct oversight from management. Applicant must be comfortable working without direct supervision and be internally motivated to seek out projects and drive forward needed initiatives.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. A Business Operations Analyst within our Business Process and Technology team works as a project manager primarily on application development for our internal DISH teams. They will manage assigned projects and write front end business requirements to ensure that stated objectives are met write.  Primary responsibilities fall into the following categories: Write business requirements for front end tools and ensure requirements are passed to ITManages the planning, development, design, and implementation of assigned program/projects. Including tracking schedules, issues, tasks, and relevant financial impacts.Coordinates the development of requirements (processes, systems, etc) for new programs and enhancements to existing programsEngages with DISH IT and DISH partners’ development from implementation throughout the program’s/project’s life-cycle.Implements monitoring systems for evaluation and effective collection of feedback for ongoing programs as to drive improvements and future enhancement requests.Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all duties and responsibilities assigned to this position. LilyP

Name: Finance and Planning Analyst
Description: The role of the Business Unit (BU) Finance and Planning team, in conjunction with the BU leadership, is to maximize value from our assets while maintaining a strong control environment (in partnership with Accounting Reporting and Control and the BU teams) and ensuring accurate financial reporting.  The Finance Analyst is an individual contributor position, reports to the Eagle Ford BU Finance and Planning Manager, and works closely with the BU Development and Operations teams and the L48 Planning team. The BU Finance and Planning Team role is to 1) Coordinate and support the BU Business strategy and lead the plan; 2) Ensure decisions are value based and drive commercial acumen in the BU; 3) Manage the forecast, variance analysis, and prepare/coordinate monthly/quarterly accruals; 4) Performance Management: drive and integrate the BU Monthly Business Review process; and 5) Support BU Business Development Projects. As a member of the Finance, the Analyst will be part of a very collaborative group, where people are willing to step out of their roles to help others. Finance Analysts in L48 serve as trusted finance advisors to the business.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: The Data Analyst will be responsible for automating the finance analysis and reporting processes by administering finance databases and creating data visualizations and dashboards. Additional responsibilities of this position include working closely with business unit finance teams to identify and implement new process improvement initiatives in accordance with the Finance strategy.  This opportunity is located at our Corporate office in downtown Denver, CO and will work closely with a small team who are developing financial data analytics for the corporation. Responsibilities:Identify opportunities for improvement and translate them into projects.Initiate new projects and build cross-functional teams with corporate / business finance, IT and subject matter experts.Develop sustainable, fully automated dashboards to help management quickly assess financial health of the business and identify drivers of performance.Work with IT Business Analytics team to develop and maintain finance data sets.Perform administrator duties in the financial planning system including master data maintenance, monthly load package updates, monitoring of the data load kick-outs, administering work status, creation of the new / maintenance of existing standard templates and system troubleshooting with business finance and IT teams.Secure buy-in from business and corporate stakeholders to ensure project success.Cooperate with corporate and business unit finance teams to implement new data modelling, analytics and presentation technology.Employ effective data visualization techniques to tell the business story.Reconcile financial information from dashboards to the data source (ERP) and implement controls to ensure continued accuracy.Coordinate with IT team to ensure optimal financial planning system performance.Implement process and database changes. Requirements: (education, skills and abilities) Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting with a minimum of 5 years of strong financial analysis and financial reporting experience.Ability to develop repeatable, clearly understandable and comprehensive data visualizations that lead to data-driven business decisions.Demonstrated ability to identify opportunities and initiating solutions. As well as an eagerness to learn.Thorough knowledge of ERP financial planning system (Experience with Tableau, BPC and/or SAP experience preferred)Strong understanding of reporting structure and businessDemonstrated passion to bridge financial expertise with the latest technology with a goal of delivering business value.Proven ability to work with and blend large volumes of data.Excellent organization and project management skills.Expertise in statistical analysis.Experience with building predictive models.Expert in Microsoft Excel.Ability to interface at all levels of the organization, both internally and externally.Minimal travel required (0 -- 10 days per year)Work environment is typical of an office setting Additional considerations given to candidates with manufacturing industry experience.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.  JM has a long history of sustainable efforts and strives to continually improve our sustainability practices through a focus on innovation, productivity and leadership that ensures we meet the needs of current stakeholders without sacrificing the needs of future generations. Name: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description: Why work with us: Blinker is a Denver-based mobile app that puts people in control of car ownership. We started our company because we believe the used car market has a major consumer problem each year, twenty eight million people in the US buy or sell a car at the dealership and lose thousands of dollars in every transaction. Blinker is the only company that allows anyone to sell a car with a lien, buy a car with financing or refinance a car, all on their own with their mobile device.  Our CEO, Rod Buscher, founded Blinker in 2013. Today, Blinker's leadership team carries 170 years of collective automotive and lending experience. Blinker has received over 100,000 downloads and originated millions of dollars in auto loans. Weve also won a 2017 SXSW Interactive Innovation Award, Colorado Biz Top Company Award, Telly Award, as well as been named a Gazelle by the Denver Office of Economic Development and a Colorado Company to Watch.  Were looking for talented people to help us continue to scale our business and serve a nationwide audience from our headquarters in downtown Denver. Were a passionate, smart, and driven group, working together to cause some major market disruption. You could be part of that. If youre eager and ready to work alongside inspiring teammates and make a major, positive impact on our business each and every day, we want you to join us.  The opportunity to join Blinker's in the Data & Reporting Analyst role is ideal for a curiosity-driven strategic thinker, possessing strong analytical skills and who thrives in an environment conducive to thorough analysis and complex options. What you will be doing: As a data analyst you will help empower Blinker to make data-driven decisions while working closely with internal stakeholders to support business initiatives. You will be expected to navigate through uncertainty to provide actionable analytic insights from available data. Develop and enhance analytical tools, such as models, reports, and dashboards, to monitor performance and drive ongoing execution of business and marketing initiativesDeliver deep-dive analysis on key performance drivers to support continuous improvementDeliver an analytical read on tests for operational changes to determine the impact of the change and inform any rollout decisionsTransform data for reporting and analysis, identifying patterns and signs of anything that can deliver a positive business impact.Monitor performance of business goals and communicate status through reporting and visual analytics.Develop, implement, and maintain performance measurement reporting and analytics for multiple areas of the business, including marketing, consumer behavior, consumer financing, partnerships, transactions, operations, and financial analysisLeverage reporting best practices to automate reports and find creative solutions to maximize reporting outputPerform market assessments and analyze trendsPrepare ad hoc data analyses and researchEstablish and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders and decision makers.Must Haves:2+ years of hands-on experience in collection, mining, reporting, and analysis of large amounts of data, preferably in a consumer-facing industryDemonstrated top-caliber analytic and problem-solving skillsCuriosity for finding optimal solutions to complex problems and passion for bringing those solutions to a reality within our businessProven ability to develop, maintain, automate, visualize, and communicate reporting for management and internal stakeholdersProficiency using MS Excel and other data and dashboard systems (we currently use Chartio, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, and more)Big Pluses:Experience in a start-up or growth oriented business, entrepreneurial mindset to always be looking forward is preferredConsumer mobile application, marketing, automotive and/or finance industry experience a plusAdditional Information:Blinker Inc. does not currently provide Visa sponsorshipWhat we offer to you:Competitive pay + equityPaid/flexible time offComprehensive medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, and parental leave benefits401K PlanPaid covered parking in Tabor Center garage or RTD transportationFully stocked kitchen with free snacks, beverages, & cold brew coffee on tapRegularly recurring, company-side social activities (e.g. BBQ lunches on patio and afternoon happy hours)Hackathons

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Danone North America is the largest Benefit Corporation in the world. Our mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible.  Danone North America is looking for a Business Process Analyst in Broomfield.  The Business Process Analyst, BPA, leads order to cash (OTC) systems and processes as the technical subject matter expert translating systems capabilities into best practice order fulfillment processes. They are responsible for monitoring and evaluating system and process performance for SAP, OpenText, Orsoft, MicroStrategy, and OmPrompt to drive successful order fulfillment for all customer orders. The BPA serves as the primary liaison between Customer Solutions and internal Master Data and EDI teams and is the gatekeeper to coordinate escalation of OTC systems issues prior to engaging those teams. The BPA leads Customer Solutions in systems development projects to ensure systems enhancements do not adversely impact customer service.    Responsibilities:Subject matter expert for order to cash systems and processes.Manages business-critical master data and configuration for Customer Solutions.Leads SAP order processing issue management and resolution.Responsible for productivity and continuous improvement including identifying, developing, and implementing efficiencies within order fulfillment process. Acts as key technical lead representing order to cash SAP functionality for Customer Solutions.Works cross functionally to deliver business objectives. Anticipates the impact of meeting new challenges and leads problem solving and adaptation to overcome challengesMaintains Customer Solutions systems SME knowledge base through SOP and training document creation and team trainings.Owns system testing and acceptance for order to cashLeverages multi-systems knowledge to provide technical expertise in developing departmental KPI reporting. Ensures that published reporting and root data are accurate based on a comprehensive systems and process knowledge.   Education and Experience (Requirements):SAP experience required including both APO and ERP, including gATP. SAP system implementation experience preferredSAP Master Data managementSAP Order to Cash experienceEDI process and transaction managementBachelor’s Degree required3 - 5 years of CPG business system experience in related area within IT, Customer Service, Logistics, or Supply Chain preferred   Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:In-depth knowledge of customer supply chain operations as well as familiarity with all systems that integrate with the order fulfillment process. Capacity to comfortably interact with all levels of the business and deliver results in a fast-paced environment.Ability to apply a disciplined, logical and comprehensive approach to problem solving.High degree of initiative and ownership.Strong attention to detail for both accuracy and content.Judgment to resolve issues with the appropriate sense of urgency including ability to provide afterhours support.Excellent communication skills both written and verbal including the ability to translate technical information to a broad end user community.Ability to create and communicate a structured business recommendation with advantages and disadvantages.Skill set which allows one to both identify an issue and implement the solution while working as part of a team or as an individual contributor.Ability to maintain productivity and professionalism while under pressure to meet strict deadlines and balance multiple priorities.Ability to develop work instructions, training material and presentations.Advanced Excel skills preferred.   NON ESSENTIAL:APICS certification preferredOpenText, MicroStrategy, Orsoft and OmPrompt experience preferred Danone North America is a Certified B Corporation business unit of Danone and operates in the U.S. from headquarter offices in White Plains, NY and Broomfield, CO. For more information, please visit DanoneNorthAmerica.com.　  Danone North America is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. Name: Product Owner / Business Analyst
Description: Who We Are: PulteGroup: A Fortune 500 company, has been providing the American Dream of homeownership to families for more than 60 years. We "Build Consumer Inspired Homes and Communities to Make Lives Better!" PulteGroup is a home builder interested in economic, environmental and social sustainability practices. The homes we build inspire "homeowners for life" with repeat business common from both the homeowners and realtors. PulteGroup operates in approximately 50 markets throughout the country and is one of the largest U.S. homebuilders by closing volume.  Pulte Mortgage: Because we are a wholly-owned subsidiary of PulteGroup we are never at a loss for business and can spend our time developing our employees instead of beating the streets. We are a financially stable partner you can trust with over 40 years in mortgage banking. We have seen it all and are stronger than ever! Named as one of Colorado's "Best Place to Work" in 2015, we are fueled by the desire to work hard, play hard, make a difference, do good things for our communities, and have fun doing it. We are a curious group and constantly strive to find new ways to help our customers achieve financial fitness through home ownership. We focus on a total rewards package with high base salaries, competitive monthly incentives, stellar, top level benefits, a fully vested 401k match, tuition reimbursement and much more!  Pulte Cares: We are dedicated to serving the community through volunteer days, charitable contributions, employee designated charitable contribution matching program, the Opens Doors Foundation, and Built to Honor program.  Centralized in Denver, Colorado, we are a mortgage banker that values customer service, exceptional training, employee development, and continuous improvement. We are committed to running our business with integrity by always choosing the right way over the easiest way. We are dedicated to improving the lives of our customers, our employees, and PulteGroup.  Product Owner / Business Analyst  Job Summary  Product Owner to join an Information Systems Department that creates and implements business-critical applications. This is an exciting opportunity to apply strong functional and technical skills in a collaborative, dynamic environment.  This position interacts with business executives, management, and end users, and agile delivery teams. This position works with the agile delivery team for Business Process Management, focusing on workflow systems. ResponsibilitiesDocument as-is processes and identify pain-pointsReview external vendor interface requirements and define gaps with current data and processesEnvision future state processes, screens, and business rules to support external vendor interfaceDevelop and clarify user stories from features requestsCollect and prioritize features by working with business stakeholdersBuild and groom product backlogCollaborate with product owners, architects and delivery teams to design the system solution for assigned features and user storiesDevelop detailed understanding of the product within a complex service-oriented architecturePresent product features at sprint demonstrations to end users, managers, and executivesReview training materials and operating procedures; participate in training sessionsApply communication skills to communicate information effectively and professionally to stakeholders, managers, and delivery teamsDevelop use cases and business requirements from both business and technical perspectives, as neededProduce high quality deliverablesResolve feature questions through data analysis and software tools (SQL, XML, etc.)Apply analytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements. Required Education Bachelors in Computer Science or related fieldRequired Experience2 years experience in residential mortgage systems3 years of agile development experience. Prefer scrum, and Product Owner experience (CSPO strongly desired)3 years software application development, product management, business systems analysisExperience documenting as-is and to-be process flows using BPMN and narrativesExperience in Agile and Waterfall methodologiesDemonstrated experience with OOAD and structured design procedures and deliverablesExperience with complex integrated environments, such-as service-oriented architecturesDemonstrated experience with MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio All employees must be committed to fair and nondiscriminatory lending, in conformity with the Equal Credit Opportunity and Fair Housing acts, and to compliance with all applicable laws, regulations and company policies. Employees must act responsibly in their efforts to provide financial services to Pulte customers and to provide support to Pulte's core purposes.SDL2017

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Reports to: Senior Product ManagerLocation: Denver, CO  Help shape the future of how people experience the digital world. You'll be at the forefront of an exciting shift in how digital identity authentication allows companies and consumers to transact with trust in the digital world.  We’re actively looking to add exceptional people to our team who align with how we envision ourselves culturally and professionally. As a lens to how outsiders see Payfone, you will represent a team of people who love what they do and who they work with. POSITION SUMMARY As a Data Analyst, your job will be to assist in designing and running data tests for new and existing clients as well as developing reporting capabilities so that we can monitor how well our products are performing. This position requires that you have the technical ability to understand and interpret client data and the results from our products, as well clearly communicate those results both internally and externally. RESPONSIBILITIES As a member of the Product team, the Data Analyst will: Receive raw data from our current clients and prospects and perform quality checks to ensure the data is as expected.Transform client data into the appropriate format required by our internal tools.Run, monitor and make improvements to our existing internal tools used for testing our products.Assist in analyzing the results of the tests to show the efficacy of our products, including writing reports detailing our findings and presenting the report to sales leaders.Assist in developing our reporting capabilities to allow better automated monitoring of our solutions.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCEBachelor's degree or equivalent experience in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Statistics or Mathematics.Proficiency in one or more programming languages, preferably Python, R or other data friendly language.Strong understanding of basic statistical concepts, such as probability distributions and significant testing.Familiarity with accessing and using API’s, command-line tools and using the command line.1-3 years of experience in data analysis, including presenting results to internal and external parties is a plus.Experience developing or using fraud prevention solutions is a plus.Knowledge of both relational and non-relational databases is a plus.More advanced statistical knowledge, such as utilizing Bayesian inference and developing predictive models such linear/logistic regression is a plus.COMPENSATION A compensation package composed of a base salary and equity component will be structured to attract a uniquely qualified candidate. Excellent health benefits are included. ABOUT PAYFONE Payfone is the leading digital identity authentication network for the connected world. Our real-time, passive identity authentication solutions enable consumers and the world’s largest banks, insurers, brokerages and technology companies to thwart digital identity theft and transact with trust. Learn more at http://www.payfone.com and https://www.linkedin.com/company/payfone.  This position description should not be considered the final description of the position. It should be assumed that we would, to some extent, structure responsibilities in accordance with the successful candidate’s capabilities and changing business conditions.  Payfone is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people regardless of race, color, religion, gender or sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, disability, veteran status or other personal characteristics.  No employment sponsorship will be provided.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY We are looking for a passionate, detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our Data Science team. The successful candidate be responsible for identifying and developing solutions to turn data into actionable business recommendations. You will need to exhibit a strong combination of analytical prowess, technical aptitude and business judgment. You will be expected to focus on results, be a self-starter and demonstrate success in using analytics to drive the understanding, progression and excellence in product and operations.  As a Data Analyst, you will be the analytical partner for our Media and Product teams. You will work closely with Campaign Strategists, Developers and Product Managers to transform subjective discussions about product into concise analytic questions that deliver actionable answers. You will support the design, development, and execution of marketing campaign analysis and game design including managing data and processes, modeling, and analysis to measure effectiveness and improve performance.  You will shape the way product performance is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions for the business. RESPONSIBILITIESEvangelize data knowledge and insights: manage communications with your stakeholders and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve.Prioritize and execute in the face of ambiguity: work with stakeholders and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches.Work on data modeling, metric development, data prototyping, and insight generation using statistical techniques.Untangle ambiguous problems and find the insights that drive operational and product excellence.Create efficiencies through automation or enhancement of existing processes.Define the data analytics research plan, scope and resources required to meet the objectives of your area of ownership (segments of the project/engagement).Construct data models (algorithms and formulas) for required business needs and predictions.Communicate findings, actionable recommendations, and data limitations to stakeholders to facilitate data-driven decisions.Proactively seek ways for the business to harness data and use it to identify solutions for more efficient operations and smart new business initiatives.EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS2+ years experience in statistical analysis, modeling and reporting.Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or a related technical field.Advanced PostgresSQL skills and intermediate to advanced scripting skills in either Python or R.Experience with Pandas, Numpy, scikit-learn, etc preferredDistinctive problem solving and analysis skills and impeccable business judgement.Experience working with imperfect data sets that, at times, will require improvements to process, definition and collection.Strong communication skills and desire to work in cross-functional groupsSolution-oriented, self-starter with a solid ability to work in a team environmentAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks on time in a fast-changing environment; comfortable with ambiguity.A passion for gaming and the mobile app space.BENEFITS & COMPENSATION AdAction celebrates individuality and we value each other's hard work by celebrating with exciting activities, lavish happy hours, complimentary meals, and seasonal sports. We offer a flexible work schedule, including generous PTO, and a benefits package including health, dental, vision insurance and up to 6% 401(k) matching. Starting salary to be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Name: vSOC Analyst I/II/III
Description: vSOC Analyst 1, which directly correlates to the Security Operations Center (SOC) Tier 1 analyst, is focused on providing descriptive analysis. They will answer questions such as the who, what, when, and where of events. These are curious individuals who actively work to develop a better understanding of the environments they are assigned to. They collaborate with other analysts, threat hunters, customer analysts and the vSOC Lead Analyst.  vSOC Analyst 2, which directly correlates to the Security Operations Center (SOC) Tier 2 analyst, provide some descriptive analysis; who, what, when, and where but are more focused on the explanative analysis of an event; why and how. These individuals demonstrate a curiosity that is tempered with training and experience. They are capable of developing greater context to events, allowing for more in depth analysis and leveraging this to develop patterns of behavior in a client. They will develop findings and make recommendations to tune environments as well as facilitating communication with the other members of the Client Analyst Team. Role and Responsibilities:Monitor the SIEM for suspicious events and anomalous activityTriage security events for criticalityValidate suspicious events and incidents using open-source and proprietary intelligence sourcesDocument and manage incident cases in our case management systemNotify assigned customers of security incidents Interface with customers to provide investigatory support and additional information as neededTriage support requests and helpdesk queue to maintain SLA Work a shift as needed and directedKeep up-to-date with information security news, techniques, and trends Identify and report any gaps in log collection or reporting as soon as possible to the customer and vSOC EngineeringReport all operational issues or problems to the shift leadReport any changes in customer environments to the Lead AnalystContribute to the creation of analytical products Document new tools and techniques and disseminate them to the rest of the teamMentor and assist Tier 1 analysts with professional developmentDevelop an area of specialty with the goal of becoming a subject matter expertProduce original content regarding new threats, techniques and information for internal and external consumptionIncident Response and threat hunting in client environmentsBecome expert with Splunk as an analyst Become expert with ServiceNow as an analystBecome expert with third-party threat intelligence tools as requiredPosition Requirements:Experience in Information Security (Required)Strong communication skills written and oral (Required)Experience with Splunk (Desired)Experience with Incident Management (Desired)Experience writing and communicating with customers (Desired)Degree in Information Security or Information Technology (Desired)Work remotely from a home office when not at a client site or corporate office.Why GuidePoint? GuidePoint Security is one of the fastest growing companies in the U.S. and a leader in cybersecurity. Since its inception in 2011, GuidePoint has grown to nearly 300 employees, established strategic partnerships with leading security vendors, and serves as a trusted advisor to more than 1,000 clients. Our core values drive all aspects of the business, which have been paramount to the company’s success and establishment of an enjoyable workplace atmosphere. At GuidePoint, your colleagues are knowledgeable, skilled, and experienced and will seek to collaborate and provide mentorship and guidance at every opportunity. Our generous benefits plan includes 100% employer paid medical and dental with generous employer family contributions and eligibility for retirement plan benefits after six months. Within GuidePoint, our next generation Managed Security Services (MSSP) business is growing very rapidly. If you have the passion, work ethic, winning attitude and competitive mindset and be at the forefront the best MSSP in the U.S., we want you on our team. Equal Opportunity EmployerGuidePoint Security, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.
