Date: Nov 27, 2018  City/State/Province: Denver, CO, US, 80237  Company: Colas  Investing in your tomorrow starts right here  Are you interested in an opportunity working for a company that puts the safety of their employees first, then you have stopped at the right careers site. Colas USA companies are part of the Colas Group, the worldwide leader in transportation infrastructure construction and maintenance. The Colas Group is active in the construction and maintenance of road, air, rail and maritime transport infrastructure, urban development projects and recreational facilities. With 70,000 employees throughout 1,400 business units in 40 countries on 5 continents, the Colas Group carries out over 100,000 projects each year.  Colas IS Support offers competitive salary and benefits packages, along with in-house training, an incredible work environment, and career advancement opportunities.  Must be able to meet all safety requirements including pre-employment fit and drug/alcohol testing. Position Description: As a Developer / Analyst for the OnBase Team, you will be part of a small team of skilled individuals who possess a breadth of knowledge and troubleshooting skills, who thrive on multi-tasking with diverse responsibilities and assignments, and who truly enjoy their work and routinely display a positive attitude. You will help to build and support OnBase software solutions that touch every part of the business from HR to Finance, AP to Operations, and more. You will be an integral part of delivering quick turn-around, high quality, easily adaptable software solutions that streamline business processes, help boost productivity, and help meet compliance initiatives using OnBase, one of the world's leading Enterprise Content Management Products.  This role is ideally suited for those with strong technical and programming skills looking to extend their daily routine to include more business analysis, more interaction with the customer, and more direct contact with the business. Primary Duties:Work with team to design, code, test, and debug OnBase solutions using OnBase's GUI, C# scripting, SQL queries, and OnBase APIs.Assist with testing and deployment of software patches.Use OnBase APIs to extend and integrate OnBase with other in-house systems and databases such as JDE, Oracle JDEdwards, HCSS Heavy Bid, and more.Build SQL queries.Develop and maintain .NET code to be used in Windows Applications, Web Services, Websites, and other forms of C# scripts.Oversee OnBase core integrity with routine performance monitoring, server and space checks, processing task reviews.Develop OnBase knowledge and best practices including OnBase APIs, Workflow, E-Forms, Unity Forms, COLD, auto-capture.Assist with the planning and installation of software upgrades.Gather and document business requirements.Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures and recommend improvements.Write system and user documentation.Provide on-going customer support by researching, resolving, and closing helpdesk tickets.Conduct training classes both on the web and in person (some travel required).Skills/Qualifications: The successful candidate will bring solid software development experience, Windows desktop experience, and either experience with OnBase or a strong desire to learn ECM and OnBase. Required qualifications:College degree in the field of computer science, information systems, or software engineering or equivalent experience.Software Development Experience involving the design, prototyping, development, testing, and debugging of applications (.NET Framework, ******* and C# preferred).Working knowledge of software development methodologies.Experience with Windows 7 or 8, Microsoft Office Professional Suite, Windows Operating Systems and general desktop technical and application support.Must be able to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities and work independently to complete projects on time.Ability to communicate and train business users on software solutions. Favorable qualifications (training will be provided for strong candidates): Experience with ECM, Scanners, ISIS, Twain, and Hyland OnBase preferred, but not required.OnBase certifications OCSA, OCASA, OCWA, OCAWA, OCAPI, OCSE, and OCWV viewed favorably, although not required and training will be provided as necessary.As a multinational company, the ability to read, write and speak French would also be an asset. Are you looking for an IT career that leaves a lasting impact? Come join our team and do your part in building our nation's infrastructure.  The Colas Group is a worldwide leader in transportation infrastructure construction and maintenance. Our goal is to set the pace in our industry and to be a model of excellence by providing safe, innovative, sustainable and cost-effective solutions for our customers. We are active in the construction and maintenance of road, air, rail and maritime transport infrastructure, urban development projects and recreational facilities. With 70,000 employees spanning 5 continents, the Colas Group carries out over 100,000 projects each year, backed by a tight international network of construction materials facilities, including: aggregate mining sites, asphalt plants, ready-mix concrete plants, liquid asphalt terminals and emulsion plants.  As a key part of this group, Colas USA has a network of companies which allow us to provide most of our products and services anywhere in the United States, from Alaska to Florida and Maine to Southern California. We support our 5,000 plus employees as they operate from more than 50 regional offices located in more than 25 states. We are committed to developing and improving products and construction services based on recycling of material, improving energy efficiency and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.  Located in the Denver Tech Center, Colas IS Support is the information technology arm of Colas USA. Our vision is to deliver world class services, strategy and processes that support our construction and manufacturing operations. We work to provide timely access to information and knowledge in an integrated, open and collaborative environment, and aim to be the standard bearer for excellence in quality, customer service and reliability. We are building a company culture where both individual and team effort are rewarded and value employees that look forward to the challenge of exceeding customer expectations. Name: Sr. Technical Business Analyst - APIs
Description: The Company Worldpay is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the fastest growing payments company in the U.S., first in PIN Debit transactions and the second largest merchant acquirer. Visit Worldpay.com for more. The Opportunity As Worldpay grows, we must be proactive in assuring we stay ahead of the curve with truly cutting-edge products and services. The payments industry is in rapid evolution with the implementation of new technologies. By hiring the best minds that understand that new features and capabilities are just as important as security, Worldpay will continue to beat the competition with our offerings. Whether it's dedicated to new products and services, or ensuring we have the best infrastructure out there, Worldpay is dedicated to tech.  The Senior Technology Business Analyst is passionate about learning new products, technologies, and processes to provide subject matter expertise of APIs, integrations, systems, and data to facilitate overall understanding while driving solutioning, development, and support. The ideal candidate will have a deep passion for learning, simplifying the complex, and continually driving improvement of products, process, and technologies Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers. Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At Worldpay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. People with ambition, optimism and courage. We provide growth and opportunity and give employees flexibility in how they get the job done. You might not expect that from a big payments company, but we're smart enough to know how to hire the best and when to step aside and let them lead. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board. What you'll do:Work closely with product management and a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization to develop, validate, refine and groom user's stories and associated test casesPerform detailed analysis, mapping, and documentation of a variety of systems and data including internal, back-end, and third party,Become an API and domain SME to facilitate team understanding of requirements and capabilities with a specific focus on the "how' and 'why'.Work under the guidance of the product owner and development manager for day to day prioritization of work and help achieve sprint goals.Provide integration support and in-depth technical trouble shootingDevelop documentation and guidelines to facilitate understanding and use of APIs, systems, and data.Who you are:You have expertise with technology, as well as with acumen from a business perspectiveYou have excellent analytical, problem-solving and research skills with a creative mindset capable of tying desperate information together and making sense of the complex.You strategically see the big picture but also can focus on the details needed to tactically execute.You are passionate about building exceptional experiences and understand what a great API that meet these needs looks like.You understand the importance of the developer experience to maximize impact, distribution and success for those building on top of APIsYou are an excellent communicator and understand the importance of networking and building relationships.You are good at sorting out ambiguity.You are persistent, rational and put facts above speculation.You are proficient in Databases. (Query languages like SQL ) and have a solid understanding of Web services/APIs. (SOAP, REST, XML etc.,).You are comfortable working with a wide variety of stakeholders at all levels within the organization.Be able to handle multiple priorities and tasksSelf-Motivated, Proactive and can work under minimal supervisionBonus skillsDemonstrated success in developing Product APIsDomain knowledge of the payment industry.Excellent presentation skills and comfort presenting complex information to senior leadershipAbility to teach others the art of analysis and developing product APIsBasic qualifications for consideration:Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related field or equivalent experience4+ years' experience in technical analysis or related field2+ years of designing, analyzing, testing, or supporting APIs (though no API programming will be required for this specific role)

Name: Sr Business Continuity Analyst
Description: Requisition Number 18-1242  Post Date 10/19/2018  Title IT Professional  Title Detail Sr Business Continuity Analyst  City Lakewood  Location Headquarters  State CO  Description This position is responsible for leading the initiative to develop, recommend, support and implement corporate wide efforts in all business continuity and disaster recover activities. The individual will play a leading role in coordination during any disaster recovery effort and be responsible for the coordination plans with the Bank?s stakeholders. The individual will also work closely with management and information technology teams to support the information security governance, risk and compliance program while also being a leading role in incident management and incident coordination. The candidate must be well-rounded with proven business continuity management expertise along with strong communication and project management skills.  As a Denver Post Top Workplaces award winner seven years in a row (2012-2018), FirstBank provides many great benefits for being a part of our family. From competitive salaries, employer-contributed retirement and health plans, some reduced fee banking services, paid time off, employer paid basic life insurance, short-term and long term disability policies, to holiday parties and more, you will be appreciated and made to feel at home at FirstBank.  FirstBank provides a high-paced work environment with different projects landing on your desk routinely. From building the back-end of new products, improving current products and designing internal systems, to managing our security systems, maintaining and improving infrastructure and much more, no week is the same. This is a challenging position that comes with great rewards. \#DCEESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES ?Advance the development of corporate business continuity plans  ?Coordinate, conduct, and document tests of company resiliency plans and back-up systems  ?Lead the development of and enhancements to the corporate business continuity strategy  ?Facilitate continuous process Improvement events looking for gaps, gathering and analyzing metrics throughout the process, determining success factors, and identifying solutions  ?Identify threats to business operations, and present relevant information to management  ?Lead incident response efforts  ?Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure preparedness is achieved  ?Assist in improving FirstBank?s assessment of operational risk  ?Design and implement risk assessments  ?Have a strong understanding of dependencies for business processes, business functions, applications, technology, and internal / external parties related to the business  ?Lead company incident management exercises  ?Perform other duties and projects as assigned  ?Participate in on-call rotation and after-hours work as required by system implementations, outages or upgrades.  ?Understand and comply with all provisions of the Safety in the Workplace policy  Salary Commensurate with Experience  Will consider hiring into a lower career stage  Requirements MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS OF POSITION  ?Typically requires a bachelor's degree in related field and a minimum of 5 years of related experience. A combination of post-high school education, job related certification and related experience equivalent to 7 years may be considered in lieu of minimum requirements. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS OF POSITION ?Bachelor?s Degree in Computer Science or other technical field preferred  ?Certified Business Continuity Planner (CBCP)  ?Master Business Continuity Planner (MBCP) KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS ?Working knowledge of Business Continuity and Mass Communication platforms  ?Excellent written and oral communication skills  ?Good computer skills including of Microsoft Office  ?Ability to work with minimal guidance and direction  ?Good understanding of FirstBank processes  ?Previous IT experience is not required, training will be provided WORKING CONDITIONS AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS Work is performed in an office environment with moderate noise levels and light to heavy traffic. An individual in this position:  ? Frequently remains stationary throughout a typical business day  ? Frequently operates a computer and other office machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and computer printer  ? Occasionally moves about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, and other rooms  ? Occasionally positions self to access drawers and shelves of various heights  ? Frequently reaches for and handles paperwork and files  ? Constantly communicates with customers, coworkers, and management in-person and on the phone  ? Must be able to exchange accurate information  Work Hours Monday through Friday  Part Time No  + FirstBank is an EOE/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law.  + Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here at http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm .  + FirstBank will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with FirstBank?s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-I.35(c)

Name: Quality/Business Analyst
Description: Position Title: Quality/Business Analyst Reports To: Technology Program Manager Location: Denver, CO  Connect for Health Colorado is the state-based health insurance marketplace and support network that allows individuals, families and small employers to compare and purchase health plans from companies including the major health plans in the state in a convenient way. We provide high quality customer assistance by phone and in person, as well as access to federal financial assistance to reduce the cost of health insurance. Our mission is to increase access, affordability, and choice for individuals and small employers purchasing health insurance in Colorado. Position Summary: The Quality/Business Analyst will be responsible for ensuring quality software is delivered to production by authoring business requirements, reviewing design documentation, authoring test scripts and executing test scenarios for multiple products. Will work closely with Connect for Health Colorados business stakeholders to identify potential system enhancements and triage production issues. Partner with operations teams on process improvement and provide support for critical efforts. Position Responsibilities:Author business requirements for multiple productsAdvocate for and act as a subject matter expert for multiple productsReview functional design documentation and author test scripts and scenarios for user acceptance testingUpdate and monitor test scripts, end to end test scenarios and user acceptance criteria for existing product functionalityIdentify and document defects, questionable behavior, errors and inconsistencies with application functionality. Monitor and track defect resolutionAttend regular project and team meetingsSupport multiple teams with critical projects and efforts resulting in broad organizational knowledge and system expertiseParticipate in and support the quality improvement initiatives throughout the organizationDemonstrate overall flexibility, creativity, and enthusiasm for the rolePosition Requirements:Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Information Technology or related fieldInformation Technology background/education preferred and/or quality or business analysis experience or work experience in quality/business analysis environmentExcellent Communication and interpersonal skillsDetail oriented and a creative problem solverProficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Word and ExcelAbility to learn quickly, work in a fast paced environment and be flexible and adaptable to changeAble to work independently without day to day directionTeam oriented with the ability to collaborate effectively with coworkers and project management teamAbility to maintain confidentiality of our system and highly sensitive informationKnowledge of health insurance industry preferredWork Environment:This is a full-time positionOn-site during office hours, typically 8am-5pmWork schedule may include some non-traditional hours, weekends and eveningsTypical office setting; the Connect for Health Colorado office is located in the Denver Tech Center, near the I-25 and I-225 exit.To Apply: Please include resume, cover letter, salary history, and three (3) references. No phone calls please. Connect for Health Colorado is an equal opportunity employer (EOE). Connect for Health Colorado may, at its discretion, conduct a background check on any workforce member and/or require job candidates to successfully complete a background check as a condition of employment. Job Type: Full-time

Name: Business Analyst - Peoplesoft
Description: Reach Your Peak at Vail Resorts. You're someone who pushes boundaries and challenges the status quo. You're brave, ambitious and passionate in everything you do. And we want you on our team. Pursue your fullest potential and never settle in the quest to deliver extraordinary guest service. Join one of the world's most innovative companies and re-imagine a mountain resort experience with us. Welcome to Vail Resorts. Reach Your Peak.Welcome to Vail Resorts. Reach Your Peak. The Senior Business Analyst plays a key role in relating and communicating technology initiatives in a business context. Responsible for conducting fit/gap analysis, partnering with the technical developers for the implementation of requested upgrades, enhancements, and changes to installed PeopleSoft HCM applications (Payroll for North America, Time and Labor). This person will lead design sessions, facilitate requirements gathering, document business needs for technical developers. This person will also be responsible for creating test plans, identifying test scenarios, writing and executing Quality Assurance scripts and identifying issues. Build customer confidence, be committed to increasing value and exceptional experiences for HR, Payroll, Benefits, and Time Entry.Ability to adapt to a rapidly growing organization while simultaneously looking for foundational improvements.Strong PeopleSoft experience in one or more of the following modules : Payroll and Time and LaborConfiguration and support of Payroll for North America, including Canadian payroll and year end processingDiagnose and resolve PeopleSoft system related questions to ensure the accuracy of business critical systems. Interact with database administrators, developers, and business system users in this effort.Work with outside vendors to develop and test new and modified interfaces. Troubleshoot production errors that are identified by vendors.Manage and participate in development of system test plans and acceptance criteria relating to enhancements, bug fixes, bundles and tax updates.Proactively identify bottlenecks and areas of opportunities. Make recommendations for potential process and/or system changes.Successfully utilize prior experience in applying methodology and best practices. Use standard techniques to elicit and document business requirements and effectively identify process inefficiencies and make suggestions for modifications.Facilitate the prioritization process across multiple stakeholders. Provide functional support of applications, working directly with clients in managing their requests, and translating functional requirements to technical specifications through hands-on analysis.Identify new ways to approach and complete Quality Assurance practices and documentation.Experience in PS conversions would be preferred We offer a variety of career opportunities at our world-class resorts and corporate headquarters near Boulder, Colorado in fields like Finance & Accounting, Human Resources, Information Technology, Legal, Public Affairs & Sustainability, Marketing, Sales & Communications and more. Our corporate team shares both a passion for the outdoors and a drive to re-imagine the mountain resort experience around the world. Learn more at www.vailresortscareers.com Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law. VRIT  Requisition ID 161332 Nearest Major Market: Denver

Name: Business Technology Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY:Responsible for assisting in technology integration. Oversees a company's current information technology (IT) systems to ensure that the company's technology-related goals are met and implements new IT systems. Business technology analysts are expected to work with, and improve upon, current systems while taking budgetary concerns into consideration.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:• Responsible for the creation and implementation of business processes, workflow, technology solutions and technology frameworks within a business organization. • Provide orientation and training to users on internal systems • Maintains and updates skills through formal and informal training opportunities. • Coordinate data integrations between systems. • Maintain IT asset inventory including the tracking and procurement of IT equipment • Follow business-specific standards relevant to various business industries when creating business/functional/system requirements. • Configure business rules and business/functional/system requirements for improvements or new additions to the current computer system. • Responsible for computer system maintenance policies such as Version Control, Form Management, Baseline Management, Change Management, and Release Management. • Responsible for maintenance and improvements/enhancements to the existing technology within a business organization.EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:• Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Computer related field.  • Five or more years of experience supporting end user systems.  • Three or more years of business analyst experience.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:• Take reasonable care of your own and others’ health and safety and of those who may be affected by the day-to-day delivery of this role by taking personal responsibility for working toward MasTec Power Corp.’s Zero Injury principles.• Read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.• Write reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals.• Effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers and the general public.• Strong analytical skills to provide timely solutions to a variety of issues.• Ability to work independently and escalate issues when appropriate.• Compile analyze and aggregate data.• Train users on IT systems.• Run user and system tests when needed.MasTec, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer. The Company's policy is not to unlawfully discriminate against any applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military status or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state, or local laws. The Company also prohibits harassment of applicants and employees based on any of these protected categories. It is also MasTec's policy to comply with all applicable state, federal and local laws respecting consideration of unemployment status in making hiring decisions.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Great-West Financial is currently recruiting a Business Systems Analyst for SAP. As part of our established SAP team. The chosen candidate will coordinate with users to determine functional and technical requirements, and ensure that SAP system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency. Ensures delivery satisfies system and business requirements. Provides on- going configuration and operational support for assigned SAP application modules. Support the configuration of new SAP company codes and related set up in support of new business initiatives.Configure and maintain SAP master data to include GL accounts, profit centers, accounting clerks, org updates, etc.Financial reporting support by updating or creating report writer/painter reports in SAP.Monthly financial reporting tasks to include the opening and closing of periods, updating exchange rates, etc.Gathers documents and analyzes system and business requirements for moderate to complex, multiplatform applications. Prepares detailed specifications from which new applications and system performance enhancements.Analyzes system and business need to effectively map business processes to SAP application modules.Test SAP application modules. Troubleshoots problems and recommends modifications to applications.Maintains requirements documentation, project tracking, and key stakeholder reporting metrics. May lead or direct projects of smaller scope.Other duties as assigned.May be assigned to on-call support rotation.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business or equivalent experience.Minimum of 2 years relevant SAP experience. Hands-on configuration experience required in SAP FI/CO, General Ledger Accounting (FI-G/L), Accounts Payable (FI-AP), Accounts Receivable (FI-AR), Fixed Asset accounting (FI-FA) modules.Desirable skills:Experience using SAP Solution Manager.Experience using Agile as method of delivering new Software Development.SAP FI-CA and/or FS-CD module experience is desired.SAP Report Painter and Report Writer experience is desired.

Name: Associate Analyst
Description: As an Associate Mutual Fund Analyst, you will work in the commissions group and report to the commissions supervisor. The commissions group is responsible for invoicing, collecting and reconciling all mutual fund servicing fees from fund families on behalf of our clients. The group handles payments remitted to clients or outside broker-dealers based on client instruction. The members of the commissions group are responsible for ensuring timely and efficient delivery of revenue to our clients, which include TPA's, banks and broker-dealers. Associates in this group must interact with a majority of the other teams at Matrix -- operational or otherwise -- which can provide opportunity for a variety of career paths.Coordinate with mutual fund families and clients to facilitate the tracking, collection and payment of commissions.Prepare and submit invoices to fund families for correct payment of commissions.Prepare, submit and track participant count requests with the customers.Reconcile commission reports and payments for various types of fees.Reconcile bank accounts.Maintain Sub-TA agreements between Customers and Funds.Demonstrate a thorough understanding of commission types and their impact.Research and resolve inquiries from fund families and customers regarding payment statuses.Meet monthly deadlines for processing invoices and other commission reports.Initiate payments to customers for admin fees.Initiate payments to outside brokers for 403b and level compensation business.Prepare and submit reports for supervisor.Assist on various projects within the group.EXPERIENCE: Typically requires a Bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2 years of related experience; or an advanced degree without experience; or equivalent work experience.Broadridge, a global fintech leader with over $4 billion in revenue, provides communications, technology, data, and analytics. We help drive business transformation for our clients with solutions for enriching client engagement, navigating risk, optimizing efficiency, and generating revenue growth.  Broadridge employs over 10,000 full-time associates globally with a significant presence in North America, Europe, and Asia. Please visit our website at www.broadridge.com to learn more.  Broadridge is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law. Click here to view the "EEO is the Law" poster.  "Our Associates Matter.  Everyone Benefits from Diversity & Inclusion.  Diverse & Inclusive Teams Drive Growth."

Name: ANALYST III - Business Tax Efile Analyst
Description: Department Information The Colorado Department of Revenue (CDOR) employs approximately 1,300 hard-working and dedicated employees throughout Colorado. We can be seen performing functions as varied as auditing and collecting taxes, issuing driver licenses and motor vehicle titles, marketing lottery products, enforcing liquor laws, and regulating gaming, horse racing, marijuana, and the auto industry and assisting the citizens of our state. At CDOR, we value Communication, Dedication, Ownership and Responsible Government.The Department of Revenue also offers:Strong, secure, yet flexible retirement benefits including PERA Defined Benefit Plan, PERA Defined Contribution Plan, State Defined Contribution plan plus 401K and 457 plans Medical and dental health plans Employer-supplemental Health Savings Account Paid life insurance Automatic short-term (and optional long-term) disability coverage 10 paid holidays per year Paid vacation and sick leave Discounted RTD Eco-Pass (Denver Metro locations) BenefitHub program for discounted merchandise, food and travel CafeWell employee wellness program Excellent work-life programs, such as some flexible work schedules, training and moreTo learn more about our benefits visit: https://www.colorado.gov/dhr/benefits Description of Job  The position is located in the Taxpayer Services Division/Electronic Filing Unit and exists to implement and advance electronic filing of business tax returns,including sales tax and other tax types, that are prepared and submitted using third party tax software or using other methods, such as spread sheet filing, that are devised to advance adoption of electronic filing. This position will analyze business tax statutory and form changes in order to update the data filing schemas for Colorado sales tax and other business taxes that are filed electronically. Provide the schemas and business rules to the Gentax developers and Gentax support group. coordinate with them on the installation and system testing of the schemas and rules. Monitor Gentax for performance issues and electronic returns that fail to process. Provide filing instructions to taxpayers and tax practitioners in order to resolve return filing issues. Respond to software provider and tax practitioner questions on taxability issues. Provide guidance to businesses wishing to being efiling. Run reports and communicate with the business tax accounting section and Discovery section to identify filing issues that could be prevented at the third party software level. Communicate with the software industry and propose upfront rules as needed to eliminate or reduce such issues.  Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Science, Finance or a related field at the the agencies discretion. AND two years of professional experience in business information operations which must include one year of testing and/or validating business information systems.(This professional experience MUST be detailed in the application. Failure to provide the above listed experience and/or "see resume" statements will not be accepted in lieu of a completed application).SubstitutionsA combination of work experience in Accounting, Auditing, Business, Management, Computer Management or Finance may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the Bachelor's degree.A Master's or Doctorate degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Science or Finance may substitute for the Bachelor's degree and one or two years of the experience, respectively. Preferred Qualifications and CompetenciesThe preferred candidates will possess a Master's degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Management or Finance; two years of xml schema design experience or two years of project management or two years of experience in testing and validating business systems or two years of system analysis and support for Gentax.  DOR REQUIRED SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: Competencies required for all DOR positions include good communications skills (both oral and written), interpersonal skills, the ability to multi-task, the ability to work with confidential information, the ability to work in high-stress environments, and the demonstrated ability to assist customers in an effective, efficient, and elegant manner.The following are conditions of employment with the Colorado Department of Revenue:1. All employees must be current with their Income Tax filings and payments with the State of Colorado. This includes successfully passing a pre-employment evaluation of your tax records/accounts.2. Employees are in a position of public trust in the performance of their job duties and must operate in a manner that maintains the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and public confidence. All job finalists require successful completion of a background investigation and reference check prior to appointment. Background checks may include national criminal, financial, traffic, civil, education, and/or experience checks or any other checks related to the job assignment. Fingerprint background checks and pre-employment drug testing may also be required for some positionsAPPEAL RIGHTS:If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination. Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging. Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb. A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination. Supplemental Information E-MAIL ADDRESS: All correspondence regarding your status in the selection/examination process will be conducted via e-mail. Include a working email address on your application; one that is checked often as time sensitive correspondence WILL take place via email. Exam information or notification will take place via email; check your email frequently. Please include your current e-mail address on your application and set up your e-mail to accept messages from "state.co.us" and "info@governmentjobs.com" addresses. It is your responsibility to ensure that your email will accept these notices and/or review your junk mail and spam filtered email. APPLICANT CHECKLIST: Only complete applications submitted by the closing date for this announcement will be given consideration. Failure to submit properly completed documents by the closing date of this announcement may result in your application being rejected.Applicants MUST submit a resume, cover letter/letter of interest and transcripts (if applicable) detailing how their experience and background address the stated minimum and preferred qualifications/competencies of the job (late submissions will not be accepted). Complete Applications must include the following documents:1) A complete CDOR Application for Announced Vacancy (Submit online using the link in this announcement)2) A complete Supplemental Questionnaire (Submit online as part of your application)3) A chronological resume (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted)4) A Cover Letter with a Written Narrative. The written narrative should describe your interest in this position and specifically how your education, abilities, skills and experience relate to the requirements, responsibilities and competencies listed in the job announcement. (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted)5) A copy of your official or unofficial transcript showing that your degree has been conferred and the name of your school, or your NACES accreditation (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted) MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS:The application will be used to determine if the applicant meets the Minimum Qualification requirements. The application, resume and cover letter/letter of interest are the first step in the comparative analysis process and will be used to determine whether an applicant will move on to the next step in the process.They may also be used to determine the top group to be invited for further testing, the applicants rank or establish an eligible list.Part of, or the entire comparative analysis for this position, may involve a review of the information submitted in the application material, including the answers to the supplemental questions. Therefore, it is paramount that in the experience portion of the application, the applicant describes the extent to which they possess the education, experience, competencies and background as they relate to the duties outlined in the job announcement, as well as the special and/or preferred qualifications. List your employment history starting with the most recent job, including part-time, temporary, and volunteer jobs. If more than one job was held with a given organization, list each job held as a separate period of employment. Under "Duties," describe clearly the tasks you performed and the nature of your supervisory, technical, or other responsibilities as they relate to the job for which you are applying. Be complete and specific in detailing of duties. Information must be accurate, including dates of employment. If it is found that information provided is falsified, you will not be considered for a job with the State of Colorado and/or may be removed from a job after hire. "See resume" statements will not be accepted in lieu of a properly competed application. Failure to include adequate information or follow instructions may affect the applicant's score and/or prevent them from competing in any subsequent measures used to arrive at a top group of applicants. Factors to be assessed are those outlined in the requirements, competencies, and preferred qualifications. Years will be expressed in terms of full-time equivalent service with full-time workload equal to one (1) Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) year. No more than 1.00 FTE year may be credited in any twelve (12) month period. Positions working 40 hours of less per week will be pro-rated (i.e. 30 hrs/wk=0.75 FTE=9 mos credit; 20 hrs/wk=0.5 FTE=6 mos credit; 10 hrs/wk=0.25 FTE=3 most credit

Name: Data Analyst
Description: We are looking for a bright and motivated individual to add expertise to our HR reporting and analytics team. In this role, you will get to go deep into the data that makes our organization run. You will pull together reports that include data extracts and along with your trend-spotting and analysis, you will make recommendations and provide guidance. Your data, analysis and reports will be instrumental in aiding leaders in the organization to make data driven decisions.In addition to the skills you will bring to the organization, you will be a part of a top-notch group of individuals who are passionate about providing a world-class healthcare solution for millions of people. You will be doing something good and giving back to the world – and that feels good. Here at DaVita Medical Group, we value people and the environment, and we strive to make the office a great and fun place to work. Come join us!ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:As a Human Resources Analyst, you will play a crucial role in building relationships with internal and external stakeholders to solve business problems by providing highly dynamic reporting, analyses and insights.Identify relationships and trends in data to uncover insightful findings.Extract data from various applications to conduct in depth analysisIdentify opportunities to automate / streamline reports, and redesign reports to include these efficiencies.Develops scorecards, dashboards, and reports that effectively depict information in a concise and actionable manner.Maintains data security for highly sensitive records, ensuring no data leaks outside its intended area.Manipulate, clean, analyze data from disparate data sources, and provide effective solutions to stakeholders.Other duties as required.CommunicationReports and summarizes results analyses, including information in the form of graphs, charts, tables, and PowerPoint, simplifying it into an executive-ready formatSummarizes insights, conclusions, and recommendations, and identify next stepsInterprets the meaning of information for others, translating or explaining what information means and how it can be usedAsks customers probing questions they may not think of, anticipating their needs and developing solutions to meet those needsTeach, educate, and coach teammates within People Services to help heighten the overall data acumen within the organizationJOB SPECIFICATIONSMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor’s Degree required in business, economics, engineering, finance, mathematics, statistics or other applicable quantitative or management related field.Experience with at least one scripting language such as R, Python, MATLAB etc.Strong background in using statistical concepts to analyze data.Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau and PowerBIAdvanced skills in Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint requiredExperience working with confidential dataExperience with data management and querying (SQL, SAS, SPSS, etc.).2+ year in a business environment, gathering and using data to solve business problems preferredComfortable working in a fast paced environment and comfortable with ambiguity.Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau and PowerBI.Experience working with diverse teams and managing relationships with clients.2+ year in a business environment, gathering and using data to solve business problems preferred.Strong written and verbal communication skills; experience collaborating on project teams, managing relationships with clients, and presenting to audiences a plusDaVita Medical Group manages and operates medical groups and affiliated physician networks in California, Colorado, Florida, Nevada, New Mexico, Pennsylvania and Washington. A leading independent medical group in America, DaVita Medical Group has over two decades of experience providing coordinated, outcomes-based medical care in a cost-effective manner. As of June 30, 2017, DaVita Medical Group’s teammates, employed clinicians and affiliated clinicians provided care for approximately 1.7 million patients. DaVita Medical Group’s leadership development initiatives and social responsibility efforts have been recognized by Fortune, Modern Healthcare, Newsweek and WorldBlu.

Name: Sr Functional/Business Analyst
Description: As a senior functional/business analyst, your primary role is to provide system support and to participate in projects involving the JDE financials, sales orders & distribution, and human capital management (HCM) modules. You will act as a JDE system expert, understand business requirements and provide system/technical solutions that meet the business requirements. You will coach other Enterprise Software & Data Services members and business stakeholders on key JDE functions and features. Configure JDE modules according to the defined business requirements, develop and execute test plans and scripts to ensure defect free solutions.Consult and coordinate with other members of the Enterprise Software & Data Services department, business experts, and IT infrastructure groups to design and develop solutions including automation of business processes.Develop functional and technical requirements and design for workflows, forms, reports, interfaces, conversions and system enhancements as they relate to JDE applications.Prepare and maintain all application documentations necessary to support development activities.Stay abreast of new JDE product development and make recommendations to management.Research bugs and enhancements in Oracle knowledge base and recommend solutions.Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Provide production support for the JDE application and related systems and interfaces.Provide application support for the end users assisting them in effectively using JDE.Handle JDE and enterprise software-related inquiries; formulate enterprise solutions.Be committed to providing excellent service to customers.Ensure high customer satisfaction with the use of JD Edwards.Participate in requirements gathering, design, configuration, testing and care for JDE and other enterprise software enhancements and/or new technology solutions.What You’ll Bring to UsStrong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills.Best practices from other companies and industries.Experience with JD Edwards EnterpriseOne financials, sales & distribution, and/or human capital management.Knowledge of other enterprise application software. Oracle CX and/or Kronos preferable.You are…Able to explain technical concepts to a broad audience.Highly attentive to detail.Able to work both independently and with others in collaborative teams to meet common business initiatives.Able to organize and prioritize your work.You have…5-7 years of experience providing JDE system analysis and production support. Prefer experience on JDE 9.1 or above.5 -7 years of experience working in financial, sales order & distribution and/or HCM modules as JDE functional analyst.Experience with BI publisher and other features of JD Edwards 9.1 or above.Experience in configuring JDE processing options for applications and batch jobs, understand JDE jobs/batches.Strong experience with various JDE integration tools: z/files, staging tables.Experience in supporting JDE system in a production environment including troubleshooting issues, performing root cause analysis, come up with work arounds where necessary and fixing the defects.System integration experience a plus.Experience with SQL a plus.Experience with other systems (e.g. Oracle CX, Kronos) a plus.BS in Accounting, Business, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, related fields or a combination of education and related work experience.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst III
Description: Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.SummaryResponsible for analyzing, evaluating and reporting of billing system operational performance metrics. Responsible for assisting in the design, implementation, and maintenance of reporting solutions; supporting end-to-end report development, management, and delivery of reporting solutions; interfacing between various business and technical teams to compile requirements and design solutions; work closely with customers to build relationships; and continuously gaining a deeper understanding of data contained in the repositories and use of the data in order to build solutions to meet business needs. Infers trends from a variety of data sources and confidently delivers their interpretation; makes recommendations to executives. Has in-depth experience, knowledge and skills in own discipline. Usually determines own work priorities. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience.Employees at all levels are expect to:- Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job- Own the customer experience-think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services- Know your stuff-be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences- Win as a team-make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas- Be an active part of the Net Promoter System-a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company-by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers- Drive results and growth- Respect and promote inclusion and diversity- Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communitiesCore Responsibilities- Analyze billing and end to end system ecosystem data to support High Speed Data Theft of Service (HSDTOS), Operations Audit and Cleanup and also IP and Video Theft of Service (VTOS) programs.- Performs all business intelligence analysis and data exploitation. Extracts signals and signatures from raw data, integrates that information with other data sources and compiles/disseminates formatted reports to customers.- Recommends improvements to competitive business intelligence reports and interpretation of data by sales, business development, product, and executive committees.- Plans and executes system testing. Requires knowledge of the customer's mission and technology used to accomplish a given task.- Leads the analysis and reconciliation of data and reporting projects and initiatives delivery.- Develops, maintains, and reports all relevant product, site, and customer metrics and applies findings to develop appropriate goals and projections.- Trains others throughout the organization in using key analytical and forecasting tools and statistical analysis.- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Education Level- Bachelors Degree or EquivalentField of Study- Business or relatedYears Experience- Generally requires 5-7 years related experience  Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Name: Health & Benefits Actuarial Analyst- Exchanges
Description: Posting DescriptionAon Is Looking For a Health Exchange Analyst As part of an industry-leading team, you will help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part of our Exchanges business group within Aon. This role is a virtual opportunity. Candidates can be based out of our Denver, CO or Chicago, IL office. Job Responsibilities:Data collection and review: feasibility studies; annual RFP processChecking and quality controlData & presentation formattingRisk Adjustment calculations and checkingFinancial modeling (including quality review) of medical and dental quoted rates vs. self-insured projectionsInitial bid analysis (including actuarial value modeling) to assist with the negotiation processData analytics supportAssistance with Defined Contribution modelingImplementation support to benefits administration teamsMiscellaneous supportParticipation in Health & Benefits practice sponsored and external training, to grow consulting acumenRequired Experience:Progress towards FSA/ASA designation (Fellow of the Society of Actuaries or Associate of the Society of Actuaries)Minimum one year of health and welfare experience (carrier or employer consulting) preferredGeneral understanding of the health insurance field and the healthcare reform legislationEducation: Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics & Business, or related fields. We offer you A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.  Our Colleague Experience: From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience.  About Aon: Aon plc (NYSE:AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.  By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.  Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.  DISCLAIMER: Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

Name: Business Operations Analyst - Audits & Exceptions
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent from four-year College or technical school, preferably in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Mathematics or Statistics, and 2+ years of related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience.Must be able to work as an individual contributor, as well as a member across a diverse group of teamsHave a great deal of initiative by being proactive and flexible through daily work and identifying creative solutions to produce resultsDemonstrate the ability to think strategically by planning and anticipating future implications, thinking broadly, and understanding the long term impacts of decisionsIntermediate-level skill and experience with Microsoft Office products, including Excel, Access, Word and Outlook The Business Operations Analyst will be part of a team heavily involved in billing operations and process improvement initiatives. A successful candidate will have strong written and verbal communication, as well as the ability to manage multiple assignments. Work will be a variable combination of data analysis, account auditing, and process improvement initiatives. Serve as Subject Matter Expert by fully understanding the process and the impact to the customer and overall businessAudit, monitor and prevent account exceptions to ensure customer inquiries are fulfilled timely and accuratelyDetect operational trends, determine root cause, and present findings and recommendations to a wide audience, including senior leadershipIdentify opportunities for process improvement to create efficiencies, improve the customer experience, and/or reduce costs LilyP

Name: Business Technology Analyst
Description: POSITION SUMMARY: Responsible for assisting in technology integration. Oversees a company's current information technology (IT) systems to ensure that the company's technology-related goals are met and implements new IT systems. Business technology analysts are expected to work with, and improve upon, current systems while taking budgetary concerns into consideration. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:Responsible for the creation and implementation of business processes, workflow, technology solutions and technology frameworks within a business organization.Provide Name: Data Visualization Analyst
Description: Kimetrica is seeking to recruit a Data Visualization Analyst to work on dashboards and visualization for web platforms aimed at supporting interactive decision-making. You are likely to have a keen interest in statistics, good design skills and the ability to find the right tools to convey complex information. A strong understanding of Business Intelligence would be advantageous and the ideal candidate will be able to craft dashboards to fit decision-making processes.  The applications include high-end interactive analytics, GIS and dashboard/visualization functionality. They serve humanitarian and international development communities, supporting decision-making on disaster management, project design and management and public policy. Current projects include tools for simulating the impacts of disasters and interventions, systems for monitoring evolving social and economic conditions in fragile states, and a significant web-based tool for geo-spatial analysis.  We are seeking a skilled and experienced visualization analyst to build user interfaces for Python/Django applications.  Key Tasks Work with clients and internal users to understand business logic and decision-making processes;Liaise with Kimetricas data scientists and subject specialists to find the optimal representations of data;Develop dashboards and visualizations using D3.js and SuperSetWork with Front End Developers to ensure seamless integration and design consistency Requirements Strong experience of data visualization tools (D3.js and/or MatPlotLib)A degree in statistics or a related disciplineExperience of developing visualizations for time-series and uncertainty analysisExperience with GIS and map visualizationsIdeally, a good working knowledge of PythonIdeally, experience in REACTjsStrong self-motivation and initiative with an ability to work with minimal supervisionIdeally experience of GitHub or GitLabExcellent CSS and HTML skillsWillingness to travel to Africa and Asia as required Location New York (Brooklyn area), Denver, Nairobi, Addis Ababa (or remotely) Perks Competitive salary Generous benefits package (health, dental, vision, 401K with match, vacation, holiday and sick leave)Dynamic, innovative and highly committed work environment focused on making a positive impact. About Kimetrica  Kimetrica is a social enterprise with a mission to increase the effectiveness of spending in the social sector. We provide software to support evidence-based humanitarian decision-making and learning. We help governments and non-profit organisations increase the impact and efficiency of their social investments, enhance accountability, manage critical risks, and build donor or taxpayer confidence. To learn more about Kimetrica click the link below and you will be directed to our LinkedIn homepage:  https://www.linkedin.com/company/kimetrica-international-limited/  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: data visualization tools (D3.js and/or MatPlotLib): 1 year (Required)

Name: Adoption Specialist - Fluency Direct (Business Analyst)
Description: Requisition Number 18-0104 Post Date 9/18/2018 Title Adoption Specialist - Fluency Direct (Business Analyst) City Denver State CO Description M*Modal is a fast moving technology company in the healthcare industry. Our portfolio of conversational speech recognition and natural language understanding technologies is widely recognized as the most advanced in the industry. We are a leading innovator  in the field of conversational documentation services (CDS) where speech recognition and natural language understanding are combined in a unique setup targeted to truly understand conversational speech and turn it into actionable and meaningful data.  We strive to “Close the Loop” in clinical documentation. Our cloud-based clinical documentation solutions connect workflows for efficient and accurate speech recognition, medical transcription, CDI, and coding. We facilitate physician-patient relationships  by making it easy for doctors to capture the patient story and by delivering information when it is needed most – at the point of care.  This position will be based out of Denver, CO. Job Description: The Fluency Direct Adoption Specialist is a member of a team that oversees the successful training and optimization of our front-end speech solution. The Adoption Specialist has primary responsibility in ensuring the optimal physician experience on initial  training of the Fluency Direct product. This person will also be responsible for the ongoing optimization of the solution within their customers’ environments. This requires regular analysis of data as well as communication to the customer regarding best practices  and optimization requirements. The position is also responsible for the onsite or virtual optimization deliverables which range from at-the-elbow physician education to workflow reviews in order to identify new opportunities for solution enhancements.  The Adoption Specialist will also act as a liaison between M*Modal Support and the customer, ensuring that appropriate followup is provided. The position will also serve as a liaison between M*Modal Development and the customer, being a voice of the customer  as it relates to product enhancements/issues.  The position requires an excellent working knowledge of clinical documentation workflows, specifically clinician-created documentation within an Electronic Medical Record (EMR). The Fluency Direct Adoption Specialist will be responsible for training within  various EMR systems, and must be able to learn new workflows and adapt the technology within a variety of applications. Key Responsibilities:At-the-elbow physician training on M*Modal’s Fluency Direct solutionOnsite or virtual customer train-the-trainer certificationsOngoing optimization of the Fluency Direct solution within various customer environmentsData analysis, with effective customer communication focused on how to improve results which will ultimately lead to higher physician satisfaction and adoption of the technology.Creation and development of strong client relationshipsOrganizing and supporting the identification of key customer objectives and outcomes as it relates to the Fluency Direct rolloutOffering assistance and information, and escalating problems to subject matter experts as required.Assisting clients in resolving / escalating technical issues to proper internal resources.Understanding and communicating features and benefits of products and services.Requirements Required Skills:Excellent training skills, both virtual and onsiteKnowledgeable in Electronic Medical Record (EMR) workflowsAbility to communicate and drive best practicesCustomer oriented with excellent communication skillsAbility to manage multiple customersAbility to problem solve quickly and effectivelyAbility to prioritize and follow through on requests and action itemsAbility to interpret technical instructions and communicate same to clients of various technical skill levelsAbility to follow through on problems and issues, creating procedures and tools to prevent future problemsRequired Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in HIM, management, or a related technical degree or equivalent experienceIn-depth knowledge of the health information industry as related to the physicianFamiliarity with EMR systems, implementation and physician training for sameTwo to three years of customer service or account management experienceTwo to three years of experience with speech recognition in the physician user domain is preferredApproximately 50% travel is required. Requirements • Bachelor’s degree in HIM, management, or a related technical degree or equivalent experienceIn-depth knowledge of the health information industry as related to the physicianFamiliarity with EMR systems, implementation and physician training for sameTwo to three years of customer service or account management experienceTwo to three years of experience with speech recognition in the physician user domain is preferredApproximately 50% travel is required.This company is an equal opportunity employer. All decisions concerning the employment relationship are made without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, marital status, veteran status, the presence of any physical or mental  disability, genetic information or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Discrimination or harassment based upon any of these factors is wholly inconsistent with our company values and will not be tolerated.Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP  here.

Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company’s clients. Effectively manages client’s expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development. Responsibilities:Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements.Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements.Research, identify, and specify solutions to problems.Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design.Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools.Support requirements management and change management processes.Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations.Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment.Education and Experience Required:Typically a Bachelor's degree in a technical or business discipline or equivalent experience.Minimum of 2 years of related experience or a Master's degree and up to two years of experience.Medicaid claims processing experience preferredinterChange MMIS processing preferred.Knowledge and Skills:2 or more years experience.Essential: requirements determination using structured techniques for documentation, analysis, evaluation/ validation; decomposition of high- level information into details; abstracting low- level information; distinguishing requests vs needs; distinguishing requirements vs. solutions; classifying/ prioritizing requirements; requirements change management and traceability; identifying risks; applying creativity to solving complex problems; building relationships and working collaboratively; effective verbal/ written communication; experience in an industry domain.Specialized: developing structured user manuals and training; business rules modeling; develop and executing acceptance test plans.

Name: Strategy & Performance Analyst/Consultant
Description: Location(s): CO - Denver  Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you're looking for. Position Summary We have an exciting opportunity for a Strategy & Performance Analyst or Consultant to support our security organization! This successful candidate will support strategic planning initiatives, security education programs, training, and special projects. They will also support and coordinate the delivery of strategy and planning special projects in alignment of business area activities, enterprise initiatives and objectives. In addition, they will provide analytical support in the development and delivery of impactful metrics and other analytics. Based on the level of the successful candidate, we are hiring at either an Analyst or Consultant level.  Essential Responsibilities Functional or Departmental Support: Prepares presentations and compiles department or function wide information, such presentations for leadership meetings and compiling weekly reports. Supports leaders by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting data and other information used in conjunction with decision making for strategy development and planning.Communication: Prepares effective strategic communications around all program activities. Determines which communication strategy or method will most successfully communicate different types of information based on corporate guidelines and geared to the intended audience. Partners with the team, business area leaders, and Corporate Communications to ensure successful communication strategy implementation.Help lead special projects: Assist in supporting project planning, such as Knowledge Fairs, Escape Rooms, etc. Taking the lead to plan original ideas for events and research venues, contacts and suppliers. Track and report project deliverables, and documentation to support key initiatives. Provides technical expertise and analytical guidance. May participate on cross-functional teams or projects for business area or companywide initiatives.Analytics/Metrics/Reporting: For the Consultant level, utilizes business area systems and data to deliver impactful metrics and other analytics and/or automated solutions. Analyze data and prepares reports that illustrate progress of plans against business results. Responds to requests for ad hoc analysis by leveraging data and information to independently create requested metrics and reports. Manages to the established reporting deadlines.Analysis: Supports the business area process by partnering with Security Operations leadership team in preparing, developing, analyzing, implementing security initiatives. Works in liaison with business area leaders to review budget estimates, variances, and suggesting changes as appropriate. Outlines the budget process and provides or creates templates that will be used during the cycle. Reports performance against budget on a periodic or ongoing basis. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in business administration or related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience.At least two years related experience. For the Consultant level, 5 years of related experience is required.Has basic knowledge of strategic planning, business management, and social media.Basic knowledge of strategy and with business and operational performance measures and meeting financial objectives (Consultant level)Strong organization and problem-solving skills. Strong technical background in Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, FrontPage).Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to effectively use a variety of communication methods such as through print, presentations, and websites.Experience with event planning.Exceptional interpersonal and collaboration skills, capable of working with teams. Preferences For the Consultant level: previous experience with data analytics and metrics reporting is strongly preferred. As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you're ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.
