Name: Investment Analyst
Description: Info about the Group/Company  Envestnet is a leading independent provider of technology-enabled, web-based investment solutions and services to financial advisors. The Investment Management and Research (IM&R) group supports Envestnet's proprietary asset management business as well as institutional wealth management platforms and independent RIAs with asset allocation and risk management tools and third-party manager selection and due diligence.  We offer a highly competitive compensation and benefits package as well as the excitement, challenges, and rewards of a fast-growing, entrepreneurial company. Join us!  Job Introductory Statement  Envestnet|PMC provides investment research and technology solutions to the wealth management industry. We are currently seeking an Investment Analyst to join our team. The Investment Analyst position will reside within Envestnet's dedicated Strategist Research Group one of the industry's first research groups focused on conducting investment research and due diligence on third-party strategist managers. Strategist managers create unique portfolio solutions comprised of exchange traded funds, mutual funds, or a combination of exchange traded funds and mutual funds. Strategist portfolio investment options range from multi-asset, risk-based portfolio solutions to niche, tactical portfolio strategies. Responsibilities The Investment Analyst's primary responsibility is to conduct investment research and due diligence on third-party strategist management firms and their respective investment products. Unique from other traditional investment due diligence roles, this role requires a deep knowledge and experience of traditional manager research and due diligence, along with familiarity of global capital markets and understanding of asset allocation and multi-asset investments. Candidates must possess the skill-set to combine traditional and non-traditional elements of investment research and due diligence in analyzing comprehensive portfolio solutions. The Investment Analyst is expected to become an expert on their assigned coverage, provide detailed insights on actively covered strategists on a stand-alone and peer group comparison, as well as interpret the major performance drivers using advanced investment research techniques. ? This mid-level opportunity will primarily involve writing regular analyst opinions and market updates, conducting manager searches, as well as producing educational and competitive intelligence content. The Investment Analyst is expected to become an expert on their assigned coverage, provide detailed insights on actively covered strategists on a stand-alone and peer group comparison, as well as interpret the major performance drivers using advanced investment research techniques. The Investment Analyst will play a vital role in updating internal and external clients on key features and benefits on strategist managers and their respective product suites, as well as pro-actively interpret and communicate significant updates to clients in a timely and concise way. The individual is expected to partner closely with internal sales, consultant, and portfolio management teams. Qualifications Envestnet/PMC is looking for individuals with demonstrated records of success who will be able to make a meaningful and immediate contribution to our team. Our ideal candidates will be an entrepreneurial self-starter with a solid understanding of the following concepts: Investment manager research and due diligenceGlobal capital marketsAsset AllocationPortfolio ConstructionRetail investment products (mutual funds, exchange traded funds, managed accounts)Familiarity with Morningstar DirectWritten and verbal communication skillsKnowledge of financial services industryRequirements Education: A bachelor's degree is required, preferably in finance or economics, along with superior writing and communications skills. A minimum of three to five years of prior manager due diligence experience is highly preferred, though a longer (more than five years) career in the financial services industry may be considered. A Master's degree or significant progress towards the CFA designation is also highly preferred.  Apply On-lineSend This Job to a Friend  Copyright © Ultimate Software

Description: Factions culture encourages and cultivates an entrepreneurial spirit every day, and embodies out-of-the-box thinking, which all translate to our company values: We are genuine; We are innovators; We are relentless problem solvers; We are passionate about client delight; We are radically transparent; We are a professional team, and we do our best thinking with a shared beverage. Name: Credit Risk Reporting Analyst
Description: Location(s): CO - DenverAre you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.Position SummaryPerforms credit risk reporting, including Delivered but Not Paid (DNP), Mark to Market (MTM), credit risk limit and posting risk models. Assists in preparing report outs for senior management. Coordinates and reconciles agreement MTM. Develops and maintains energy commodity market knowledge and intuition about proprietary portfolio. Assists in periodic fundamental credit risk analysis and coordination with Treasury. Assists with credit reviews to maintain appropriate credit lines.Essential ResponsibilitiesRun credit risk reports, perform annual creditworthiness reviews to maintain appropriate credit lines, highlight key concerns, ensuring concerns are addressedAssist in periodic fundamental credit risk analysis, work with counterparty credit groups to identify business intelligence, as well as daily reconciliations between credit agreement MTM and required collateral provisioning; coordinate with Treasury to ensure collateral transfers match collateral requirements. Experienced using Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.Demonstrated attention to detail.Strong quantitative skills.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Ability to develop and maintain professional relationships both internal and external to the firm. Name: Operations Data & Reliability Analyst
Description: Location(s): CO - Denver; MN - Minneapolis; TX - Amarillo; WI - Eau ClaireAre you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.Position Summary The Operations Organization requires various work groups to assess and manage the performance of assets and systems pertaining to the Company’s electric transmission and distribution systems. To accomplish this business need, the implementation and management of data systems is critical to support the advanced data capture, extraction, analysis and reporting required for both regulatory compliance and business planning requirements.The Operations Data & Reliability Analyst supports the development, implementation, and management of analytical tools that facilitate data extraction and reporting. These tools typically focus on the capture, maintenance and analysis of data elements and work processes supporting the business needs of the Operations Organization. This position supports efforts to create or enhance efficient processes while ensuring data accuracy and consistency for both operational and regulatory requirements across the Xcel Energy enterprise. Provides technical support to other departmental staff positions as needed, including periodic process or reporting backup, as needed.Essential Responsibilities a) Synthesizes volumes of data into work plans, forecasts, reporting, and data request responses related to asset, data, and other systems within the Operations organization. Performs data quality testing and provides data visualizations for presentation purposes.  b) Performs extraction and advanced analysis of operational, asset, performance, and financial data from multiple corporate systems utilizing a variety of query and analysis applications.  c) Development, implementation and maintenance of databases, database queries, and data analysis/visualization tools that support the Operations organization, including but not limited to regulatory, compliance, and corporate reporting through efficient, consistent, complete work processes, including automation of repetitive tasks.  d) Provides detailed data analysis, and is responsible for providing efficient, rapid, accurate and complete responses to routine and ad hoc requests by compiling data and creating presentation materials from own work and work of others for reporting and presentation requests, both internal and external.  e) Assumes any additional responsibilities or duties that may be required during special studies to ensure effective operation of the department, including backup support to critical department processes.  f) Acts as business area expert for major applications development and continuous improvement. Influences management and technical staff regarding the content and functionality of business applications. Minimum Requirements •Associate's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Engineering (or combination of education experience providing equivalent knowledge in data management, analysis or statistics)•2-3 years related work experience demonstrating advanced level knowledge in Microsoft Office applications (Excel,Access,PowerPoint,Word)•2-3 years related work experience demonstrating advanced level ability to author, develop, debug, and deliver applications using Microsoft Visual Basic or SAPDesired:•Bachelor's degree egree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business or Engineering•Technical data system development and advanced analysis with related experience in data management, analysis, or statistics•Knowledge and experience in utility operations and related system application•Knowledge of Microsoft Visio, Business Objects and department-specific applications•Strong analytical interpretational skills along with experience with database structures, query and report building, data analysis, data research, data requirements development, flowcharting, graphing and technical writing desired•Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to manage and accurately prioritize multiple projects concurrently with minimal supervision while meeting schedules and deadlines to assure successful results•Strong communication skills and assertiveness to ask insightful questions and learn industry-specific terminologyAs a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you’re ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.Posting Notes: CO - Denver || CO - Denver; MN - Minneapolis; TX - Amarillo; WI - Eau Claire || United States (US) || Utilities Group || 41419:XES Engineering Operations || Full-Time || Non-Bargaining ||Requisition Number: 16225Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/VeteranIndividuals with a disability who need an accommodation to apply please contact us at recruiting@xcelenergy.com

Name: Entry Level Financial Reporting Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionRussell Tobin is seeking an Entry Level Banking Operations Analyst to work with a client on a contract to full time opportunity in Centennial, CO.  The Securities Analysis Representative analyzes new securities for appropriate accounting treatment and maintains security information in the accounting system. The position provides support to senior team members and managers in connection with fund holdings and general fund security information and also completes various projects as assigned by the Securities Analysis Manager/Seniors. The position also provides support to various teams in relation to securities/holdings.  Analyzes all securities as to income, amortization, gain/loss, market prices, tax and book treatment.  Addresses routine items with other groups within the Fund Accounting, Middle Office Operations and Fund Administration departments. Assists with the research process for payment deviations and devise solutions using the Invest One accounting system  Assists with Securities Analysis projects as needed including (but not limited to) yield analysis, original issue discount, and market discount/premium.  Generates and maintains various daily and monthly reports used for Financial Reporting and Fund Tax department.  Assists client with all questions regarding yields, interest, accretion, amortization, and payments.  Assures all external and internal customer requests are processed in a timely manner.  Backs up other Securities Analysis Representatives’ desks as needed.  Communicates appropriately with the Senior Securities Analysis Representatives with respect to all timetables and workflow, and communicating to the extent appropriate, all relevant matters with other department members.  Requirements:  Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics or Accounting  6 Months internship experience within the Financial SectorCompany DescriptionRussell Tobin, one of the nation’s leading professional recruitment and staffing advisory firms, offers a tailored approach to helping organizations connect with direct hire and contract employees across a variety of skill-sets and industries. Having a depth and breadth of industry expertise, our talent advisers and recruitment specialists are able to provide customized and swift solutions to fulfill client and candidate hiring needs. We work with each and every candidate to assess their respective goals and subsequently build a comprehensive and transparent road-map for achieving a successful placement. We take great pride in cultivating an open and honest relationship with our clients and candidates in an effort to create a long-term relationship.Our dedication to results, along with our reputation built on a consistent and successful track record of placing candidates, enables us to continuously provide best-in-class services. Russell Tobin is a division of Pride Global, a minority-owned integrated human capital solutions firm headquartered in New York with operating companies throughout the United States, Canada, India and Brazil. Pride Global companies focus on a diverse array of services including vendor management, payroll programs, business process optimization, and staffing for both direct hire and contingent labor. Follow Russell Tobin on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RussellTobin/Follow Russell Tobin on Instagram: @russelltobin

Name: 2019 Project Analyst I - Campus
Description: Title 2019 Project Analyst I - Campus  29-Nov-2018 Job DescriptionTravelport is the only true travel commerce platform in the world. We are specialist solution providers and are committed to building leading technology that makes the experience of buying and managing travel continually better for the global travel and tourism industry. Come and be part of our mission to make sure that every trip is powered by Travelport… Are you looking for an exciting place to jumpstart your career? Do you feel passionate about innovative technology? If so, then we could be the place for you.  As a Project Analyst at Travelport, you can thrive in the exciting world of Travel Tech.  This Analyst position will involve… Support gathering of business requirements, analyzing and documenting these for a product/tool or a subset of an internal business systemDocumenting requirements according to enterprise standards/tools (eg: Jira)Capturing use cases required by the business stakeholder in an agile delivery environment, the Project Analyst may support product owners writing user stories/epics and creating requirements for delivery of solutionsContributing to the translation of business requirements into functional and support the onward process of creation of technical specifications for functions within a product/subset of business systemCreating test plans and acceptance criteria for review by senior colleagues and attending meetings with delivery teams to fully understand Travelport SDLC and the Change LifecycleParticipating in UAT as requiredParticipating in continuous reviews to ensure acceptance criteria is met and the solution meets assigned project objectives/expectationsPresenting ideas to improve product/subsystem design/workflowsWorking with internal departments as requested to correct poorly structured or inaccurate data/processesRegularly seeking review and feedback of work activities under overall guidance of line manager Come and join us…  To ensure we achieve our goal, you will join us in embracing our core values; Be a player, not a spectator; You will take ownership and make things happen.Think we, not me; We are One Travelport, collaborating to succeed.Keep it simple; We’re straightforward and easy to do business with.Build for tomorrow; You will challenge the norm, aim high and lead change. You’ll be an innovator, passionate, accountable and solutions focused, not to mention adaptable, hungry for a challenge and an individual who thrives on partnering. All of these combined with the below capabilities are what will make us such a bold and compelling organization. You:0-2 years of project analysis or related experienceHas training and basic knowledge of job function principles, theories, and concepts to complete clearly documented requirements for supervised assignments/scopeHas basic knowledge of SDLC including Agile methodology, business, and technology operationsDegree in Computer Science, Business or Statistics or equivalent (major course of study is role dependent)Fast learner with strong analytical and problem-solving skillsFamiliarity with one or more programming languages desirable (Java, SQL etc)Familiar with SDLC / Agile methodology and processes and the Change LifecycleFamiliar with service analysis and design eg: ITILIdeally some knowledge of Business Process Discovery methods and tools (Different approaches, Workshops, Interviews, etc)Ideally some knowledge of relevant tools for Requirements Management (eg: Jira) and Project Mgmt tools (eg: PPM) If this sounds like you, we’d love for you to get in touch.  What’s in it for you?  You will receive a competitive salary & benefits package accompanied with the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, dynamic and progressive organization that cares about its people and promotes innovation.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Applicants for this position must have work authorization that does not now or in the future requires Company sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.Auto req ID6304BREmployee type Employee Employment type Regular - Full Time Office locationUS - ATLANTA - DATA CENTER, US - ATLANTA - HQ, US - DENVER - ENGLEWOODFunctional Area Technology Experience Required None Education Required Bachelors Degree

Name: Technical Implementation Consultant - Analyst
Description: Position: Technical Implementation Consultant 2019 Overview: Recognized on the Inc. 5000 fastest growing companies in the US, Peloton is one of the largest and fastest growing professional services firms specializing in Integrated Cloud Solutions for Enterprise Resource Planning, Enterprise Performance Management, and Big Data and Analytics. At the core of who we are – we believe that business analytics is changing the competitive landscape. Companies that are equipped with the right information, have the know-how, and the enabling technology to consistently leverage analytics will gain a competitive advantage.  Our company provides an opportunity to work with consulting professionals in a collaborative, stimulating, entrepreneurial environment. Where individuals look forward to arriving at work each day, are recognized and appreciated, and are allowed to move boundaries and take calculated risks for greater success. Our teams partner with business leaders to develop unique and innovative solutions that generate real business results. Beyond results, we also strive to make every engagement educational and fun. Yes – fun! We really like what we do and we let it show.  If you are interested in being part of our high performing and growing organization – and have strong passion for business and/or technical consulting; especially as related to analytics, enterprise performance management, cloud solutions, or information management – you may be a good fit for our team. Our proven innovative approach to accelerate solution deployment and enhance value through experiential learning delivers solutions that assure quality and adoption. Join the revolution and lead organizations on a journey to compete in the 21st century!  Specific responsibilities include:Defining business requirements and providing recommendations to resolve client pain pointsContributing to team brainstorms and effectively communicating informationDesigning, prototyping, and building technical solutionsConducting system integration testing and user acceptance testingDelivering end user training and conducting knowledge transfer sessions with the clientDeveloping Peloton knowledge assets and intellectual propertyRequired Experience and Skills:Qualified candidates must have a BS or BA degree in Finance, Business/ Consulting, Technology, or equivalentExcellent analytical and problem solving skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsEagerness to work in a team oriented environment, high levels of initiative and driveProficient in Microsoft Excel and AccessAbility to quickly understand and decompose financial and technical conceptsExposure to technologies: web (Java, HTML, Python), relational database (Oracle, SQL), reporting, or data analysis/data miningAbility and willingness to travel within the United States Compensation:Competitive Base Salary and Performance BonusMedical, Dental, and Vision Insurance401K with a supporting company matchFlexible SpendingTechnical and Business Skills TrainingPaid Holidays and Vacation DaysDiscounts on Pet Insurance Peloton Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, genetics, or veteran status.

Name: Program Financial Analyst
Description: Job Description: Leidos has a career opportunity for a Program Finance Analyst to provide program support in Chantilly, VA. The Program Finance Analyst is responsible for planning, tracking, analysis, and reporting on projects of various contract type, size, complexity, and level of risk. Individuals in this role have significant interface with Project Managers, Contracts, Senior Technical Personnel, as well as other organizations. Individual will work directly with the program manager to help define the program's goals; create and maintain a program's budget, schedule and prepare EAC. They will prepare and present financial forecasts, reports and help with new business proposals for the customer. External referral eligible Implementation of financial policies and procedures in support of projects; establishment and maintenance of cost/schedule baselines, development of WBS and budgets based on program requirements;- Managing subcontractor hours and costs and assessing funding needs;- Ensuring all financial deliverables are submitted; communicating with the customer to ensure financial requirements are met;- Preparation of written and verbal reports to management regarding financial metrics including cost and schedule variances; program life-cycle activities such as project setup/ maintenance;- Internal financial activities such as invoicing support, accruals, and program financial revenue projections and variance analysis;- Development and maintenance of Estimates at Completion (EACs);- Participation in proposals through BOE support, cost modeling and providing input into cost volumes. - Requires a BA degree and 2 - 4 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 years of prior relevant experience;- Active TS/SCI Clearance (CI Poly a plus)- Comprehensive knowledge of the Program Finance Field and the ability to complete difficult and complex assignments- Basic knowledge of multiple contract types: FFP, T&M, CPFF and CPAF- Strong analytical, communication, and presentations skills, and the ability to operate independently- Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly strong in MS Excel.

Name: Collections Analyst
Description: From day one, experience our difference. Our internal firm services focuses on the firm’s critical business needs. From marketing to internal accounting and everything in between, our integrated solution approach is designed to help enable and manage growth, leverage resources, and mitigate firm operations. At Plante Moran, we have a privilege of serving clients and providing consultative services as they face challenges and seek new opportunities. Your role. Your work will include: Coordinate client collections activities, including notifying partners of delinquent status, collecting accounts by assessing complex situations to develop solutions and successfully obtain payment.Maintain and monitor account payments along with documentation of all collections activity by leveraging available record keeping functionality in firm systems, workflows and forms in accordance with firm policy and procedure.Prepare, interpret and deliver ad-hoc reports to key stakeholders and management related to a variety of collection situations.Analyze major accounts and synthesize findings regarding financial activity to explain and interpret accounting/financial information presented.The qualifications.Requires 3+ years of collections experience. Experience with Accounts Receivable will be beneficial.Associate’s degree strongly preferred; will consider commensurate experience.Experience working within a professional services firm collection department is highly preferred.Exposure to Promissory Note coordination, payment planning, and bankruptcy and litigation activities is desired.Ability to coordinate information flow with multiple sources (Management, Partnership, team, staff, etc.) and effectively influence and implement collections strategies.Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to build relationships with firm leadership and partners, as well as maintain high levels of customer service to our clients.Our difference. We are a nationally recognized public accounting, consulting, and wealth management firm, consistently ranked as one of FORTUNE magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For.” At Plante Moran, we live by the Golden Rule, fostering a relatively “jerk-free” culture with the lowest staff turnover rate in the industry. Our supportive network of well-rounded professionals is excited to catapult your growth and help pave your pathway to professional excellence.  Apply now. Experience our difference.  This is an exempt position, so you may have to work hours that exceed the standard 40-hour work week. Plante Moran is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse workplace. Interested applicants must submit their resume for consideration using our applicant tracking system. Due to the high volume of applications received, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship, with the exception of candidates that are bilingual in Japanese and English. Unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, or similar, will not be paid a fee and become the property of Plante Moran.  The specific statements above are not intended to be all-inclusive.

Name: Adoption Specialist - Fluency Direct (Business Analyst)
Description: Requisition Number 18-0104 Post Date 9/18/2018 Title Adoption Specialist - Fluency Direct (Business Analyst) City Denver State CO Description M*Modal is a fast moving technology company in the healthcare industry. Our portfolio of conversational speech recognition and natural language understanding technologies is widely recognized as the most advanced in the industry. We are a leading innovator  in the field of conversational documentation services (CDS) where speech recognition and natural language understanding are combined in a unique setup targeted to truly understand conversational speech and turn it into actionable and meaningful data.  We strive to “Close the Loop” in clinical documentation. Our cloud-based clinical documentation solutions connect workflows for efficient and accurate speech recognition, medical transcription, CDI, and coding. We facilitate physician-patient relationships  by making it easy for doctors to capture the patient story and by delivering information when it is needed most – at the point of care.  This position will be based out of Denver, CO. Job Description: The Fluency Direct Adoption Specialist is a member of a team that oversees the successful training and optimization of our front-end speech solution. The Adoption Specialist has primary responsibility in ensuring the optimal physician experience on initial  training of the Fluency Direct product. This person will also be responsible for the ongoing optimization of the solution within their customers’ environments. This requires regular analysis of data as well as communication to the customer regarding best practices  and optimization requirements. The position is also responsible for the onsite or virtual optimization deliverables which range from at-the-elbow physician education to workflow reviews in order to identify new opportunities for solution enhancements.  The Adoption Specialist will also act as a liaison between M*Modal Support and the customer, ensuring that appropriate followup is provided. The position will also serve as a liaison between M*Modal Development and the customer, being a voice of the customer  as it relates to product enhancements/issues.  The position requires an excellent working knowledge of clinical documentation workflows, specifically clinician-created documentation within an Electronic Medical Record (EMR). The Fluency Direct Adoption Specialist will be responsible for training within  various EMR systems, and must be able to learn new workflows and adapt the technology within a variety of applications. Name: Business Analyst - Peoplesoft
Description: Reach Your Peak at Vail Resorts. You're someone who pushes boundaries and challenges the status quo. You're brave, ambitious and passionate in everything you do. And we want you on our team. Pursue your fullest potential and never settle in the quest to deliver extraordinary guest service. Join one of the world's most innovative companies and re-imagine a mountain resort experience with us. Welcome to Vail Resorts. Reach Your Peak.  Welcome to Vail Resorts. Reach Your Peak.  The Senior Business Analyst plays a key role in relating and communicating technology initiatives in a business context. Responsible for conducting fit/gap analysis, partnering with the technical developers for the implementation of requested upgrades, enhancements, and changes to installed PeopleSoft HCM applications (Payroll for North America, Time and Labor). This person will lead design sessions, facilitate requirements gathering, document business needs for technical developers. This person will also be responsible for creating test plans, identifying test scenarios, writing and executing Quality Assurance scripts and identifying issues. Build customer confidence, be committed to increasing value and exceptional experiences for HR, Payroll, Benefits, and Time Entry.Ability to adapt to a rapidly growing organization while simultaneously looking for foundational improvements.Strong PeopleSoft experience in one or more of the following modules : Payroll and Time and LaborConfiguration and support of Payroll for North America, including Canadian payroll and year end processingDiagnose and resolve PeopleSoft system related questions to ensure the accuracy of business critical systems. Interact with database administrators, developers, and business system users in this effort.Work with outside vendors to develop and test new and modified interfaces. Troubleshoot production errors that are identified by vendors.Manage and participate in development of system test plans and acceptance criteria relating to enhancements, bug fixes, bundles and tax updates.Proactively identify bottlenecks and areas of opportunities. Make recommendations for potential process and/or system changes.Successfully utilize prior experience in applying methodology and best practices. Use standard techniques to elicit and document business requirements and effectively identify process inefficiencies and make suggestions for modifications.Facilitate the prioritization process across multiple stakeholders. Provide functional support of applications, working directly with clients in managing their requests, and translating functional requirements to technical specifications through hands-on analysis.Identify new ways to approach and complete Quality Assurance practices and documentation.Experience in PS conversions would be preferred We offer a variety of career opportunities at our world-class resorts and corporate headquarters near Boulder, Colorado in fields like Finance & Accounting, Human Resources, Information Technology, Legal, Public Affairs & Sustainability, Marketing, Sales & Communications and more. Our corporate team shares both a passion for the outdoors and a drive to re-imagine the mountain resort experience around the world. Learn more at www.vailresortscareers.com  Vail Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law. Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: OVERVIEW The Senior Analyst, Clinical Analytics will work as part of a highly  strategic and crucial team that supports DaVita s home dialysis  patients and field operations. This individual is a key member of the  team that is responsible for all aspects of clinical reporting and  statistical analysis. This role has three primary responsibilities: 1)  Drive process from beginning to end to solve complex clinical problems  using sophisticated statistical and logical analyses, 2) Produce all  team s clinical reporting, and 3) Ad hoc analyses as requested. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The Senior Analyst of Clinical Analytics must be able to work  successfully with cross-functional teams and provide insights to  executives across departments. The following duties and  responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position  but are not intended to be all inclusive: Work collaboratively with the Clinical Enterprise and IT teams to drive analytic projects from start to completion. Work collaboratively with data analysts, clinicians, and operators to identify opportunities to add value through advanced analytics. Integrate disparate data sets, conduct exploratory analysis, and produce actionable insights for clinical intervention and  risk-based contracting. Help drive the development of next-generation reporting and business intelligence tools, working closely with internal IT  teammates and external vendors. Design and implement predictive models to project patient outcomes dependent on demographic and clinical care variables. Storyboard, stress test, and articulate arguments to key decision-makers. Enhance data visualization capabilities to communicate findings from complex analyses. Serve as an in-house data expert and teach data science techniques to fellow teammates. Commit to continued professional growth and development as well as ensure and contribute to the growth and development of the team s  junior personnel. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSAdvanced degree (Masters or higher) preferred in applied math, statistics, computer science, or related field Minimum two years of experience integrating disparate data sets and producing statistical analyses using SAS, SPSS, R, Angoss or  other programs Experience in network data science, tree-based approaches, time series analysis, cluster analysis, and predictive model-building  process. Experience in healthcare, specifically analyzing clinical data or medical claims Experience with SQL and managing relational databases for regular and ad hoc reporting Database maintenance including custom views and tablesExperience with other programming languages, preferably PythonESSENTIAL BEHAVIORS, SKILLS, AND ATTITUDES REQUIRED FOR SUCCESS INTHIS POSITIONCommitment to DaVita's values of Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfillment and Fun Effective communication skills - verbal and writtenStrong analytical skills - the ability to accurately perform complex quantitative analyses and quickly learn new data  management processes Focus on analytical process improvementEnergetic team playerConfident self-starter with positive attitude and driveAbility to multi-task and consistently meet deadlinesProblem solver who works well independently and in team environments Successful candidates will have interest and strengths in competitive strategy and innovation  Here is what you can expect when you join our Village A "community first, company second" culture based on Core Values that really matter. Clinical outcomes consistently ranked above the national average.Award-winning education and training across multiple career paths to help you reach your potential. Performance-based rewards based on stellar individual and team contributions. A comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance your health, your financial well-being and your future. Dedication, above all, to caring for patients suffering from chronic kidney failure across the nation.

Name: Benefits and Compensation Analyst
Description: BREAK GROUND ON A REWARDING CAREER WITH US!Just like cement serves as the foundation of the homes we build, our employees are the foundation of our business. From the gifted architects who design our homes to the dedicated associates who sell them, our employees are talented, enthusiastic and driven to help us fulfill our mission: making the dream of home ownership a reality across the nation. We encourage a company culture that promotes the following basic tenants: Professionalism, teamwork, health and wellness and work-life balance. If you have a passion for success, the desire to join a highly talented organization and a calling to help people achieve their dream of homeownership, consider building a career with us!The foundation… We are seeking a qualified Benefits & Compensation Analyst to join our Human Resources team. This position is responsible for administering all health and welfare plans. Assists in the design, implementation and management of cost effective and competitive Total Rewards programs, and ensures compliance of such plans with various government and benefit regulations and statutes. Serves as the subject matter expert in responding to employee questions. Core ResponsibilitiesBenefits (80%):Responsible for day to day administration of all health and welfare plans.Act as first point of escalation for employeesAssist with the development of employee communication materials Manages all leave of absences and works with the disability TPAManages the company’s wellness programAssist in the management of the Annual Open Enrollment and Annual Health FairAudit and ensure timely processing and payment of all benefit invoicesAudit employee benefit deductions and make system corrections as neededCoordinates COBRA programWorks closely with Payroll team in processing biweekly deduction wires. Works closely with HRIS Analyst to process benefit enrollments and manage eligibility files.Compensation (20%):Completes market surveys and monitors the quality of market pay data to support Division and Corporate needs relating to competitiveness, best practices and internal equity.Manages monthly bonuses for HMC (mortgage company).Assists with quarterly production bonusesThe tools for success…Minimum Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. 3-5 years related experience with a strong emphasis on benefits.Experience: Knowledge of laws and regulations related to employee benefits (e.g., PPACA, ADA, FMLA, COBRA, ERISA, HIPAA, etc.). Strong HRIS skills (UltiPro experience preferred).Ability to effectively communicate with employees regarding benefit plans and enrollment procedures. Demonstrated ability to read and accurately interpret Summary Plan Descriptions, Plan Documents, and policy and procedure manuals. Project management experience should include the managing/delivery of projects through human resources team as well as utilizing resources from other groups or departments. Project scope should have also incorporated change management and communication campaigns.Skill in: Must have the ability to work on projects and/or tasks that require strong analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to work independently to formulate recommendations based on market data and best practices. Results oriented. Has demonstrated proficiency with HR Information systems (multiple-systems) and demonstrated mastery of MS Office Products (e.g. Word, Excel & PowerPoint).Make yourself at home with us! At MDC Holdings, Inc. we value hard work and teamwork, but we also value fun! Ours is a collaborative environment, where employees freely bounce ideas off one another and exciting teambuilding activities and outings, like trips to the ballpark, picnics and ice cream socials are commonplace! Our employees enjoy exclusive perks, including a home discount program, home mortgage discount program, GE® appliance discounts and more! *Comprehensive medical insuranceHealth savings account (HSA)401(k) savings plan with company matchDental insuranceVision insuranceCompany-paid life insurance and AD&DShort- and long-term disability insuranceEmployee assistance program (EAP)Flexible spending account (FSA)Time off (paid holiday, sick and vacation)Pre-paid legal planDiscounted pet insuranceMatching charitable contribution programAnd that’s not all…Bonus opportunitiesEarly entry/discounts at model home furniture salesEmployee home purchase programVendor discountsWellness programs*All benefits are subject to qualification and hire dates. Not all benefits apply to commissioned sales people. #LI-SS1

Name: IT - IAM Analyst
Description: Job Description: The Identity and Access Management (IAM) Analyst is a dedicated professional who manages system security across the enterprise, focusing on access management. This individual ensures the right individuals can access the right resources at the right time for the right reasons. Provides support to the business and IT for system access related issues. Ensures customers receive appropriate and accurate access in a timely manner while enforcing compliance with corporate policies and standards. Responsibilities:Ability to provide support for access management across any of the Worldpay platforms Creates and updates entitlement provisioning procedures for applications and platforms under control of the identity and access management team at Worldpay Performs direct support for business and IT personnel by fulfilling entitlement requests and acting as a subject matter expert Functions as an escalation for the Worldpay service desk Performs research and investigations for access related issues Coordinates changes with service owners in support of IAM functions Provides assistance with evidence collection and analysis for internal and external audits Reviews security and audit reports and researches violations and inconsistencies Troubleshoots access related issues Typically requires a minimum of 2 years of related experience with a technical degree or equivalent work experience. Familiarity with network operating systems (e.g., Linux, UNIX, Windows) and major platforms used at Worldpay (e.g., mainframe, Oracle Identity Manager, Oracle Identity Analytics). Knowledgeable of security issues, techniques and implications. Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of personnel throughout the organization. Must be able to work on multiple tasks concurrently and reprioritize work independently as needed

Name: Business Analyst, QA Automation Support
Description: Location: Denver, CO --  Denver Federal Center, 6th Avenue & Kipling, Lakewood, CO 80225 Job Description: ASRC Federal Vistronix is actively seeking a Business Analyst and QA Automation advisor to join our team and support analysis efforts for a government client in Denver, Colorado.  ASRC Federal Vistronix is a technical, professional services company providing state-of-the-art solutions to government and commercial clients. Our services include custom-engineered solutions that integrate with the latest technology, resulting in advanced information technology systems; business and management consulting services to assess client needs and reengineer processes; and strategic and tactical program expertise to support continuity and provide comprehensive oversight for mission-critical initiatives.  We partner with government and commercial agencies that require development of systems, such as communication systems, asset management, network deployment and engineering services, power and energy management solutions, portal applications, command and control, and geospatial information systems (GIS) to operate more efficiently and profitably.  We are always looking for exceptionally bright and motivated people to join our team. We are thought leaders in our market space - providing comprehensive solutions to our clients, throughout the enterprise. If you are looking for an opportunity to use your skills in an environment that promotes free thinking, presents positive challenges, and makes real impact - Vistronix is the place for you. RESPONSIBILTIES: The successful candidate will work with business sponsors and other relevant stakeholders to define and document the business requirements for complex government software systems using Agile software development processes. In addition, this position will provide leadership in automated testing of systems in efforts to ease the burden of Agile software releases. The ability to work with both technical and non-technical audiences is very important, so having a solid understanding of the software development process is key. Principal responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Performing business analysis to support the project managers in defining project scope and objectives,Analyzing business processes for new and revised business applications,Providing leadership and guidance in instituting best-practices supporting automated testing of computer systems during development,Eliciting information and functional requirements from product owners and business sponsors through oral and written communication,Documenting requirements, planning meeting agendas and scheduling requirements elicitation,Developing Agile user stories and workflow diagrams to support the elicitation process. Working with developers to generate mockups of proposed solutions, presenting mockups and refining requirements,Prioritizing product backlogs and assist in backlog grooming process,Defining test plans and test cases and supporting testing for Scrum development teams,Developing conceptual and logical data models to help define business requirements,Assist with product backlog grooming process,Providing Alternatives Analysis for new Collecting and documenting preliminary data requirements,Assisting in design of technical specifications for complex, integrated government systems which include numerous feeders crossing agency boundaries,Working with other analysts to support a holistic approach to business analysis applicable to portfolio-level development efforts.REQUIREMENTS:Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree -- Computer Science or Technical Journalism degree preferredAt least 6 years of experience supporting software/hardware development efforts as a business analyst, software tester, or similar roleAt least 8 years of relevant work experience in lieu of a specific degree would be acceptable, especially if the experience is multi-functional (i.e., operations and development)Required Skills and Competencies:Strong technical writing skills, with the ability to concisely describe business requirements and functional requirements.Ability to use a variety of software tools for managing requirements, creating diagrams and written documents to communicate with a variety of stakeholders; both technical and non-technical.Examples of BA tools include Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPointExperience developing automated testing scripts, using tools such as Selenium and HPE-UFT.Experience performing a variety of software test types (such as smoke, integration, performance and load, accessibility, etc.)Experience documenting business requirements. Examples of documentation include business requirement specifications (BSR), work flow diagrams, context diagrams, use cases, and user stories.Understanding of user interfaces and most common approaches found in GUIsPresentation of requirements findings and mockups for review with sponsors and end usersAbility to understand formulas used in financial calculations and to describe relevant workflowsBusiness Process analysis skillsDesired Skills:Solid understanding of Agile development methodologies. Experience supporting Scrum development highly desired.Experience creating conceptual and logical data models as part of the requirements definition process (experience using Erwin data modeling software highly desired).Experience working with a wide range of personnel, including business sponsors, product owners, government project managers, development teams, and end users at all levels of the organization.Familiarity with formalized requirements management frameworks (including requirements traceability) such as IEEE and ITIL.Experience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) conceptsFamiliarity with integrating COTS and custom software as part of an enterprise software solutionExperience with the following Analysis tasks:Systems design skills would include UML diagrams, mockups, context diagrams, entity relationship diagrams and object models.Familiarity with data modeling conceptsWorking knowledge of database systems (SQL Server preferred)Prior experience as a web-based software developer (C# and JavaScript experience preferred)Experience designing web interfaces including services and writing specifications. The successful candidate is subject to a U.S. Federal Government background investigation and must be able to meet the requirements to hold a position of public trust or higher. ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard torace, gender, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, religion, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor prohibited by applicable law.

Name: Business Operations Analyst Programs and Offers
Description: Summary  DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service Sling TV that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win it's in our DNA. We're looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  Job Duties and Responsibilities  The Business Operations Analyst is responsible for helping to develop and support DISH's sales and product efforts within the targeted vertical market. Individuals in this role will maintain comprehensive knowledge of the targeted vertical markets, including competitive landscape, market trends and opportunities, and product/service needs. Utilizing this knowledge they will assist in developing and implementing strategic plans to maximize revenue, channel growth and market share.  Primary responsibilities fall into the following categories: Maintain comprehensive understanding of competitive pricing and product offerings in key markets including:Competitor deep-dives with cross-functional teams (portfolio, SWOT, capabilities, strategic priorities, and implications for DISH)Regular reviews of events/results (e.g. financial reports, investor presentations, organizational charts)Ongoing analysis of existing and emerging market competitors to current and developing service and technology solutions.Create and present regular summaries to share insights and position DISH's competitive differences to Senior Management, Sales, Product and Business Development teams.Serve as a focal point within the company for competitive requests in support of sales opportunities, such as specialized competitive materials, demand generation campaigns and product marketing initiatives.Coordinate closely with Sales and Marketing to ensure consistent understanding, and communication, of competitive advantages.Utilize competitive intelligence and other internal/external resources to propose strategies to improve acquisition, retention and monetization of customers in target markets.Maintain understanding of competitive programs from Indirect Channel Partners to ensure DISH is positioned as a preferred choice for prospective sellers. Skills - Experience and Requirements  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university; and two years related competitive or business intelligence experience and/or trainingPreferred degrees: Business, Finance, or MarketingExperience in strategic planning, sales process development and performance management.Exhibit the core values of DISH Curiosity, Pride, Adventure and Winning.Ability to effectively respond to and interact with all levels of organizational staff within the commercial department and across the DISH organization.Competencies include presentation/facilitation, organizational, analytical, interpersonal and written/oral communication skillsPosition requires computer expertise, including use of internet, database, word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation applicationsMust be flexible, innovative and have the ability to manage responsibilities and priorities in a fast paced, growth-oriented and time-critical environmentLimited travel may be requiredSDL2017

reports for low bonds, and escalate concerning accounts to Regional Credit Manager as applicable  + Review accounts receivable \(AR\) portfolio for potential problem accounts and determine, if Credit Manager intervention is required  + Gather account statements and invoice copies for delinquent accounts and escalate to Legal department  + Monitor recent bankruptcy filings to determine exposure  + Create credit limit change requests  + Review and synchronize credit limits between ERPs as applicable  + Complete request and forms related to quarterly bad debt review process  + Comply with applicable company policies, including Personnel, Quality System and Health, Safety and  + Environment standards and procedures\.  + Successfully complete required safety training \(including but not limited to drugs and alcohol, electrical, emergency response, fire, first aid, health and hygiene, PPE, SIPP, risk reporting, IT security, hazardous materials, driving\)\. *Qualifications & Experience** + Minimum Bachelor?s Degree in Accounting/ Finance  + 3 years of professional experience in large accounting firm or Multinational company  + Advanced knowledge in MS\-Office  + Expert level English written and verbal communication skills  + Interpersonal skills and Team player  + Pro\-active, self\-motivated and eager to acquire knowledge  + Ability to work under pressure  + Problem solving and analytic skills  + Candidates must be able to legally work and reside in the US, without sponsorship  + Knowledge of Oilfield terminology and business practices\. Oil & Gas Industry exposure  + Ability to work in global distributed setting, previous international exposure  + Self\-driven, Proactive, Systems Thinking  Schlumberger is an equal employment opportunity employer\. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a protected veteran or other characteristics protected by law\.  Schlumberger is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor ? priority referral Protected Veterans requested\.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: The Role Come help our customers learn more about the world. Below is a small sample of the questions weve asked of our data over the last year. Did Lyfts prospects improve in politically progressive areas in the aftermath of Ubers press woes? Is Amazons revenue growth in the fourth quarter primarily driven by customers in rural areas? How did the path of the solar eclipse affect hotel bookings across the United States? As part of a nascent customer-focused function on the data team, you will be responsible for helping industry-leading companies understand how purchase and travel behavior is changing in America. You will become an expert in our dataset and answers questions from prospects, customers, and internal stakeholders to help extract value from our data.You You creatively work through problems with statistically sound thinking and have the natural itch to follow obstacles to their root cause. You think deeply about the problems ahead and are comfortable moving between tools in your toolbelt. And you are quick to learn, implementing new approaches when facing questions that demand it. You are a stickler for quality and pay careful attention to the details that matter. You are a gifted communicator and are passionate about helping others make sense of data. You are comfortable juggling multiple projects at one time and relish the opportunity to empower leaders in finance, technology, and consumer goods with data to shape their long term strategy.Requirements 2+ years of SQL experience Ability to communicate findings to non-experts Desire to learn data modeling technologies (python, spark) and build on statistical knowledge Bachelors in social science (Economics, Sociology, ...), related discipline or equivalent experience Excited by a high learning curve Excellent written and oral communicatorCompensation and Benefits Highly competitive salary and benefits Stock grants pre-IPO at a company backed by top investors Take unlimited, responsible vacationAbout Us Edison provides intelligent email solutions for users and competitive intelligence for businesses. The largest, most valuable and as yet untapped data on earth is in mail; 3x larger than the worldwide web. Through our user base of more than 3 million users, we empower investors, brands, and technology companies to understand trends in the marketplace and gain deep insights into consumer behavior patterns.  As a team, were collaborative, engaged, and committed to continually improving as we serve our mission. None of us are on an island-- we trust our teammates to lend a hand when were stuck and our egos take a backseat to figuring out the best approach to tackling problems. Were energized by tough problems and are excited to know that a challenge ahead of us does not have a textbook solution. Finally, were always in a posture of learning-- there is a lot we do not know but that does not hold us back from making an attempt at solutions. We lead thorough blameless postmortems to become better analysts, scientists, and leaders.

Name: Commercial Products Analyst
Description: Job Summary  Under general supervision, the Commercial Products Analyst performs a variety of duties to include various data and statistical analysis, administrative and customer service plan marketing activities for Denver Health Medical Plan’s (DHMP) Large Group segment. Prepares monthly reports including enrollment trends and profitability. The individual will have direct oversight of plan enrollment activities supporting the manager, and broker teams with member events as assigned. This position requires development and maintenance of the commercial large group segment within the business.  Minimum Qualifications Education and Experience 1. Bachelor’s Degree required. 2. Three years of related commercial health plan experience required. 3. Five years of related commercial health plan experience preferred. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 1. Ability to recognize, document and initiate process improvement efforts as it is related to enrollment and process and procedure evaluation in order to improve departmental efforts. 2. Demonstrates a strong ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. 3. Working knowledge of the Colorado Medicaid System. 4. Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills. 5. Ability to think analytically, problem solve, and perform with a high level of accuracy. 6. Ability to prioritize work activities with minimal supervision in a team setting. 7. Bilingual in Spanish preferred. Computers and Technology 1. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Visio, Microsoft Project, and SharePoint. 2. Working knowledge of QNXT.All job applicants for safety-sensitive positions must pass a pre-employment drug test, once a conditional offer of employment has  been made.Denver Health is an integrated, efficient, high-quality academic health care system that is considered a model for the nation. The Denver Health system includes the Rocky Mountain Regional Level I Trauma Center, a 525-bed acute care medical center, Denver’s 911 emergency medical response system, 8 family health centers, 15 school-based health centers, the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Center, the Denver Public Health Department, an HMO, and The Denver Health Foundation.  As Colorado’s primary safety net institution, Denver Health is a mission-driven organization that has provided more than $3.3 billion in care for the uninsured in the last ten years. Denver Health is a leader in performance and quality improvements and remains financially secure, in part, due to its nationally recognized implementation of lean principles in healthcare. Denver Health is a major resource to the community, serving approximately 185,000 individuals and 67,000 children a year.  Located just south of downtown Denver, Denver Health is just minutes away from many of the cultural and recreational activities Denver has to offer.  We strongly support diversity in the workforce and Denver Health is an equal opportunity employer (EOE).  “Denver Health is committed to provide equal treatment and equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Denver Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.”

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst THE IDEAL CANDIDATE  You are detail orientated, highly analytical, extremely data driven and strive to continuously raise the bar. You are inquisitive, a problem solver, and able to find actionable insights from datasets. You want to learn about marketing, sales, and company operations as it relates to growth. You are also someone that brings experience from previous projects and can analyze and articulate why they succeeded or failed. You are excited about a “blank canvas” opportunity and the chance to iterate on our best practices.  RESPONSIBILITIES Primary responsibilities will be to support the operations team with analytical and executional bandwidth.Analyze marketing and sales reports to isolate positive and negative trends. Follow-up with actionable next steps for campaign optimization.Pull A/B test results and deliver insights. Track and maintain all results to apply across other portfolio companies.Build dashboards in Excel, Salesforce, Hubspot, Google Data StudioWork with the Sales and Online Marketing (SEO/Paid) Directors to forecast marketing and sales. Create the corresponding plans to meet those goals.This position has the opportunity to grow and specialize into sales or marketing specific role.Responsible for dashboard maintenance, reporting of numbers, and generation of data for weekly meetings and Board reports ABOUT YOU Great attention to detail, highly organized yet able to see the “big picture”Data drivenHave experience with setting up lead generation campaignsExcited about a blank canvasFast learner that proactively tackles challengesTeam player with a strong work ethicUnderstand and appreciate the importance of communicating with the teamAbility to thrive in a start-up environment, managing multiple projects simultaneouslyFun with a great sense of humor EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE Bachelors degree required2+ years in digital marketing or sales operationsAdvanced Excel user preferredHubspot, Adwords, GA experience a plusCRM experience with Hubspot and familiarity with workflow processes and systems within the marketing/sales cycleStrong data evaluation skills with the ability to extract and interpret data from various sources.Experience/passion for A/B testingWillingness to collaborate with the team, share your knowledge and learn along the way ATSI (a group of four companies, Trakstar, Reviewsnap, Recruiterbox and MIndflash) are four companies whose mission is to deliver the people management platforms that empower the growing companies of tomorrow through tools that help find, train, and motivate great employees because we believe people are happier and healthier when they know their work matters.  Our strategy is to combine amazing people with results-oriented marketing, sales optimization and operational execution to drive the growth of our business. We are analytically driven, curious by nature, and always looking for the next experiment to drive improvement.  The team at ATSI is tasked with building and executing growth plans for each line of business as well as the combined whole of ATSI. We’re looking for a Data Analyst to help our team understand how to drive Sales, Marketing and Support performance of our companies by collecting, analyzing, and finding insights in our data, in addition to providing executional support when needed.

Name: Financial Reporting Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe Client Accounting team is responsible for year-end reconciliations of client accounts to 1099’s and YTD information through Schedule C preparation. Significant Responsibilities: · Verifying and reconciling revenue and expense amounts provided by clients or partner carriers to amounts reported within the ATBS database;  · Researching and ensuring that clients’ financial results are in line with established due diligence parameters or have reasonable explanations from the established parameters;  · Researching accounting and data entry issues to determine the correct application of client transactions in the preparation of profit and loss statements and related schedules;  · Generating accurate Schedule C information for inclusion in clients’ income tax returns and adhering to all established reconciliation processes;  · Providing high-quality customer service by assisting in answering clients’ questions regarding accounting matters and communicating information in a manner that is understood by clients and ATBS employees;  · Supporting other departments and contributing to the growth of ATBS by answering inquiries regarding accounting transactions that impact client reporting in a timely manner; and  · Responsible for data entry of client materials, in accordance with established guidelines. Education and/or Experience: · Bachelors or Associate’s degree in accounting is preferred;  · Strong analytical, computer, and math skills;  · Experience and demonstrated ability with Microsoft Excel and Word;  · Excellent communication and customer service skills;  · Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with external and internal customers;  · Flexibility to work additional hours when required; and  · Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.  ATBS is an equal opportunity employer.  ​Compensation range is dependent on skills, academic achievements, and prior relevant work experience.Company DescriptionATBS is located in Lakewood, Colorado and is a premier services firm that has served its clients since 1998. ATBS provides a full spectrum of back office management that includes income tax preparation, bookkeeping and accounting, payroll, record keeping, online financial statements, online receipt archive, as well as business consulting. ATBS offers exceptional compensation, competitive benefits, reasonable work/life balance, and an excellent working environment.

Name: CDS Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThis position is located in Denver, CO and is not remote.  Position Summary: Develops effective and accurate healthcare cost, utilization and trend reporting in support of business operations. Provides analysis of ad hoc and standard reporting requests, and participates in projects as needed. COMPETENCIES/Role-Specific Functions:COMMUNICATION Communicates well both verbally and in writing, creates accurate and punctual reports, delivers presentations, shares information and ideas with others, has good listening skills. Develops reports using appropriate reporting tools (including SQL, SSIS, Excel, etc.), and effectively communicates results and recommendations of analyses to internal and external customers.PROBLEM SOLVING Breaks down problems into smaller components, understands underlying issues, can simplify and process complex issues, understands the difference between critical details and unimportant facts. Analyzes, prepares, and reports on financial performance of contract including but not limited to delegated risk, specialty and ancillary capitation, referral trends, and utilization data.PRODUCTIVITY Manages a fair workload, volunteers for additional work, prioritizes tasks, develops good work procedures, manages time well, handles information flow. Ensure analyses are supported with proper documentation.Manages multiple tasks and priorities effectively and meets deadlines as needed.SELF DEVELOPMENT Seeks out and accepts feedback, is a proactive learner, takes on tough assignments to improve skills, keeps knowledge and skills up-to-date, turns mistakes into learning opportunities. Actively seeks out and obtains information and knowledge relating to industry trends in data development tools and methodologies.Volunteers to work on projects to continue to expand ones knowledge and skillset.CUSTOMER FOCUS Builds customer confidence, is committed to increasing customer satisfaction, sets achievable customer expectations, assumes responsibility for solving customer problems, ensures commitments to customers are met, solicits opinions and ideas from customers, responds to customers. Establishes and maintains effective collaborative and professional relationships with internal and external customers while exhibiting tact and consideration.Presents timely, accurate data to both internal and external clients.JOB KNOWLEDGE Understands duties and responsibilities, has necessary job knowledge, has necessary technical skills, understands company mission/values, keeps job knowledge current, is in command of critical issues. Develops reports utilizing SQL, SSRS, Excel, or other reporting tools as needed.Provide additional analysis as necessary to explain trends and variances.Other duties as assigned.Qualifications (Education/Experience/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities):Bachelor Degree in health administration, business administration, economics, finance or related field preferred or equivalent.One to three years experience performing financial analysis in a health care environment including one to two years in a hospital, physician practice or managed care environment.Knowledge of managed care contract terms and requirements.Knowledge of healthcare terminology, including codes (Cpt, Revenue, ICD-9, ICD-10, DRGs, etc.) and standard reporting measures (Member Months, PMPM, days per thousand, etc.).Skilled with database maneuvers that include the ability to retrieve data from a SQL Server data warehouse and to create database reports in Crystal Reports or similar software.Skilled in financial and data analysis, problem resolution and reconciliation under critical time constraints.Skilled in examining documents for correctness and interpreting accuracy.Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external customers.Ability to prepare and make verbal or written presentations.Ability to respond quickly to internal and external customer needs.Ability to complete reports and analyses in an accurate and timely manner.Home office that is HIPAA compliant for all remote or telecommuting positions as outlined by the company policies and procedures. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: The Arvada Fire Protection District (AFPD) has an immediate opening for a Business Intelligence Analyst. This is a full-time, FLSA non-exempt, benefited position.  The Business Intelligence Analyst facilitates fulfilment of data analysis needs for all divisions and accreditation requirements using the latest business intelligence programs. This position conducts research and evaluation of District performance metrics and identifies trends. The Business Intelligence Analyst is an active member of the accreditation team and participates in continuous improvement efforts.  Minimum Qualifications: High School Diploma or GEDState of Colorado drivers license with a satisfactory driving recordAssociate Degree in data analytics, business administration, statistics, computer science, information technology or related field or equivalent level of skill and knowledge achieved through a combination of experience and education5 years of experience in business or data analytics Technical Experience Data analytic software (Microsoft BI preferred)Data blending systems (Microsoft Azure data solutions preferred)SQL and/or Relational database operations and reportingExperience and advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office productsGIS systems * Experience in Fire Service or Public Safety Preferred  To apply, submit a cover letter and current resume. Submissions will be accepted until 5:00 pm on Friday December 7, 2018.  Top candidates may be invited to a skills assessment and interview December 17th or 18th. Offers of employment are contingent upon passing a drug screen and background check (employment, criminal, motor vehicle). Arvada Fire Protection District is an Equal Opportunity Employer See job description at www.arvadafire.com under I Want To work for Arvada Fire for a complete list of qualifications. Name: Business Systems Analyst Sr.
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements gathering and functional design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Key Responsibilities:Partner with the business line to develop requirementsWork with the application development team to create functional designsParticipate in testing, training, and implementation of applicationsAnalyze and evaluate user needsDevelop and maintain a complete and accurate understanding of how a business unit impacted by an assigned application conducts their business.Assist in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspectiveAssist business lines in use of new and existing capabilities of a system.Work with internal business groups to document, analyze, and redesign business processes.Partner with business representatives to identify, refine, and document detailed business needs.Join clients and technical staff to investigate, analyze, and resolve application problems related to system functions May be point of contact for user support and problem-solving. Occasionally manage small projects. Frequently interface with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. Work with technology and application development teams to design functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs.
