Name: Analyst, Strategy and Special Projects
Description: The Clinical Enterprise Analyst, Strategy and Special Projects, will help drive the development of DaVitas clinical strategy and prepare the organization for a shift to value-based care. As a part of the Clinical Enterprise team, this Analyst will focus on initiatives and strategic projects to reduce hospitalizations for patients and improve DaVita's overall clinical performance. The Analyst will act as a liaison between the business office (Atlas) and the field, including in-center teammates and regional and divisional leadership, by partnering to innovate and pilot solutions in the field. The role will work closely with the office of the chief operating officer, chief medical officer, field operations and other strategic business units. Key responsibilities include:Clinical Program SupportManages the development, piloting, deployment and outcomes of clinical programsCoordinates with teams across the enterprise to enable rollout of new clinical programsWorks with Information Technology to update, design and/or develop software changes to support the implementation of clinical programs and drive outcomes performanceEvaluates integrated care requirements in partnership with other strategic business unitsSupports pilot and program design of incorporated integrated care functions in the dialysis centerProjectsLeads strategic initiatives for the Clinical Enterprise team, including hypothesis development, research, insight generation, and business recommendationsRepresents the Clinical Enterprise on cross-functional projectsEvaluates project efficacy through clinical analytics and reportingQualificationsBachelor's degree required2-4 years of work experience in management consulting, process engineering, investment banking or a corporate strategy role preferredDemonstrated experience and/or interest in healthcare delivery and patient experiencePreferred Additional Skills:Strong executive communication skillsProficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and other Microsoft productsStrong influencing skills; track record of successful client relationship development and ability to quickly build credibility and gain the confidence of individuals at all levelsOutstanding conceptual, analytical and strategic skillsDemonstrated ability to recognize, prioritize, and evaluate market trends and specific growth opportunitiesPossesses the ability to balance strategic vision and execution capabilities to deliver resultsAbility to effectively handle and drive multiple projects.Keen understanding of healthcare marketsStrong business and financial acumen with a sense of shareholder responsibilityTeam player with the ability to sell change effectively and influence othersComfortable with ambiguityHere is what you can expect when you join our Village:A "community first, company second" culture based on Core Values that really matter.Clinical outcomes consistently ranked above the national average.Award-winning education and training across multiple career paths to help you reach your potential.Performance-based rewards based on stellar individual and team contributions.A comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance your health, your financial well-being and your future.Dedication, above all, to caring for patients suffering from chronic kidney failure across the nation. Name: Sr. Marketing Data Analyst
Description: Cherwell (@Cherwell) empowers organizations to transform their business through the rapid adoption and easy management of digital services.Cherwell's adaptable platform has enabled thousands of organizations to modernize their business operations with customizable service management, automation, and reporting across the enterprise. Friction makes work slow and frustratingCherwell helps organizations achieve meaningful and measurable digital service transformation, faster.  We are looking for a/an Sr. Marketing Data Analyst to join our team in Denver, CO or Colorado Springs, CO.SummaryWe are looking for a highly motivated, results-oriented Sr. Marketing Data Analytics Manager, to join our global marketing team. As a key part of the global Marketing Operations team, you will help deliver actionable analyses that will be used to measure the effectiveness of past marketing campaigns and help shape future benchmarks and plans.  You will work cross-functionality with individuals and teams in marketing and sales to translate data into business strategies that deliver measurable results. You will be responsible for daily/weekly monitoring and reporting, ad hoc deep dives, and leading meetings to share key data points and recommendations.  You havean understanding of the B2B marketing and sales funnel, are passionate about operational efficiencies, and have great experience with MarTech tools for reporting needs. You engage in thoughtful investigation of data to compliment decision making and are willing to go the extra mile to help the team optimize results, processes and infrastructure. You are a team player, have a mindset to help and enable people around you, and are committed to finding the best solutions to the reporting challenges we face. Your Responsibilities:Providing direct analytical support to business stakeholders and leaders to prioritize, execute, analyze and optimize marketing initiatives.Providing segmentation and personalization recommendations for digital marketing channels, as well as optimizing existing marketing systems and processes.Leveraging data to identify areas of growth through top-of-funnel expansion, mid-funnel acquisition and conversion, optimal channel spend and optimal touchpoint strategy for members and future members.Analyzing path to conversion and identifying fractional attribution of each touchpoint in members' journeys.Serving as a best-practices and implementation owner for A/B tests and other controlled experimentsPartner with individuals and teams across marketing and sales to assist in analyzing pipeline generating campaigns (email nurtures, events, account-based marketing, webinars, etc.), and measure, and optimize multi-channel campaigns that drive the growth of the business.Providing direct analytical support to business stakeholders and leaders to prioritize, execute, analyze and optimize marketing initiativesParticipates in discussions with various stakeholders across the globe, including regional marketing teams, sales, exeutive leadership, and data reporting teams, in order to understand business analysis needs and drive to efficient solutions.Technologies You'll Work With:MarketoSalesforceBizibleMarketo Revenue Cycle ExplorerLeanDataGoogle AnalyticsAdobe AnalyticsAdobe Audience ManagerExperience Required Bachelor's Degree required or equivalent combination of experience and education (preferred area of study: Marketing, Computer Science, Maths or other similar fields).Minimum 5 years of experience in marketing operations, demand generation and/or campaign management in a B2B domain.Understanding of B2B marketing and an ability to translate business goals into operational requirements; understanding of data flow between CRM and marketing automation and analytics systems.Knowledge of marketing automation, CRM, ABM solutions (Marketo, Salesforce.com and Bizible), as well as web analytics and reporting tools a plus.Ability to manage multiple priorities in fast-paced environment, work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, and ensure high quality deliverables with high attention to detail.Demonstrated analytical ability and quantitative skills; demonstrable ability to analyze campaign and pipeline metrics and effectiveness and optimize to improve performance.Ability to take a logical and methodical approach to problem solving, while still being innovative and creative.Cherwell Software is an Equal Opportunities Employer. We do not tolerate discrimination against any applicant on the basis of gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, veteran status, disability or age. Cherwell encourages diversity in hiring, recognizing that this enriches the work environment and that a broad variety of perspectives enhances decision-making and creativity. If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions in the US please send an email with your request to Recruiting@Cherwell.com. #LI-NM1

Name: Operations Import Analyst
Description: About SRS Acquiom At SRS Acquiom, our sole focus is on making M&A deals happen more efficiently. Since 2007, we have been continuously innovating to solve issues for some of the industrys most sophisticated buyers, sellers, and counsel. Our top-tier team has supported more than 2,000 deals including high-profile transactions such as Googles acquisition of Nest, Facebooks acquisition of Oculus and Yahoos acquisition of Tumblr. We are looking for extraordinary people to help drive our continued success. If you are looking to join a growing, entrepreneurial environment in an established company, we want to hear from you! Visit www.srsacquiom.com to learn more. Position Summary SRS Acquiom is currently hiring for an Operations Import Analyst who will be responsible for interpreting complicated payment and allocation spreadsheets and creating guidelines as well as manipulating data for import into the system of record. This function will drive the creation of standard procedures and perform the duties outlined below. Specific functional responsibility includes interpreting complex spreadsheets and analyzing the same against merger and agreement documentation, ensuring that all data imported to the system of record matches the source documents for each deal and that VIP holders receive confirmation. This hands-on position is based in Denver and reports to the manager of SRS Acquiom Operations.Primary Responsibilities Interpret and audit payment and allocation spreadsheets, create guidelines for interpretation of data, manipulate data for import to system of record Import and export files for use in system of record (NetSuite). Confirming data is imported accurately for reporting to shareholders Work with other teams to ensure the data received meets all requirements for import into system of record. Ensure Operations manuals and guidelines are updated and stay up to date so they can be relied upon for business continuation situations Manage vendor relationships and respond to vendor and shareholder inquiries in accordance with our Customer Service standards Perform reconciliation of escrow and paying accounts and resolve outstanding breaks while driving systematic improvement of processesRequired Qualifications Minimum 3-5 years financial operations analyst experience and 1-2 years of payments experience preferred Bachelors degree required Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and formula writing, and interpretation required; VBA experience a plus Experience with sophisticated ERP systems and developing work streams and work-arounds to accomplish the desired business task or requirement Experience working within a cross-functional and cross geographical environment High awareness of operational risk, critical timelines and of the complex nature of a financial operations environment with an ability to work under pressure and to meet tight deadlines Knowledge of the M&A process a plus Ability to work outside of business hours on an as-needed basisA few benefits our employees enjoy Comprehensive benefit plans (medical/dental/vision) starting on day 1 401(k) with 4% matching Discretionary time off Fitness Credit Several pre-tax plans (dependent care, transportation, flexible spending)

Name: Order to Cash Business Analyst
Description: Location: Broomfield CO Duration: 12 Months The Order to Cash (O2C) Business Analyst position calls for a self-possessed individual contributor to coordinate testing, implement system enhancement requests, provide production support and lead large-scale project initiatives as part of a team that supports Oracle Finance business units.  As a member of the O2C team, this individual will act as liaison between Finance Business groups and IT to provide efficient operational execution and deliver relevant, reliable and timely information in a cost- effective way, while acting as a fiduciary to manage risk to the enterprise. Responsibilities include proactively identifying and managing resolution of production issues, leading O2C teams on cross-functional projects involving large UATs, and managing testing activities through development of project plans that specify requirements, timelines, test plans, implementation, and post Go-Live activities. As a member of the Global Process Organization, this individual is also responsible for development, documentation, and enforcement of O2C policies and procedures. Facilitate cross-functional team meetings and conference calls. Effectively communicate status updates, recommendations and escalations to management. Prepare and deliver quality presentations.  Performs work independently without direct oversight. Collaborate with management, team members and business partners. Assigned ad-hoc projects as required. between the business and IT teamsPrioritization of production issues based on assessment of customer and business impactsIssue tracking, reporting and monitoringIdentification and documentation of The individual needs to be self-directed only requiring management direction for new tasks or complex situations. Able to grasp complex concepts quickly. Name: Senior Data Analyst
Description: The Clinical Analytics & Reporting Team is responsible for designing, developing and overseeing analytical solutions for our clinical and operations executives in support of DaVita’s clinical strategy. Our team’s mission is to improve patient quality of life in terms of care safety, quality, and efficiency by transforming data into actionable information that guides strategic decisions, supports clinical innovation, and informs operating tactics.  A successful teammate exemplifies personal behaviors in line with DaVita’s core values: service excellence, integrity, team, continuous improvement, accountability, fulfillment, and fun. Responsibilities The Senior Clinical Data Analyst’s primary objective is to partner with diverse teams from around the enterprise to produce analytical insights that support a broad range of clinical initiatives specifically for VillageHealth, DaVita’s integrated care initiative. The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be fully inclusive. Partner with clinical subject matter experts and operational leadership to identify key clinical questions that can be answered using data to drive clinical goals and objectivesIndependently conduct clinical analysis and synthesize results in a non-technical manner to provide recommendations to senior executivesStructure analytic plans that comprehensively address clinical questions and provide a detailed methodology and approach for analysisDevelop clinical models to drive strategic initiatives on the basis of care efficacy and resource allocationBuild, implement, and maintain multifunctional clinical tools to disseminate real-time information to VillageHealth care teammates and nephrologistsUtilize multiple computational languages, platforms and environments to mine and manage data in preparation for analysisAdhere to best demonstrated practices in clinical analytics from the fields of informatics, biostatistics, epidemiology, and data science to analyze data to provide unbiased and unconfounded answers to clinical questionsPartner with cross-functional teams to socialize analytic findings and drive management processes to meaningful resultsBecome a subject matter expert and thought partner in clinical and methodologic areasWilling to travel (up to 10% of time)QualificationsBachelor’s degree required; major in biostatistics, statistics, informatics, computer science, math, or relevant field required; post-graduate degree in an analytic discipline strongly recommended.Prior relevant work experience preferredDemonstrated ability to learn and develop proficiency in any or all of the following as needed: Microsoft Office Studio, SQL, SAS, Tableau, IBM Cognos, Python, R, etc.Advanced critical thinking, strong work ethic, creative mindset, adept communication skills, attention to detail, design-mindedness, flexibility with change, comfort with ambiguity, efficient time management, technical aptitude, and business acumenLanguage Skills Fluent in the written and verbal skills necessary to perform successfully the essential functions, duties and responsibilities of the position Vision Requirements Vision adequate to perform essential duties and responsibilities of position Physical Demands Physical requirements can vary. These must be reviewed with management. However, in general, the position requires the following physical activities: Ability to lift minimum of 2 pounds to a maximum of 15 pounds unassisted; ability to sit for extended periods of time with some standing, stooping, walking, stretching, reaching, lifting; moderate range of body motionsAbility to use computer and all peripherals for extended periods of time

Name: Programmer Analyst/Application Software Developer RQS 2018
Description: The Governor’s Office of Information Technology is a consolidated IT service provider for the State of Colorado. Technical support is provided to the various state agencies. A partner agency, the Department of Health Care Policy and Financing uses an application known DDD Web, or Developmental Disabilities Web. The system is an in-house development over a twenty-five years ago now requires upgrade to support system functionality and stability.  Additional Details:  This position will assist the lead developer in successfully configuring the SAP BusinessObjects BI 4.1 on the new server to ensure a key migration is complete and successful.  In addition this position will assist with migrating the database from MS SQL 2008 R2 standard to MS SQL 2016 Enterprise.  The successful candidate will have: 4 years experience in Business Objects including version 4.15 years experience in designing and deploying the BO Universe.7 years experience in Report Design.7 years experience in MS SQL.Experience with data migrations.Ability work independently and without significant guidanceBe onsite Monday through Friday 8-5pmSpeak clearly and communicate with customers The current application has 750 users. The application utilizes C#; .NET 4.0; IIS7; C; Visual Studio 2017; JavaScript; MS SQL 2008 R2 database all on 64 bit servers. Name: Safety Sr. Systems Analyst
Description: Link Technologies (LinkTechConsulting.com), a staffing and IT consulting firm, is seeking a Safety Sr. Systems Analyst for a 1-year contract position with a well-established client in Denver, CO. Job Description:The client is in need of a Senior Systems Analyst to support the Sheriff’s Office. The contractor will work closely with the Safety team, other agency resources, and the software vendor. The candidate will partner with senior management and end-users within the Department of Safety on a highly complex project to replace the client’s existing Jail Management System. Responsibilities will include the analysis, design, implementation planning, training, and support/maintenance phases of the SDLC.Expected Responsibilities: • Providing input to the JMS (jail management system) replacement project, with a major focus on data conversion and mapping from the old system to the new. • Building a strong relationship with business end users and being comfortable explaining technical terms to non-technical resources. • Creating spreadsheets to document data mapping, validating data conversion in a test environment, and working with the vendor to modify fields/data types to fit the business needs. • Potential to expand to include system testing and other systems analyst functions, as needed. • Following TS documentation and change management processes Qualifications: Minimum three years of current, professional experience analyzing and supporting applications which should include two years of experience performing lead work for multi-sized projects, including: • Experience with Safety organizations (i.e. Police and Sherriff) is nice to have. • Flexibility to handle shifting priorities. • Ability to work well under pressure. • Creating functional and technical specifications.• Extensive experience in creating data maps and data flow diagrams. • Working with customers on cleaning up old and redundant data in preparation for the new system.• Advising customers on best practices in a technical landscape. • Vendor, process and change management.• Excellent team collaboration with challenging customers. • Developing and coordinating end user testing and training.• The primary work location will be split between two buildings in Denver.

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: Genesis10, is seeking a Sr. Financial Analyst for a contract position with our client in Denver, CO. Summary: Analyzes and reconciles accounts. Prepares and annotates variance reports. Works with operating plans to create supporting financial forecasts and budgets. Performs research to understand the accounting consequences of alternative approaches. Responsible for conducting financial analysis projects (e.g. capital versus expense, ROI, resource allocations, budget preparation, etc.) and special statistical studies. Analyze performance returns for accuracy, communicate and review results with investment professionals. Role requires a thorough knowledge of accounting and finance principles, excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to present financial analysis to management. Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel/Word/PowerPoint software and have a working knowledge of popular financial management applications.  Responsibilities/Qualifications: Perform quality checks to ensure integrity of data  Analysis, data profiling, development and integration of disparate systems  Independently create and maintain reports  Review projects and develops templates, queries and procedures for internal reporting  Coordinate data cleansing and organization of reports.  Ability to work under pressure of strict timelines  Detail oriented, self-starter, and works well within a team environment  Team oriented and enjoy working with a team and sharing knowledge to improve processes and create efficiencies  Ability to adapt graciously to changing business conditions and priorities  Strong understanding of data management best practices in areas such as metadata management, data quality management, root cause analysis, process design and master and reference data management.  Proven ability to design business processes for managing data throughout the lifecycle.  Experience with technology environments.  Experience on various business processes supported by SAP ERP solutions.  Strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills, focus on detail (passion for data and accuracy).  Excellent organizational, prioritization and independent decision making skills.  Ability to work collaboratively with business stakeholders across geographically distributed sites.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills across all aspects of the business.  If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, apply today!  Genesis10 provides access to career opportunities with over 40 clients in the Twin Cities. As the #3 ranked firm for Business and IT consulting in Minnesota, we offer a variety of opportunities whether you are looking for contract, contract-to-hire, or permanent positions. Let's connect today!  Benefits of Working with Genesis10: Medical and dental insurance available- including HSA  Bi-weekly payroll  Established consultant re-marketing program with our 50+ local clients!  401k plan  Delivery Director for employee success and support  Referral program with the opportunity to earn additional income About Genesis10: Genesis10 is a Professional Technology Services Firm providing Staffing, Workforce Optimization and Domestic Outsourcing Solutions. If you are a high performing business or IT professional with solid, referenced experience, we want to meet you. Name: 2019 Summer Undergraduate Internship - Business Analyst/Project Management - Atlanta, GA
Description: Looking for an internship where you?ll really make a difference? Apply at U.S. Bank. *What You?ll Do** We offer a competitive 10-week paid internship where you?ll work on meaningful projects and effect real change at our company. You?ll build your resume while making new connections and sharpening the skills you need to succeed at work. Plus, the work you do will be tailored to your interests. A typical employee spends eight hours a day at work. We think you should spend that time doing something you love ? not just earning a paycheck.  _As a U.S. Bank intern, you?ll have the opportunity to interact with senior executives, get paired with a formal mentor and attend fun events specifically tailored for interns, including a volunteer day where you?ll give back to the community. In your day-to-day work, you?ll learn how employees collaborate to serve all our stakeholders._ Your meaningful work experience may even translate into a full-time position in the banking industry upon graduation. *Why U.S. Bank?** Join a team of more than 74,000 employees in 28 states and eight countries, all committed to doing the right thing, making smart changes and collaborating for the good of our customers, communities, and other stakeholders ? and especially for the good of one another. But don?t just take our word for it ? we?ve been recognized by the Ethisphere Institute as a 2018 World's Most Ethical Company? for four years running.  Part of doing the right thing is making sure our employees feel welcome and supported at work, while challenging you to develop personally and professionally. Strong written and verbal communication skills  ? Ability to think and work independently within a professional setting  ? Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills  ? Flexibility to work within a multiple disciplinary team and receive dynamic on-the-job training  ? Highly organized; ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously  Explore your career possibilities at U.S. Bank and join a company that?s as passionate as you are about helping our customers meet their goals and making a difference in the communities we live and work. Our industry-leading financial performance, innovative spirit and best-in-class reputation empower employees to succeed. Name: Data Base Programmer/Analyst
Description: Client is contracting for an on-site, temporary, full-time contractor resource Database Programmer to analyze, develop and implement enhancements to the existing CDE systems, Record Integration Tracking System (RITS System), Educator Identification System (EDIS System), RITS READ, and EDIS READ.At the heart of these systems is the ability to identify a student/educator based on demographic data provided by School Districts.The RITS/EDIS Matching Engines are implemented in 2002 using the Oracle 8i database, tables, views and PL/SQL (stored procedures and user defined functions).This component implements the student matching functionality, the gate through which student demographic data is passed to insure the State Assigned Student Identifier remains as correct as possible.The Sr. Database Programmer shall be contracted toModernize the above four systems by taking advantage of the new features available in CDE's current Oracle database version is 11g R2 running in Oracle EXADATA platform.He/ She shall be looking at ways to enhance the processing time for the RITS/EDIS Matching Engines, reduce the number of review cases that CDE administrator manually review, and enhance the matching logic to better match Students/ Educator records.Review and enhance RITS Archive engine.The primary purpose of the archive and purge function is to remove old data from the system which provides the following benefits:Improved system response times.The online database contains less data which decreases the amount of time it takes the system to wade through the data and produce the desired output.Less stale data as the older information is not displayed by the RITS Web application.Close the refresh gap/delta between RITS Read and RITS Web so that they match as closely as possible.Look at large tables to identify candidates for partitioning.Additional Database enhancements that need attention that have not been identified at this time.Requirements:Experience in application coding and in creating computer applications and/or databases5+ years' experience using Oracle database5+ years of PL/SQL development experience3+ years of Unix scripting is a plusAbility to work independently to research issuesAbility to work with end users to troubleshoot production issuesAbility to document solutions/processes as neededPreferred:Oracle EXADATA.Oracle built in DBMS packages.Experience with Toad.About our Company: Connecting people’s aptitude & ambitions with our opportunities to deliver results.22nd Century Staffing is a Minority & Woman Owned Business Enterprise (MWBE) that supports demanding staffing programs for Corporations and State and Local Government Agencies. Our journey began in 1997 by supporting large Federal contracts which nudged us in the direction of creating large candidate pools across the country. Over the last 20 years, we have built a strong business model that is carefully constructed to deliver on multiple facets. We have proven past performance of providing services that exceed our clients' expectations. Today 22nd Century supports clients in all 50 states and has grown to be a company that is trusted and sought for providing a complex mix of workforce solutions.Our Global Delivery model with over 110 recruiters, data miners and research analysts working across multiple time zones is backed by an internal database of 800,000 resources across all major industries.With a firm grip on the entire spectrum of staffing solutions, we have placed more than 500,000 skilled resources and delivered 15 million+ man-hours.“22nd Century Staffing is an Equal Opportunity Employer" and “US Citizens & all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply."

Name: Accenture DayNine - Workday Financials Sr. Analyst
Description: - Job description Wanted: Workday InnovatorsReady to innovate at the forefront of Workday? As a member of one of the world’s largest Workday-certified teams, you’ll be part of a team of advisory professionals who deliver more than just technology. You’ll deliver HR and financial management solutions that help organizations realize the Workday promise of integrated, cloud-based capabilities that put them on the fast track to a better way to work. Grow your career with leading-edge technologies, continuous learning opportunities and a global community with deep industry expertise that help to solve clients’ biggest challenges. Now is the perfect time for you to join the Accenture DayNine Workday team, where you’ll: Assess, strategize and manage Workday deployments for organizations across the globe. Accenture has worked with more than 600 clients to deliver Workday deployments to unlock the potential of their organizations. Design and deliver future-ready Workday solutions to help organizations optimize their HR and Finance functions and enhance their employees’ experiences. Join more than 1,200 professionals certified in Workday, collaborating to drive enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale. Expand your Workday skills and advance your career with unparalleled training and professional development opportunities. Key ResponsibilitiesAs a Workday Financials Senior Analyst, you should expect to be involved in the following: Identification of business requirements, functional design, process design (including scenario design, flow mapping), prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures Lead workshops for client education Conduct working sessions with clients to gather, understand, and analyze business requirements Support the Financials Lead in architecting Workday Financials solution to ensure that all work streams are cohesive and cross functional impacts are considered and mitigated Advise clients on industry standards and leading practices Demonstrate design options through the use of prototyping Understand and apply Workday and Accenture DayNine methodologies  + Basic qualifications Basic Qualifications:1+ years of previous consulting experience either as an internal consultant or with a consulting/software company Hands-on Financials functional experience Bachelor’s Degree Ability and willingness to travel up to 80% Preferred Skills: Existing and up to date Workday Financials certification If not already a holder of the relevant Workday Certifications, successful completion of appropriate Workday Certification(s) is a requirement of the role. Proficiency in multiple business processes: Procure-to-Pay (PTP) Order-to-Cash (OTC) General Ledger (GL) Fixed Asset Management (FA) Budgeting Cash Management Grant Management Chart of Accounts Re-Design Purchase Order Conversions Expense Management 1+ years prior experience implementing Workday with a certified Workday implementer. Thrive in a diverse, fast paced environment. Other leading Cloud based SaaS financial application implementation experience (ie: NetSuite, Fusion Intact, PeopleSoft, Oracle, SAP, Lawson) An advanced degree in the area of specialization Deep functional knowledge around financial systems and processes Demonstrated experience in developing systems requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions under multiple deadlines Think analytically and can effectively apply logic to solve problems. Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently and meet deadlines, despite conflicting demands. Effective interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate and team with others. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, and can clearly articulate complex messages and requirements. Strong desire to work with clients and provide exceptional client experiences. Demonstrated commitment and achievement to delivery excellence and client relationship management All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.   Applications for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.   Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.   Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.   Equal Employment Opportunity All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.   Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.   Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Name: Business Ops Analyst - Risk and Audit
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the launch of the first live, internet-delivered TV Service – Sling TV, that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We have a bold sense of pride, adventure, and desire to win – it’s in our DNA. And we’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor’s Degree preferredExperience working with Microsoft SQL a plusExperience in the Pay TV and/or Risk Management a plusExcellent written and verbal communication skills needed to effectively present information for a variety of issues.Ability to prioritize, organize and complete all tasks, meeting deadlines and target completion dates.Multi-tasking is a necessity.Strong customer service skills; friendly, approachable and motivated with a strong work ethic and high degree of integrity.Ability to create, maintain, analyze and publish data primarily utilizing Microsoft Excel.Experience in the Pay TV and/or the financial industry a plus. The Business Operations Analyst is responsible for a high-level review of audits conducted on retailer businesses. In addition to reviewing and investigating new customer activations, Analyst will review and present complex audit details to the business, compiling information for drawing conclusions, and summarizing the findings for management review. The analyst will monitor and respond to current and newly developed operational policies, procedures, and systems among multiple departments. This role supports audit management and various assignments for Sales Operations Risk and Audit Team. Primary responsibilities include the following:Conduct research related to Incentive Payments based on Business Rules.Completes assigned audits and summarize findings to the business.Analyze current processes and procedures to maintain them or make recommendations to promote effective operations within and between departments.Responsible for preparing and delivering the required training to facilitate changes in policies and procedures.Assist in the completion of difficult projects that are broad in nature by following general guidelines. Maintain and applies knowledge of practices and procedures in area of expertise.Create, explain and maintain data mainly utilizing Excel workbooks.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Brandfolder is looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to grow our presence at the forefront of Digital Asset Management. You will inspire the most recognizable brands in the world, like TripAdvisor and Slack, by providing tools and strategic insights that increase their brand engagement. At our core, Brandfolder is data driven company. We strive to use data in all our decision and product development processes ranging from lead generation to product feature tuning to incorporating new machine learning based features in product.  Who are we looking for? You have a solid grounding in statistics and are comfortable with hypothesis testing, design of experiments, regression and classification models, multivariate statistics and time series methods. You have experience with data munging and model building with R or Python using various statistical packages like tidyverse, forecast, lubridate, caret, statsmodels, scikit-learn, pandas to name a few. You have strong experience with query languages like SQL. You have experience building visualizations with packages like ggplot2, matplotlib, plotly etc. As a Data Analyst at Brandfolder, you will be part of the data science team that works across product, marketing, sales, customer experience and finance. Specifically, you would be involved in projects such as campaign response modeling and measurement, customer segmentation and persona modeling, customer lifetime value modeling, churn prediction, anomaly detection in product usage to proactively maintain reliability/uptime, lead scoring etc. We have an amazing list of clients that will rely on you to provide an enhanced data driven experience in all aspects of our interaction with them.  Do you want a role where your contributions directly affect the success of the company? Will you make a name for yourself at Brandfolder? We have a team of curious, eager, and humble individuals who rally together both within and outside the confines of the office and aim to expand and evolve our culture as our team grows. We embrace that each interaction and opportunity for feedback can help us grow individually and collectively.What you'll doJoin a collaborative team of engineers, sales, marketing and customer experience folks in DenverContribute to best-in-class analytics patterns and practices as we growDevelop and own analysis, dashboards and delivery platformsDevelop robust data and analysis pipelines for continuous analysis & reportingWrite good quality maintainable and reusable codeConstantly optimize and improve data quality and modelsBecome an integral contributor to the direction of the data teamWhat you'll needBachelor's Degree in Statistics, Computer Science or similar analytics discipline2+ years of data analysis and model buildingPositive attitude and the adaptability to thrive in a fast-paced environmentStatistical programming experience with R or PythonExperience building visualizations and dashboardsSolid understanding of statistical inference, regression and classificationData mining ability with query language like SQLGood ability of explaining results to broader audienceStrong knack for picking up new tools and technologies, continuously learningThe drive to take initiative and own high-impact projects from day oneBonus points forMaster's Degree in Statistics, Computer Science or similar analytics disciplineExperience building shiny interactive dashboards or similar systemsExperience with version control systems like gitPrevious experience in marketing and/or sales analysisExperience with D3js to build visualizationsPrevious work experience in a startup-like environmentA growth mindset and passion for learningThe ability to elevate those around youBrandfolder PerksIconic office location in RiNo, bike and light rail friendlyGenerous paid time offMedical and dental insurance, 100% paid by BrandfolderMonthly company events and happy hoursDog-friendly officeExposure to recognizable and powerful brandsAbout BrandfolderHeadquartered in Denver's RiNo neighborhood, Brandfolder is an enterprise digital asset management (DAM) platform that enables businesses to organize, discover, distribute, and measure brand engagement. Loved by global brands including Under Armour, New Belgium, Slack, and jetBlue.  Brandfolder is an equal opportunity employer; we are focused on creating an inclusive environment and believe that diversity of all types is essential to our success. We encourage all to apply, and will choose you on the basis of qualifications and merit.

Name: CRM Business Analyst Intern
Description: Title: Business Analyst, CRM Intern Job description BETSOL is a fast-growing Denver based IT Company. BETSOL is looking for a Business Analyst Intern. The Business Analyst Intern will work on CRM processes and analysis. This is a hands-on position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills.  This position is in Broomfield, Colorado ResponsibilitiesCollaborate with and work alongside business stakeholders to understand their process, team objectives, and prioritize solution developmentProvide real-time support for issues relating to CRM solutions and other supported integrated platforms and demonstrate ability to remain calm when troubleshootingProvide administration support of the CRM environmentCreate/update PHP scripts to integrate with APIs of CRM solutionsUse business analysis techniques such as user interviews, requirements workshops, task analysis, etc. to elicit requirements and areas for process improvementAssist in resolving business issues by translating requirements into project deliverables and partner with the business and key stakeholders within teams to model, design, and help build solutions in CRM solutionsResearch new features based on user needs and user interviewsProactively seek out ways to utilize CRM solutions to improve processes and productivity and make recommendations to individual teams and to the larger businessSkillsGeneral knowledge of CRM solutions such as Salesforce, SugarCRMHands on experience with PHP scriptingShould be aware of how APIs workAbility to roll up sleeves and do what is needed to make programs successfulAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, unpredictable environmentQualificationsBackground in computer science and ITExcellent communication and organizational skillsEnjoy working in teamsAbout Us BETSOL is a Product Engineering and Managed IT Services company, offering products and solutions to enterprise customers and consumers. BETSOL sells products such as Rebit (rebitgo.com), Zmanda (Zmanda.com) and Leto (Betsol.com). Through managed IT services, we enable our enterprise customers to reduce time to market and scale their solutions.  With team members who hold several patents, our world class engineering team delivers award-winning products and solutions.  Our work locations are set against the vibrant backdrops of Downtown Denver, Boulder, Broomfield, and the Denver Tech Center.  We offer health insurance, competitive salary compensation, volunteer programs, scholarship opportunities, on site gym and cafeteria, monthly happy hours, and fully paid RTD passes. What you can expect from us Here at BETSOL, we work hard to provide our team with the best opportunities to grow their careers. You can expect to be a pioneer of ideas, a student of innovation, and a leader of thought. Innovation and thought leadership is at the center of everything we do, at all levels of the company.  Lets make your career great!  Job Type: Internship  Job Type: Internship  Experience: CRM: 1 year (Preferred)Salesforce Admin: 1 year (Preferred) Location: Broomfield, CO (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Loading...Who We Are:Samantha Brands Group (“SBG”) was founded in 2016 on the premise that promising young food brands and their founding entrepreneurs needed more than just financial investment in order to be successful. In addition to Financial support, SBG's team of seasoned CPG operators work alongside the Founders in each of its portfolio companies day to day in order to help them grow their brands in the right way and at a much faster rate. Today, we operate two of the fastest growing Natural Foods Brands including Tres Latin Foods and Wildmade Snacks We are looking to hire one Supply Chain Analyst for each of our businesses as we continue to expand rapidly. Our corporate offices are located in Denver, CO.What You Will Do:The Supply Chain Analyst will report to the Director of Operations and will be an integral part in helping to manage the supply chain for each brand. More specifically, the Supply Chain Analyst will help strategically plan and manage logistics and customer order management, manage inventory levels of both raw materials and finished goods, develop and implement new processes and systems, as well as manage custom supply chain projects as needed. This position will also have the opportunity to collaborate with several other functions within the organization such as sales, marketing, and accounting. Candidates will also have a chance to learn about building a fast-growing food business from a small but seasoned team of business professionals who love working together.Specific duties include but are not limited to:Strategically plan and manage logistics and transportation, actively manage warehouse stock levels, and proactively communicate with key customers and distributors. Keep track of quantity, stock levels, delivery times, transport costs and efficiencyImplement specific customer requirements, such as internal reporting or customized transportation metricsDevelop optimal transportation modes, routing, and frequencyResolve problems concerning transportation, logistics systems, imports or exportsAnalyze the financial impact of proposed logistics changes, such as routing, shipping modes, product volumes or mixes, or carriersManage inventory levels of finished goods and raw materials: Keep track of internal finished stock levels, raw materials, delivery times and costsWork with Director of Ops/CEO on procurement related projects including specific cost reduction, dual sourcing and co manufacturingRegularly communicate with vendors, the manufacturing facility and distribution warehouses with updates and changes to finished goods and raw materialsDevelop and implement new processes and procedures: Maintain metrics and analyze data to assess performance and implement improvementsCollaborate with other departments to integrate analyses and supply chain with existing business systems or processes, such as sales, marketing, accounting, other operations requirementsManage custom supply chain projects as needed: As this is a small and growing business, the Logistics Manager will need to wear many hats. As such, there will be other operations duties as assignedWho You Are:Bachelor’s degreeAt least 2 years previous successful experience of supply chain and logistics management; preferably in a food company but not requiredProficiency in relevant softwareExcellent written and spoken English language skills and the ability to communicate clearly in oral and written formPositive outlook and professional demeanorAbility to work in a fast-paced, team environmentAbility to be flexible with assignments and multiple prioritiesAbility to creatively problem solveExcellent attention to detail and organizational skillsAbility to operate standard office equipment such as computer, calculator, phone, printer, copier and faxSolid competency with Microsoft Office products, including Excel and Word.

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionRxRevu is hiring a mid-level professional to excel in a multi-faceted client-facing role for a growing healthcare IT company. The successful candidate will assist in user behavior analysis, data validation, report generation, and analysis of healthcare and web application data. The Data Analyst will work closely with colleagues on the analytics and client services teams. The Data Analyst will also work closely with healthcare provider and payer clients to identify and acquire the core data elements utilized in building RxRevu’s analytics product.  Responsibilities include: Generating statistical reporting by obtaining data from disparate sources ensuring the applicability and accuracy of informationBuilding dashboards and reports for payers, providers and internal business units, to provide insights for the strategic goals of each stakeholderWorking directly with clients on data management, acquisition and deliveryEvaluating customer utilization data and identifying opportunities to drive user engagement and the product development processImplementing special projects and reports as assigned · Reinforcing RxRevu's core values of transparency, accountability, empathy, courage, and a belief in the best of each other Qualifications The successful candidate will have the following required qualifications:  · A bachelor’s degree in statistics, information sciences, information technology or other applicable concentration. Other relevant experience will also be considered in lieu of a formal degree. 2+ years of relevant data analysis work experienceExperience with programming in relevant statistical languages such as Python/R/ExcelAdvanced knowledge of data visualization and dashboarding tools such as TableauWillingness to challenge the status quo and drive creative and unique solutionsAdept at translating vague ideas into clear, defined goals, and an ability to drive the execution of those goalsStrong attention to details, with excellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal skills and an ability to build and maintain productive, positive relationships with other members of the RxRevu teamA desire to learn and grow in a fast-paced environment · An ability to travel up to 25%  The following qualifications are desirable but not required: Familiarity with electronic health records or other healthcare provider-facing software solutions This is a full-time position based in Denver, Colorado. The successful candidate must already have, or be able to obtain, authorization to work in the United States. The Data Analyst will report to the Vice President of Analytics & Operations. All candidate information will be held in confidence, and in accordance with EEOC guidelines. Benefits RxRevu benefits include the following: Medical, vision, dental and flexible spending accountsFlexible vacation time and a flexible work scheduleMain office located in the River North (RiNo) area of DenverCompany-paid parking Company DescriptionAbout RxRevu  At RxRevu we believe in improving the value of healthcare through informed, consistent prescription decisions. We also believe that lasting changes require a dedicated intention and aligned effort, and we are committed to investing in the future of healthcare.  We leverage Prescription Decision Support (PDS) to deliver real-time, patient-specific cost information, electronic prior authorization, and therapeutic alternatives at the point of care. By doing so, we enable shared decisions between providers and patients, help patients get the right medication the first time, and remove friction from the point of care to fulfillment. Our goals: Increasing medication adherence  Creating better outcomes for patients  Enhancing patient-prescriber conversations  Improving prescriber experiences  Solidifying PDS as a premier standard of care

Name: Business Systems Analyst (Qualitative)
Description: The United States Postal Service (USPS) operates a complex logistics operation to transport mail and equipment between its mail processing and delivery facilities. While some of the local transportation service within the larger metropolitan areas is provided by postal employees, the majority of the network is serviced by highway contract suppliers. The complexity of the network requires continuous adaptations, resulting in requests for new service, or contract modifications. Transportation purchasing in the USPS environment requires technically skilled and knowledgeable personnel who specialize in the commodity, and that are well versed in procurement, contract administration, and contract law. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs.Documents requirements, defines scope and objectives, and formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.Familiar with relational database concepts, and client-server concepts.Performs financial/statistical analysis and presenting recommendations based on the findings.Tracks record of driving results through process improvementMonitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions.Provided executive management with improved visibility to high-level trends, identification of key controllable metrics and creation of standardized reporting.Oversee the life cycle of changes to business systems and prepare detailed reports for executive management.Must be a U.S. citizen.Security Clearance Type: Public Trust.Full background check including drug screening .Bachelor degree in a business related disciplines; MBA preferred.Knowledge of Qualitative Business Processes, re-engineering.Business analysis experience (i.e. requirement analysis/gathering, business case development, etc.)Strong writing skills; experience in developing job aids and policy documents.Experience recommending controls by identifying problems and writing improved procedures.Demonstrated experience improving workflow systems by studying current practices and designing modifications.Detail-oriented and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.EIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer/M/F/V/Disabled.

Name: Business Analyst - (Forms)
Description: Company:ICAT Description:Position Summary The Business Analyst is responsible for a full range of activities including both QA and UAT which ensure the operational effectiveness and excellence of the business unit. The Business Analyst will track and analyze business unit trends and make appropriate recommendations that will positively impact the unit. The Business Analyst will also act as Project Manager for small sized projects as necessary. The Business Analyst will be the functional expert on the specified application(s) as liaison between the business unit and Information Technology.  Essential Functions and Responsibilities  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Provides an understanding of existing procedures, policies, practices and products and renders insights to the project team regarding future state needs, requirements and impacts.Work closely with the Business Unit leaders and Subject Matter Experts (SME) by providing key analytical support that will allow business needs and requirements to be understood, defined and documented at a level that will enable business and technical systems to be effectively developed, deployed and supported.Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.Responsible for the Business Requirements Definition process.Understands business and technology environments, application and process capabilities.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Business Requirements Document, Use Cases, GUI Design and Process Flows)Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.Participates in Steering Committee and Business process analysis.Develops User Acceptance Testing (UAT) Test Plans and coordinates and participates in UAT process as well as supporting the QA process as needed.Coordinates groups of business personnel who test, evaluate and validate new functions and applications, and identify issues in software or services.Ensures that all items follow the change management process and are entered and tracked through the change management software.Obtains final signoff from the business sponsor to release code to production.Participates in smoke testing in release process.Ensures issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner.Communicates needed changes discovered in UAT to Project Manager and development team.Owns the development and management of project scope, cost and schedule.Owns the front to back process to implement approved and defined projects.Provides the day-to-day planning, management and project control.Project Manager provides leadership, supports the required review activities, and regularly reports project progress and status.Coordinates interactions with the impacted and involved business, management and technical areas and keeps the Project Team on target and focused.Provides Tier 2 Application Production support by managing specific application quality assurance and help desk activities including the tracking of bug reports and change requests, ensuring their timely resolution.Maintain knowledge of and support ICAT's company values and strategic planOther duties as assigned. Preferred Job Qualifications BA degree in business or related field or equivalent work experience.Experience in the Insurance Industry is a must. Exposure to Claims preferred.Minimum 5 years experience in business analysis including project management, client consulting, and quality assurance.Proven business analyst, project management and leadership skills.Proven communication skills (written and verbal) in working with management, clients and technological experts.Strong organizational and time management skills.Proven ability to develop, document and maintain operational policies and procedures, including the designing and documenting detailed process flows.Solid understanding of existing and emerging industry practices, and ability to evaluate alternative business solutions.Understanding of application programming, database and system designs, systems and application interfacing and Agile, RUP and Waterfall development methodology a plusAdvanced skills in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Word, Excel and Outlook.Knowledge of e-mail/scheduling software applications.Experience with web-based underwriting systems.Knowledge of MS Project a plus. Founded in 1998 and based in Broomfield, Colorado, ICAT is a leading provider of property insurance protection to homeowners and businesses located in hurricane- and earthquake-exposed regions of the United States. ICAT draws from highly specialized underwriting expertise and advanced technology tools to offer brokers and their clients market-leading catastrophe coverage. Along with its subsidiary, Boulder Claims, ICAT's inherent promise to policyholders is to assist people and businesses as they recover from disasters. ICAT programs currently protect over 85,000 homeowners and business owners in catastrophe-exposed regions of the US.  Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers.

Name: ANALYST III - Online Efile Analyst
Description: Department Information  The Colorado Department of Revenue (CDOR) employs approximately 1,300 hard-working and dedicated employees throughout Colorado. We can be seen performing functions as varied as auditing and collecting taxes, issuing driver licenses and motor vehicle titles, marketing lottery products, enforcing liquor laws, and regulating gaming, horse racing, marijuana, and the auto industry and assisting the citizens of our state. At CDOR, we value Communication, Dedication, Ownership and Responsible Government. The Department of Revenue also offers:Strong, secure, yet flexible retirement benefits including PERA Defined Benefit Plan, PERA Defined Contribution Plan, State Defined Contribution plan plus 401K and 457 plansMedical and dental health plansEmployer-supplemental Health Savings AccountPaid life insuranceAutomatic short-term (and optional long-term) disability coverage10 paid holidays per yearPaid vacation and sick leaveDiscounted RTD Eco-Pass (Denver Metro locations)BenefitHub program for discounted merchandise, food and travelCafeWell employee wellness programExcellent work-life programs, such as some flexible work schedules, training and more To learn more about our benefits visit: https://www.colorado.gov/dhr/benefits Description of Job  The position is located in the Taxpayer Services Division/Electronic Filing Unit and exists to implement and advance electronic filing of income and business tax returns that are prepared and submitted via user interfaces in Revenue Online, and optimize taxpayer inquired or protest submissions made online. The position will also interact with Colorado Interactive and other state agencies to advance electronic tax administration. The incumbent must be able to determine if web filing issues are due to inadequate instructions or due to weaknesses in the web interface workflow. Must track and resolve taxpayer and tax practitioner inquiries on return filing issues or knowing how to navigate Revenue Online. This requires applying basic knowledge of the tax filing requirements and information that can be securely shared through the web. Analyze statutory and form changes in order to update the online filing applications offered in the Revenue Online system for multiple taxes. Provide the necessary update information to the Gentax developers and Gentax support group. Coordinate with them on the installation and system testing of online filing and rules. Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Science, Finance or a related field at the the agencies discretion.  AND two years of professional experience in business information operations which must include one year of testing and/or validating business information systems.  (This professional experience MUST be detailed in the application. Failure to provide the above listed experience and/or "see resume" statements will not be accepted in lieu of a completed application).  Substitutions  A combination of work experience in Accounting, Auditing, Business, Management, Computer Management or Finance may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the Bachelor's degree.  A Master's or Doctorate degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Science or Finance may substitute for the Bachelor's degree and one or two years of the experience, respectively.  Preferred Qualifications and Competencies  The preferred candidates will possess a Master's degree in Accounting, Business, Management, Computer Management or Finance; two years of project management or two years of experience in design, testing and validating web systems or two years of system analysis and support for Revenue Online.  DOR REQUIRED SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: Competencies required for all DOR positions include good communications skills (both oral and written), interpersonal skills, the ability to multi-task, the ability to work with confidential information, the ability to work in high-stress environments, and the demonstrated ability to assist customers in an effective, efficient, and elegant manner.  The following are conditions of employment with the Colorado Department of Revenue: All employees must be current with their Income Tax filings and payments with the State of Colorado. This includes successfully passing a pre-employment evaluation of your tax records/accounts.Employees are in a position of public trust in the performance of their job duties and must operate in a manner that maintains the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and public confidence. All job finalists require successful completion of a background investigation and reference check prior to appointment. Background checks may include national criminal, financial, traffic, civil, education, and/or experience checks or any other checks related to the job assignment. Fingerprint background checks and pre-employment drug testing may also be required for some positionsAPPEAL RIGHTS: If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.  Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.  Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb.  A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.  Supplemental Information E-MAIL ADDRESS: All correspondence regarding your status in the selection/examination process will be conducted via e-mail. Include a working email address on your application; one that is checked often as time sensitive correspondence WILL take place via email. Exam information or notification will take place via email; check your email frequently. Please include your current e-mail address on your application and set up your e-mail to accept messages from "state.co.us" and "info@governmentjobs.com" addresses. It is your responsibility to ensure that your email will accept these notices and/or review your junk mail and spam filtered email. APPLICANT CHECKLIST: Only complete applications submitted by the closing date for this announcement will be given consideration. Failure to submit properly completed documents by the closing date of this announcement may result in your application being rejected.  Applicants MUST submit a resume, cover letter/letter of interest and transcripts (if applicable) detailing how their experience and background address the stated minimum and preferred qualifications/competencies of the job (late submissions will not be accepted).  Complete Applications must include the following documents:  1) A complete CDOR Application for Announced Vacancy (Submit online using the link in this announcement)  2) A complete Supplemental Questionnaire (Submit online as part of your application)  3) A chronological resume (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted)  4) A Cover Letter with a Written Narrative. The written narrative should describe your interest in this position and specifically how your education, abilities, skills and experience relate to the requirements, responsibilities and competencies listed in the job announcement. (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted)  5) A copy of your official or unofficial transcript showing that your degree has been conferred and the name of your school, or your NACES accreditation (Attach to your online application, late submissions will not be accepted) MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AND COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS:The application will be used to determine if the applicant meets the Minimum Qualification requirements.The application, resume and cover letter/letter of interest are the first step in the comparative analysis process and will be used to determine whether an applicant will move on to the next step in the process.They may also be used to determine the top group to be invited for further testing, the applicants rank or establish an eligible list. Part of, or the entire comparative analysis for this position, may involve a review of the information submitted in the application material, including the answers to the supplemental questions. Therefore, it is paramount that in the experience portion of the application, the applicant describes the extent to which they possess the education, experience, competencies and background as they relate to the duties outlined in the job announcement, as well as the special and/or preferred qualifications. List your employment history starting with the most recent job, including part-time, temporary, and volunteer jobs. If more than one job was held with a given organization, list each job held as a separate period of employment. Under "Duties," describe clearly the tasks you performed and the nature of your supervisory, technical, or other responsibilities as they relate to the job for which you are applying. Be complete and specific in detailing of duties. Information must be accurate, including dates of employment. If it is found that information provided is falsified, you will not be considered for a job with the State of Colorado and/or may be removed from a job after hire. "See resume" statements will not be accepted in lieu of a properly competed application. Failure to include adequate information or follow instructions may affect the applicant's score and/or prevent them from competing in any subsequent measures used to arrive at a top group of applicants. Factors to be assessed are those outlined in the requirements, competencies, and preferred qualifications.  Years will be expressed in terms of full-time equivalent service with full-time workload equal to one (1) Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) year. No more than 1.00 FTE year may be credited in any twelve (12) month period. Positions working 40 hours of less per week will be pro-rated (i.e. 30 hrs/wk=0.75 FTE=9 mos credit; 20 hrs/wk=0.5 FTE=6 mos credit; 10 hrs/wk=0.25 FTE=3 most creditSDL2017

Name: Cost Analyst
Description: The CSI Companies is actively seeking a Cost Analyst for our client in the Denver, CO area.  The Cost Analyst will be responsible for Captial Reporting, Variance Analysis, Budget Planning, Reimbursements, & Authority for expenditures (AFE) Creation & Project Closeout.  We're looking for a candidate that can work the below hours:  This team works 80 hours in 9 days with every other Friday off...9 hours per day with core hours of 8AM to 3PM...so an individual can work 8AM to 6PM or 6AM to 4PM as long as 9 hours are worked in a day. Job Duties: Capital Reporting  Assist in maintenance of Capital Portfolio Database  Update the monthly capital reports  Pull Capital forecasts monthly in preparation for monthly reports/meetings  Update monthly Logistics scorecard slide data  Variance Analysis  Understand variances of capital portfolio and why items have moved or changed  Work with regional contacts to compile commentary on variances and be prepared to discuss  Report back to business monthly on variances  Budget Planning  Be point of contact for compiling the 5 year capital plan  Work with other groups (Ops, BD, Analytics) to align capital plan with EBITDA and maintenance plans  Communicate out the final plan and be keeper of list  Reimbursements  Work with accounting, contracts, AFE admin and the business to understand the landscape of reimbursable projects  Ensure we have a grasp on the Gross vs. Net nature of any reimbursable projects  Be able to report out on the capital portfolio from both Gross and Net perspective  AFE Creation and Project Closeout  Assist with coordinating needed AFE documentation  Understand capital policy and assist in determination of Income /Maintenance /Deferred /Expense  Assist with invoice issues  Assist getting PO closed out and projects closed out Requirements: Ability to pass a Hair Follicle Drug Test  2-4 years of experience in Accounting/Finance/Project Controls background  Experience with computer applications such as Microsoft Suite Programs (Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint) and any other related financial software preferred.  SAP experience preferred (major plus)  Attention to detail, accuracy & timeliness (project is time sensitive)  Associates Degree minimum - Bachelor's degree in accounting or related financial discipline preferred.
