This is an initial 3+ month contract opportunity.Roles and Responsibilities:Must work in the office on-premise from 8 AM to 5 PM with 1 hour lunch break ServiceNow Coordinator (junior business analyst) support the teams in technical design sessions Provide support for strategic planning and continuous improvements of ServiceNow Assist and support troubleshooting ServiceNow related issues Assist and scribe ServiceNow related meetings Support team in responding to business requests proposals for ServiceNow Assist Prepares and submits proposals/results for complex analysis for ServiceNow Assist gathering business requirements for the design, implement and document of new or modified processes in ServiceNow Assist and track ServiceNow enhancements Develop reports for ServiceNow support teams Assist, monitor, and manage ServiceNow administrative reports Assist and support providing responses for processes in ServiceNow requested by audit Assist in creation of requirements, test plans, test cases and testing for any ServiceNow automation or modifications Assist Managed Services Process Owner in creation and/or review of process, policies and procedure manuals against detailed requirements to support Assist and support training End Users, Technical Support teams and Third-Party Vendors Assist, monitor, and manage Knowledgebase ArticlesQualifications:Entry level to 2 years as a Business Analyst experience Effectively use teamwork to positively contribute in high performing, results driven, and collaborative team environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively communicate business and technical information across all levels of the organization, being sensitive to the needs of unique audiences Requirements gathering - Solicit, gather and challenge business requirements for ServiceNow Experience in developing test cases, participation in the testing of software systems (including requirement validation/traceability), leading UAT sessions Experience in leading and influencing small teams Entry to middle level ServiceNow Information Technology Service Management and project portfolio management experience Understands ITIL Methodologies ITIL Foundation Certification V3 (optional) Assist in reviewing ITIL Processes for Managed and Branch Services Mid-Level to expert user of Office 365 products SharePoint, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Visio, Outlook, etc. Ability to understand, analyze and create financial reports Ability to work independently and aggressively track to project timelines as well as in team environments Ability to develop new and improve existing processes and procedures Building and strengthening relationship with internal and external teams Pro-active problem-solving skills Ability to multi-task and well organized Geographical knowledge and map reading skills Knowledge of IT industry is recommended Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

Name: Senior Cyber Security Fraud Investigative Analyst
Description: Job FamilyInfrastructure SecurityJob Description SummaryResponsible for delivering new technologies to support the strategies of the business. These technologies are delivered as a part of a technology strategy and roadmap that is developed based on a comprehensive analysis of capabilities and needs. Participates in and provides leadership for small project to delivery teams as these new technologies are introduced to the business.Job DescriptionResponsibilitiesReviewing and analyzing forensic data related to fraud and potential fraud events.Correlating log, paper, process and event data to find relevant connections and to broaden understanding of fraud events as well as other cyber security, network and process events.Threat intelligence correlation to reveal and enrich understanding of threat vectors, attack processes, fraud actors, and malicious cyber behavior.Participating in usage and deployment of fraud and case management technologies. Development and distribution of root cause analyses; to gain shared understanding and agreement on attack, containment and remediative steps, process changes and technical control implementation.Facilitating, documenting, and implementing anti-fraud controls, standards and guidelines as required.Working with business leaders and client management organizations to explain and level set fraud event issues and concepts.QualificationsSubject matter experts in one or more technologies and their interaction with applications.Breadth of knowledge across technology disciplines. Ability to convert complex information into simple, explainable solutions.Understanding of current and future business needs met by infrastructure platforms.Results-driven with a bias towards practical applications. Possesses a planning orientation with integrative and strategic thinking skills. 2-5+ years of related work experience.Preferred QualificationsFour-year Computer Science or related degree, or equivalent work experience.Five or more years of related work experience.Certifications in relevant technologies, methods, or platforms are a plus.Demonstrate the key critical behaviors of commitment to task, communication, customer focus, decision making / problem solving, flexibility, tolerance of ambiguity, planning, prioritizing, and goal settingStrong knowledge of Information Security and Cyber Fraud demonstrated by one or more of the following:Bachelor degree in Information/Cyber Security, Information Risk, Information Risk Management.Bachelor degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Management or similar four year technical degree combined with one or more of the following:Active CHFI, CISSP, CEH, CompTIA Security+, CAP, CISM, CASP or CISA or equivalent certificationsDemonstrate the key critical behaviors of commitment to task, communication, customer focus, decision making / problem solving, flexibility, tolerance of ambiguity, planning, prioritizing, and goal setting.Experience in Insurance, Payments, Banking or other Fin-Tech Industries.Behavioral & Leadership CompetenciesAbility to define and communicate complex technical and cyber security problems, concepts and situations to multiple skill levels; including business personnel with little to no cyber experience.Ability to quickly learn and apply new conceptsAbility to drive and achieve consensus/support from large diverse groups. Strong written and verbal communication skills enabling effective articulation of strategy.Experience with systems such as Remedy, JIRA, Tanium, and or equivalent.Proficiency with Microsoft Office, preferably with deep Excel and PowerPoint skill sets.Demonstrated project management and client relationship skills.Ability to lead teams on small to medium projects is required.Our CultureAt Transamerica we promote a Future Fit mindset. What is a Future Fit mindset?Acting as One fosters an environment of positive collaboration.Accountability allows us to own the problem as well as the solution.Agility inspires new ideas, innovation and challenges the status quo.Customer Centricity encourages an above and beyond approach to our customer.Working ConditionsMust be available to travel up to 10%.Why Work for UsTotal Rewards at Transamerica: It’s more than a paycheck.Our comprehensive Total Rewards package is designed to help support you in many ways — throughout all stages of your life and career. We provide a competitive, market-driven program that encompasses base compensation, bonus potential, retirement, health and wellness benefits, learning and development opportunities, plus great employee perks. All designed with you in mind… to help you live your best life, grow personally and professionally - and feel valued for the work you do.Learn more about our Total Rewards Package.Equal Opportunity Employer:Transamerica Life Insurance Company is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee because of age, religion, sex, gender identity, genetic information, race, color, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, marital status, participation in the uniformed services (e.g. U.S. Armed Forces, National Guard), physical or mental disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local equal employment opportunities laws.AEGON USA Realty Advisors, LLC, is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate against any applicant or employee because of age, religion, sex, gender identity, genetic information, race, color, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, marital status, participation in the uniformed services (e.g. U.S. Armed Forces, National Guard), physical or mental disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local equal employment opportunities laws.Applicants with physical or mental disabilities may be entitled to a form of reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state and local laws. Name: Sr Staff, Business Systems Analyst
Description: Description:Lone Tree - CO, DENR1, 9800 Schwab Way, 80124  Paul Medina Guevara  1126-44987 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Culture: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qkic76FWat8 Our Opportunity: Offer Management is a team of Technical Product Owners and Business Systems Analysts that manage the Offer Order platform and internal products we call “offers”. Offers allow Schwab to segment data by business/product line to assemble intended digital experiences for each Schwab client. The platform is highly integrated with front and back end systems throughout the firm to facilitate the delivery of consistent cross channel experience.  As a Senior Technical Product Owner/Business Systems Analyst you will prioritize and define project requirements, become an SME on the platform, and liaison with internal business and technical stakeholders to bring world class client experiences to life. Key Responsibilities:You will build products and experiences which enhance Schwab’s digital platforms, and help to develop new ideas based on market analytics and interactions with business stakeholders, customers and prospects.You will develop user stories and determine acceptance criteria that fulfill the needs of our business partners and our clients.You will fulfill the product owner role for a dedicated scrum team in daily stand-up meetings, sprint planning sessions, and product demonstrations.You will work with technical and business counterparts to define product release requirements and investigate production issues as they arise.You will become a subject matter expert on the Offer Order domain and bring stakeholder’s digital products to life by acting as an internal consultant from the ideation stage through deployment.You will learn and understand Schwab’s business and product lines that you are assigned as well as understand how the technical domains interact behind the scenes to fulfill on those products and services.You will perform data and systems analysis to research issues and discover information to support decision making.What you have:Strong business systems analysis skills. The ability to join a project team and quickly understand the business goal and bigger picture using requirements discovery techniques and process mapping. The ability to grasp how our platform fits into the strategy of the firm and can distill project level business requirements down to the domain level.Superior communication skills – written, verbal, and pictorial (diagrams!). Confident communicating with business and technical partners at all levels during every stage of the software development lifecycle. Awareness of different partners and tailors communication depending on the audience.Strong technical product management skills and experience.Effective relationship builder with strong initiative. The propensity to create an internal network and find information. Partners well cross-functionally and works effectively with various personality types. Effective team member and contributor.Strong research and data analysis skills. The ability to perform ad-hoc data analysis by writing SQL and running queries. Can support researching production issues and pull data to support informed decisions.Thrives in a dynamic and fast-moving work environment. A positive attitude and solid work ethic.The ability to track multiple projects (3-4) at once.The ability to rank and prioritize competing work efforts.Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methods and processes is a plus.Experience with Visio, JIRA, Confluence, HipChat, Tableau, and Splunk is a plus.What you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab.  Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is Schwab's policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, legally protected medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, military status, citizenship status or any other status that is protected by law. Schwab also does not discriminate against applicants or employees because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. At Schwab, we believe that every employee, through their diverse abilities and experiences, can contribute to our growth, innovation and client loyalty. We embrace diversity and are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. If you have a disability, and require reasonable accommodations in the application process, call Human Resources at 800-725-3535. We will be happy to assist you. Schwab will only share your accommodation request with those individuals who have a specific need to know. The request for an accommodation will not affect Schwab's hiring decisions. All other submissions should be performed online.Job Specifications  Relocation Offered?: No Work Schedule: Days Languages: English - spoken Current Licenses / Certifications: None Relevant Work Experience: Product Development-2-5 yrs Position Located In: CO - Lone Tree Education: BA/BS Job Type: Full Time Category:Digital Services  Activation Date: Monday, November 26, 2018  Expiration Date: Saturday, December 1, 2018  Apply Here

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst - Manufacturing
Description: Sr. Financial Analyst - ManufacturingOur goal at Elkay is to inspire everyday – customers, employees…and the employees of tomorrow. We focus on doing the right thing so we can be in business forever. Our values-driven culture emphasizes investing in people and treating them like part of the family. We’re financially-stable and privately-owned with a solid reputation for ethics, integrity, giving back, and providing an engaging, inclusive environment where careers flourish and grow.It’s Elkay’s people who really give us our edge. We empower our employees to take the lead in delivering Elkay’s exceptional customer experience. Our commitment to our people is a recipe for success that has fueled our growth from a three-person shop in 1920 to one of today’s leading international suppliers of plumbing, water delivery and cabinetry products. If you’re ready for a new career challenge where everything you do will make a difference, talk to us about joining the Elkay family.Reporting to the Director of Finance, the manufacturing Sr. Financial Analyst partners with Operations leaders and Plant Leaders to provide financial analytics that drive business results in support of the short-term and long-term value of the assets, liabilities and investments of the plant. The position delivers analysis as part of the finance processes, linking financial results to operational performance drivers. The position interfaces with internal customers and stakeholders in the plant and corporate finance functions, driving continuous improvement to deliverables and processes supporting these customers. The Manufacturing Financial Analyst will be a dynamic leader within the business by providing valuable decision support analysis and driving business success. Specific responsibilities include:Business partner in process development and improvement to increase efficiency and effectiveness of the plant.Providing financial analysis and guidance for the plant manager and leadership teams at the facilityAnnual Budget and quarterly forecasting for plant – material, labor, burden, and freightCapital projects – performing analysis on advisability of expenditure via ROI calculations. Ensuring that proper documentation is provided to expenditure committee. Perform lookback analysis on all capital projectsActively support the physical inventory counts and cycle countsPeriod end and year end close activities – journal entries, review of expenses, and variance analysis. Report on plant performance/variances at monthly close meetings and in operations staff meetingsQualifications:BA/BS required in accounting or finance, requiredSolid background in Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and ERP systems required. Oracle experience is a plus. Candidate should have 5 –7 years of experience in financial analysis. Previous experience in accounting and manufacturing required.Excellent analytical and communication skills.Advanced Excel and database skills, MS Office, Essbase, Hyperion Planning, Oracle or equivalent ERPAbility to handle multiple projects at once and prioritizeProcess driven with ability to think critically Ability to work independently & take initiative while collaborating with remote business partnersMust be proficient in data gathering and analysis tools to create meaningful reports with ability to draw conclusions & problem solve.EOE/M/F/D/V/SO

Name: Outside Sales - Business Consultant
Description: Outside Sales - Business ConsultantDo you want to be part of an award winning company that is growing? Are you passionate about improving your skill set and business acumen? If so, keep reading. Not only does this company offer a fantastic company culture and environment for growth, but they have a residual commission structure! You can make six figures and earn the chance to move into management quickly!  Our client is a growing Professional Employer Organization (PEO) that offers employee-related services such as payroll, employee benefits, tax and HR compliance, and workers compensation. They are seeking ultra-motivated, goal driven outside B2B sales consultants to meet with local business owners in your area. You will be prospecting, delivering sales presentations and driving new client acquisition.Compensation & Benefits: This company offers Residual Commissions on every deal you close!! That is rare these days. You will continue to get paid on past deals you have closed for the lifetime of the contract.$45,000 Base salary + Uncapped Residual CommissionsMonthly auto/smart phone allowanceAnnual Presidents Club tripsRemote office environmentHigh-level training, support and mentoringMarketing support to drive demandFully paid healthcare benefits for employee and family (Did you read this? FULLY PAID!)Real career advancement opportunitiesRequirements:Bachelors degree1-3 years of outside sales experience preferredExcellent written and verbal communication skillsBusiness AcumenAbility to work independentlyIf you want to learn more, please apply and an Executive Recruiter will contact you if you fit the requirements above.

Name: Senior HRIS Analyst
Description: Want to Work with Really Great People?The lifeblood of Covius is our people. We are a tight-knit group and we're passionate about what we do. If you thrive on challenges and collaboration, and work hard no matter who is watching, we want to talk to you. At Covius, we believe it's possible to love coming to work. We don't do easy here. Standards are high, and we take pride in exceeding expectations. It's how we've gotten to where we are, and it's how we grow. We are a mid-sized company with a big heart. If you're looking for an opportunity that's authentic, meaningful and emphasizes living a balanced life, Covius is the place for you.The Senior HRIS Analyst partners with HR and Business leadership to analyze current work flows, improve processes, and leverage technological capabilities within our various systems. The Senior HRIS Analyst creates project plans, ensures timelines are met, and works effectively with colleagues to maximize existing system functionality. Responsible for ensuring 3rd party vendors act and deliver on requirements in an accurate and timely manner. Reviews and enforces system security, data privacy, and compliance. This position assists in the management of security administration for our HR/Payroll system (Ultimate), the monitoring and troubleshooting of both internal and external integrations, training of users, as well as end user testing.Essential Functions Act as an HR liaison with, HR Functional owners, IT and other 3rd parties to provide support to HR production systems, required upgrades and system enhancements.  Accountable for the maintenance of HR System security.  Maintain and support HR system interfaces including reconciliation and error reports.  Coordinate and conduct timely root cause analysis and drive to resolution for all HR systems, interfaces, and integrations.  Identify and recommend areas to simplify, standardize and improve HRIS set up.  Provide consultative direction, knowledge, and functional assistance to HR leadership, business leaders, end users, and other team members for ongoing administration of HR Systems.   Assist in HR audits, and maintenance of controls and documentation for compliance.   Maintain data integrity and enforce consistent data mapping across all HR systems.  Develop, maintain, support and deliver a variety of reports or queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools including semi-monthly, monthly, quarterly and year-end activities and reports.  Develop standard reports for ongoing customer needs.  Identify and lead the implementation of process improvements to gain efficiency and ensure data integrity across HR systems Education Bachelor’s degree in related field preferred  Equivalent education and experience may be considered Experience 5 + years of HRIS experience  Ultimate experience strongly preferred  Experience with coordination of projects  Intermediate/Advanced MS Excel Skills  Essential Knowledge, Skills& Abilities  Advanced proficiency with comprehensive HR/Payroll applications, preferably Ultimate (payroll, HR, benefits and reporting modules) or similar platforms (ADP, WorkDay, Peoplesoft).  Experience with Performance Management and Learning Management Systems (i.e. Cornerstone) and Rewards and Recognition System (i.e. YouEarnedIt)  HR System integration experience.  Interface management experience.  Payroll, benefits HR systems analysis, design, development, implementation, and integration with internal and external systems and applications preferred.  Strong understanding of HR functional processes and data requirements.  Advanced knowledge of MS Excel required, Intermediate knowledge of other MS Office products.  Project Management experience.  Demonstrated ability to manage third party vendor relationships to maintain systems and recommend system enhancements.  Solid interpersonal and communication (verbal& written) skills with focus on customer service.  Excellent attention to detail  Strong analytical, and critical thinking skills.Working ConditionsWork is performed in climate controlled indoor administrative office setting. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate, depending upon office or meeting location.Physical DemandsWhile performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate. The employee frequently is required to remain stationary. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move 10 pounds. Vision: Close and distance required with ability to see objects in presence of glare or bright lighting (e.g., computer screen). Speech/Hearing: Frequently interact with management, vendors, coworkers, industry constituents, clients and the public.Covius offers an extensive benefits package for all employees, including medical, dental, vision and 401k!Covius is committed to equal opportunity in all employment practices to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, pregnancy, disability, genetics, marital status, military or veteran status or any other protected category as established by local, state and federal law. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment relationship including recruitment and hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, compensation, disciplinary action, layoff, leaves of absence, training and termination. All such employment decisions will be made without unlawful discrimination based on any prohibited basis.The essential functions, working conditions and physical demands described above are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.*The employing entity for this role will be Covius Shared Services, LLC, a Covius company*

Name: Business Systems Analyst - Campus Recruiting
Description: *Business Systems Analyst - Campus Recruiting***CGI-experience the commitment** Find similar career opportunities  Category:Business Analysis (functional and technical)  City:Denver, Colorado, United States  Position ID:J0918-0217  Employment Type:Graduate *Position Description:** CGI is seeking students interested in careers in the Information Technology field. Become part of a unique culture that gives you the freedom to innovate, to make decisions, to achieve your full potential and to chart your own career.  Our Business System Analysts typically have a demonstrated interest in technology and business, strong problem-solving abilities, and excellent interpersonal skills. Business Analysis: Developing knowledge of a client?s industry, customers, organization and business objectives in order to help the client in a problem-solving role. Assessing user requirements, procedures and problems to create or improve a system.  ? User Support Analysis: Providing quality client support by answering client questions, researching possible solutions to problems, and fostering open communication between the client and the CGI project team. Tracking software and documentation defects, performing application maintenance, and providing onsite consulting and training as required.  ? System Testing: Working with system developers and designers to identify, diagnose, and document problems and errors in specific components of a system. Name: Business Process Analyst III/Power BI
Description: SUMMARY: The Business Process Analyst will serve as the Microsoft Power BI expert for all IAS Operations projects. Collaborating with business stakeholders and subject matter experts, he or she will design, develop and support Business Intelligence reports, dashboards, and self-service applications sourced from various production systems. Further, the Business Process Analyst will build and deploy business intelligence reports and dashboards using a variety of front-end visualization tools such as MS Power BI, or Excel. The Business Process Analyst will need to play multiple roles including architect, report developer, metadata modeler, SQL programmer, and end user trainer or mentor. With the ability to work in a highly collaborative environment with minimal supervision, the Business Process Analyst develop automated reports and dashboards using Power BI, Excel, and other reporting tools. Experience with data warehousing and Deltek CostPoint is required.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Identify gaps in current business processes, assess the efficiencies of operations, and analyze internal controls for weaknessesUnderstand business application data to identify opportunities to integrate systems, ensure data accuracy, integrity, and qualityInterface with Business and IT users to scope projects, manage budgets, and full oversight of process cycle implementation from inception to completionFormulate recommendations for process improvementsIdentify key business process management solutions and coordinate with Business Systems Analyst for automation of internal systems that align with the processDrive organizational change through facilitating cross functional teams consisting of key stakeholders from the business areas and functional areasDocument formal business policies, processes, and procedures in a clear and concise manner to support ease of use and understandingProduce reference documents and visual aids to communicate/demonstrate process flow and/or role responsibilitiesADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:Punctuality to work each day and prepared to work scheduled work hoursOther duties as assignedCOMPLIANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:Responsible for thoughtful adherence to all SNC Policies, Procedures, and Compliance regulations (internal and external)ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Minimum physical requirements to perform all duties and responsibilities, as defined by managementSNC job descriptions are meant as summarizations only. They do not necessarily reflect all duties and responsibilities of a positionEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:Requires a BA/BS in Related Field. Relevant work experience may substitute for required education.6+ years of experience in business process analysis2+ years of Power BI and Data WarehousingMust have experience in the implementation of Power BI into a business environmentFamiliarity with Deltek CostpointAbility to develop automated reports and dashboards using Power BI, Excel, and other reporting toolsStrong organizational and interpersonal skills, along with strong analytical abilityStrong facilitation skillsStrong project management and strong utilization of project life cycle methodologySelf-directed with an ability and commitment to understanding, conceptualizing, and modeling business processesCollaboration, negotiating, and influencing skillsAbility to handle many tasks at one time and to work with deadlinesProficiency in spreadsheets and graphics computer programs is requiredMinimum Fundamental Knowledge, Skills and Abilities as stated in SNC’s Responsibility Matrix. IMPORTANT NOTICES: This position requires current/active Top Secret/Secret (choose) U.S. Security Clearance. U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position needs an active U.S. Security Clearance for employment. Non-US citizens may not be eligible to obtain a security clearance. The Defense Industrial Security Clearance Office (DISCO), an agency of the Department of Defense, handles and adjudicates the security clearance process. Security clearance factors include, but are not limited to, allegiance to the US, foreign influence, foreign preference, criminal conduct, security violations and drug involvement.To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. *LIJH3Sierra Nevada Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer– Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran, or any other protected status  pursuant to applicable local, state or federal law, ordinance or regulation.

Name: Manufacturing Business Operations Analyst - Logistics
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH. Bachelor's degree (B. A. or B. S.) in Statistics, Data Science, Mathematics, Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering, or related degree from a four-year college or university.1+ years of experience working in a data-intensive position or with “big data.”Advanced skills and experience with Excel.Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to convey findings from complex data sets with use of easy to understand charts, graphs, and observations.Ability to articulate detailed business requirements for IT reporting and project request documents.Well-developed verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.Preferred Qualifications:1+ years of data analysis experience in a manufacturing or logistics environment.Strong understanding of statistical modeling and/or operations research concepts.Experience with additional data analysis tools such as Tableau, SAS, R, or statistical modeling tools.Familiarity with SQL and ability to write basic queries. DISH’s Manufacturing Department ensures the high-quality condition of millions of satellite receivers, remote controls, and other accessories. State-of-the-art facilities in El Paso, TX, Spartanburg, SC, and Denver, CO, use advanced diagnostic tools and equipment to test, refurbish, and redistribute hardware to customers. Responsibilities: The Business Operations Analyst will be responsible for analyzing large data sets to create trend reports, developing tools to audit operational processes, investigating irregularities in our shipments, and building analytical tools and models to improve our transportation programs. Research individual shipping invoices that do not contain necessary information to automatically bill to specific departments within Dish.Work with internal teams such as accounting, finance, manufacturing, and distribution to develop reports useful in understanding freight costs and patterns.Respond to carrier inquiries about payment status on invoices.Work with Dish’s Freight Payment vendor to ensure carrier compliance on invoices and to manage freight payment business rules.Assist internal teams with shipping and ensuring that all information is provided for accurate invoice payment.Develop reporting to ensure the freight payment program business rules remain up to date and accurate.Analyze transportation data to look for opportunities to improve processes and recommend best practices.Participate in quarterly business reviews with our Freight Payment vendor and transportation partners as necessary.Assist the Logistics team with other tasks as needed which may include data entry, reporting and analysis, partner management, and more.

Name: Financial Analyst/ Sales Engineer
Description: Job DescriptionSCOPE OF POSITION This role will be a key asset in the future growth of the company. This individual will be spear-heading the Company’s annual budgeting process, operating plan variance analysis and special projects. S/he will provide financial consulting and strategic support to senior management including preparing financial presentations, sales margin analyses, new business opportunities and other projects requested by senior management. This function acts as the analytical engine of the company to provide insights and support ‘optimal’ business decision making.  In addition to financial analysis, this role will also perform Sales Engineer duties, supporting sales team members and related departments including marketing and inside sales worldwide. Our Sales Engineers perform all aspects of Sales Operations including requirements gathering, developing solutions, performing analysis, running and writing reports with guidance and oversight. Support multiple versions of the Sales CRM tool which are configured differently for different business needs and processes. Support Sales CRM tool and related tools with maintenance, enhancements, basic administration, user support and user training with guidance and oversight. JOB RESPONSIBILITIESFinancial Analyst: · Analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators including all areas of revenue, cost of sales, expenses and capital expenditures  · Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance  · Oversee and manage the continued development of Budgeting, Financial Forecasting, Operating Plan and Modeling tools  · Ad-Hoc Reporting and Analysis  · Quarterly and Monthly Financial reporting assistance  · Improve performance by evaluating processes to drive efficiencies and understand ROI in marketing programs, product pricing, new initiative rollouts etc  · Develop financial models and analyses to support strategic initiatives  · Analyze complex financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management for decision making purposes  · Supporting Senior Management Team and Departments heads with in-depth analysis Sales Engineer: · Work on projects to make enhancements and modifications to the Sales CRM tool and processes as the needs of the organization expand and evolve  · Coordinates all steps of the sales process between sales and operations  · Interpret needs across various business groups and translate to actionable technical requirements  · Communicate and work alongside developer resources to build and QA custom Sales CRM tool solutions  · Lead roll out process of business solutions to the field through training and process implementation  · Develop/maintain reports and dashboards  · Perform analysis of data from multiple sources and make business recommendations  · Serve as first level interface to Sales CRM users for questions and issues  · Load data to the Sales CRM as needed  · Responsible for data integrity; Run audit reports and work with users to clean-up data  · Maintain and continually update/expand on the Sales CRM tool and process documentation  · Perform other duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS · Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance; MBA or other advanced degree preferred  · 2-5 years’ experience in Financial Planning and Analysis  · Experience monitoring inventory stock levels as it relates to sales volume and backorders  · Mathematic skills and an understanding of fractions, percentages, discounts, interest, tax rates, commissions, volume amounts, weights, conversions, and the like.  · Computer proficiently, specifically but not limited to:  • Salesforce  • Fishbowl/Locate inventory management (MRP)  • Advanced Microsoft Office Suite  · Expert time-management, prioritization and multi-tasking skills; Ability to quickly adapt to an often-changing and rapid-paced work environment.  · Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills  · Ability to think creatively, highly-driven and self-motivated  · Demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on management capacity ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS · Standard office hours are 8 – 5 Monday - Friday; but circumstances could require extraordinary time commitment.  · All prospective employees must pass a background check and all necessary assessments after conditional offer of employment is extended.Company DescriptionWe are entrepreneurs with a mission to use our collective years of business experience to make an impactful difference for our clients and partners.  As investor consultants, our commitment to create lasting impact means that we work differently, diligent in our desire to deliver on the fundamentals that drive businesses over the long-term.

Name: Client Financial Management Analyst - Philadelphia
Description: Job descriptionClient Financial Management AnalystLocation: Philadelphia, PAWe are in the midst of a technology revolution that is disrupting and transforming businesses and entire industries around the world. Accenture is working with clients to apply innovation and intelligence at the heart of their organizations. Empowered with leading-edge technologies, continuous learning opportunities and a global community with deep industry expertise, you’ll grow your career while solving clients’ biggest challenges.Our analyst experience includes a comprehensive and multi-modal learning curriculum with common required training and specialized training specific to your career track.  You’ll also benefit from mentorship and coaching from our people to ensure a successful integration.  Through local office corporate citizenship, inclusion & diversity and networking opportunities, we’ll help you build a strong sense of community and camaraderie from the start.  We are also committed to providing you varied experiences that will help you expand your skill set and broaden your exposure to all that Accenture has to offer its clients. Whatever your passion, Accenture offers a range of career opportunities in our strategy, consulting, digital, technology, security or operations businesses.Job DescriptionPeople in the Corporate Function career track contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.Finance professionals prepare and interpret financial plans and reports, ensuring accuracy and compliance with applicable financial rules and regulations, including internal financial controls, to mitigate risk for the company. Finance professionals may also shape and execute client deals to maximize the use of Accenture's capital and resources, manage cash and/or liaise with the investor community.ResponsibilitiesClient Financial Management professionals provide their services from the opportunity phase through contract completion in the areas of GAAP compliance, internal controls, budgeting/forecasting, contract profit and loss management, and advisory services to our customer leadership teams and corporate leadership.Assisting with the preparation of engagement, project, and program reporting as well as Accenture internal financial accounting processesExecuting or assisting with tracking and reporting of third-party out-of-pocket expenses, hardware/software costs, and client time and expenses against program budget, and any other expense charges to program budgetMonitoring or advising on engagement financial status and engagement capital assets and technology rental equipmentPerforming or assisting with reconciliation processes, data and report archiving, forecast management activities, and contract compliance trackingProviding value-added financial management, analysis, and advice to client engagement teams to maximize the profitability of engagementsEnsuring compliance with U.S. GAAP, Accenture finance policies and local statutory requirementsPreparing or assisting in the development of pricing calculations for engagements+ Basic qualificationsYour Experience:Basic QualificationsAccenture Analysts are forward-thinking, well-rounded people with a record of outstanding academic performance and high learning agility. We’re looking for individuals who can work in an open and entrepreneurial way.Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or other business-related major with a minimum of 9 credit hours of Accounting with a graduation date between January 2016 and December 2018Minimum overall GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 or one year of professional work experience in lieu of 3.0 GPAPreferredSkillsFinancial accounting experience including reconciliation, invoice preparation, processing financial transactions, and preparing financial budgets, etc.Strong PC skillsPC literate (e.g., working knowledge of MS Office Programs)Professional SkillsStrong analytical skillsGood oral and written communication skillsStrong organizational, time management and multi-tasking skillsAbility to work independentlyAbility to interact with executivesAttention to detailProven ability to work independently and as a team memberAbility to be flexible and work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environmentGood communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skillsExcellent customer service skillsStrong organizational and analytical skillsDemonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilianDemonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilianAbout AccentureAccenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions – underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network – Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With more than 435,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives. Visit us at www.accenture.com.Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.Accenture is an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.Equal Employment OpportunityAll employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women.

Name: Business Operations Analyst â Programs and Offers
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university; and two years related competitive or business intelligence experience and/or trainingPreferred degrees: Business, Finance, or MarketingExperience in strategic planning, sales process development and performance management.Exhibit the core values of DISH – Curiosity, Pride, Adventure and Winning.Ability to effectively respond to and interact with all levels of organizational staff within the commercial department and across the DISH organization.Competencies include presentation/facilitation, organizational, analytical, interpersonal and written/oral communication skillsPosition requires computer expertise, including use of internet, database, word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation applicationsMust be flexible, innovative and have the ability to manage responsibilities and priorities in a fast paced, growth-oriented and time-critical environmentLimited travel may be required The Business Operations Analyst is responsible for helping to develop and support DISH’s sales and product efforts within the targeted vertical market. Individuals in this role will maintain comprehensive knowledge of the targeted vertical markets, including competitive landscape, market trends and opportunities, and product/service needs. Utilizing this knowledge they will assist in developing and implementing strategic plans to maximize revenue, channel growth and market share. Primary responsibilities fall into the following categories:Maintain comprehensive understanding of competitive pricing and product offerings in key markets including:Competitor deep-dives with cross-functional teams (portfolio, SWOT, capabilities, strategic priorities, and implications for DISH)Regular reviews of events/results (e.g. financial reports, investor presentations, organizational charts)Ongoing analysis of existing and emerging market competitors to current and developing service and technology solutions.Create and present regular summaries to share insights and position DISH’s competitive differences to Senior Management, Sales, Product and Business Development teams.Serve as a focal point within the company for competitive requests in support of sales opportunities, such as specialized competitive materials, demand generation campaigns and product marketing initiatives.Coordinate closely with Sales and Marketing to ensure consistent understanding, and communication, of competitive advantages.Utilize competitive intelligence and other internal/external resources to propose strategies to improve acquisition, retention and monetization of customers in target markets.Maintain understanding of competitive programs from Indirect Channel Partners to ensure DISH is positioned as a preferred choice for prospective sellers.

Name: Trading Analyst
Description: Location(s): CO - Denver  Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you're looking for.  This position will be based out of our offices at 1800 Larimer St. in Denver, Colorado. Please note that while this position is primarily day shift, in the event of a crisis employees may be required to work outside their normal schedule to support operations. Preference will be given to candidates with NERC certification, prior trading analyst experience, energy or power trading experience, physical bilateral market operations experience, and/or balancing area operations experience.  Summary  Design and perform quantitative analysis to price wholesale energy commodity transactions and quantify and hedge risk. Plan and optimize seasonal, monthly, balance-of-month, and daily resource commitment schedules and portfolio positions to provide the most economic operations of the power system portfolios. Perform post-analysis of actual dispatch and system operations for each of the Xcel power system portfolios to determine opportunities for efficiency improvements. Know and adhere to business rules and understand regulatory regime.  Essential Responsibilities Design and perform appropriate quantitative studies of historical and forecasted prices, system loads, fuel costs, determination of the natural position of Xcel's power system portfolios. Supports trading and risk management activities through the quantification of the natural position of each Xcel regulated operating company. 'Troubleshoots' the daily operation of Xcel's regulated electric operating companies and provides technical support to Real-time Traders during daily operation of the systems. Assists Fuels in the determination of forward fuel requirements and the daily gas nomination process.Identify opportunities to improve system operations. Design and create analytical studies to model opportunities and determine costs and savings (e.g. rescheduling plant maintenance, alternative operating strategies for certain resources, etc.). Help plant operations personnel to understand market implications of plant operating decisions. Understands mechanical aspects of power plants and the potential optionality in the various power generation technologies. Understands electrical system constraints and operations.Create and run modeling scenarios to optimize daily unit commitment, additional purchases and sales, as well as long term energy limited or constrained seasonal purchases. Verifies accuracy of results through extensive post-analysis of Xcel system performance. These analyses include development of short-term load forecasts, current plant/contract availability, fuel costs and market conditions. These analyses result in determination of quantities of energy to buy/sell, optimal scheduling of constrained resources and optimal commitment decisions for plants and contractual resources.Design and perform post-analysis models of previous day system operation to determine opportunities for dispatch efficiency and purchase/sales improvements. Performs benchmarking of models as appropriate to assure analysis integrity. Verifies accuracy of sales costing when appropriate.Continuously seek improvements to processes and analyses used for purchasing and selling commodities, scheduling of contracted resources, and commitment and dispatch of Xcel generation assets.Perform pricing and costing of Real-Time Pricing Program sales and wholesale sales.Analyze and forecast future market prices at various trading points. Research energy market trends, maintains awareness of energy optimization techniques and tools to support trading contributors. Stays abreast of regulatory requirements. Maintains superior computer skills and continually searches for improved processes. Recommend trading strategies based on technical and fundamental market analysis. Required Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Applied Sciences or related fields Preferred 4 years experience in electricity industry with 1 year in energy commodity trading operations1 year experience with generation cost modeling software (Prosym, Promod, Couger, or Gentrader) As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you're ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.  Posting Notes: CO - Denver || CO - Denver || United States (US) || Operations || 25250:Power Operations || Full-Time || Non-Bargaining ||  Requisition Number: 16705  Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran  Individuals with a disability who need an accommodation to apply please contact us at recruiting@xcelenergy.comSDL2017

Name: Commercial Products Analyst
Description: Job Summary  Under general supervision, the Commercial Products Analyst performs a variety of duties to include various data and statistical analysis, administrative and customer service plan marketing activities for Denver Health Medical Plan’s (DHMP) Large Group segment. Prepares monthly reports including enrollment trends and profitability. The individual will have direct oversight of plan enrollment activities supporting the manager, and broker teams with member events as assigned. This position requires development and maintenance of the commercial large group segment within the business.  Minimum Qualifications Education and Experience 1. Bachelor’s Degree required. 2. Three years of related commercial health plan experience required. 3. Five years of related commercial health plan experience preferred. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities 1. Ability to recognize, document and initiate process improvement efforts as it is related to enrollment and process and procedure evaluation in order to improve departmental efforts. 2. Demonstrates a strong ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. 3. Working knowledge of the Colorado Medicaid System. 4. Strong written, verbal, and presentation communication skills. 5. Ability to think analytically, problem solve, and perform with a high level of accuracy. 6. Ability to prioritize work activities with minimal supervision in a team setting. 7. Bilingual in Spanish preferred. Computers and Technology 1. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including Visio, Microsoft Project, and SharePoint. 2. Working knowledge of QNXT.All job applicants for safety-sensitive positions must pass a pre-employment drug test, once a conditional offer of employment has  been made.Denver Health is an integrated, efficient, high-quality academic health care system that is considered a model for the nation. The Denver Health system includes the Rocky Mountain Regional Level I Trauma Center, a 525-bed acute care medical center, Denver’s 911 emergency medical response system, 8 family health centers, 15 school-based health centers, the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Center, the Denver Public Health Department, an HMO, and The Denver Health Foundation.  As Colorado’s primary safety net institution, Denver Health is a mission-driven organization that has provided more than $3.3 billion in care for the uninsured in the last ten years. Denver Health is a leader in performance and quality improvements and remains financially secure, in part, due to its nationally recognized implementation of lean principles in healthcare. Denver Health is a major resource to the community, serving approximately 185,000 individuals and 67,000 children a year.  Located just south of downtown Denver, Denver Health is just minutes away from many of the cultural and recreational activities Denver has to offer.  We strongly support diversity in the workforce and Denver Health is an equal opportunity employer (EOE).  “Denver Health is committed to provide equal treatment and equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees. Denver Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.”

Name: Administrative Analyst
Description: Job SummaryUnder general supervision, this accounting position is responsible for ordering a wide variety of program supplies following agency guidelines and processes including the use of a company credit card and placing orders online. The position ensures the accuracy of all orders and invoices upon receipt and will complete any follow-up needed to resolve discrepancies. The position prepares reimbursement requests, obtains required signatures, and tracks payment information through a variety of systems. The position is responsible for reconciling monthly charges to make sure all expenses are accurately charged to the appropriate program area. The position will assist the department by answering incoming calls, distributing mail, welcoming and directing visitors and providing general administrative support to staff. The ideal candidate will enjoy working with numbers while also providing excellent external and internal customer service in a front office setting.  Minimum Qualifications  Education: High school diploma or GED certificate. An Associate’s degree in business, accounting, finance or related field preferred. Experience: Typically 3 years of related experience in clerical, administrative or program support in public health or related field. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Products including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, and Excel. Proficient in data entry into spreadsheets and databases. Ability to use scheduling systems and coordinate meetings. Effective verbal and written communication and interpersonal human relations skills. Ability to prioritize, lead tasks and take initiative to achieve daily work expectations independently. Ability to multi-task with good troubleshooting and problem solving skills. Certificate/License/Registration: None All Certifications and Licenses required for this job must be kept current as a condition of continued employment.All job applicants for safety-sensitive positions must pass a pre-employment drug test, once a conditional offer of employment has  been made.Denver Health is an integrated, efficient, high-quality academic health care system that is considered a model for the nation. The Denver Health system includes the Rocky Mountain Regional Level I Trauma Center, a 525-bed acute care medical center, Denver’s 911 emergency medical response system, 8 family health centers, 15 school-based health centers, the Rocky Mountain Poison and Drug Center, the Denver Public Health Department, an HMO, and The Denver Health Foundation.  As Colorado’s primary safety net institution, Denver Health is a mission-driven organization that has provided more than $3.3 billion in care for the uninsured in the last ten years. Denver Health is a leader in performance and quality improvements and remains financially secure, in part, due to its nationally recognized implementation of lean principles in healthcare. Denver Health is a major resource to the community, serving approximately 185,000 individuals and 67,000 children a year. Name: Fraud Analyst
Description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!  We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  Compliance Specialist I performs a variety of administrative tasks to support other Fraud Compliance Specialists and a Fraud Compliance Manager to meet the requirements of the assigned regulatory area of the Compliance Management Program which includes researching, reviewing, and interpreting existing and pending laws and regulations.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities  + Assists with researching, reviewing, and interpreting existing and pending laws and regulations, which potentially affect the assigned regulatory area, such as FACTA, BSA, Compliance, etc.  + Works directly with the Fraud Compliance Specialists and Fraud Compliance Manager to meet the requirements of the Compliance Management Program, which includes associate training, conducting internal assessments, and board reports.  + Provides ongoing assistance and support to the Fraud compliance manager in administrative responsibilities.  + Ensures that all departmental documents and activities are performed in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies and procedures as applicable to this position, including completion of required compliance training.  + Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Skills + Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos.  + Ability to read and interpret documents such as procedure manuals, general business correspondence and/or journals or government regulations.  + Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial report and/or legal documents.  + Ability to write simple-to-business correspondence, routine reports, and procedures.  + Ability to respond in writing to customer complaints, regulatory agencies or members of the business community.  Education and/or Experience  + BS/BA Degree (4 year) from an accredited university /college or two to four years? experience in equivalent compliance position, preferred.  Specialized Training  + None  Computer Skills  + MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook  Other Qualifications (including physical requirements)  + Must have good time management, communication, and organizational skills.  Equal Employment Opportunity Information: Simmons First National Corporation and its subsidiaries are committed to a policy of equal employment with respect to a person's race, color, religion, sex, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, covered veterans, military status, physical or mental disability or any other legally protected classifications. Simmons First National Corporation and its subsidiaries are committed to Affirmative Action Programs consisting of results-oriented procedures to ensure equal employment opportunities. These programs require positive action in lieu of neutral non-discrimination and merit hiring/performance policies.  Since 1903, Simmons Bank has been dedicated to helping people and businesses realize their financial dreams. Simmons is the subsidiary bank for Simmons First National Corporation (NASDAQ: SFNC), a publicly traded bank holding company headquartered in Pine Bluff, Arkansas. After merging with First Texas BHC, Inc., parent company of Southwest Bank, and Southwest Bancorp, Inc., parent company of Bank SNB, Simmons First National Corporation has grown steadily to more than $14 billion in assets along with 2,700 associates located in Arkansas, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, Oklahoma, Tennessee and Texas. We?re growing! In fact, Fortune magazine recently listed Simmons as the 62nd fastest growing company in the U.S. Our growth has led to some amazing career opportunities. There?s never been a better time to join our team ? a team dedicated to working together, high integrity, passion for all we do, and a commitment to high performance and personal and professional growth. If these cornerstones of company culture appeal to you, let?s talk!

Name: Research Analyst- Technology
Description: Janus Henderson Global Investors is a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for clients through a broad range of actively managed funds\.  We provide our institutional, retail and high net\-worth individuals with access to skilled investment professionals representing a broad range of asset classes including, equities, fixed income, multi asset and alternatives\.  We are a team of independent thinkers who work tirelessly to help our clients achieve their goals and we do it by fostering an energetic and collaborative culture that ensures our people love the place they work\.  Headquartered in London, Janus Henderson is a truly global asset manager with a diverse geographic footprint, managing assets from 27 offices globally and employing more than 2,000 staff\.  Overview of the Role  Responsible for providing portfolio managers with relevant information and recommendations regarding investment attractiveness of equities and other securities in the small/mid\-cap financial/technology/services sectors\. Analyst conducts deep fundamental analysis of individual companies, focusing on factors such as: financial performance, competitive industry dynamics, technological innovation, quality of company management, etc\. Analyst will develop detailed financial models, including revenue/profit estimates, free cash flow projections, projected returns on capital, etc\. Analyst will be expected to project long\-term values of stocks under coverage using discounted cash flow methodologies and make buy and sell recommendations\.  Duties and Responsibilities  + Conducts deep fundamental analysis\. While the analyst will interview company management teams, research should include extensive independent contacts such as competitors, customers, partners and other relevant participants in the financial, technology and business services value chain\.  + Forecasts growth, evaluates competitive position, determines quality of financial statement information, and analyzes potential responses to worst case scenarios\.  + Synthesizes fundamental research to form a differentiated view on companies\.  + Strong communication skills Communicates articulately, concisely and persuasively\.  + Strong modeling skills Uses financial models to generate all relevant questions that need to be answered in the research process and model future revenue, earnings and cash flows\.  + Constructs comprehensive valuation analyses\.  + Drafts reports/notes on relevant investment themes and breaking news events  + Partner closely with portfolio managers, a key cultural tenet of the organization\.Other FunctionsAssumes additional duties as assignedSupervisory ResponsibilitiesNone\. Technical Skills and Qualifications  + Strong interest in the stock market and/or personal investment experience  + Background in equity research, technology, private equity, investment banking or consulting preferred\.  + Exceptional analytical skills and attention to detail  + Ability to work and make decisions independently, and to function effectively within a team  + Strong creativity, initiative, intellectual curiosity and drive  + Strong verbal and written communication skills  + Understanding of corporate finance, accounting, and experience with MS Word, Excel and research on the internet\.  + Ability to multi\-task, organize, and assimilate large amounts of information quickly  + 5\+ years relevant experience  + Four\-year degree in finance, economics, computer science, engineering or related fields  + Post graduate degree such as MBA/MS a plus  + Progress toward a CFA a plus  Ongoing competence in the role to be assessed by:  + Annual Performance Appraisal  + Completion of all assigned Compliance trainingWorking Environment/Physical Activities  + Overtime may be required on short notice and may include evening, weekend, holiday hours  + Typical office environment with telephone, desktop computer, copier  + Substantive travel expected  Janus Henderson Investors \(including its subsidiaries\) will not maintain existing or sponsor new industry registrations or licenses where not supported by an employees job functions \(as determined by Janus Henderson Investors at its sole discretion\)\.  All applicants must be willing to comply with the provisions of Janus Henderson Investors' Investment Advisory Code of Ethics related to personal securities activities and other disclosure and certification requirements, including past political contributions and political activities\. Applicants past political contributions or activity may impact applicants eligibility for this position\. **Janus Henderson Investors is an equal opportunity / Affirmative Action employer\.** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status\. All applications are subject to background checks\.

Name: Fraud Analyst
Description: The following is a breakdown what the Fraud Analyst at Name.com would take ownership of. Fraud review has served Name.com well as it increases understanding of industry trends that allow the organization to differentiate a quality transaction from a malicious one. Such review not only mitigates fraudulent orders, it also educates the company on industry trends. This employee will be expected to operate through several of forums, including email, phone and web chat if warranted. Fraud processing Comprehensive review that of all flagged orders to determine if they are fraudulent or not. Follow up on all chargebacks and disputes. The employee will be responsible for reviewing all internal reports and determine what is actionable. Optimize Name.com's current approach to fraud prevention and increase savings through effective cost recovery efforts. Reporting / Internal audit Chargebacks / Challenging disputes / Fraud backlog, are all part of the review process. If hired, the applicant will be to report on each of these and provide a picture on the state of fraud while making recommendations on next steps, should there be anomalies. Comprehensive statistic retention and reporting on friendly fraud. The goal is to identify trends and give recommendations about how to improve retention and recovery efforts. Through a frequent audit, the employee will determine whether or not chargeback thresholds were met and how much fraud Name.com saw in an effort to avoid penalties. Financial trends Track and speak to the following trends with the goal of identifying items Name.com needs to take action on:  Automatic renewal rates and how it relates to refunds / chargebacks. Payment processing failure and success rates. Shopping cart abandonment rates. Chargeback mitigation and retention Fraud review / training They will be expected to host regular training on internal processes, optimization initiatives and industry changes to all departments at Name.com that apply. They will be responsible for development, implementation and monitoring of new procedures. Compliance Review The Fraud Analyst will also serve as an emergency backup for the Compliance department. They will be cross trained and proficient enough to act alone in fielding a variety of case types in accordance with company policy. What wed like to see in your experience Minimum 2 years of fraud review or a risk mitigation role, Ecommerce preferred Excellent telephone and written correspondence required Excellent problem solving, communication, interpersonal and organizational skills Strong work ethic, great attendance and punctuality Excellent time management and multitasking skills with a consistent bias for action Experience showing patience when assisting upset customers Willingness to learn new technologies Strong team player who collaborates well with others Demonstrates diligence in following business processes Strong drive for challenging the status quo to innovate and improve existing processes Minimum Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) Hard skills we would like to see Experience in data collection, interfaces and processes Strong MS Excel skills General working knowledge of SQL Helpful knowledge/experience, but not a prerequisite Policy enforcement or development Domain Name, Web Hosting, ISP industry Experience working with government agencies or law enforcement Name.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or any other category prohibited by local, state or federal law. This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including recruitment, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, social and recreational activities and termination.

Name: BI Data Analyst
