Assist in the development of standards.Maintain individual machines, such as drivers and settings of personal computers as well as printers.Administer servers, desktop computers, printers, routers, phones, smartphones, software deployments, security updates and patches.Participate in a support on call rotation with the rest of the IT Staff.QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS:Technical, analytical, interpersonal and organization skills requiredKnowledge of Windows and general IT best practices and proceduresAvailability in response to needs of the customer for installation, maintenance and equipment malfunctionsWindows and Active Directory ExperienceStrong organizational skillsSelf-motivatedEffective communicatorDetail oriented with a high degree of accuracy and quality in work ability to manage multiple projects/tasks/initiativesL*EVEL *2 SUPPORTA*NALYST EDUCATIONAL*/EXPERIENCEREQUIREMENTS:Associates Degree or equivalent work experience, or combination of education and direct work experienceA minimum of 2 to 4 years related IT ExperienceAbility to respond to help desk requests in after-hours support Romanos Macaroni Grill® reserves the right to revise or change this job description as the need arises. This job description is not all inclusive of total job responsibilities nor does it constitute a written or implied contract of employment. Name: Global Research Analyst - Fixed Income
Description: Janus Henderson Global Investors is a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for clients through a broad range of actively managed funds\.  We provide our institutional, retail and high net\-worth individuals with access to skilled investment professionals representing a broad range of asset classes including, equities, fixed income, multi asset and alternatives\.  We are a team of independent thinkers who work tirelessly to help our clients achieve their goals and we do it by fostering an energetic and collaborative culture that ensures our people love the place they work\.  Headquartered in London, Janus Henderson is a truly global asset manager with a diverse geographic footprint, managing assets from 27 offices globally and employing more than 2,000 staff\.  Overview of the Role  This role provides portfolio managers and the investment team with relevant information and recommendations regarding investment attractiveness of multi\-currency corporate bonds and other fixed income and equity instruments e\.g\. bank loans and convertible bonds\. To analyse a company's position within its industry, sales and profit estimates, projected free cash flow estimates, and credit metrics\. Make Overweight, Marketweight, Underweight and Avoid recommendations with projected risk adjusted total returns for individual securities\. Conduct bottom up fundamental analysis of individual companies, focusing on business factors such as financial performance, competitive industry analysis, quality of company management, etc\.  Duties and Responsibilities  + Generalist focused on identifying investment opportunities within the global credit markets across both the investment grade and high yield universe\.  + Selection of the best risk adjusted total return global securities with a focus on downside protection  + Comprehensive understanding of the general and strategic drivers of the global bond and leveraged loan markets  + Research select industries, companies, and geographic markets  + Build, update and maintain financial and valuation models with a focus on free cash flow forecasting  + Produce notes on relevant investment themes, earnings and breaking news events  + Synthesize and assess financial industry data  + Forecast growth, evaluate competitive position within an industry, determine quality Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Business Unit PRICING & OFFER MGMT (ENT-MT WEST/WEST) (50036361) The position is a finance/marketing role with a Pricing focus for Network, Managed Hosting, Dedicated Cloud and Colocation product suites. Responsibilities include the data gathering, analysis, teaming, development and implementation of price points and pricing strategies and overall general knowledge of telecommunications contracts is required. Job Responsibilities: • Position will require understanding of financial modeling/measures, the ability to partner across multiple groups, and to effectively communicate objectives and changes to team members and executives.  • Position will require overall marketing understanding, development, and the application of the pricing “P”.  • Position will provide daily interaction, communication and direction to marketing, special pricing, sales and process/project objectives.  • Position will require the ability to make sense of complex data and translate that data into meaningful analysis as well as the ability to report, interpret, and summarize results.  • Position will require the ability to research (or direct research) of customer behavior, pricing results and competitive data in support of results, pricing and strategy.  • Position will require the ability to maintain, and update pricing information in a timely manner.  • Position will be working with, negotiating with and providing reporting and feedback to Director, VP, SVP and EVP partners in Strategic Pricing, Product Management, Product Development, Product Marketing, Business Sales and Finance.  • Position will develop and implement pricing strategies appropriate to changing market conditions  • Provide reporting support on the key metric drivers for the Business Pricing Offer Management team, Finance and Management  • Provide & communicate Executive based reporting & analysis of projects. These projects are both recurring and adhoc in nature, with a need for creative thinking and approach in developing findings/recommendations  • Must be able to work across multiple functional groups to support and implement programs  • Must be able to effectively communicate strategies and objectives across the organization  • Must be able to confidently present to and negotiate with senior executives  • Knowledge of Telecommunication and Enterprise segment products  • Ability to establish and foster key relationships within the organization  • Ability to understand detail/complex data and translate into actionable/understandable terms  • Ability to take ownership and personally drive projects and objectives to completion  • Ability to understand and develop and support financial concepts/models  • Highly motivated to perform and contribute  • Strategic in supporting and completing projects with a strong degree of creativity and flexibility, from both a production stand-point but also in connecting the ‘strategic dots’  • Devises methods, modifies or adapts standard procedures to meet varied situations  • High attention to detail & quality-based results  • Ability to effectively partner with associates and peer organizations, and actively participate in solution-based dialog  Minimum Qualifications: • Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Marketing or related discipline field  • Two or more years Finance, Marketing and/or Telecommunications experience  • Expertise in Business Management and Finance disciplines necessary  • Experience in the Cloud, Colocation or Managed Hosting industry and products  • Excellent working knowledge of personal computers, spreadsheet and presentation software (Excel and PowerPoint)  • Strong analytical, presentation, and communication skills  • Self-directed  • Project Management skills  • Goal and detail oriented  • Willingness to work overtime and travel as necessary  • Ability to manage financial models and develop business cases  Preferred Qualifications: • MBA  • Pricing or offer development experience  • Experience working with executive management

Name: Business Operations Analyst - Business Process & Technology
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) from a four year College/University; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to solve practical problems in an ever-changing and evolving business landscape.Ability to effectively communicate, interact and present information across a large spectrum of audiences ranging from the general public to individual contributors, managers and/or executives from various business stakeholder units and IT.Applicant must be willing to handle a variety of situations and tasks with minimal supervision from management. Applicant must be self-motivated and strive to take initiative to analyze data, draw conclusions, derive solutions and solve problems on their own. A Business Operations Analyst within the Business Process and Technology department will work cross-functionally with other departments to deliver projects, programs and strategic initiatives which impact the company’s bottom line. Your work will make key contributions towards the end to end experience for customers, agents (sales & customer service, marketing, legal and broadband) and technicians. In order to be successful in this role, you will need to be a highly motivated individual capable of working with peers, managers and executives of other departments to identify issues, establish priorities and engage IT technical resources to define solutions.  Primary Responsibilities and Job Functions: Manages planning, development, design, requirements gathering, project scope documentation and implementation of assigned projects, programs & strategic initiatives.Engages with business unit stakeholders and IT to oversee and guide implementation throughout the project, program or initiatives life-cycle.Serves as the subject matter expert and “go to” resource for business rules and projects, programs and strategic initiatives.Creates and distributes weekly project statuses/updates, organizes and conducts weekly project meetings and tracks any relevant issues and tasks on said programs and projects.Performs analysis to identify/verify production application issues. Determines solutions for production application issues and works with appropriate teams to fix the issue(s).Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive summary of all duties and responsibilities assigned to this position.

Name: Sales Operations Analyst
Description: Requisition Number:10974Location(s): Denver,Colorado Position Type: Full-time Shift: First Eligible for Relocation: No Job Description:The Company Vantiv is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the fastest growing payments company in the U.S., first in PIN Debit transactions and the second largest merchant acquirer. Visit Vantiv.com for more. The Opportunity Part of Vantiv's success and rapid growth is a result of our teams functioning like well-oiled machines that strive for continual improvement. Once we gain a new customer, our teams have to work together seamlessly in order to deliver stellar service that gets our clients up and running as quickly as possible. Our Sales Operations team members are specialists in communicating our customers' needs to the right teams at Vantiv, ensuring nothing but the best experience from sale to implementation and beyond.  The Senior Sales Operations Analyst works to ensure Vantiv is continuously improving our approach to sales and delivering products and services. They are laser-focused on keeping Vantiv competitive in a constantly evolving market. By using sales measurement models and other performance indicators, he/she analyzes data to make recommendations in the way we design products, approach sales tactics, pricing structures and the overall sales process. By being critical in looking at our data from all angles, we can be proactive and anticipate changes we need to make in the business. Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers. Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At Vantiv, it comes from people in every corner of the office. People with ambition, optimism and courage. We provide growth and opportunity and give employees flexibility in how they get the job done. You might not expect that from a big payments company, but we're smart enough to know how to hire the best and when to step aside and let them lead. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board. The Day-to-Day Responsibilities: Develops or uses sales measurement models and diagnostic tools to help identify sales performance indicators, key areas of opportunity and sales force training needs.Recommends strategic priorities, sales force performance metrics and sales effectiveness tracking methods to maintain and improve the company's competitive.Evaluates and recommends changes in sales incentive plans in line with analyses.Helps develop and/or administers new training programs to fill competency gaps.Reviews capital expenditures and analyzes sales-related expenses associated with such things as the order pipeline, bookings, revenue forecasting, revenue reporting, sales productivity and goal attainment.Performs regular variance analysis for expenses and budgets.Evaluates pricing structures to meet and achieve company objectives.Effectively incorporates client delivery schedules and operational changes into future revenue forecasts and revenue timeline considerations.Draws on past experience and current data to influence business partners and improve sales force/portfolio performance and best practices.Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise.Responsible for structuring, maintaining, validating, and answering leadership questions for real time reporting toolsBuilds and maintains excel, salesforce.com, and PowerBI reporting toolsAnalyzes sales performance results presentations and recommendations for sales and/or finance management.Contributes to the development or improvement of systems to effectively track or capture data.Performs revenue growth analysis & modeling of alternative commission/incentive plan design or quota levels.Preparing and distributing key sales reports for relevant stakeholdersEvaluating and recommending sales targets based on historical trends and activity & setting monthly sales targetsEvaluating and recommending changes in sales incentive plans based upon business performancePreparing and distributing key sales reports for relevant stakeholders, including rep, leader, and senior leader audiencesGaining access to necessary data through data mining/querying and reportingPredictive analytics: will support predictive analytics needs for an AI machine learning lead generation software on an ad hoc basisKey Skills:· Good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions  · Has high level of data analysis skills and knowledge and sales processes Experienced in disaggregating complex content into clear, concise messagesContributes to the development or improvement of systems to effectively track or capture data.Exhibits specialized knowledge of incentive compensation and concepts related to role.Systems Experience:· Advanced Excel  · Salesforce.com, emphasis on report-writing  · Nice to have: PowerBI, Business Objects, basic querying capabilities (any SQL syntax), Access Qualifications:Advanced degree in finance or relevant experience in pricing and financial sales force support required.Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree; or 3 years and a Master's degree; or a PhD without experience; or equivalent work experience. All the above duties and responsibilities are essential job functions for which reasonable accommodation will be made. All job requirements listed indicate the minimum level of knowledge, skills and/or ability deemed necessary to perform the job proficiently. This position description is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Employees may be required to perform any other job-related instructions as requested by their leader, subject to reasonable accommodation.

Name: IT Access Management Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionLocation: Denver, CO Salary: Open Description: Our client is currently seeking a IT Access Management Analyst who has the ability to perform Access Management functions. Confidentiality, attention to detail and the adherence to pre-defined processes and procedures. Ensures user access is appropriate, approved, applied and records maintained in accordance with Global Information Security, Risk, Compliance and Audit standards and policies. This job will have the following responsibilities: * This includes but is not limited to: * Ownership, management and resolution of Access Management requests / issues from beginning to end. * Validation of requests, ensuring security is not compromised and correct records are maintained for audit and compliance purposes and appropriate licenses are in place. * Report on status and progress of work or causes of delays * Report on breaches of policy to management * Apply principles and practices for continuous improvement * Manage Access in line with the agreed SLA's and company policy or guidelines. * Monitoring of entitlements and controls to ensure the integrity of access to systems and appropriate access levels are maintained. * Maintain, implement and assist in the definition of security and company policies as determined by CISO, Risk, Compliance and Audit. * Assist in new technology rollouts to ensure standards are being maintained * Obtain, Prepare and Provide evidence of compliance of processes required during audits and reviews from various sources (Active Directory, Applications, Service Now, Identity & Access Management Systems and 3rd Parties). * Participate in business recovery planning and exercises * This role will be required on a Rota basis covering the hours 07:00 - 18:00. * Overtime and weekend hours may be required. Qualifications & Requirements: * * Ability to use service management tools to create, monitor and resolve incidents and requests. Particularly Service Now. * Strong knowledge of security access technologies particularly Active Directory, Azure and Exchange * Strong Knowledge of MS Office applications particularly Excel and Outlook * Knowledge of Identity and Access Management Systems particularly SailPoint Identity IQ, Varonis DatAdvantage, Quest Change Auditor would be desirable. * Knowledge of application, file and print security * Knowledge of Remote Access Systems particularly RSA, Good, Blackberry Work and Citrix * Desirable knowledge of Business Systems particularly Charles River, SAP HR, SAP Finance, SAP GRC, Salesforce and SharePoint * At least two years of IT Access Management administration experience. Contact: jmcfarland@judge.com This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at www.judge.com

Name: Senior Data Analyst, Healthcare
Description: Join VillageHealth, one of DaVita's most exciting strategic business lines! VillageHealth partners with payers to assume responsibility for the total care and cost of patients with kidney failure. The Health Care Economics Team in VillageHealth is looking for a proven Senior Data Analyst. Our team supports senior operating leaders through medical cost analytics, financial reporting, and actionable insights. We also work with care coordination teams to identify gaps in care, enabling them to formulate interventions that keep patients healthy and out of the hospital. The ideal candidate has proficiency in medical claims analysis, data aggregation, and interpretation of medical claims data. Candidates must be adept at verbal, visual, and written communication, as well as developing recommendations for multidisciplinary audiences. GENERAL PURPOSE OF THE JOB Analyze and interpret medical claims data, communicate findings and recommendations at multiple levels of seniority, lead ad hoc projects to improve operating performance. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES The following duties and responsibilities generally reflect the expectations of this position but are not intended to be all-inclusive. Lead analysis and reporting of medical claims data.Apply various quantitative methods to evaluate the effectiveness of interventions and the financial health of programs.Serve as project lead on key strategic initiativesEffectively communicate and build relationships with stakeholders across business lanes.Produce various reports that are useful for analyst- to executive-level customers.Generate reports monthly to track utilization, billing patterns, and program performance.Supplement routine reporting with exploratory analytics to find insights that lead to innovative pilots and higher levels of program performance.Organize and display information to convey targeted messages for each audience.Present findings, recommendations, and project proposals to internal and external teams.Apply relentless attention to detail in all deliverables.QUALIFICATIONSPersonal values align with DaVitas values of service excellence, integrity, team, continuous improvement, accountability, fulfillment, and fun.Bachelor's degree in health care field, math, statistics, or other quantitative fields strongly preferred.Minimum of 3 years of experience with analytics and reporting.Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills.Strong communication skills to work across teams, garner input, and build consensus.Advanced proficiency with Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL databases, including writing queries to extract and aggregate data.Knowledge of relational database principles including SQL and Microsoft Office software.Knowledge of statistical and/or quantitative analysis that can be readily applied.Advanced knowledge of medical claims terminology (CPTs, DRGs, ICD-10, etc.).Detailed understanding of health care billing and payment methods.

Name: Application system analyst
Description: *** Local Candidates only please. Must work in Denver and be available for an in person interview. **** Note: This position is currently funded for 3 months but may last as long as 8 months. I. Introduction  The State of Colorado Parks and Wildlife division with the Governor’s office of Information technology (OIT) is seeking a qualified Contractor to serve as a Senior Developer during the API development, unit testing and integration testing phase of the Integrated Parks and Wildlife System Project (IPAWS) project. This document outlines the project and the qualifications for the Senior Developer.  II. Background  Integrated Parks and Wildlife System Project (IPAWS)  Colorado Parks and Wildlife (CPW) was created in 2011 from the merger of State Parks and the Division of Wildlife. CPW collects fees for fish/hunt licenses, park passes, campground reservations, and for registering boats and off-highway vehicles. TLS (Total Licensing System) processes hunt/fish license sales. PARKS (Parks Automated Records Keeping System) accounts for sales of parks passes and for sales made through VRS (Vehicle Registration System) and CRS (Campground Reservation System). The primary goal of this project is to have an integrated parks and wildlife system that includes current and enhanced business functionality, upgraded technology that supports agency and public needs, and provides one-stop shopping for outdoor recreationists.  III. Current State  Wildlife Products  The current Colorado Parks and Wildlife (CPW) Total Licensing System (TLS) is based on web and point-of-sale (POS) applications used to provide hunting and fishing license products, collect customer information, service customer information requests, deliver related products and information, and record transactions. TLS is currently used almost exclusively for the sale of wildlife-related products. The system stores customer and transaction information, provides reports, controls inventory information, records all accounting activities, and provides administrative control functions. Several systems supporting the licensing program have been created and are supported and maintained by in-house staff. Some of these systems are integrated with TLS and others are stand-alone in nature.  Parks Products  Parks products consist of passes to state parks, registrations of recreational vehicles (i.e. boats, snowmobiles, off-road), and campsite reservations and rentals. These products are currently provided through state parks locations[1], parks commercial retail outlets, the Internet, and by phone[2]. They are issued to individuals but are typically associated with vehicles. Limited personal identification information is collected for some parks product purchases which does not afford CPW the opportunity to effectively communicate with many parks product purchasers after they have made a purchase. There are four primary systems that enable and track the sale of park passes, permits, registrations, reservations, and other parks-related goods and services: PARKS - Parks Automated Record Keeping SystemVRS - Vehicle Registration SystemActiveWorks Outdoors/CRS - Camping Reservation SystemeStore - Electronic Store IV. Future State  The recent merger of the state’s Divisions of Parks and Wildlife presents the opportunity to provide sales of State parks passes, recreational vehicle registrations, and other parks-related products through the wildlife oriented system, which is scheduled for implementation over the next two years. The goal is to have a modified replacement system in place where CPW can present their products and services as one agency.  V. Senior Developer Qualifications  The successful candidate must be well versed in unit testing including test driven development, nUnit, Visual Studio, and other unit testing frameworks and tools. In addition, they must be comfortable creating mock objects, test harnesses, and other advanced unit testing strategies. They need to be able to demonstrate involvement in past projects including the aforementioned items.  We also require 5-6 years of experience as a software developer in progressively more complex assignments with experience managing requirements for software application development, service delivery, and customer satisfaction, or relevant experience in an IT applications/solutions delivery role.  The IPAWS APIs will be developed using .Net version 4 and C# . The senior developer must have experience writing T-SQL, web services and SSRS packages.

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: Janus Henderson Global Investors is a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for clients through a broad range of actively managed funds\.  We provide our institutional, retail and high net\-worth individuals with access to skilled investment professionals representing a broad range of asset classes including, equities, fixed income, multi asset and alternatives\.  We are a team of independent thinkers who work tirelessly to help our clients achieve their goals and we do it by fostering an energetic and collaborative culture that ensures our people love the place they work\.  Headquartered in London, Janus Henderson is a truly global asset manager with a diverse geographic footprint, managing assets from 27 offices globally and employing more than 2,000 staff\. *Overview of the Role** This Denver based role, will be responsible for providing end to end financial support to various departments \(could include Investments and Support organizations\)\. This person will serve as a partner to senior business leaders to drive resource planning and control and to facilitate effective forward looking business decision making with commercial insight to identify opportunities to create value\. *Duties and Responsibilities** + Develops business plans and forecasts on an annual, quarterly, and ad hoc basis  + Reviews, analyzes and reports monthly expenses to business leaders, highlighting risks and opportunities  + Creates and assesses profitability analyses on an ongoing and ad hoc basis using advanced modeling techniques; makes recommendations to business leaders on opportunities to drive financial success  + Works closely with business leaders to develop and analyze metrics to measure financial and operational performance  + Contributes to and helps develop management reporting for the North America Leadership team  + Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and reduce costs  + Prepares standard and customized financial reports on an ongoing and ad hoc basis  + Supports cross\-functional special projects  + Proactively identifies and resolves problems that may be complex in nature  + Tracks and monitors merger related costs and synergies  + Supports broader FP&A and Business Finance team deliverables *Other Functions** Assumes additional duties as assigned *Technical Skills and Qualifications** + Three to five years financial analysis experience required  + Investment Management industry experience a plus  + Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics, or equivalent required  + MBA or post\-graduate degree a plus *Competencies Required** + Team player with a flexible, results driven approach  + Strong communication, interpersonal and client service skills  + Strong understanding of financial concepts and measures  + Strong analytical skills with the ability to accumulate, organize and assimilate large amounts of data  + Ability to plan, prioritize, and organize work effectively and to quickly shift priorities when necessary  + Ability to work and make decisions independently  + Advanced computer skills, emphasizing MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and Enterprise Resource Planning systems \(SAP\)  Ongoing competence in the role to be assessed by:  + Annual Performance Appraisal  + Completion of all assigned Compliance training  Working Environment/Physical Activities  + Extended hours may be required on short notice and may include evening, weekend, and holiday hours  Janus Henderson Investors \(including its subsidiaries\) will not maintain existing or sponsor new industry registrations or licenses where not supported by an employees job functions \(as determined by Janus Henderson Investors at its sole discretion\)\.  All applicants must be willing to comply with the provisions of Janus Henderson Investors' Investment Advisory Code of Ethics related to personal securities activities and other disclosure and certification requirements, including past political contributions and political activities\. Applicants past political contributions or activity may impact applicants eligibility for this position\. **Janus Henderson Investors is an equal opportunity / Affirmative Action employer\.** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status\. All applications are subject to background checks\.

Name: Lodging & Distribution Analyst
Description: Summary/Objective:The Lodging & Distribution Analyst's primary responsibility is to ensure that Hotel Engines product is competitive, attractive and relevant for our fast-growing global customer base.This person will also continuously work with Hotel Engines hotel partners to ensure proper connectivity with their CRS systems to improve the marketing and distribution potential from their participation in the Hotel Engine marketplace. This individual will be a strong influencer that can take directive action as a self-starter to move the business forward.This role is the foundation on which the supplier relations team is based. The team ensures that Hotel Engines global customers always find the most suitable property for their trip wherever they want to go and that our hotel partners can effectively, efficiently and throughout the year, reach Hotel Engines full breadth of traveler demand.Essential Functions:Coordinate with the development team to optimize content, rate and availability competitiveness on the sites to increase customer conversionSecure additional lodging rates and availability information over high demand and compression periods to satisfy customers pressing needs as needed to support the Director of Supplier RelationsEducate hotel partners on the self-service features available on HE supplier portal and disseminate supplier performance reporting on a monthly basisSupport Hotel Engine business development efforts through smooth onboarding of new hotel partners and support demand generationRe-establish relationships with dormant hotel partners by ensuring proper technical connections with hotel CRS systemAssist the Director of Supplier Relations with developing and delivering system specific training to hoteliers on rate loading and basic GDS connectivitySupport research to identify properties not currently listed on the hosted marketplaceCompetency:High impact personality: intellectual agility, entrepreneur, relationship builderDetermined, motivated, and results-focusedOrganized and strong time management skillsAnalytical and strong in deductive reasoning skillsProven follow-up/persistence when facing challenging situationsAbility to multi-task effectively and change gears quickly without skipping a beatAbility to persuade and influence others and lead changeRequired Education & Experience:Bachelors Degree; or equivalent work experience with a hotel or travel management company1-2 years of experience in hotel reservation, front desk, or sales or experience as a booking agent for large volume corporate booking agency preferredExpert experience with hotel CRS systemsProficiency with MS Office specifically Excel and Outlook required including the ability to manage large data sets in multiple workbooks in ExcelExpert in knowledge of pivot tables and macros requiredKnowledge of Salesforce is a plusKnowledge of Revenue Management concepts, tactics, and processes preferredKnowledge of hotel operations including front office, sales, and reservations processes highly desiredWhat we provide:Paid vacation, holidays and sick daysMedical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Plans401K and supplemental insurance plan benefitsPaid gym membership and organic fruit delivery.Free parking, free option for secure bike storage.Discounted Wireless Service plansCompany sponsored events, holiday parties, and volunteer opportunities.A healthy work/life balance

Name: SR ANALYST
Description: About CenturyLink CenturyLink (NYSE: CTL) is the second largest U.S. communications provider to global enterprise customers. With customers in more than 60 countries and an intense focus on the customer experience, CenturyLink strives to be the world’s best networking company by solving customers’ increased demand for reliable and secure connections. The company also serves as its customers’ trusted partner, helping them manage increased network and IT complexity and providing managed network and cyber security solutions that help protect their business.Job Summary Evaluate, document, and communicate the business value propositions of machine learning and other algorithms. Translate requirements into delivered solutions. Review, analyze, build; and modify advanced analytics models in python; jupyter hub; splunk; and related tools. Perform statistical analysis and other data science work to provide insights and requirements to other analysts, data scientists, etc, including teams of data engineers (in addition to doing some of this work on their own for testing and proof of concept work) for debugging, aggregations, time series, normalizations, data mining, descriptive analysis, preparation of ETL code, and documentation of large volumes (up to terabytes) of operational data in a Hadoop environment using SQL, Spark, and other languages and formats to support machine learning algorithms. A portion of the data will be machine generated data (router syslogs, performance management data; etc). Job Description Skill sets are business unit facing and communication skills – expertise needed includes: Ability to do data discovery; iterate on modeling and make changes to identify the best overall solutions. Skilled in gathering requirements and be able do the requisite data modeling (i.e., strong at both client engagement and data aggregations and data mapping).Must be able to quickly understand a requirement and mock up a working solution.Develop prototype data sets, analysis, and solutions that accurately reflect needs so it can be streamlined and standardized.Awareness and ability to communicate the value of big data and analytics to business operations users and executives.Demonstrable evidence of Hadoop; hdfs; big data; and advanced database knowledge, including ability to provide requirements and work iteratively with others that are doing data handling and manipulation techniques (ETL); ingestion; ability to map data all the way through ETL (extract; transform; load) type processes.Conduct data interrelationship analysis and rationalization to support multiple simultaneous algorithms in a reusable fashion.Create common definitions of various data sources so data can be rationally mapped together via joins; aggregations; etc. across multiple (and different) frequencies (seconds; minutes; hours; days; etc).Inquisitiveness; analysis skills; asking good questions; following up in a constructive and productive manner.Ability to motivate others, use good teamwork skills, including development of interdepartmental relationships and the ability to make complex decisions.Work iteratively in a fast paced environment. Ability to work as a member of a team in a dynamic environment is required.Demonstrates high personal work standards.Embraces change, inspires trust, communicates in all directions and is a continuous learner.Has a track record as a self starter with the ability to work well with minimal direction and the discipline to meet deadlines on time.Design, prepare and communicate the contents of data summaries with a focus on views that facilitate ease of communication (concise and actionable).Ability to explain complex analysis to non-technical stakeholders.Present work to others for review in a well thought out manner that creates clarity.Ability to communicate with pictures; diagrams; and in writing in a way that makes it easy to understand complex situations and provides useful solutions.Conduct ad-hoc data analysis requests and design data extracts.Conduct data validation of existing applications and new solutions to ensure continuous data accuracy, and ease-of-use.Ask good questions that help with problems solving.QualificationsExcellent English oral and written communications skills.Masters or PhD Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, or related degree and applicable experienceMust be self-motivated, inquisitive, highly analytical, organized, and detail-oriented with strong time management skills and ability to meet project timelines in a fast-paced environment.5+ years of experience delivering Advanced Analytics solutions; preferably including machine learning.3+ Years Spark, Scala, Numpy, sklearn, pandas and/or other common data and machine learning Python libraries; or similar tools.Additional Preferred skill sets:5+ Years relational database and SQL experience - strong ability to produce complex data models. SQL expertise with time series data.Ability to use matrix operations within Python.3+ years experience with HDFS; Impala; Hue; Hive, HBase, Yarn, RDD, and other Hadoop components and concepts.R Studio experience.Experience working with telecom consumer and network data is preferred.Education Masters or Equivalent  Bachelors or Equivalent Alternate Location: US-Colorado-Littleton Requisition #: 204616  This job may require successful completion of an online assessment. We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. Name: Business Operations Analyst - Payment Operations - Sling TV
Description: DISH is a Fortune 250 company with more than $14 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.Opportunity is here. We are DISH.A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following:Bachelors Degree or equivalent from four-year College or technical school, preferably in Accounting, Business Administration, Economics, Finance, Mathematics or Statistics, and at least two years of related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experienceAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, including the ability to create and work with Pivot Tables, SUMIF, VLOOKUP functions, and exposure to MacroExperience with SQL or Microsoft Access is a plusProficiency with Microsoft Office Applications (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)Ability to read, analyze, and interpret common metrics used to measure and monitor operational performance, define problems, collect data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and provide clear and concise communication with a wide audience of internal departmentsThe Sling Joint Billing and Payment Operations team is responsible for managing day to day operations for customer payment billing and payment related items for Sling. They are responsible for working in conjunction with our Sling Billing and Fraud team to audit and analyze customer accounts to ensure billing and payment accuracy across all Sling billing platforms. The job functions include, but are not limited to account auditing and analysis, evaluating and improving overall customer experience, managing payment and billing initiatives across the Sling organization including understanding billing and payment budgets, developing efficiencies and driving improvements to meet organizational goals.Responsibilities:Identify trends in billing, payments, refunds and chargebacks and use trending to make strategic business decisionsPrepare, produce, and validate daily, weekly, and monthly reports measuring, monitoring, and alerting the business regarding unforeseen shifts in the performance. Identify potential opportunities for process improvement and report automation using various methods.Serve as a Subject Matter Expert and fully understand processes and their impact on the overall business.Create ad-hoc reports as requested in a timely and accurate manner, assist senior manager with various tasks and items as neededLilyP

Name: Analyst, Operations Innovation
Description: The Operations Strategy and Innovation Analyst will work on high priority COO initiatives by collaborating with Senior Analysts and operating leaders of DaVita Medical Group  Topics will likely include:  Growth strategies across Kidney Care, International, Healthcare Partners and Strategic Business Units  Large-scale operating model changes to drive efficiencies and improve outcomes in the rapidly changing healthcare landscape  Integrated care business model development  Introduction and incubation of disruptive medical technologies  Commercializing portfolio of assets and business-unit specific operations strategy  The Operations Strategy and Innovation Analyst will work with a team of highly-motivated individuals with management consulting, process engineering, change management, investment banking, and clinical experience, and is expected to effectively manage individual work streams and communicate recommendations to senior analysts and/or managers.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities  · Collaborative Problem Solving:  o Demonstrates first-principles thinking in analyzing problems and engaging with teammates  o Leverages hypotheses-based approach to identify, validate, and quantify opportunities  Data & Analytics:  o Develops and improves credible and pragmatic analytical approaches and frameworks; uses continuous improvement tools (Lean, Six-Sigma, PDCA)  o Build complex models and conducts financial planning and analyses to assess impact on business metrics  Written & Oral Communication:  o Conveys findings in a cohesive story, including summarizing insights from analysis  o Builds appropriate horizontal and vertical logic in presentation decks  o Presents comfortably and compellingly to senior audiences  o Works closely with teammates in the clinics and develops long-standing relationships with operators and clinicians  Travel: 10%-25% travel may be required  · 0-2 years of experience in analytics, consulting, investment banking or corporate strategy preferred  Experience on teams undertaking large-scale business transformations with tangible impact on operating/financial performance  Healthcare background preferred

Name: Business Analyst Specialist - IT - Dealer Program
Description: Company Overview : ADT is a leading provider of security and automation solutions for homes and businesses in the United States and Canada. ADT's broad and pioneering set of products and services, including ADT Pulse® interactive home and business solutions, and health services, meet a range of customer needs for todays active and increasingly mobile lifestyles. Headquartered in Boca Raton, Florida, ADT helps provide peace of mind to nearly seven million customers, and it employs approximately 17,000 people at 200 locations. More information is available at www.adt.com . Business Process Specialist Summary: Support IT project activities pertaining to requirements, design, implementation, and administration of application product and services. Duties and Responsibilities: Apply high-level understanding of the organization's business systems and industry requirements. Serve as a liaison between the business and IT to create and document solution designs, focusing on process analysis and re-engineering with an understanding of technical problems and solutions related to current and future business environments. Assist with daily operations and provide general administrative support to the assigned IT organization. Prepare charts and diagrams to assist in problem analysis and submit recommendations for solutions. Create process change by integrating new processes with existing processes and communicate the changes to the Business Systems team impacted. As appropriate, may participate in the development, implementation, and maintenance of IT strategies and plans. Manages, coordinates, directs, and integrate the companys IT processes, services, and applications for the purpose IT business delivery. Responsible for working closely with support teams to ensure the design, implementation, and administration of the companys IT initiatives. Propose and implement effective solutions based on business requirements while analyzing and evaluating the impact of current processes/business. Partner with technical solution providers to ensure optimal delivery. Performs other duties as assigned.

Name: eRA Business Analyst and Technical Administrator
Description: Department:Office of Information Technology Administration (OIT)Requisition Number:14679Location: Boulder, COEmployment Type:University StaffSchedule:Full-TimePosting Close Date:09-Dec-2018 Job SummaryThe Research Administration (eRA) Business Analyst and Technical Administrator will support the implementation and maintenance of electronic research administration systems at the University of Colorado Boulder. This Business Analyst must understand the business needs and objectives of the Research and Innovation Office (RIO), specifically the work of the Office of Contracts and Grants (OCG) and the Office of Research Integrity (ORI) as well as campus faculty and staff. Specifically, the eRA Business Analyst and Technical Administrator Administrator will support the development, implementation, and maintenance of electronic Research Administration (eRA) initiatives. Currently, these include Human Subjects, Conflict of Interest and Proposal/Award Tracking modules developed by InfoEd International, Topaz to support animal research, and Inteum to support the Technology Transfer office. Future developments are likely to include additional research administration modules, which may be provided by InfoEd International or other vendors, or developed internally. This position will be responsible for understanding the functions and technical capabilities of eRA systems, developing and running testing scripts, understanding the functions and capabilities of the eRA modules and serving to gather requirements and provide analysis through implementation and ongoing support. In this role, you will also provide input into testing requirements; collaborate with developers to diagnose functional problems and propose solutions.Who We AreThe Office of Information Technology (OIT) is a dynamic organization, filled with energetic staff and students who aim to serve the campus and contribute to student success while supporting the University’s academic, research and service missions. We’re located in the heart of the beautiful CU Boulder campus. See what OIT is all about by watching our This is OIT video.What Your Key Responsibilities Will BeLead the technical implementation and on-going maintenance and user support for the new and existing eRA systems:Provide and develop technical solutions\tools to suit business needs.Develop, execute, and administer over the technical specifications and implementation of the overall design as well as ongoing technical configuration changes.Serve as the primary functional and technical system expert for eRA.Develop strategies and procedures for, and assist with, data conversion from the current ATS system to the new ATS system.Support the development and execution of standard and ad-hoc reports.Support the development and delivery of training materials and programs as they relate to eRA systems.Develop and maintain thorough documentation of system configurations and of testing procedures.Work closely and in collaboration with the eRA Recruiting Coordinators to support them in their roles as functional experts.Business Analysis and Functional Expertise:Perform functional analysis and requirements gathering for any IT related initiatives.Develop necessary requirements and specifications including process flow models, use cases or user stories, data models, and UML diagrams that fully communicate requirements and conditions of satisfaction.Develop a thorough understanding of system capabilities from both a technical and functional perspective.Work closely with recruiting leaders, campus faculty and staff to develop a thorough understanding of business needs and practices.Monitor and manage the eRA implementation projects and deployed services, ensuring they continue to meet the established objectives and business needs within the established budgets through a continual service improvement methodology:Collaborate with eRA leaders as well as campus faculty and staff to ensure that system configurations meet the business needs.Assist with the development of agendas, report meeting minutes, action items, and issues that arise during meetings.Thoroughly communicate the status of projects, report and track issues and enhancements.What We Can OfferBase salary for this position is competitive and market-based, and will be commensurate with background, experience and education.Benefits Benefits The University of Colorado offers excellent benefits, including medical, dental, retirement, paid time off, tuition benefit and ECO Pass. The University of Colorado Boulder is one of the largest employers in Boulder County and offers an inspiring higher education environment. Learn more about the University of Colorado Boulder.Be StatementsBe Effective. Be Pioneering. Be Boulder.What We RequireBachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution or a combination of education and relevant experience as described here may be substituted for the degree on a year-for-year basis.5 years of experience including:Business analysis, process mapping, design of complex systems and processes, with a demonstrated ability to translate business requirements into technical solution requirements.Strong analytical and technical experience in developing, implementing, configuring, maintaining, and upgrading complex application systems.What You Will NeedMust possess the ability to translate functional requirements into techical specifications and then develop, configure and implement those needs in collaboration with OCG and ORIExcellent customer service skills and a client focused approachStrong troubleshooting skills, including the ability to diagnose a problem and provide technically accurate details and workaroundsFinely honed communication, collaboration and organization skills.Ability to manage time and work effectively under tight deadlines.Ability to learn business processes and translate them into the eRA systemsWhat We Would Like You To HaveAt least one year of experience in research administration, preferably in higher education.Experience with InfoEd, Topaz or other electronic research administration modules.At least one year of experience developing and running test scripts.Prior experience with data conversions and/or project management experience.Familiarity with the relational database models, specifically Oracle version 10g or higher.Familiarity with SQL syntax and able to write both simple and complex queries.Special InstructionsTo apply, please submit the following materials:A current resume.A cover letter that specifically addresses how your background and experience align with the requirements, qualifications and responsibilities of the position.You will not be asked to upload references at this time.Please apply by December 9, 2018 for consideration.Note: Application materials will not be accepted via email. For consideration, applications must be submitted through CU Boulder Jobs.Posting Contact Name: Boulder Campus Human Resources Posting Contact Email: recruiting@colorado.eduThe University of Colorado is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer

Name: Client Support Analyst
Description: Why YOU want this position: Drillinginfo delivers business-critical insights to oil and gas industries through a state-of-the-art SaaS platform built on industry-leading data and energy analytics. Our solutions deliver value across the upstream and downstream supply chain empowering exploration and production (E&P), oilfield services, midstream, and financial services companies to be more proactive, efficient, and competitive.  We are currently seeking a Client Support Analyst to join our Denver, CO team. The Client Support Analyst provides customers and end users with product support by providing world class customer service. This position is the first line of application support to our customers with focus on our vendor and operator inquires. Performance Objectives:Provides first-level support of Oildex's software applications, data, products, and services. Answers, evaluates, and prioritizes service requests received via telephone, voice mail, e-mail and web chat.Resolves product or service problems by clarifying the customer's complaint; determining the cause of the problem; selecting and explaining the solution to solve the problem; and following up to ensure resolution.Responds to internal and external customer questions efficiently and effectively through the use of active listening, personalization techniques, and focusing on adding value.Handles customer problems that appear to arise from the use of the product.Logs and tracks calls using ServiceNow, and maintains history records and related problem documentation. Documents customer requests, troubleshooting procedures, follow-up actions items, assigned to Senior Customer Care Analyst, and conversations with customers, including instructions communicated to customers intended to resolve their issues.Records resolution information in ServiceNow and maintains accuracy of help desk database.Helps create efficiencies, reduce processing risk, and enhance the client's experience.The Customer Care Analyst will escalate to a Senior Customer Care Analyst if an issue cannot be resolved within 30 minutes and qualifies as a more advanced fix.Works well in group problem solving situations. Looks for ways to improve and promote quality.Adds value for customers by building relationships and trust through customer interactions and manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs and solicits customer feedback to improve service.Investigates and validates reported issues to assess risk and exposure; driving prioritization discussions.Communicates with Senior Customer Care Analysts regarding escalated tickets and advanced solutions to customer inquiries.Competitive Candidate Profile:Minimum 1+ years Customer Service environment where application support is a primary job function, preferredExperience with Trouble Ticketing Software or ServiceNow is desiredWindows, Microsoft Office and MacOS knowledgeExcellent written and verbal communication skills; Able to articulate issues in both a technical and non-technical manner Works with peers and other team members to problem solve and continually find ways to improve and promote a quality organization  Works independently in a fast paced customer service environment without required immediate supervisionSDL2017

Name: Clinical Health Data Analyst/Informaticist
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary: Analyzes and provides clinical data expertise that helps the clinical team identify health care trends in utilization, prioritize at-risk populations, evaluate health outcomes and guide population and disease management. Identifies opportunities for data-driven solution and has the ability to translate business needs into information system requirements. This work supports physician practices and their patients across Colorado through targeted care coordination, clinical quality improvement, provider and patient education, claims documentation and reporting. COMPETENCIES/Role-Specific Functions:COMMUNICATION Communicates well both verbally and in writing, creates accurate and punctual reports, delivers presentations, shares information and ideas with others, has good listening skills. Effectively communicates clinical data with internal teams and external client committees to present, adopt and implement measures for clinical performance.Collaborates with other departments to develop reports in support of Independent Physician Association (IPA), provider and practice-level improvements.PROBLEM SOLVING Breaks down problems into smaller components, understands underlying issues, can simplify and process complex issues, understands the difference between critical details and unimportant facts. Understands clinical data requests, seeks additional information appropriately and has the ability to simplify complex process and issues.Can critically analyze trends and advise PHP staff on the significance of the data.Can assess and offer strategic solutions for data collection and storage and provide analytics across multiple, and sometimes non-conforming, data sources.PRODUCTIVITY Manages a fair workload, volunteers for additional work, prioritizes tasks, develops good work procedures, manages time well, handles information flow. Provides evidence based research and references national guidelines when recommending clinical interventions and measures.Automates and documents processes and procedures to standardize work and provide efficiencies.Collaborates within the informatics team to trouble-shoot challenges through knowledge-sharing and team problem-solving.SELF DEVELOPMENT Seeks out and accepts feedback, is a proactive learner, takes on tough assignments to improve skills, keeps knowledge and skills up-to-date, turns mistakes into learning opportunities. Researches new systems, softwares, and processes, analytical approaches, and data sources to improve skills and knowledge and makes recommendations to help business efficiencies.CUSTOMER FOCUS Builds customer confidence, is committed to increasing customer satisfaction, sets achievable customer expectations, assumes responsibility for solving customer problems, ensures commitments to customers are met, solicits opinions and ideas from customers, responds to customers. Develop accurate and complete quality measurement testing plans and conduct end-to-end testing of measures from end-user perspective.Collect and analyze clinical outcomes data in order to develop and support clinical process improvement initiatives, quality, program evaluation and patient safety.JOB KNOWLEDGE Understands duties and responsibilities, has necessary job knowledge, has necessary technical skills, understands company mission/values, keeps job knowledge current, is in command of critical issues. Develops analytic programming, manipulate and analyze large datasets using software packages, SQL/T-SQL using Microsoft SSMS, SSRS and business intelligence tools.Develops detailed documentation of quality measures and reports, including definitions, specifications and technical requirements.Gains understanding of technical design in addition to measure specifications to support effective communication and management of measure development.Develops population management reports that enhance clinical interventions for the clinical team at PHP. Evaluates programs and initiatives and provides statistical data to support these programs.Other duties as assigned.Qualifications (Education/Experience/Knowledge/Skills/Abilities):Bachelors degree in Health Administration, Applied Statistics or related. Masters in healthcare, epidemiology, business or analytics preferred.Minimum of two to five years analytic experience, in physician group/IPA setting or in other health care settings.Knowledge of relational databases and database theory and concepts.Extensive experience in writing and tuning T-SQL queries and in writing SQL stored procedures and report development in SSRS. Experience with R and Tableau or PowerBI a plus.Experience working in the healthcare industry, with a focus on medical claims and clinical data; knowledge of medical terminology, acronyms, and coding a plus.Strong technical and analytic skills with the ability to develop a deep understanding of customer and company needs so that they can be transformed into operational requirements.Strong knowledge of quality improvement approaches in a clinical setting with a focus on identification and utilization of appropriate processes and outcome measures, developing appropriate benchmark comparisons, producing trend and evaluation data, and documentation of opportunities for improvement.Skilled in effective application of quality measures and clinical guidelines disseminated by national quality organizations, including National Committee of Quality Assurance (NCQA), health plan employer data and information set (HEDIS) and National Quality Forum (NQF).Proven ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize workload and meet deadlines.Excellent written and oral communication skillsAbility to work effectively in integrated structure by establishing effective work relationships with all departments and levels of staff and customersHome office that is HIPAA compliant for all remote or telecommuting positions as outlined by the company policies and procedures. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is occasionally required to climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus.  Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Name: Analyst, Strategy and Special Projects
Description: The Clinical Enterprise Analyst, Strategy and Special Projects, will  help drive the development of DaVita s clinical strategy and prepare  the organization for a shift to value-based care. As a part of the  Clinical Enterprise team, this Analyst will focus on initiatives and  strategic projects to reduce hospitalizations for patients and improve  DaVita's overall clinical performance. The Analyst will act as a  liaison between the business office ( Atlas ) and the field, including  in-center teammates and regional and divisional leadership, by  partnering to innovate and pilot solutions in the field. The role will  work closely with the office of the chief operating officer, chief  medical officer, field operations and other strategic business units. Key responsibilities include: Clinical Program Support Manages the development, piloting, deployment and outcomes of clinical programs Coordinates with teams across the enterprise to enable rollout of new clinical programs Works with Information Technology to update, design and/or develop software changes to support the implementation of clinical  programs and drive outcomes performance Evaluates integrated care requirements in partnership with other strategic business units Supports pilot and program design of incorporated integrated care functions in the dialysis center  Projects Leads strategic initiatives for the Clinical Enterprise team, including hypothesis development, research, insight generation,  and business recommendations Represents the Clinical Enterprise on cross-functional projectsEvaluates project efficacy through clinical analytics and reporting QualificationsBachelor's degree required2-4 years of work experience in management consulting, process engineering, investment banking or a corporate strategy role  preferred Demonstrated experience and/or interest in healthcare delivery and patient experience Preferred Additional Skills:Strong executive communication skillsProficiency in PowerPoint, Excel and other Microsoft productsStrong influencing skills; track record of successful client relationship development and ability to quickly build credibility  and gain the confidence of individuals at all levels Outstanding conceptual, analytical and strategic skillsDemonstrated ability to recognize, prioritize, and evaluate market trends and specific growth opportunities Possesses the ability to balance strategic vision and execution capabilities to deliver results Ability to effectively handle and drive multiple projects.Keen understanding of healthcare marketsStrong business and financial acumen with a sense of shareholder responsibility Team player with the ability to sell change effectively and influence others Comfortable with ambiguity Here is what you can expect when you join our Village: A "community first, company second" culture based on Core Values that really matter. Clinical outcomes consistently ranked above the national average.Award-winning education and training across multiple career paths to help you reach your potential. Performance-based rewards based on stellar individual and team contributions. A comprehensive benefits package designed to enhance your health, your financial well-being and your future. Dedication, above all, to caring for patients suffering from chronic kidney failure across the nation.  Why wait? Explore a career with DaVita today.  Go to ************************* to learn more or apply.

Name: Accenture DayNine - Workday Integrations Senior Analyst
Description: Job descriptionWanted: Workday InnovatorsReady to innovate at the forefront of Workday?As a member of one of the world’s largest  Workday-certified teams, you’ll be part of a team of advisory professionals who  deliver more than just technology. You’ll deliver HR and financial management  solutions that help organizations realize the Workday promise of integrated,  cloud-based capabilities that put them on the fast track to a better way to  work.  Grow your career with leading-edge technologies,  continuous learning opportunities and a global community with deep industry  expertise that help to solve clients’ biggest challenges.  Now is the perfect time for you to join the  Accenture DayNine Workday team, where you’ll: Assess, strategize and manage Workday deployments for organizations across the globe.  Accenture has worked with more than 600 clients to deliver Workday deployments  to unlock the potential of their organizations.Design and deliver future-ready Workday solutions to help organizations optimize their  HR and Finance functions and enhance their employees’ experiences.Join more than 1,200 professionals certified in Workday, collaborating to drive  enterprise-wide transformational projects on a global scale.Expand your Workday skills and advance your career with unparalleled training and  professional development opportunities.Key ResponsibilitiesAs a Workday Integration Senior Analyst, you should expect to be supported by an  Integration Lead or working independently on smaller projects, play and active  role in the delivery of a defined set of integrations that meet the client's  business requirements. You will be client facing and have the following responsibilities: Comprehend data integrations from point to point systems as well as  holistic interchange services rendering effective data quality and  dependable exchanges of digital informationIdentify, assess, and solve complex business problems for integrating the  Workday cloud application with external applications across a wide array  of Human Capital Management and Financial functional areas, where analysis  of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factorsDesign, build, and support testing of Workday integration code base  including Studio, EIB and supporting 3rd party codingClosely follow the strategic direction set by client leadership  when establishing Workday project goalsResponsible for timely identification and escalation of risks and  development of alternative technical and functional approaches when  necessary + Basic qualificationsBasic  Qualifications:1-2+ years previous consulting experience  either as an internal consultant or with a consulting/software companySuperior communication skills, both written  and oral1-2+ year of experience in HRIS field;  experience in integration development for SAP, Oracle, PeopleSoft, or similar  applicationsExperience in the application of modern  integration technologies (EDI, Web Services, XML, XSLT, Java, .Net, middleware)Ability and willingness to travel up to 75%Preferred  Qualifications:Existing and up to  date Workday Integrations and Studio certification preferredIf not already a holder of the relevant  Workday Certifications, successful completion of appropriate Workday  Certification(s) is a requirement of the role.Proven ability work within a team-oriented environmentAbility to work in  a fast-paced environment and to adapt to frequent changeProven ability to work creatively and analytically in a  problem-solving environmentExperience with Excel, Visio and PowerPointBachelor’s Degree (technical degree strongly preferred) Deliver robust services to help organizations thrive in a digital world,  with access to Accenture’s unrivaled breadth and depth of capabilities. Apply today.All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive  training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills  development.
