Name: Financial Analyst
Description: General Description:Mercy Housing is looking for people who want to create a more humane world where poverty is alleviated, communities are healthy, and all people can develop their full potential. We believe that affordable housing and supportive programs improve the economic status of residents, transform neighborhoods and stabilize lives.  The Financial Analyst prepares, analyzes, and summarizes cash position, financial results, and forecasting and budgeting models to assist management with financial decision making. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Prepares, populates, and maintains monthly and quarterly forecasting models for Mercy Housing (MHI) and the regions. Prepares management reports to summarize all completed forecasts and conducts analysis of the completed forecasts.  2. Supports the annual corporate budgeting process. Provides assistance in preparing detailed budget reports for the individual regions and on a consolidated basis.  3. Prepares and analyzes cash projections to identify trends and variances from forecasts for MHI and the regions. Conducts similar analysis for properties and other entities when requested.  4. Participates in ad hoc analysis as requested from the team members and manager.  5. Analyzes financial statements of MHI, Mercy Housing Management Group (MHM), the Geographic Business Centers (GBC), and other entities as directed.  6. Supports monthly financial reports for MHI-combined operations (including regions) in a manner to provide useful information for the following stakeholders: MHI Board and Finance Committee, CFO, CEO, President, and the regional Presidents.  7. Works with MHI department heads, regional personnel, and accounting staff to explain major budget variances.  **This is a brief description summarizing the abilities needed for the position.**Requirements:EDUCATION: Four (4) year accounting or finance degree. EXPERIENCE: Minimum of three (3) years in financial analysis or accounting required. ABILITIES:  1. Flexibility: work in a complex and changing organization and adapt to changes in structure and work priorities.  2. Team orientation: interest in working both independently and in groups, and willingness to be assigned to help team members in order to achieve departmental goals. Willingness to learn: seeks advice and comment when appropriate from coworkers, team members, and manager. Understand and implement directives from team members and manager.  3. Efficiency: work quickly and accurately.  4. Independence: make independent decisions with minimal supervision.  5. Proficiency in spreadsheet and computerized accounting applications. Create, populate, and maintain large budget and forecast models using Excel.Advanced Excel skills including pivot tables, V-Lookups, and macros.Work with Visual Basic (VBA) will be a plus.Experience working with large data sets (mining, modeling, manipulating, and reporting) is necessary. 6. Initiative: problem-solve and to identify and act on issues of materiality. Exhibits positive attitude, professionalism, and integrity.  7. Communicate clearly in both verbal and written form and relate effectively with others.  8. Treat a variety of people with respect and compassion.  9. Represent Mercy Housing in a professional manner at all times.  10. Understand and support the mission and values of Mercy Housing.Location:  MHI Corporate-MHCOR ........................................:

Name: IT Cloud Business Analyst
Description: Position:IT Cloud Business AnalystJob Description:You will join the Cloud R&D team made up of around 50 engineers working in a startup spirit and driven by a Dev Ops culture. On a daily basis, you will interact with vendors, customers, and Arrow Cloud Business Units in different countries to enhance and develop our cloud service platform - ArrowSphere.  ArrowSphere is a single point of entry to cloud solutions. A single platform to search leading cloud products, build IaaS, PaaS & SaaS solutions. To learn more, check out this short video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=he1PaHeGW2s. Among your tasks, you will be responsible for onboarding of suppliers and customers onto ArrowSphere to stay ahead of our competitors. Required Skills4-6 years of related experience as a developer, tester, IT business analyst, IT Project Analyst, an architect, or technical/software sales engineerAt least 1 year of experience in cloud services (PaaS, Saas, IaaS, etc.), including Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS or IBM Softlayer/IBM CloudProven ability to maintain project schedule/prioritiesFlexible, business-oriented and comfortable with verbal and written communicationAdditional languages could be appreciated due to the various international relationsExperience with standard software development processes and methodologies (Agile and Continuous Integration/Delivery), including supporting tools such as Atlassian, Jira, etc.Knowledge of and ability to perform analyses such as, gap analysis, process mapping, root-cause analysis, risk analysis and requirements gatheringUnderstanding of general principles of digital platform design and architectureArrowSphere - Software managementResponsible for developing user stories with internal and external teamsResponsible for designing and approving the functional requirements document with internal and external teamsResponsible for following timelines and on-time deliveryRisk management and escalationResponsible for version releases and customization of the productResponsible for software testing and validationRegular interaction with Arrow suppliers, customers and internal teamsResponsible for the integration of the vendors and customers onto the platformInternal communication to the key people involved in the project in all regionsArrowSphere - SupportSupport to the internal technical teams (ERP integration / Cloud technical team) with the help of the Cloud support teamResponsible for the documentation provided to internal teams (communication and training if required)Escalation to the supplier, if requiredEscalation to the internal development team, if required #dice#Location:Denver (Panorama)Time Type:Full timeJob Category:Non-Customer Facing/Supplier Facing

Description: Job Description:-Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs -Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities -Analyzes business partner’s operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions -Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology -Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications -Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business -Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation -Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge -May make recommendations for buy versus build decision Additional Responsibilities/Skillsets Required:The CXE analysts will work with the CXE team on developing technical solutions to business problems, by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements to meet Comcast product requirements for new features and reportsAlso, creating the test cases, functional, and integration effort to support the products and report features for our stakeholdersThe CXE analysts typically will take the lead role or assist with the CXE business cases and eliciting requirements and requirements organizationHe/she will use requirements to drive detailed design and review of test cases. Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: Janus Henderson Global Investors is a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for clients through a broad range of actively managed funds\.  We provide our institutional, retail and high net\-worth individuals with access to skilled investment professionals representing a broad range of asset classes including, equities, fixed income, multi asset and alternatives\.  We are a team of independent thinkers who work tirelessly to help our clients achieve their goals and we do it by fostering an energetic and collaborative culture that ensures our people love the place they work\.  Headquartered in London, Janus Henderson is a truly global asset manager with a diverse geographic footprint, managing assets from 27 offices globally and employing more than 2,000 staff\. *Overview of the Role** This Denver based role, will be responsible for providing end to end financial support to various departments \(could include Investments and Support organizations\)\. This person will serve as a partner to senior business leaders to drive resource planning and control and to facilitate effective forward looking business decision making with commercial insight to identify opportunities to create value\. *Duties and Responsibilities** + Develops business plans and forecasts on an annual, quarterly, and ad hoc basis  + Reviews, analyzes and reports monthly expenses to business leaders, highlighting risks and opportunities  + Creates and assesses profitability analyses on an ongoing and ad hoc basis using advanced modeling techniques; makes recommendations to business leaders on opportunities to drive financial success  + Works closely with business leaders to develop and analyze metrics to measure financial and operational performance  + Contributes to and helps develop management reporting for the North America Leadership team  + Identify opportunities to improve efficiency and reduce costs  + Prepares standard and customized financial reports on an ongoing and ad hoc basis  + Supports cross\-functional special projects  + Proactively identifies and resolves problems that may be complex in nature  + Tracks and monitors merger related costs and synergies  + Supports broader FP&A and Business Finance team deliverables *Other Functions** Assumes additional duties as assigned *Technical Skills and Qualifications** + Three to five years financial analysis experience required  + Investment Management industry experience a plus  + Bachelors Degree in Finance, Economics, or equivalent required  + MBA or post\-graduate degree a plus *Competencies Required** + Team player with a flexible, results driven approach  + Strong communication, interpersonal and client service skills  + Strong understanding of financial concepts and measures  + Strong analytical skills with the ability to accumulate, organize and assimilate large amounts of data  + Ability to plan, prioritize, and organize work effectively and to quickly shift priorities when necessary  + Ability to work and make decisions independently  + Advanced computer skills, emphasizing MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and Enterprise Resource Planning systems \(SAP\)  Ongoing competence in the role to be assessed by:  + Annual Performance Appraisal  + Completion of all assigned Compliance training  Working Environment/Physical Activities  + Extended hours may be required on short notice and may include evening, weekend, and holiday hours  Janus Henderson Investors \(including its subsidiaries\) will not maintain existing or sponsor new industry registrations or licenses where not supported by an employees job functions \(as determined by Janus Henderson Investors at its sole discretion\)\.  All applicants must be willing to comply with the provisions of Janus Henderson Investors' Investment Advisory Code of Ethics related to personal securities activities and other disclosure and certification requirements, including past political contributions and political activities\. Applicants past political contributions or activity may impact applicants eligibility for this position\. **Janus Henderson Investors is an equal opportunity / Affirmative Action employer\.** All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status\. All applications are subject to background checks\.

Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst
Description: Ball Aerospace leads the way in designing, developing and manufacturing innovative aerospace systems. We take on some of the most complex and exciting challenges in the universe--from space and Earth science to national security and intelligence programs.  We produce spacecraft, instruments and sensors, RF and microwave technologies, data exploitation solutions, and a variety of advanced aerospace technologies and products. In addition, we pioneered the development of the commercial remote sensing market, producing spacecraft and imaging systems that helped spawn a market-driven demand for imagery.  Our success is built on more than products or systems. Our team of more than 3,000 engineers, scientists, technicians and support staff drives all the achievements at Ball Aerospace. Whether contributing to a better understanding of the universe or helping keep our nation safe, our people bring their diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills together to achieve a common mission. Sr. Business Process AnalystWhat You’ll Do Coordinate/prioritize ITS projects and maintenance requests for developers. Support Agile Product Data Management (PDM), IFS Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Velocity Manufacturing Execution System (MES) enterprise applications used to enable program execution activities in multiple environments including classified areas. Troubleshoot technical issues associated with these systems and supporting applications. Responsible for working with internal users of these applications to understand functionality needs, configure system to provide requested functionality and provide second level user support as needed. Develop initial training materials for new functionality and conduct "Train the Trainer" training sessions. Support the creation of installation guides and creation of supporting release notes defining the updates for a specific release. Support new ITS projects to develop new capabilities that involve these applications, work closely with ITS software developers to design/develop new enhancements and interfaces, configure data access controls etc. Provide Project Management for internal IT projects responsible for defining scope, cost and schedule and managing execution activities to successfully new capabilities. Coordinate with the business to manage/prioritize tool enhancement request backlog. Support the installation of new instances of these applications inside classified areas. Support material requirements planning (MRP) activities. Maintain a regular and predictable work schedule. Establish and maintain effective working relationships within the department, the SBU/SSU and the Company. Interact appropriately with others in order to maintain a positive and productive work environment. Perform other duties as necessary.What You’ll Need Bachelor's degree plus 10 or more years related experience. Each higher level degree, i.e., Master’s Degree or Ph.D., may substitute for two years of experience. Two years of related experience may be substituted for each year of education. Degree must be from a university, college, or school which is accredited by an agency recognized by the US Secretary of Education, US Department of Education. Customer service orientation, excellent communication and listening skills, organizational skills, ability to collaborate with a cross-functional team, be self-motivated, detail oriented etc. Experience using Agile (PDM), IFS (ERP) and Velocity (MES) or related systems is a plus. Business processes experience and compliance requirements knowledge associated with executing government contracts for space based and/or DOD programs.Working Conditions Work is performed in an office environment. Travel and local commute between Ball campuses and other possible non-Ball locations may be required. Successful applicant for this position must be eligible to obtain a DoD clearance. A current DoD clearance is not required to be eligible for this position, however the successful applicant will be required to obtain a DoD clearance within a reasonable time after the offer is extended and must be able to maintain the applicable clearance. * US Citizenship is Required  Relocation for this position is NOT Available US CITIZENSHIP REQUIRED Equal Opportunity Employer  Minority, Female, Disabled, Lesbian, Gay, Bi-sexual, Transgender and Veterans.

Name: Sr. Systems Analyst
Description: SUMMARYA brief description summarizing the overall purpose and objectives of the position and the results the worker is expected to accomplish. The Senior Systems Analyst is primarily responsible for configuration, design, maintenance, monitoring, support and documentation of all aspects of PDC’s Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition systems. The Sr. Systems Analyst will work actively with other departments on the SCADA system implementation and to identify business processes improvements through the application of SCADA technologies. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSThe tasks, duties, and responsibilities of the position that are most important to get the job done.Acts as first line of support for all applications across departments;Handles day to day administration, monitoring and support of the SCADA system, devices and field communications infrastructure;Track all customer issues and responses in the IT Helpdesk system (KACE);Develops and maintains policies and procedures for SCADA IT operations;Ensures proper installation, operation, maintenance and support of PDC’s SCADA systems and associated hardware and software;Manages and maintains SCADA/Automation processes and reports;Perform other reporting and system analysis needs;Works with IT management to develop and implement appropriate security practices for critical infrastructure;Sets up and maintains all user access and security role changes for the SCADA systems;Assists with communication network changes and expansions;Sets up and maintains DR processes for the SCADA systems;Oversee vendor resources on SCADA projects;Assists in the implementation of new software/systems;Maintains a positive image when dealing with other PDC employees;Performs and assumes other duties and responsibilities as may be required at the direction of the Director, Information Technology.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ATTRIBUTESThe specific minimum competencies required for job performance.Comprehensive end-to-end understanding SCADA systems (HMI, applications, communications, RTUs);Working knowledge of Windows server & client operating systems, and TCP/IP networks and control network security practices;Advanced knowledge of SCADA protocols and data communications;Experience with programming in VB;Excellent troubleshooting and problem solving skills;Strong interpersonal skills – must be able to work effectively as part of a team and foster team cooperation;Effective verbal and written communications skills.SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESThe scope of the person’s authority, including a list of jobs that report to the incumbent. There are no supervisory responsibilities associated with this position. WORKING CONDITIONSThe environment in which the job is performed, especially any unique conditions outside a normal office environment.Consistent with that of a normal work environment;Participates in 24x7 on-call rotation;Required to work on-call during planned maintenance and/or emergencies;Frequent travel to all PDC offices required.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSThe minimum level of education, experience, and certifications required to perform the job.Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field;Five (5) years’ + of relevant work experience;Previous with developing/supporting/implementing SCADA systems (preferably Cygnet) in the E&P industry is required;Valid driver’s license (Required).

Name: Cyber Technical Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionDGS is currently seeking a talented Cyber Technical Analyst to support our Team located in Denver, CO.  Responsibilities and Duties  The Cyber Technical Analyst will provide specific duties and functions include, but are not limited to: Leverage technical methods to monitor and execute cyber operations to pursue and respond to urgent cyber security and intelligence mission requirementsProvide time-sensitive mission support to identify, understand, pursue and mitigate advanced persistent cyber threats and anomalous cyber behaviors on stakeholder networksMaintain competencies on technology, tools, and cyber technical tradecraft to achieve cyber intelligence mission objectivesRequired SkillsIndividual must have a minimum of five (5) years of experience in technical analysisExperience in understanding and detection of foreign intelligence activity in the cyber domain and demonstrated ability to correlate cyber network operations (CNO) tactics, techniques, and procedures to known or suspected cyber threat actorsExperience in complex cyber investigations and use of the latest and most advanced cyber forensics-analysis tools, multi-source intelligence analysis, knowledgeable of USIC activities is requiredMust be capable of conducting independent research, as well as, work with team members and partner agenciesMust have experience dealing with complex cyber based investigations and national security matters. Must possess excellent verbal and written communications skills, and have experience in conducting cyber interviews and defensive briefings and debriefingsMust have demonstrated ability to work under pressure and meet short deadlinesKnowledge of customer cyber requirements related to the conduct of cyber activities and defensive operations in accordance with applicable Federal law, Executive Order, and Intelligence Directives is requiredKnowledge of Customer Orders, and Customer/NNSA facilities, policies and procedures is desired Demonstrated creativity, innovation, flexibility, and analytical skills in problem solving is requiredTS/SCI (Q desired, but not required) Clearance Required - (please note: only apply if you currently have the necessary security clearance stated below) TS/SCI (Q desired, but not required)EducationBachelor's degree from an accredited college or university is required, preferably in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related fieldAn advanced degree is preferred, this requirement may be waived if the individual has demonstrated experience in the information technology or cyber security fields Company Overview  Dependable Global Solutions (DGS), a Security and Intelligence Firm, was founded in September 2004 as a privately held small business. DGS principle belief is that security is not a singular endeavor. Our clients require the ability to recognize, plan for, and mitigate risk in all of its various forms.  DGS specializes in IT security, mission assurance, and intelligence operations and analysis. We build, manage, and enhance our clients ability to identify and deal with threats and attacks in near real-time.  DGS Benefits  At DGS, we understand that our employees are our most valuable resource. Thats why we offer competitive compensation packages and a supportive environment with good work-life balance. In addition, we provide opportunities for growth and development so that our employees can continually develop their competencies, skills, and talents, and pursue advancement opportunities.  When you join the DGS Team you receive - Medical Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Life Insurance, Short Term & Long-Term Disability, Flexible Spending Account, 401k Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match, Employee Assistance Program, Tuition and Professional Development Assistance, 529 College Savings Plan.

Name: Mid-Office / Sales & Trading Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Overview The Mid-Office/Sales & Trading Analyst is responsible for providing support to and linking front office sales and trading with back office operations. Key responsibilities include contract management, reconciliation of contract and delivered volumes and pricing, pricing analysis and tracking, profit and loss tracking on all physical (i.e. biodiesel and other fuels), renewable fuel credits (i.e. RINs and LCFS & CFP carbon credits), and financial trading (i.e. future, swaps, options) operations, position risk analysis, and other reporting related to physical and financial buy/sell transactions. This role will be multi-dimensional, as it will require the skill set to track all facets of the transaction and logistics (truck/rail) lifecycle associated with physical, renewable fuel credit, and financial buy/sell transactions to position and cash breaks. This position requires developing a thorough understanding of how the market and pricing for biodiesel and petroleum fuels and renewable fuel credits works. This position entails working closely with/between the commercial (sales, trading and logistics), accounting, and regulatory compliance departments. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:Confirmation / Affirmation of Physical and Financial trades/transactions –Architect/maintenance/tracking of contract and pricing databaseResolution on contract issues between front and back office groups and external customersEnsure customer transactional amount stay within established credit limits and that all credit stipulations have been satisfiedPoint person between external and internal reconciliation >> resolve contract, billing, invoice issuesInvestigate, resolve, communicate discrepancies between internal and external contracts with customers and internal groups (payable and receivable)Thorough understanding of how the market and pricing for biodiesel and petroleum fuels and renewable fuel credits works · Contract management >> collection and maintenance of all data associated with each buy/sell contracts Calculating P&L and maintaining P&L database for all physical, renewable fuel credit, and financial buy/sell transactionsDaily review of open positions and associated P&L risk analysisEssential Business Experience and Technical Skills · 3+ years experience in mid-office, commodity contract (physical/financial) or accounting.  · Must have very strong Excel skills with strong ability to create, maintain, and analyze diverse data sets  § Understanding of P&L for physical Biodiesel and other fuel, renewable fuel credit (RINs and LCFS & CFP carbon credits), and financial (futures/options) transactions  § Understanding of Logistics costs, Capital costs, and other costs; ability to factor these into P&L calculation and analysis  § Familiarity with futures and/or OTC brokerage statements  § Proven ability to orchestrate amicable resolution of all discrepancies between different internal departments / stakeholders as well as with external stakeholders. Education and Basic Requirements § Bachelor Degree  § Highly organized with high degree of attention to all detail  § Excellent oral and written communication skills – the ability to convey a broad array of information succinctly and accurately  § Must have excellent interpersonal skills and be an effective communicator; can remain poised and in control while dealing with competing time pressure demandsCompany DescriptionCrimson Renewable Energy and its subsidiaries are producers of renewable transportation fuels and are the largest producer of biodiesel in California and Oregon. Crimson customers ranging from major oil companies such as Chevron, Valero, Exxon, and Philips 66 to truck stop operators such as Pilot Flying J count on Crimson as a reliable and consistent supplier of ultra-low carbon biodiesel. Crimson, headquartered in Denver, Colorado, provides a variety of timing, logistics, and pricing structures to best suit its various customers and to offer the highest degree of flexibility to its supply chain partners.  Since commencing biodiesel production in late 2011, Crimson has grown to become a market leader in California’s alternative fuels industry, which is one of the two largest markets for biodiesel in the United States. Throughout its growth trajectory, Crimson has held onto its startup culture characterized by the pursuit of excellence combined with an emphasis on customer responsiveness, integrity, strong work ethic, teamwork, and accountability at all levels. In summary, we work very hard to do a better job than our competitors in operational and back-office execution and managing the myriad market and commodity risks inherent in our business

Name: Sr Business Analyst IT
Description: Job DescriptionWe are working with a global company located in Glendale, CO. Our client is building a data heavy web application from scratch and need a business analyst to join their team!  This position serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization’s systems and capabilities. Analyzes business partner’s operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine improvement opportunities. Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications. Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge. Lead or participates in test efforts as defined by the project team. Establishes appropriate quality checkpoints for functional testing, user acceptance testing and production quality assurance signoff. Job Responsibilities (Estimated Percentage of Time Dedicated to Responsibilities): · Lead / participate in the Requirements Management Process within the context of the System Development Lifecycle (SDLC). Core responsibilities include but are not limited to:  o Requirements elicitation, analysis and documentation  o Requirements engineering  o Requirements documentation in the form of tickets and stories (50%)  · Promote and support the Agile development process (15%)  · Prepares and maintains documentation for application systems. 25%  · Provides training as needed 10%  · Perform other related duties as required. Desired Background: · Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.  · 5 to 7 years of relevant technical or business work experience in the software development industry.  · Experienced in Agile and Waterfall development.  · Demonstrated experience in creating visual models such as: Activity Diagrams, Feature Mapping, Product Roadmap, Temporal Sequence Diagrams, UI/UX  · Able to create project artifacts including but not limited to: wireframes, process flows, entity relationship diagrams, UML Diagrams  · Works with business partners between multiple business functions to align technology solutions with business strategies.  · Demonstrates an informed knowledge of multiple business areas to resolve problems for more complex recurring and new business initiatives.  · Ability to multitask and juggle competing priorities; Works on multiple projects simultaneously as a project team member.  · Excellent written and oral communications.  · Proficiency in Microsoft PC software: Excel, Word, Access, Outlook. Desirable knowledge, skills and abilities · Ability to analyze disparate sources of data and generate data processing specifications.  · Keen analytical skills.  · Excellent written and oral communications.  · CBAP (Certified BA Professional) and / or CSPO (Certified Scrum Product Owner)  · Proficiency in Microsoft PC software: Excel, Word, Access, Outlook.  · Extensive Data Analytics competencies using modern tools and techniques including Excel, Microsoft SQL Server, custom SQL Queries, etc.

Name: Business Requirements Analyst
Description: DISH is a Fortune 200 company with more than $15 billion in annual revenue that continues to redefine the communications industry. Our legacy is innovation and a willingness to challenge the status quo, including reinventing ourselves. We disrupted the pay-TV industry in the mid-90s with the launch of the DISH satellite TV service, taking on some of the largest U.S. corporations in the process, and grew to be the fourth-largest pay-TV provider. We are doing it again with the first live, internet-delivered TV service – Sling TV – that bucks traditional pay-TV norms and gives consumers a truly new way to access and watch television.  Now we have our sights set on upending the wireless industry and unseating the entrenched incumbent carriers.  We are driven by curiosity, pride, adventure, and a desire to win – it’s in our DNA. We’re looking for people with boundless energy, intelligence, and an overwhelming need to achieve to join our team as we embark on the next chapter of our story.  Opportunity is here. We are DISH.  A successful Business Operations Analyst will have the following: Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year College or university; or at least four years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to interact with and communicate effectively with a large spectrum of different stakeholders from IT personnel to field operations. Preferred: Programming background and an understanding of basic IT architecture.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office notably Excel. Preferably, an understanding of service codes and how different systems communicate with one another.Must be able to handle different situations and tasks with minimal direct oversight from management. Applicant must be comfortable working without direct supervision and be internally motivated to seek out projects and drive forward needed initiatives.Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. A Business Operations Analyst within our Business Process and Technology team works as a project manager primarily on application development for our internal DISH teams. They will manage assigned projects and write front end business requirements to ensure that stated objectives are met write.  Primary responsibilities fall into the following categories: Write business requirements for front end tools and ensure requirements are passed to ITManages the planning, development, design, and implementation of assigned program/projects. Including tracking schedules, issues, tasks, and relevant financial impacts.Coordinates the development of requirements (processes, systems, etc) for new programs and enhancements to existing programsEngages with DISH IT and DISH partners’ development from implementation throughout the program’s/project’s life-cycle.Implements monitoring systems for evaluation and effective collection of feedback for ongoing programs as to drive improvements and future enhancement requests.Other duties as required. This list is not meant to be a comprehensive inventory of all duties and responsibilities assigned to this position. LilyP

Name: Sr. Analyst, Strategy & Operations
Description: Senior Analyst, Strategy & Operations DaVita Medical Group is one of the nation's largest and most innovative healthcare communities, grounded in a passion for and commitment to clinical excellence and improving patients' health and quality of life.  We are currently seeking a Senior Analyst to join our high-energy, creative and motivated Strategy and Operations Team. This teammate will serve our Markets as healthcare strategy and operations consultant. This team is dedicated to high-impact projects inside DaVita Medical Group.  Projects vary depending on Market need and impact; however, representative projects include: Comparing operational performance to internal and external benchmarksIdentifying how a market or markets can work together to reduce operating costs through shared servicesWorking with market operators to build work plans and begin implementationDeveloping a market assessment to support strategic planningCreating a business plan for a new service plan or business unitIdentifying how to best enter a new geographyESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Work with subject matter experts and operators to identify high value initiatives that have real and immediate impactInteract with senior management and leaders by providing thoughtful analysis on key decision points to drive initiatives forwardBuild relationships at all levels of the market, from Analysts to Market PresidentProvide practical, thought leadership to the marketsDevelop deliverables and project plans and help the team begin implementationHelp to facilitate meaningful discussions within and across marketsDevelop reporting and analytic tools for operators, management, and other support teamsAnalyze large data sets to identify gaps performance and opportunities for operational and cost improvementProvide ad-hoc analyses and support as necessaryProvide leadership to more junior analystsEDUCATION:Bachelor’s degree from top school with focus in engineering, mathematics, science, business or other analytical degreeEXPERIENCE:Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience (e.g. consulting, strategy, healthcare operations, health plans, business analysis, data analytics, data science, investment banking)ESSENTIAL BEHAVIORS, SKILLS, AND ATTITUDES REQUIRED FOR SUCCESS IN THIS POSITION:Commitment to our values: Service Excellence, Integrity, Team, Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Fulfillment and Fun. Serve as a natural, pro-active role model of our values with patients, teammates, physicians, and/or vendors in every day performance and interactionsAbility to Get Stuff Done (GSD)Strong interpersonal and client service skillsAnalytical thinker with ability to perform root cause analysis, prepare and implement action plans, and lead initiativesDemonstrated ability to perform cost-benefit analyses to drive decision-making and skill in explaining the resultsDemonstrated strengths in strategic planning, teamwork, and management skillsExcellent presentation and communication skills (written and verbal)Demonstrated ability to work effectively at both detail and big-picture levels and to drive projects forwardAbility and willingness to maintain open and clear communication with teammates, clients, and vendorsAbility to thrive in an environment of ambiguity and autonomy; flexibility and ability to manage multiple projects, deadlines and priorities in a fast-paced, changing and evolving work environmentQUALIFICATIONS:Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint requiredStrong computer literacy and proficiencyProficiency with SQL is a plusAbility to travel at least 50% (travel averages to 50%; some projects require more/less)LOCATION: Denver, CO (strong preference); El Segundo, CA

Name: Junior Credit Analyst (Underwriter)
Description: Junior Credit Analyst (Underwriter)- Denver ( Job Number:  043551 )  hours per week : 40  Description  Vectra Bank Colorado is excited to offer an opportunity as a  Credit Analyst  to an  experienced  candidate.  We are genuine and humble enough to admit that Credit is a big part of how we do business. These positions are at the core of our decision making process as to who we do business with and support those individuals who connect businesses to banks and help grow our economy. Our Credit Analysts Go Somewhere Here!  We have a strong belief in our credit culture and ensuring that our Analysts are able to support our strategies and vision. We provide extensive training and believe in fostering development and career progression from this position.  What are we looking for?  Vectra Bank Colorado is seeking a proven, highly motivated, analytical and articulate individual to support the credit and underwriting process for our Relationship Managers in our Corporate and Commercial Banking groups located at our Colorado Center and Corporate office in Denver and in our Community Banking regions across the state of Colorado.  This position is responsible for:  · Conducts credit investigations, credit and loan analysis, underwriting and other documentation information pertaining to loan analysis  · Investigates all available sources of credit and financial information, including reporting services, credit bureaus, other companies, main office files, and branches  · Analyzes financial statements and related material and makes recommendations for approvals of credits  · Analyzes financial conditions and trends; reviews and reports non-compliance with loan covenants  · Determines cash flow using appropriate tax analysis  · Prepares summaries, presents facts, and offers opinions concerning credit-worthiness and any risk items or issues  · Provides credit information and references for customers, loan officers, or other agencies as requested  · Ensures that all credit files include current financial statements, agency reports, etc  · May make recommendations for loan structure  · Maintains control over current accounts, noting payment progress, watching for any developing problems, and keep loan officers informed  · Keeps abreast of all new credit regulations and laws and ensures compliance with such  · May assists with projects as needed  · Other duties as assigned  Qualifications  Who should apply?  We want someone who has:  · Requires a Bachelors degree required in finance, business, accounting or a related field  · At least 1 year credit/financial analysis, lending, underwriting or other directly related experience. A combination of education and experience may meet job requirements  · Basic working knowledge of financial and spread analysis, credit, lending and underwriting processes and principles  · Some experience working with various types of loans  · Basic working knowledge of credit risk, legal and regulatory requirements  · An ability to work with all levels of our credit risk and relationship manager teams  · Has a strong sense of urgency and commitment to the loan growth goals  · Solid client relationship and communication skills, both verbal and written  · Ability to make sound decisions and recommendations regarding loans  · Working knowledge of computer software programs including spreadsheets, word processing, etc. required  · An appetite for detail and confidence, and can articulate data in a meaningful and understood language  You have to want to be a part of a motivated and driven team and work under respected leaders. We need someone who is proactive, who has a great attitude, who is confident and wants to work with professional people and will inspire them to achieve the department initiatives, including driving loan growth.  0  Work Locations  Colorado-Denver-CO - Colorado Center - Corp  Credit Admin  Nov 1, 2018

Name: Sr Business Continuity Analyst
Description: Requisition Number 18-1242  Post Date 10/19/2018  Title IT Professional  Title Detail Sr Business Continuity Analyst  City Lakewood  Location Headquarters  State CO  Description This position is responsible for leading the initiative to develop, recommend, support and implement corporate wide efforts in all business continuity and disaster recover activities. The individual will play a leading role in coordination during any disaster recovery effort and be responsible for the coordination plans with the Bank?s stakeholders. Name: Application system analyst
Description: *** Local Candidates only please. Must work in Denver and be available for an in person interview. **** Note: This position is currently funded for 3 months but may last as long as 8 months. I. Introduction  The State of Colorado Parks and Wildlife division with the Governor’s office of Information technology (OIT) is seeking a qualified Contractor to serve as a Senior Developer during the API development, unit testing and integration testing phase of the Integrated Parks and Wildlife System Project (IPAWS) project. This document outlines the project and the qualifications for the Senior Developer.  II. Background  Integrated Parks and Wildlife System Project (IPAWS)  Colorado Parks and Wildlife (CPW) was created in 2011 from the merger of State Parks and the Division of Wildlife. CPW collects fees for fish/hunt licenses, park passes, campground reservations, and for registering boats and off-highway vehicles. TLS (Total Licensing System) processes hunt/fish license sales. PARKS (Parks Automated Records Keeping System) accounts for sales of parks passes and for sales made through VRS (Vehicle Registration System) and CRS (Campground Reservation System). The primary goal of this project is to have an integrated parks and wildlife system that includes current and enhanced business functionality, upgraded technology that supports agency and public needs, and provides one-stop shopping for outdoor recreationists.  III. Current State  Wildlife Products  The current Colorado Parks and Wildlife (CPW) Total Licensing System (TLS) is based on web and point-of-sale (POS) applications used to provide hunting and fishing license products, collect customer information, service customer information requests, deliver related products and information, and record transactions. TLS is currently used almost exclusively for the sale of wildlife-related products. The system stores customer and transaction information, provides reports, controls inventory information, records all accounting activities, and provides administrative control functions. Several systems supporting the licensing program have been created and are supported and maintained by in-house staff. Some of these systems are integrated with TLS and others are stand-alone in nature.  Parks Products  Parks products consist of passes to state parks, registrations of recreational vehicles (i.e. boats, snowmobiles, off-road), and campsite reservations and rentals. These products are currently provided through state parks locations[1], parks commercial retail outlets, the Internet, and by phone[2]. They are issued to individuals but are typically associated with vehicles. Limited personal identification information is collected for some parks product purchases which does not afford CPW the opportunity to effectively communicate with many parks product purchasers after they have made a purchase. There are four primary systems that enable and track the sale of park passes, permits, registrations, reservations, and other parks-related goods and services: PARKS - Parks Automated Record Keeping SystemVRS - Vehicle Registration SystemActiveWorks Outdoors/CRS - Camping Reservation SystemeStore - Electronic Store IV. Future State  The recent merger of the state’s Divisions of Parks and Wildlife presents the opportunity to provide sales of State parks passes, recreational vehicle registrations, and other parks-related products through the wildlife oriented system, which is scheduled for implementation over the next two years. The goal is to have a modified replacement system in place where CPW can present their products and services as one agency.  V. Senior Developer Qualifications  The successful candidate must be well versed in unit testing including test driven development, nUnit, Visual Studio, and other unit testing frameworks and tools. In addition, they must be comfortable creating mock objects, test harnesses, and other advanced unit testing strategies. They need to be able to demonstrate involvement in past projects including the aforementioned items.  We also require 5-6 years of experience as a software developer in progressively more complex assignments with experience managing requirements for software application development, service delivery, and customer satisfaction, or relevant experience in an IT applications/solutions delivery role.  The IPAWS APIs will be developed using .Net version 4 and C# . The senior developer must have experience writing T-SQL, web services and SSRS packages.

Name: Publisher Advancement Analyst
Description: About the Team The Publisher Advancement Team is an exciting new opportunity at Sovrn created with the goal of helping publishers grow by delivering proactive and dedicated full-stack support and analysis across all functions of their business. About the Job You'll be working with your team to understand the common trends with publishers in specific verticals. You'll be able to analyze these trends and formulate some solutions we can take to our publishers to help them better understand their business. We will be utilizing a "sprint" format to ensure that we hit our deadlines and our KPI's. What You'll Be Doing:Work with the Publisher Advancement Manager in driving success for a group of 1000-1500 publishersPartner on project-based work that has the potential to drive success for a group of your publishersPartner with the Publisher Advancement Engineer on technical implementations and troubleshooting issues by providing analysis as neededDevelop analytics on the health of your publisher-base to understand where there are opportunities your team can action onUtilize analysis to understand the success of initiatives that your team executesWith guidance from your Manager, reach out to publishers to provide insights that you believe will help drive more success for themDevelop a cadence for analyzing your teams achievement of certain key performance indicatorsDevelop a cadence for communicating performance analytics to publishers within your client group - consistently try to improve these based on feedbackUnderstand the Sovrn product suite so that you can make recommendations for product adoption when you see a good fitPartner with the other Analysts to develop new systems, strategies, compile testing data, track broader trends, and execute broader optimization initiativesAbout You You are a self starter and able to get the job done without micro management. You have to be comfortable with change as this is a new team and we will have to evolve as we learn. You need to be comfortable working in a team environment and be able to collaborate with other people in similar roles. The successful candidate will have:High level of technical aptitudeAnalytical, can tie data to bigger pictureSees obstacles as opportunitiesEmpathy for others and our customersEmpowered to speak upCommunicates openly and honestlyProblem solverWants to learn!Bonus PointsDigital Media experience/knowledgePosition Reports to: Manager, Publisher AdvancementAbout Sovrn We spend a great deal of our time online. Whether it's for information, commerce, or entertainment, each of us has come to depend on what we research, discover, and share. Publishers those who create and curate content are what makes the Internet great. Yet these publishers practice their craft largely alone, in silos without reference points or insightful understanding about where they sit in the grand scheme of things. To add to the challenge, once a Publisher's content is in the wild, then the task of building engagement, growing a loyal following and enriching the engagement with that following can sometimes feel like shots in the dark or worse, a black box. Moreover, making money from their craft can be a complex task for any independent publisher who might prioritize generating content first and money second.  Sovrn believes that independent publishers are the Internet's vibrancy. As a partner and advocate to tens of thousands of independent publishers, Sovrn provides tools, technologies and services that help publishers (a) make money; (b) get distribution to grow their audience; and (c) access a massive data commons providing extraordinary insights.  The landscape of content networks, adtech vendors, and the myriad of buy-side / sell-side companies can be a complete maze for any reasonable person to decipher. Sovrn cuts through the noise and simplifies things with a basic, straightforward mission:  Help content creators do more of what they want to do and less of what they don't Sovrn is an Equal Opportunity Employer!

Name: Senior Digital Analyst
Description: Who we are: POSSIBLE Mobile builds native apps for mobile devices in iOS, Android and connected devices including Apple TV, Chromecast and Android TV.  We are trusted by and have long lasting relationships with our clients including renowned brands like JetBlue, PGA Tour, Hasbro and Major League Soccer.  More than development, our team partners with our customers providing strategy, consulting, and business analytics from start to ship to ensure each app performs well and meets user needs.  Founded in 2008 as one of the first mobile consulting shops, we pride ourselves on continually being cutting-edge and place a high priority on staying in the forefront of technology.  We are the mobile strategy, user experience, design, and development capabilities division of POSSIBLE, a creative agency, part of the WPP portfolio.  By nature, we are visionaries, innovators and pioneers in the mobile space. If that describes you too, then by all means, get in touchwe'd love to work with you. Who are we looking for: POSSIBLE Mobile is seeking a Senior Digital Analyst in Denver who is an experienced analyst and consultant, with a background in data, business marketing and strategic analysis. The role entails deep technical understanding of the Adobe Marketing Cloud, primarily Adobe Analytics. (Formerly Omniture SiteCatalyst) Additionally, it requires conceptual understanding of native application development and analytics. What you'll do:Lead existing Mobile/Web Analytics engagements.Create custom analytics tagging specifications for web and mobile applications.Analyze mobile/web analytics data as well as other offline data to evaluate app performance.Conduct instrumentation quality assurance across all platforms and devices.Create well organized presentations and reports with direction from senior project leads. Lead client presentations, add insight to data, and field strategic and technical questions.What you'll need:2-3 years experience with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics.1-3 years business, digital marketing strategy or online marketing background.Bachelor's degree in Marketing Analytics, Information Science, Informatics or related field.Demonstrated proficiency in MS Excel.Excellent written, presentation and oral communication skills.Expert at working with mobile/online metrics, terminology, industry best practices, and Industry Trends.About POSSIBLE: POSSIBLE believes that a promise is the foundation of every good relationship and the truth is, brands make promises every day. We are visionaries and innovators working in creative, technology, strategy, and data science to create experiences that keep brand promises so that every interaction is an opportunity to build trust and loyalty. We use data to help us identify opportunities, technology to help us take advantage of them and emotion to make the resulting experiences magical.  We've built our agency with our own promise: to foster a culture of inclusiveness and collaboration that appeals to those who want to do great work and make a difference. POSSIBLE creates experiences for some of the world's most dynamic brands, including Microsoft, AT&T, Nestle, Adidas, and Turner. POSSIBLE is part WPP and the Wunderman Group.  Follow POSSIBLE on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/possible-com/  Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/possible/  Twitter: https://twitter.com/POSSIBLE  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/POSSIBLE.com  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  We rely on legitimate interest as a legal basis for processing personal information under the GDPR for purposes of recruitment and applications for employment.SDL2017

Name: Sr. Technical Business Analyst - APIs
Description: The Company Worldpay is making payments smarter, faster and easier for all our partners, as well as the consumers they serve. From the largest retailers in the U.S. to the coffee shop down the street, we are leading the transformation in payments through chip-enabled cards, mobile wallets, eCommerce, and payment solutions for businesses of all sizes. We are the fastest growing payments company in the U.S., first in PIN Debit transactions and the second largest merchant acquirer. Visit Worldpay.com for more. The Opportunity As Worldpay grows, we must be proactive in assuring we stay ahead of the curve with truly cutting-edge products and services. The payments industry is in rapid evolution with the implementation of new technologies. By hiring the best minds that understand that new features and capabilities are just as important as security, Worldpay will continue to beat the competition with our offerings. Whether it's dedicated to new products and services, or ensuring we have the best infrastructure out there, Worldpay is dedicated to tech.  The Senior Technology Business Analyst is passionate about learning new products, technologies, and processes to provide subject matter expertise of APIs, integrations, systems, and data to facilitate overall understanding while driving solutioning, development, and support. The ideal candidate will have a deep passion for learning, simplifying the complex, and continually driving improvement of products, process, and technologies Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers. Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. At Worldpay, it comes from people in every corner of the office. People with ambition, optimism and courage. We provide growth and opportunity and give employees flexibility in how they get the job done. You might not expect that from a big payments company, but we're smart enough to know how to hire the best and when to step aside and let them lead. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board. What you'll do:Work closely with product management and a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization to develop, validate, refine and groom user's stories and associated test casesPerform detailed analysis, mapping, and documentation of a variety of systems and data including internal, back-end, and third party,Become an API and domain SME to facilitate team understanding of requirements and capabilities with a specific focus on the "how' and 'why'.Work under the guidance of the product owner and development manager for day to day prioritization of work and help achieve sprint goals.Provide integration support and in-depth technical trouble shootingDevelop documentation and guidelines to facilitate understanding and use of APIs, systems, and data.Who you are:You have expertise with technology, as well as with acumen from a business perspectiveYou have excellent analytical, problem-solving and research skills with a creative mindset capable of tying desperate information together and making sense of the complex.You strategically see the big picture but also can focus on the details needed to tactically execute.You are passionate about building exceptional experiences and understand what a great API that meet these needs looks like.You understand the importance of the developer experience to maximize impact, distribution and success for those building on top of APIsYou are an excellent communicator and understand the importance of networking and building relationships.You are good at sorting out ambiguity.You are persistent, rational and put facts above speculation.You are proficient in Databases. (Query languages like SQL ) and have a solid understanding of Web services/APIs. (SOAP, REST, XML etc.,).You are comfortable working with a wide variety of stakeholders at all levels within the organization.Be able to handle multiple priorities and tasksSelf-Motivated, Proactive and can work under minimal supervisionBonus skillsDemonstrated success in developing Product APIsDomain knowledge of the payment industry.Excellent presentation skills and comfort presenting complex information to senior leadershipAbility to teach others the art of analysis and developing product APIsBasic qualifications for consideration:Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering or a related field or equivalent experience4+ years' experience in technical analysis or related field2+ years of designing, analyzing, testing, or supporting APIs (though no API programming will be required for this specific role)

Name: Senior Stress Analyst
Description: Senior Stress Analyst Site  Denver, CO Employment duration  Full-Time Job Category  EngineeringApply Now Job BriefWe are seeking a Senior Stress Analyst for our Denver, CO location.Analytical Mechanics Associates, Inc., (AMA) is proud of our customer relationships, our diverse and dynamic work environment, and our employees' career satisfaction. AMA is a small business specializing in aerospace engineering, business analytics, information technology, and visualization solutions. AMA combines the best of engineering and mathematics capabilities with the latest in information technologies and visualization to build creative solutions. Headquartered in Hampton, Virginia, AMA also has operations in Huntsville (Alabama), Dallas (Texas), Denver (Colorado), Mountain View (California), Houston (Texas), New Orleans (Louisiana) and Hancock County (Mississippi). We offer a competitive salary and attractive benefits package, including paid personal leave and holidays, salary deferrals into a 401(k) matching plan with immediate vesting, tuition reimbursement, short/long term disability plans, medical, dental, and vision insurance. Our website describes our corporate values and how they apply to the professional success and growth of our employees.Job Description: The position will be responsible for various mechanical design and structural analysis support of advanced aerospace flight vehicles, including satellites, manned-vehicles, and launch vehicles. Systems may include a range of manned and unmanned aircraft and space vehicles, including satellites, capsules, lifting bodies, and launch vehicles. Work may be at a system or individual components level and may include test articles, facilities, and testing arrangements supporting these vehicles, products and their subsystems. The position will utilize solid modeling tools and high-fidelity stress analysis tools employing finite element modeling and analysis techniques, as well as handbook computations to complete these tasks. The position will also include systems engineering functions such as requirements development, trade studies, modeling and simulation, and cost, schedule, and risk assessment. Analysis may include work for both AMA developed concepts and as engineering services for NASA or commercial Aerospace companies.  Job duties include: Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of structures utilizing a range of software platforms including Nastran (MSC, NEi and NX), and FEMAPStress analysis of launch vehicle propulsion subsystems (tubing, ducting, valves, struts, etc.)Perform structural engineering hand calculationsKnowledge of metallic and composite structuresKnowledge of spacecraft and launch vehicle subsystemsDevelop reports, presentations and other documentationPretest and post-test analyses of modal survey and static-structural test at assembly and subassembly levelsMargin management policy development and trackingGeometric Dimensioning and TolerancingTest plan development and test data assimilationProject management including cost and schedule tracking and oversight of support personnel is possibleInteraction and interface with a range of customers To support a growing office, the position will require responsibilities that engage a very wide breadth of activities across subject matter and, at times, required both breadth and depth in spacecraft and test facilities design and analysis. The ability to multi-task between multiple, unrelated projects is as desirable as the engineering work. Candidates with capabilities in office operations, proposal writing, and business development support are preferred. Education and Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace, Aeronautical, Structural or Mechanical Engineering. Advanced degrees are a plus.Minimum 5 years of applicable work related experienceExperience in FEMAP/NastranProficiency in other design and analysis tools (e.g. CAD, CFD, Matlab), NX a plusPDM/PLM software knowledge, Windchill is a plusKnowledge of metal fabrication and assembly methods is preferredKnowledge of composite analysis and fabrication methods preferredKnowledge of NASA and/or FAA structural design standards a plusKnowledge regarding the process of developing structural loads (acoustic, thermal, aerodynamic and aerothermal) is a plusAbility to integrate and lead small teamsProficiency in non-linear analysis and dynamics a plusAbility to interface successfully with customers is requiredExcellent written and oral communication skillsStrong analytical skills requiredAbility to quickly adapt to dynamic work requirements and learn new disciplines US citizenship is required AMA is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Product Support Analyst
Description: Job Description Immediate need for a Technical Product Support Analyst with experience in the Cable Industry. This is a 6+ month’s contract opportunity with long-term potential located in Denver,CO. Please review the job description below: Job ID: 17 - 18657Key Responsibilities:Responsible for providing post-sales technical product support.This includes, but is not limited to, analyzing customers business needs and developing technical requirements, preparing technical responses to Requests for Quotes (RFQs), configuring integrated solutions to meet customer needs and implementing client solutions.May act as a primary point of contact between customer's technical staff and the enterprise's development/engineering organization.Serves as technical consultant to the sales team and must have a broad knowledge of multiple computer environments, platforms and technologies and in-depth knowledge of the enterprise's products.Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field or equivalent work experience.Typically has 3 - 6 years of high-tech industry and/or IT work experience in product engineering, development and/or support functions.Key Requirements and Technology Experience:Operating Systems & ApplicationsCentOS, CoreOS LinuxApacheGitBootstrapJira & ConfluenceVirtualization PlatformsVMware vSphere, vCenter, vCloud, vRAOpenStackKubernetes & DockerCompute & Storage PlatformsCisco UCSGeneric ComputeDistributed Object StorageCleversafe object storageNetApp storage solutions. Our client is a leading Cable Industry and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. Qualified candidates should apply online for immediate consideration.

Name: Sr Business System Analyst
Description: Job FamilyBusiness SystemsJob Description SummaryFacilitate the business analysis process to identify business requirements for system solutions or improved processes that will increase efficiency and overall productivity.Job DescriptionResponsibilitiesConduct business process analysis and needs assessments in an effort to align IT solutions with business initiatives.Prepares “as is” and “current state” documentation in written and graphical form (flows).Use Business Process Modeling techniques and tools to create business process models.Lead effort to develop new or revised processes or procedures in lieu of system development.Facilitates the elicitation of business and systems requirements. Analyze business unit requests and understand business requirements.Prepare documentation for business and system requirements in various formats.Works on project teams that are developing or modifying highly complex information systems, includes analysis and documentation of business and system requirement and revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary.Conducts research and analysis to quantify business opportunities and develops formal recommendations to management.May serve as a participant in the Enterprise Architecture program.This may involve providing input as to how data is created, stored and used (re-used) as it relates to our business processes.May use project management and program management methodologies to support a systems development methodology to meet project deliverables.Provide test scenarios or test criteria based on knowledge gained through business and systems analysis. May provide approval or quality check on test plans or test matrix.QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent education/experience, preferably in IT or a business area discipline (i.e. accounting, investments, or marketing). Minimum of 5 or more years of experience in business systems analysis. 2-4 years of SQL and/or data modeling experience.Two years of experience managing technical projects in a complex environment.Preferred QualificationsBasic knowledge of insurance company operations. Understanding of Hadoop Ecosystem.Strong Agile or Scrum background.Behavioral & Leadership CompetenciesWilling to lead a team or project to successful completion.Work with various technical staff members to determine possible solutions and communicate business and system impacts to IT and Operations staff.Strong organizational and analytical skills with attention to detail. Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills.Ability to accept and manage changing priorities and address issues quickly and professionally.Able to work in a team environment.Our CultureAt Transamerica we promote a Future Fit mindset.
